en-mt: These enzymes are widely expressed in many organs, especially the heart and liver, are released during tissue damage.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: ដូច្នេះពួកវាគឺជាសញ្ញាសម្គាល់ជាទម្លាប់សម្រាប់ភាពមិនដំណើរការនៃបេះដូងឬថ្លើម។
en-mt: So they are routine signs for heart or liver dysfunction.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: រោគសញ្ញាពីការព្យាបាលពិសោធន៍ជាក់ស្តែងសំខាន់ៗ៖ ការថតកាំរស្មីទ្រូង និងការវិវត្តទៅតាមពេលវេលានៃរោគសញ្ញាពីការព្យាបាលពិសោធន៍ជាក់ស្តែងគួរតែត្រូវបានពិចារណារួមគ្នាជាមួយបញ្ហាផ្សេងទៀត សម្រាប់ការទស្សន៍ទាយលទ្ធផល និងផលវិបាកនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 ។
en-mt: Key practical experimental therapy symptoms: radiation and evolution over time of treatment symptoms Actual experiences should be considered together with other issues for predicting the outcome and consequences of COVID-19.

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: ការប្រើប្រាស់ថ្នាំ steroids៖ ដូចដែលបានរៀបរាប់ខាងលើ steroids គឺជាសារធាតុដែលធ្វើអោយប្រព័ន្ធភាពស៊ាំចុះខ្សោយ ដែលត្រូវបានគេប្រើក្នុងការព្យាបាលបូកផ្សំសម្រាប់ជំងឺឆ្លងមួយចំនួនដើម្បីកាត់បន្ថយភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរនៃការរលាក។
en-mt: Using steroids: As described above, steroids are substances that weaken the immune system Used in compound-plus therapy for some infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammation.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: ការប្រើប្រាស់កម្រិតថ្នាំ corticosteroid ក្នុងកម្រិតខ្ពស់គឺត្រូវបានប្រើប្រាស់ក្នុងការព្យាបាលអ្នកជំងឺ SARS ធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ។ អ្នកដែលរស់រានមានជីវិតបានទទួលរងនូវការស្លោកសរសៃឈាមនិងឆ្អឹង ដែលបង្កឲ្យមានពិការភាពមួយជីវិត ឬក៏ថយចុះគុណភាពជីវិត។
en-mt: Advanced doses of corticosteroid drugs are used in treating severe SARS patients Survivors have suffered blood and bone slogans that cause life disabilities or decreased quality of life.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ដូច្នេះហើយ ប្រសិនបើមានការចាំបាច់ steroids គួរតែត្រូវបានប្រើប្រាស់នៅក្នុងកម្រិតមួយទាប និងរយៈពេលខ្លីសម្រាប់អ្នកជំងឺ COVID-19។
en-mt: Therefore, if necessary, steroids should be used at a lower level and for a short period of time for COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: ភាពតានតឹងខាងផ្លូវចិត្ត៖ ដូចដែលបានរៀបរាប់ខាងលើ ក្នុងកំឡុងពេលនៃការផ្ទុះជំងឺ COVID-19 អ្នកជំងឺជាច្រើនបានទទួលរងនូវភាពតានតឹងមិនធម្មតាទេ ព្រោះពួកគេស៊ូទ្រាំយូរនិងច​ត្តា​ឡី​ស័ក ភាពមិនប្រាកដប្រជា ហើយនិងការឃើញការស្លាប់របស់សមាជិកគ្រួសារជិតស្និទ្ធនិងអ្នកជំងឺផ្សេងទៀត។
en-mt: Mental stress: As mentioned above during the COVID-19 outbreak, many patients suffered from unusual stress Because they endure long and factory, uncertainty and the sight of the death of close family members and other patients.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: វាជាការចាំបាច់ក្នុងការផ្តល់ការប្រឹក្សាខាងផ្លូវចិត្តនិងការគាំទ្ររយៈពេលវែងដើម្បីជួយអ្នកជំងឺទាំងនេះឱ្យរួចផុតពីភាពតានតឹងនិងត្រឡប់ទៅរកជីវិតធម្មតាវិញ។
en-mt: It is essential to provide emotional counseling and long-term support to help these patients out of stress and return to normal life.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: យោងតាមការសិក្សាប្រជាសាស្ត្រកន្លងមក ជំងឺ COVID-19 ហាក់ដូចជាមានលក្ខណៈប្លែកពីជំងឺរាតត្បាត SARS។
en-mt: According to past demographic studies, COVID-19 appears to be a distinctive characteristic of the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: បន្ថែមពីលើការចម្លងនៅក្នុងបំពង់ផ្លូវដង្ហើមខាងក្រោម វីរុស SARS-CoV-2 អាចចម្លងតាមបំពង់ផ្លូវដង្ហើមផ្នែកខាងលើបានយ៉ាងមានប្រសិទ្ធិភាព និងបណ្តាលឱ្យមានរោគសញ្ញាស្រាល ឬមិនមានរោគសញ្ញានៅដំណាក់កាលដំបូងនៃការឆ្លងមេរោគ ដែលវាស្រដៀងគ្នាទៅនឹងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណាដទៃទៀត ដែលជាបង្កឱ្យមានជំងឺផ្តាសាយធម្មតា។
en-mt: In addition to transmission in the respiratory tube below, the SARS-CoV-2 virus can be effectively transmitted via the upper respiratory tube and accounts for Mild symptoms or no symptoms in the early stages of an infection, which is similar to other cholera, which leads to normal influency.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: ដូច្នេះហើយ អ្នកជំងឺដែលបានឆ្លងនៅដំណាក់កាលដំបូង ឬក៏នៅក្នុងរយៈពេលដែលមិនទាន់ចេញរោគសញ្ញា អាចផលិតបាននូវបរិមាណមេរោគយ៉ាងច្រើនក្នុងអំឡុងពេលធ្វើសកម្មភាពរស់នៅប្រចាំថ្ងៃ ដែលនេះបណ្ដាលអោយមានការពិបាកក្នុងការគ្រប់គ្រងជំងឺរាតត្បាតនេះ។
en-mt: So patients who are infected in the early stages or within the period of non-symptoms can produce main quantities A large number of diseases during daily living activities, creating difficulties in controlling the pandemic.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: ទោះជាយ៉ាងនេះក្តី ការបញ្ជូនបន្ត ឬការចម្លងនៃវីរុស SARS-CoV ត្រូវបានគេចាត់ទុកថាបានកើតឡើងនៅពេលដែលអ្នកជំងឺមានអាការធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ ខណៈដែលការឆ្លងភាគច្រើនមិនបានកើតឡើងនៅដំណាក់កាលដំបូងនោះឡើយ។
en-mt: Even so, the relay or transmission of the SARS-CoV virus is considered to have occurred when you are He was severe, while most infections did not occur in the early stages.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: ដូច្នេះការផ្ទុះឡើងបច្ចុប្បន្ននៃ COVID-19 គឺមានសភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរនិងពិបាកគ្រប់គ្រងជាងការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺសា (SARS) ។
en-mt: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is more serene and harder to control than the outbreak (SARS).

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: បច្ចុប្បន្ននេះកិច្ចខិតខំប្រឹងប្រែងដ៏ធំកំពុងដំណើរការនៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិនរួមមានការបិទទ្វារទីក្រុងវូហាននិងទីក្រុងជុំវិញ និងការធ្វើច​ត្តា​ឡី​ស័កជាបន្តបន្ទាប់នៃប្រជាជនស្ទើរតែទាំងអស់ដោយសង្ឃឹមថាអាចនឹងរាំងស្ទះដល់ការចម្លងបន្តនៃជំងឺ SARS-CoV-2 ។
en-mt: Currently, major efforts are underway in China, including closing the city of Wuhan and surrounding cities And the subsequent performance of almost all people, hoping to stunt the continuing transmission of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: ទោះបីជាសកម្មភាពទាំងនេះបានធ្វើឱ្យខូចខាតដល់សេដ្ឋកិច្ចនិងវិស័យផ្សេងទៀតនៃប្រទេសក៏ដោយ ចំនួនអ្នកជំងឺថ្មីកំពុងថយចុះដែលបង្ហាញពីការថយចុះនៃការឆ្លងរាលដាល។
en-mt: Albeit these actions have damaged the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, showing a decline in infections.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: ការប៉ាន់ស្មានដ៏សុទិដ្ឋិនិយមបំផុត គឺថាការផ្ទុះឡើងនឹងបញ្ចប់នៅខែមីនា ហើយដំណាក់កាលធ្លាក់ចុះថមថយនឹងមានរយៈពេលពី 3-4 ខែ។
en-mt: The most optimistic speculation is that the outbreak will end in March and the downward phase will last from 3-4 months.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ អ្នកជំនាញខ្លះទៀតមិនមានសុទិដ្ឋិនិយមដូចនេះទេ។
en-mt: However, some other experts are not as optimistic.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: លោក ផល ហាន់ធើរ (Paul Hunter) និងអ្នកដទៃទៀត បានប៉ាន់ប្រមាណថា ជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលហាក់ដូចជា ឆ្លងខ្លាំងជាងជំងឺ SARS នឹងមិនបញ្ចប់នៅឆ្នាំ 2020 ទេ។
en-mt: Paul Hunter and others have estimated that COVID-19, which appears to be higher than SARS, will not end by 2020.

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: លោកអ៊ីរ៉ា ឡងហ្គីនី (Ira Longini) និងអ្នកដទៃទៀត បានបង្កើតគំរូមួយ ដើម្បីព្យាករលទ្ធផលនៃការរីករាលដាល ហើយបានណែនាំថាវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 អាចឆ្លងដល់ទៅពីរភាគបីនៃចំនួនប្រជាជនពិភពលោក។
en-mt: Ira Longini and others have created a model to predict the outcome of the growth SARS-CoV-2 virus can reach up to two-thirds of the world's population.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: ក្រុមកាណាដាមួយក្រុមបានរាយការណ៍ថា វីរុស SARS-CoV-2 ត្រូវបានគេរកឃើញទាំងនៅនឹងជ័រស៊កច្រមុះនិងជ័រចាក់ស៊កបំពង់ករបស់អ្នកជំងឺដែលបានជាសះស្បើយ និងចេញពីមន្ទីរពេទ្យកាលពី 2 សប្តាហ៍មុនដែលបង្ហាញថាវីរុសដែលត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ថាថ្មីអាចក្លាយជាដំណាក់កាលវដ្តស្រដៀងនឹងជំងឺផ្តាសាយ។
en-mt: A group of Canadians reported that the SARS-CoV-2 virus was found both in the nose and the throat jumper of a recovered patient And out of the hospital 2 weeks ago, showing that the newly known virus could become a cyclical phase similar to influency.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ សញ្ញាលេចធ្លោបានកើតឡើងនៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិន ដោយផ្អែកលើចំនួនករណីថ្មី ដែលកំពុងតែថយចុះ ដែលវាបង្ហាញថា យុទ្ធសាស្ត្របច្ចុប្បន្នអាចនឹងកំពុងដំណើរការ។
en-mt: However, prominent signs have emerged in China based on the number of new, declining cases, which it indicates that the current strategy may be working.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: អេបូឡាត្រូវបានគេព្យាករណ៍ពីដំបូងថាអាចបណ្តាលឱ្យមានករណីដល់ទៅមួយលានករណីជាមួយនឹងការស្លាប់កន្លះលាននាក់។
en-mt: Ebola was initially predicted that could result in as many as one million cases with half a million deaths.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: វីរុស SARS-CoV-2 មានអត្រាឆ្លងខ្ពស់តាមរយៈការក្អក កណ្តាស ឬក៏អាចឆ្លងតាមរយៈការប៉ះពាល់វត្ថុណាដែលមានផ្ទុកនូវវីរុសដោយផ្ទាល់។
en-mt: The SARS-CoV-2 virus has a high rate of infection via nausea or can be transmitted via the impact of any obstacle that contains the virus directly.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.

en-mt: The virus was also found in waste, raising the new possibility of transmission from the mouth to the mouth.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: ការសិក្សាថ្មីមួយទៅលើករណីចំនួន 138 បានរាយការណ៍ថា 41% នៃករណីសរុបគឺប្រហែលជាបានបង្កឡើងដោយការរីករាលដាលពីក្នុងមន្ទីរពេទ្យ ដោយមានអ្នកជំងឺ 17 នាក់មានជំងឺស្រាប់ រួមនឹងអ្នកផ្ដល់សេវាសុខភាព 40 នាក់។
en-mt: A new study into 138 cases reported that 41% of the total cases were probably caused by grief The spread from within the hospital with 17 patients with ill health, including 40 health service providers.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: ហេតុដូច្នេះហើយ ការប្រយ័ត្នប្រយែងល្អបំផុត គួរតែត្រូវបានធ្វើឡើងក្នុងការការពារមនុស្សលោក ជាពិសេសអ្នកផ្តល់សេវាសុខភាព អ្នកធ្វើការងារសង្គម សមាជិកគ្រួសារ បុគ្គលិករួមការងារ ក៏ដូចជាអ្នក ដែលប្រឈមមុខផ្ទាល់ជាមួយអ្នកជំងឺ ឬក៏អ្នកដែលឆ្លង។
en-mt: Therefore, the best precautions should be taken in protecting people, especially health service providers, workers Social members, family members, colleagues, as well as those who directly challenge the patient or the infected.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: ខ្សែការពារទីមួយដែលអាចប្រើដើម្បីបន្ថយហានិភ័យនៃការឆ្លងគឺតាមរយៈការពាក់ម៉ាស់។ ទាំងការប្រើប្រាស់ម៉ាស់ពាក់វះកាត់ និងម៉ាស់ការពារដង្ហើម N95 (ស៊េរី # 1860s) ជួយគ្រប់គ្រងការរីករាលដាលនៃមេរោគ។
en-mt: The number one quarterback that can be used to reduce the risk of crossing is through wearing masks. Surgery and N95 respiratory prevention mass (series # 1860s) help control the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: របាំងមុខសម្រាប់វះកាត់ការពារដំណក់ទឹករាវពីបុគ្គល ដែលអាចងាយឆ្លងជំងឺ ដោយការពារពីការធ្វើដំណើរតាមខ្យល់នៃដំណក់ទឹកនេះ ឬធ្លាក់លើផ្ទៃនៃវត្ថុធាតុផ្សេងទៀត ដែលជាកន្លែង ដែលពួកគេអាចត្រូវបានបញ្ជូនបន្តទៅអ្នកដទៃ។
en-mt: A mask for surgery protects liquid droplets from individuals who may be susceptible to disease by protecting against air travel This drop of water or falls on the surface of other objects, where they can be passed on to others.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: ទោះជាយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ មានតែម៉ាស់ប្រភេទ N95 (ស៊េរី # 1860s) ប៉ុណ្ណោះដែលអាចការពារប្រឆាំងទៅនឹងការជ្រាបចូលនៃវីរុសដែលមានទំហំតូចពី 10 ទៅ 80 nm ហើយ 5% នៃវីរុសប៉ុណ្ណោះដែលអាចជ្រាបចូលទៅក្នុងម៉ាស់នេះបាន។ SARS-CoV-2 មានលក្ខណៈស្រដៀងគ្នាទៅនឹង SARS-CoV ដែលទំហំពួកវាគឺ 85 nm។
en-mt: However, only the N95 type of N95 (series #1860s) can protect against the penetration of small viruses from 10 to 80 nm and only 5% of the virus can be penetrated into this mass. SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV, where they are 85 nm.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: ដោយហេតុថាភាគល្អិតអាចជ្រាបចូលបានសូម្បីតែតាមរយៈម៉ាស់ពាក់វះកាត់ចំនួនប្រាំដែលដាក់ត្រួតគ្នា អ្នកផ្តល់សេវាថែទាំសុខភាពដែលទាក់ទងផ្ទាល់ជាមួយអ្នកជំងឺត្រូវតែពាក់ម៉ាស់ N95 (ស៊េរីកំឡុងឆ្នាំ 1860) ប៉ុន្តែមិនត្រូវពាក់ម៉ាស់វះកាត់ទេ។
en-mt: Because the particles are accessible, even through five surgical masks that are controlled, white maintenance service providers Health directly associated with patients must wear the N95 (series during 1860), but not to wear surgery.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: បន្ថែមពីលើការពាក់ម៉ាស់ អ្នកផ្តល់សេវាសុខភាពគួរតែពាក់ឈុតពេទ្យដាច់ដោយឡែកពីគ្នា ក្នុងគោលបំណងកាត់បន្ថយការប៉ះពាល់ផ្ទាល់ជាមួយវីរុសបន្ថែមទៀត។
en-mt: In addition to wearing clothes, health service providers should wear separate medical suits in order to reduce direct contact with additional viruses.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: វីរុសក៏អាចចម្លងដល់មនុស្សម្នាក់តាមរយៈភ្នែកផងដែរ។
en-mt: The virus can also be transmitted to a human being via the eye.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 22 ខែមករាឆ្នាំ 2020 វេជ្ជបណ្ឌិតម្នាក់បានឆ្លងវីរុs SARS-CoV-2 ទោះបីជាគាត់ពាក់ម៉ាស់ N95 ក៏ដោយ។ វីរុសប្រហែលជាចូលក្នុងខ្លួនរបស់គាត់តាមរយៈភ្នែករលាករបស់គាត់។
en-mt: On January 22, 2020, a doctor contracted SARS-CoV-2 Although he is wearing an N95 mask, the virus may have entered his body through his rashing eye.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: ហេតុដូច្នេះ អ្នកផ្តល់សេវាថែទាំសុខភាពក៏ត្រូវពាក់របាំងមុខឬវ៉ែនតាការពារភ្នែកផងដែរនៅពេលប្រតិបត្តិការជាមួយអ្នកជំងឺ។
en-mt: Therefore, healthcare service providers also have to wear eye-protective masks or ventilators when operating with patients.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: សម្រាប់ប្រជាជនទូទៅដែលស្ថិតនៅក្នុងតំបន់ដែលមានការឆ្លង ឬក៏ឆ្លងខ្លាំង ពួកគេគ្រប់គ្នាត្រូវបានណែនាំឲ្យលាងដៃជាមួយសាប៊ូសម្លាប់មេរោគឱ្យបានញឹកញាប់ជាងរាល់ដង ហើយព្យាយាមស្នាក់នៅក្នុងផ្ទះសម្រាប់ការធ្វើចត្តាឡីស័កខ្លួនឯង និងកំណត់ការប្រាស្រ័យទាក់ទងជាមួយនឹងបុគ្គលដែលអាចនឹងមានការឆ្លង។
en-mt: For the general population located in an infected or highly infected area, they are all advised to wash their hands with soap and kill the virus frequently More than every time and try to stay in the house for self-employment and determine interaction with individuals who may be transmitted.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: បីហ្វីត ត្រូវបានគេចាត់ទុកថា ជាចម្ងាយសមរម្យសម្រាប់មនុស្សដែលត្រូវនៅឱ្យឆ្ងាយពីអ្នកជំងឺ។
en-mt: Three feet are considered a suitably distance for people to stay away from the patient.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: សកម្មភាពទាំងនេះគឺជាវិធីសាស្ត្រដ៏មានប្រសិទ្ធភាពដើម្បីកាត់បន្ថយហានិភ័យនៃការឆ្លងក៏ដូចជាការពារនូវការរីករាលដាលនៃវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: These activities are effective methods to reduce the risk of transmission as well as prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: ទោះបីជាវីរុសជំងឺ SARS-CoV-2 បានក្លាយជាវីរុសថ្មីសម្រាប់ពិភពមនុស្សក៏ដោយ ភាពដូចគ្នាខ្លាំងទៅនឹងវីរុសជំងឺសា (SARS-CoV) របស់វាដូចដែលត្រូវបានគេរាយការណ៍នៅថ្ងៃទី 7 ខែមករាឆ្នាំ 2020 គួរតែធ្វើឲ្យ​ប្រទេសចិនបានមានការប្រុងប្រយ័ត្នខ្ពស់ និងគួរតែបានចងចាំយ៉ាងច្បាស់អំពីការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺសា (SARS) ក្នុងឆ្នាំ 2003 ។
en-mt: Although the SARS-CoV-2 virus has become a new virus for the human globe, a strong similarity to its SARS-CoV virus as it is reported January 7, 2020 should make China on high alert and should clearly remember the outbreak (SARS) in 2003.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ រហូតមកដល់ថ្ងៃទី 19 ខែមករាឆ្នាំ 2020 នាយកនៃមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលគ្រប់គ្រងជំងឺអ៊ូហានបានលួងលោមប្រជាពលរដ្ឋខ្លួនដោយនិយាយថា វីរុសថ្មីនេះមានការចម្លងទាប ហើយការបន្តពូជរបស់វាគឺនៅមានកម្រិតពីមនុស្សម្នាក់ទៅមនុស្សម្នាក់ទៀត ហើយវាគ្មានបញ្ហាក្នុងការការពារនិងទប់ទល់នឹងជំងឺនេះនោះទេ។
en-mt: However, until January 19, 2020, the director of the John's Centers for Disease Control consoled its cities by saying  The new virus is low-transmission and its reproduction is still limited from one human to another, and it has no problem protecting and resisting it.

sourceString: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
targetString: សារនេះបានបន្ធូរបន្ថយនូវការប្រកាសអាសន្នដល់សាធារណជនជាពិសេសនៅពេលដែលប្រទេសទាំងមូលកំពុងរៀបចំសម្រាប់ពិធីបុណ្យនិទាឃរដូវ ហើយវាជាពេលវេលាដ៏សំខាន់ដែលបានខកខានក្នុងការទប់ស្កាត់នូវការនូវជំងឺនេះ កាលវានៅមានកម្រិតតិចតួចនៅឡើយនៅក្រុង វូហាន។
en-mt: The message has diminished emergency declarations to the public, especially when the whole country is preparing for festivals Spring, and it is essentially a missed time to prevent the disease, while it is still minimal to Vaughan.

sourceString: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
targetString: ភ្នាក់ងារគ្រប់គ្រងជំងឺនៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិនអាចនឹងទទួលយកមេរៀនដ៏លំបាកនេះ និងធ្វើការកែលម្អយ៉ាងមុតមាំនាពេលអនាគត។
en-mt: The disease control agency in China may take this difficult education and make sustained future improvements.

sourceString: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
targetString: ឧទាហរណ៍ ទីភ្នាក់ងារទាំងនេះគួរតែ (1) មានការប្រុងប្រយ័ត្នជាងមុននៅពេលធ្វើការប្រកាសជាសាធារណៈ ពីព្រោះគ្រប់ពាក្យទាំងអស់ គឺមានសារៈសំខាន់ណាស់ទៅដល់ពលរដ្ឋ ហើយវាអាចផ្លាស់ប្តូរអាកប្បកិរិយា និងការសម្រេចចិត្តរបស់ពួកគេបាន។ (2) ប្រុងប្រយ័ត្ន ហើយឆ្លើយតបឲ្យបានល្អចំពោះព័ត៌មានមិនប្រក្រតី ដែលបានមកពីគ្លីនិកជាជាងរង់ចាំរបាយការណ៍ផ្លូវការចេញពីវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត ឬមន្រ្តី។ (3) រឹតត្បិតបន្ថែមទៀត ដើម្បីទប់ទល់នឹងការរាតត្បាត ដែលអាចកើតមាននៅដំណាក់កាលដំបូង ជាជាងព្យាយាមលួងលោមសាធារណជនដទៃ។ និង (4) ញឹកញាប់ជាងមុនក្នុងការហាត់អនុវត្តសាកល្បង ដែលមានគោលដៅ និងមានប្រសិទ្ធភាព ដើម្បីបង្កើនការយល់ដឹងរបស់សាធារណៈជនអំពីជំងឺរាតត្បាត និងដើម្បីធ្វើតេស្ត និងកែលម្អប្រព័ន្ធឆ្លើយតបរបស់សង្គមជាប្រចាំ។
en-mt: For example, these agencies should (1) be more cautive when making public declarations because every term is important Come to the cities and it can change their attitudes and decisions. (2) Be careful and respond well to the clouds Irregular information coming from the clinic rather than waiting for official reports from doctors or music. (3) restrictions Additionally to combat an epidemic that could occur in the early stages rather than trying to comfort the other public. and (4) More frequently in testing practices that are targeted and effective to improve the public's understanding of pandemics and to test and regularly improve social response systems.

sourceString: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលបណ្ដាលមកពីវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 បានចាប់ផ្ដើមនៅចុងខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019។
en-mt: The outbreak of THE COVID-19 disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus began in late December 2019.

sourceString: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
targetString: ក្នុងរយៈពេលតិចជាងពីរខែ វាបានរីករាលដាលពាសពេញប្រទេសចិននិងជិត 50 ប្រទេសផ្សេងទៀតនៅទូទាំងពិភពលោកនៅពេលនៃការសរសេរនេះ។
en-mt: In less than two months, it spread across China and nearly 50 other countries around the globe at the time of the writing.

sourceString: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
targetString: ដោយសារវីរុសនេះមានលក្ខណៈស្រដៀងនឹងវីរុស SARS-CoV ហើយរោគសញ្ញាក៏ស្រដៀងគ្នារវាងជំងឺ COVID-19 និង SARS ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 បានបង្កើតឱ្យមានអារម្មណ៍ថាជំងឺ SARS លាប់ឡើង​វិញ។
en-mt: Because the virus is similar to SARS-CoV, and symptoms are similar between COVID-19 and SARS, an outbreak of COVID-19 has recreated the feeling of SARS.

sourceString: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
targetString: បើទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ មានភាពខុសគ្នាគួរឱ្យកត់សម្គាល់មួយចំនួនរវាងជំងឺ COVID-19 និងជំងឺ SARS ដែលចាំបាច់សម្រាប់ការទប់ស្កាត់កុំឲ្យមានការរាលដាលនិងដើម្បីព្យាបាលអ្នកជំងឺ។
en-mt: However, there are some significant differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for preventing spread and to treat patients.

sourceString: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
targetString: ជំងឺ COVID-19 ប៉ះពាល់មនុស្សដែលមានវ័យចំណាស់ ច្រើនជាងយុវជន ហើយបុរសច្រើនជាងស្ត្រី និងភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ និងអត្រាមរណភាពសម្រាប់អ្នកជំងឺ ដែលមានវ័យចំណាស់ខ្លាំង ក៏មានខ្ពស់ជាងយុវជនផងដែរ។
en-mt: COVID-19 affects people older than young men and men more than women and obesity Severity and death rates for extremely elderly patients are also higher than young people.

sourceString: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
targetString: ជំងឺ SARS មានមរណៈភាពច្រើនជាងជំងឺ COVID-19 (10.91% ទល់នឹង 1.44%)។
en-mt: SARS died more than COVID-19 (10.91% vs. 1.44%).

sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: អ្នកជំងឺ COVID-19 ចម្លងវីរុសនេះទៅអ្នកដទៃបានបើទោះបីជាពួកគេមិនមានរោគសញ្ញាក៏ដោយ ខណៈដែលអ្នកជំងឺ SARS មិនមានរោគសញ្ញាអ្វីទៅវិញនៅពេលដែលពួកគេមានសភាពជំងឺធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ ដែលនេះវាធ្វើឱ្យកាន់តែលំបាកក្នុងការទប់ស្កាត់ការរីករាលដាលនៃ COVID-19 ជាង SARS។
en-mt: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus to others, albeit they have no symptoms, while SARS patients have no symptoms On the other hand, when they are sick, it makes it more difficult to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: ការនេះពន្យល់បានខ្លះៗពីមូលហេតុដែលវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 រីករាលដាលលឿនជាងវីរុស SARS-CoV ។
en-mt: This explains some of the reasons why the SARS-CoV-2 virus spreads faster than the SARS-CoV virus.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ខ្សែស្រឡាយ RNA ជាធម្មតារបស់ SARS-CoV-2 អាចនឹងមិនមានវត្តមានក្នុងខ្លួនអ្នកជំងឺ COVID-19 មួយចំនួន។
en-mt: The usual RNA thread of SARS-CoV-2 may not be present in some COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: ម៉្យាងទៀត អ្នកជំងឺដែលបានព្យាបាលជាសះស្បើយហើយអាចមានវីរុសនេះវិជ្ជមានឡើងវិញ។
en-mt: On the other hand, patients who have recovered and may have the virus re-positive.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: ការរកឃើញទាំងនេះបង្កើនហានិភ័យនៃការរាលដាលវីរុសយ៉ាងខ្លាំង។
en-mt: These findings significantly increase the risk of spreading the virus.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: ដោយមានការវិវឌ្ឍន៍យ៉ាងឆាប់រហ័សបែបនេះនៅក្នុងការស្រាវជ្រាវលើជំងឺ COVID-19 មានបញ្ហាសំខាន់ៗមួយចំនួនដែលត្រូវដោះស្រាយដូចខាងក្រោម៖
en-mt: With this rapid evolution in research into COVID-19, there are some important issues to be addressed as:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: តើជំងឺសា (SARS-CoV-2) មានដើមកំណើតចេញមកពីណា?
en-mt: Where did the disease (SARS-CoV-2) come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: ទោះបីជា 96% នៃភាពដូចគ្នានៃហ្សែនត្រូវបានគេរកឃើញរវាង SARS-CoV-2 និងវីរុសប្រភេទ SARS ពីសត្វប្រចៀវក៏ដោយក៏យើងនៅតែមិនអាចសន្និដ្ឋានបានថា SARS-CoV-2 គឺមកពីសត្វប្រចៀវ។
en-mt: Albeit 96% of genetic samples were detected between SARS-CoV-2 and SAR-type viruses S from bats, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from a bat.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: តើសត្វអ្វីជាសត្វនៅកណ្តាលដែលអាចចម្លងវីរុសពីមេចម្លងដើម ឧទាហរណ៍ដូចជាសត្វប្រចៀវ ទៅកាន់មនុស្ស?
en-mt: What animals in the middle can transmit viruses from the original transmission, for example, as bats to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: ដោយមិនដឹងចម្លើយទី 1 និងទី 2 យើងមិនអាចកាត់បន្ថយការចម្លង ឬបញ្ជូនបានដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាពទេ ហើយការផ្ទុះឡើងអាចនឹងកើតឡើងវិញនៅពេលណាក៏បាន។
en-mt: Without knowing the 1st and 2nd answers, we cannot reduce transmission or transmission effectively, and an outbreak may recur at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: ទោះបីជាមានការធ្វើគំរូម៉ូលេគុល និងការសាកល្បងធ្វើគីមីជីវសាស្រ្តក៏ដោយ ក៏វាបានបង្ហាញថា វីរុស SRAS-CoV-2 អាចបត់បែន និងជ្រាបចូលទៅក្នុង ACE2 ប៉ុន្តែថាតើ វីរុសនេះអាចចូលទៅក្នុងកោសិកាផ្លូវដង្ហើម ដែលបណ្ដាលឱ្យកើតជំងឺដោយរបៀបណា គឺមិនទាន់ដឹងច្បាស់នៅឡើយទេ?
en-mt: Despite molecular modeling and biological chemical tests, it has shown that the SRAS-CoV-2 virus is flexible and penetrating In ACE2, but how is the virus able to enter respiratory cells that cause disease is not yet known.

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
targetString: តើវីរុសនេះអាចភ្ជាប់កោសិកាដែលបញ្ចេញ ACE2 ទៅក្នុងសរីរាង្គផ្សេងទៀតបានដែរឬទេ?
en-mt: Could the virus be connected to cells that release ACE2 into other organisms?

sourceString: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
targetString: ប្រសិនបើគ្មានចម្លើយច្បាស់លាស់ចំពោះសំណួរទាំងនេះទេ យើងមិនអាចទទួលបានការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យបានលឿន និងត្រឹមត្រូវ និងការព្យាបាលប្រកបដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាពនោះទេ។
en-mt: If there are no definitive answers to these questions, we cannot get quick and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.

sourceString: How long will the epidemic last?
targetString: តើការរាតត្បាតនេះនឹងមានរយៈពេលយូរប៉ុនណា?
en-mt: How long will the epidemic last?

sourceString: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
targetString: តើវីរុសមានការវិវត្តហ្សែនយ៉ាងដូចម្តេចអំឡុងពេលឆ្លងក្នុងចំណោមមនុស្ស?
en-mt: How genetically evolves during infections around humans?

sourceString: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
targetString: តើវានឹងក្លាយទៅជាជំងឺរាតត្បាតជាសកល ឬក៏បាត់ទៅវិញដូចជាជំងឺ SARS ឬក៏កើតឡើងវិញដូចទៅនឹងជំងឺផ្កាសាយធំ?
en-mt: Is it going to turn into a global pandemic or disappear back as SARS, or a recurrence akin to blossoms?

sourceString: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
targetString: វាពិតជាមានសារៈសំខាន់ ប៉ុន្តែវាអាចត្រូវការពេលខ្លះដើម្បីធ្វើការស្រាវជ្រាវសម្រាប់ឆ្លើយតបនូវសំណួរខាងលើ ក៏ដូចជាសំណួរផ្សេងៗទៀត។
en-mt: It is really important, but it may take some time to do research for answering the above questions as well as other questions.

sourceString: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ មិនថាត្រូវចំណាយអ្វីក៏ដោយ យើងគ្មានជំរើសអ្វីនោះទេ គឺយើងត្រូវតែបញ្ឈប់ការរីករាលដាលឱ្យបានឆាប់ និងធ្វើឱ្យជីវិតរបស់យើង វិលមករកភាពធម្មតាវិញ​។
en-mt: However, no matter what it costs, we have no choice, we must stop the spread quickly and make our lives return to normal.

sourceString: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
targetString: ដើមកំណើតហ្សូណូតិច (ចម្លងពីសត្វទៅមនុស្ស) នៃវីរុសកូរ៉ូណារបស់មនុស្ស
en-mt: The origin of Xonotech (transmission from animals to humans) of the human cholera virus

sourceString: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
targetString: ការផ្លាស់ប្តូរនិងការបន្សាំខ្លួនបានជំរុញឱ្យមានសហនៃវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា (CoVs) និងភាវៈរស់ បួករួមទាំងមនុស្សជាតិអស់រយៈពេលរាប់ពាន់ឆ្នាំមកហើយ។
en-mt: The changes and combinations have prompted the co-operation of the Corona virus (CoVs) and living organs, including humanity, for thousands of years.

sourceString: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
targetString: មុនឆ្នាំ 2003 គេបានរកឃើញមនុស្សពីរនាក់ដែលមានវីរុស CoVs (HCoVs) ដែលបង្កឲ្យ​មាន​ជំងឺស្រាលដូចជាជំងឺផ្តាសាយធម្មតា។
en-mt: Before 2003, two people with CoVs (HCoVs) caused a common flu-like disease.

sourceString: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃរោគសញ្ញាផ្លូវដង្ហើមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ (SARS) និងរោគសញ្ញាផ្លូវដង្ហើមមជ្ឈឹមបូព៌ា (MERS) បានបង្វែរគោលដៅ ដើម្បីបង្ហាញថា តើការឆ្លងមេរោគ HCoV គឺវាសាហាវ និងគ្រោះថ្នាក់ដល់អាយុជីវិតមនុស្សកម្រិតណា។
en-mt: An outbreak of severe respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East Tract Syndrome The Orient (MERS) has turned to demonstrating how brutal and human life-threatening HCoV infections are.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
targetString: ការលេចឡើងនៃ SARS-CoV-2 នៅភាគកណ្ដាលប្រទេសចិនកាលពីចុងឆ្នាំ 2019 បានធ្វើឱ្យមេរោគនេះស្ថិតក្នុងចំនុចក្តៅម្តងទៀត ហើយធ្វើឱ្យយើងភ្ញាក់ផ្អើលចំពោះការរាលដាលយ៉ាងខ្លាំងរបស់វា ប៉ុន្តែបែរជាមានការថយចុះនៃលទ្ធភាពបង្កជាជំងឺ បើប្រៀបធៀបទៅនឹង​បងស្រី SARS-CoV របស់វា។
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China in late 2019 put the virus in the hot spot again and made it We were surprised by its dramatic spread, but there was a decrease in the likelihood of causing disease compared to its SARS-CoV sister.

sourceString: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
targetString: ការឆ្លងមេរោគ HCoV គឺជាជម្ងឺហ្សូ៊ណូទិច (ឆ្លងពីសត្វទៅមនុស្ស) ហើយការស្វែងយល់ពីប្រភពហ្ស៊ូណូទិចនៃ HCoVs គឺអាចជួយយើងបាន។
en-mt: HCoV infection is a xenotic disease (transmitted from animals to humans) and finding out the source of HCoVs of XunoVs can help us.

sourceString: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
targetString: HCoV ភាគច្រើនមានដើមកំណើតពីសត្វប្រចៀវដែលពួកវាមិនមែនជាអ្នកបង្ករោគ។
en-mt: Most HCoV originates from bats, where they are not infected.

sourceString: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
targetString: គេបានរកឃើញ​ធ្មួលអាងស្តុកកណ្តាលនៃមេរោគ HCoVs មួយចំនួន។
en-mt: Some HCoVs have been found.

sourceString: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
targetString: ការកំណត់អត្តសញ្ញាណធ្មួលសត្វមានផលប៉ះពាល់ផ្ទាល់ក្នុងការការពារជំងឺរបស់មនុស្ស។
en-mt: Identifying animal habitats has a direct impact in the protection of human disease.

sourceString: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
targetString: ការស៊ើបអង្កេតអំពីអន្តរកម្មរបស់ CoV-host នៅក្នុងខ្លួនសត្វប្រហែលជាអាចផ្ដល់នូវការយល់ដឹងបន្ថែមសំខាន់ៗអំពីការបង្កមេរោគ CoV នៅក្នុងខ្លួនមនុស្ស។
en-mt: Investigating the interactions of CoV-host in animals may provide important additional insights into coV virus in humans.

sourceString: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
targetString: នៅក្នុងការរំឮកឡើងវិញនេះ ពួកយើងនឹងបង្ហាញអំពីចំណេះដឹងដែលមានស្រាប់អំពីមេរោគ HCoVs ទាំងប្រាំពីរ ហើយយើងនឹងផ្ដោតសំខាន់ទៅលើប្រវត្តិនៃការរកឃើញ ក៏ដូចជាប្រភពដើមនៃការចម្លងពីសត្វមកមនុស្ស និងការចម្លងពីពូជមួយទៅពូជមួយទៀត។
en-mt: In this retrospective retrospective, we will showcase existing knowledge of the seven HCoVs and we will focus on Discovery practices as well as the original source of transmission from human animals and transmission from one species to another.

sourceString: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
targetString: សំខាន់ជាងនេះទៅទៀត ពួកយើងប្រៀបធៀបនឹង ធ្វើឱ្យឃើញភាពខុសគ្នារវាងវីរុស HCoVs និងទស្សនៈនៃការវិវត្តរបស់វីរុសក៏ដូចជាការប្រមូលផ្ដុំឡើងវិញ​នៃហ្សែនរបស់វា។
en-mt: More importantly, we compare to see the difference between HCoVs and the virus's evolutionary vision as well as the recall of its genes.

sourceString: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.

sourceString: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
targetString: ជាងនេះទៀត គេក៏សង្កត់​ធ្ងន់លើ​តម្រូវការសម្រាប់ការផ្លាស់ប្តូរធ្មួលដោយជោគជ័យ និងផលប៉ះពាល់នៃការវិវត្តន៍របស់វីរុសលើភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរនៃជំងឺផងដែរ។
en-mt: In addition, they also emphasise the need for successful humidity changes and the effects of the evolution of the virus on the severity of the disease.

sourceString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
targetString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) ស្ថិតនៅក្នុងក្រុម Coronaviridae ដែលមានក្រុមវីរុស RNA ដែលមានលក្ខណៈជាស្រោម ញ្ញាណវិជ្ជមាន និងមានខ្សែតែមួយ។
en-mt: Coronaviruses (CoVs) are located in the Coronaviridae group with a RNA virus group with a positive envelope and a single cable.

sourceString: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
targetString: វីរុសទាំងនេះកំពុងផ្ដល់ជម្រកដល់ហ្សែនធំបំផុតពី 26 ទៅ 32 គឺឡូបេស ក្នុងចំនោម RNA របស់វីរុសដែលត្រូវបានគេឱ្យឈ្មោះថា“ CoVs” ដោយសារតែរូបសាស្រ្ដវារាងដូចម្កុដបើមើលក្នុងមីក្រូទ​ស្ស​ន៍ប្រើអេឡិចត្រុង។
en-mt: These viruses are providing shelter to the largest 26 to 32 genes— lopes away from the RNA of the virus They are called "CoVs" because of the crown-like philosophy, if looked at in a TV use of electrons.

sourceString: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
targetString: តាមរចនាសម្ព័ន្ធ CoVs មានសេណូមដែលមិនមានបំណែក ដែលស្ថិតក្រោមអម្បូរស្រដៀងគ្នា។
en-mt: Structurally, CoVs have no fragmented senoms that are subject to similar implications.

sourceString: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
targetString: ប្រហែលជាពីរភាគបីនៃសេណូមមានទម្រង់អំណាន​ចំហជាន់គ្នាធំៗចំនួនពីរ (ORF1a និង ORF1b) ដែល​គេបានផ្ទេរទៅក្នុងប៉ូលីប្រូតេអ៊ីនវីភ្លីកាស់ pp1a និង pp1ab ។
en-mt: About two-thirds of Senom had two large forms of opposition (ORF1a and ORF1b) transferred into the pp1a and pp1ab protein polytechnics.

sourceString: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
targetString: ប៉ូលីត្រូតេអ៊ីនត្រូវបានដំណើរការបន្ថែមទៀតដើម្បីបង្កើតប្រូតេអ៊ីនដែលមិនមែនជារចនាសម្ព័ន្ធចំនួន 16 ដែលត្រូវបានកំណត់ដោយ nsp1~16។
en-mt: Polyteins are processed further to create 16 non-structural proteins determined by nsp1~16.

sourceString: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
targetString: ផ្នែកដែលនៅសល់នៃហ្សែនមានផ្ទុក ORFs សម្រាប់ប្រូតេអ៊ីនដែលមានរចនាសម្ព័ន្ធរួមមាន ស្ព៉ៃឃ៍ (spike (S)), អឹនវែលឡូប (envelope (E)), មឹមប្រេម (membrane (M)) និងប្រូតេអ៊ីននូក្លៀវ (nucleoprotein (N))។
en-mt: The remaining parts of the gene contain ORFs for structured proteins including spike (S), Envelope (E), membrane (M)) and nucleoprotein (N).

sourceString: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
targetString: ប្រូតេអ៊ីនអមជំនួយនៃខ្សែស្រឡាយមួយចំនួនត្រូវបានបញ្ចូលកូដផងដែរដោយខ្សែស្រឡាយ CoVs ខុសគ្នា។
en-mt: The accompanying proteins of certain threads are also coded by different CoVs.

sourceString: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
targetString: យោងតាមភាពខុសគ្នាក្នុងលំដាប់ប្រូតេអ៊ីន គេបានចាត់ COVs ចេញជាបួនប្រភេទ (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV និង delta-CoV) ក្នុងចំណោមប្រភេទទាំងនេះ beta-CoV មាន HCoVs ច្រើនបំផុត ហើយវា​បាន​បែងចែកចេញជាអំបូរបួនទៀត (A, B, C និង D)។
en-mt: According to differences in the protein sequence, coVs were sent out into four types (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV) among these beta-CoV have the most HCoVs and it is divided into four more butterflies (A, B, C and D).

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
targetString: ភស្តុតាងដែលបង្កើតអំបូរមនុស្សសត្វរុក្ខជាតិបានបង្ហាញថា សត្វប្រចៀវ និងសត្វកកេរ បម្រើជាប្រភពហ្សែននៃ alpha-CoVs និង beta-CoVs ច្រើនបំផុត ខណៈដែលសត្វស្លាបគឺជាជលដ្ឋានដ៏ចំបងនៃ gamma-CoVs និង delta-CoVs ។
en-mt: Evidentiary creating plant human fertiliser suggests that bats and spinovers serve as genetic sources of alp The most birds-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main bases of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.

sourceString: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.

sourceString: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.

sourceString: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺ SARS ដែលបានកើតឡើងកាលពីឆ្នាំ 2003 គឺជាការបំផ្លិចបំផ្លាញយ៉ាងសម្បើមមួយក្នុងប្រវត្តិសាស្រ្តបច្ចុប្បន្ន ដែលបានឆ្លងដល់មនុស្សជាង 8000 នាក់ ហើយមានអត្រាមរណភាពសរុបប្រមាណជាង 10%។
en-mt: The outbreak of SARS that occurred in 2003 was one of the massive devastations in history The current psychology has infected more than 8000 people and has a total death rate of approximately 10%.

sourceString: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
targetString: ដប់ឆ្នាំក្រោយមក ការផ្ទុះជម្ងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើមមជ្ឈឹមបូព៌ាបណ្តាលឱ្យមានការរីករាលដាលឥតឈប់ឈរនៅឧបទ្វីបអារ៉ាប់ជាមួយនឹងការរីករាលដាលជាបណ្តើរៗទៅកាន់ពិភពលោក។
en-mt: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory epidemic caused a constant spread in the Arabian Peninsula with the gradual spread of the globe.

sourceString: The 2019 novel HCoV (2019-nCoV), which has subsequently been renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the causative agent of the ongoing epidemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which has claimed more than 3,120 lives and infected more than 91,000 people as of March 3, 2020.
targetString: វីរុសណូវែល HCoV ឆ្នាំ 2019 (2019-nCoV) ដែលត្រូវបានប្តូរឈ្មោះជាថ្មី SARS-CoV-2 គឺជាភ្នាក់ងារបង្កហេតុនៃការរីករាលដាលនៃវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា 2019 (COVID-19) ដែលបានសម្លាប់មនុស្សជាង 3120 នាក់និងឆ្លងច្រើនជាង 91,000 នាក់គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 3 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020។
en-mt: The 2019 HCoV virus (2019-nCoV), renamed SARS-CoV-2, is the cause agent of the viral epidemic Corona 2019 (COVID-19) that killed more than 3120 people and infected more than 91,000 as of March 3, 2020.

sourceString: The alarm has been ringing and the world has to prepare for the coming pandemic of SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: All seven HCoVs have a zoonotic origin from bats, mice or domestic animals.
targetString: HCoV ទាំងប្រាំពីរមានដើមកំណើតហ្សូណូតិចមកពីសត្វប្រចៀវ សត្វកណ្តុរ ឬសត្វចិញ្ចឹមក្នុងស្រុក។

sourceString: Multiple lines of evidence support an evolutionary origin of all HCoVs from bats, where viruses are well adapted and non-pathogenic but show great genetic diversity.

en-mt: Many evidence supports the evolutionary source of all HCoVs from viruses that are variable and non-infective, but shows spectacular genetic diversity.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic has presented enormous medical, scientific, social and moral challenges to China and the world.

sourceString: Tracing the zoonotic origins of HCoVs provides a framework to understand the natural history, driving force and restriction factors of species jumping.

sourceString: This might also guide or facilitate the search for the reservoir, intermediate and amplifying animal host(s) of SARS-CoV-2, with important implications in the prevention of future spillovers.

sourceString: In this review we present an overview of the zoonotic origins, interspecies transmission and pathogenesis of HCoVs.

sourceString: Patients infected with HCoV-229E presented with common cold symptoms, including headache, sneezing, malaise and sore-throat, with fever and cough seen in 10~20% cases.

sourceString: Later in 1967, HCoV-OC43 was isolated from organ culture and subsequent serial passage in brains of suckling mice.

sourceString: The clinical features of HCoV-OC43 infection appear to be similar to those caused by HCoV-229E, which are symptomatically indistinguishable from infection with other respiratory tract pathogens such as influenza A viruses and rhinoviruses.

sourceString: SARS, also known as “atypical pneumonia”, was the first well documented HCoV-caused pandemic in human history and the etiological agent is SARS-CoV, the third HCoV discovered.

sourceString: It was initially found to be prevalent in young children, the elderly and immunocompromised patients with respiratory illnesses.

sourceString: Another independent study described the isolation of the same virus from a nasal specimen from an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.

en-mt: Another independent study described separating the same virus from a nose sample of an 8-month-old boy suffering from pneumonia in the Netherlands.

sourceString: Although it was identified in Netherlands, it is actually distributed globally.
targetString: ទោះបីជាគេបានកំណត់អត្តសញ្ញាណវា​ឃើញនៅក្នុងប្រទេសហូឡង់ក៏ដោយ គេពិតជាបានចែកចាយវាទូទាំងសាកល​លោកមែន។
en-mt: Although it was identified in the Netherlands, they actually shared it globally.

sourceString: It has been estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for approximately 4.7% of common respiratory diseases, and its peak incidence occurs during early summer, spring and winter.
targetString: គេបានប៉ាន់ប្រមាណថា HCoV-NL63 មានចំនួនប្រហែល 4.7% នៃជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើមទូទៅ ហើយការកើនឡើងខ្ពស់បំផុតរបស់វាគឺនៅដើមរដូវក្តៅ និទាឃរដូវ និងរដូវរងា។
en-mt: It is estimated that HCoV-NL63 accounts for about 4.7% of the overall respiratory disease, and its peak is in early summer, spring and winter.

sourceString: HCoV-NL63 is associated with obstructive laryngitis, also known as croup.
targetString: HCoV-NL63 ជាប់ទាក់ទងនឹងជំងឺស្ទះ និងរលាកបំពង់ក ដែលត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ថាជាជំងឺ Croup។
en-mt: HCoV-NL63 is linked to tuberculosis and tuberculosis, known as Croup Disease.

sourceString: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was isolated from a 71-year-old man who had been hospitalized with pneumonia and bronchiolitis in Hong Kong.
targetString: ក្នុងឆ្នាំដដែល HCoV-HKU1 ត្រូវបានបំបែកចេញពីបុរសម្នាក់អាយុ 71 ឆ្នាំដែលបានសម្រាកព្យាបាលនៅមន្ទីរពេទ្យដោយសារជំងឺរលាកសួត និងរលាកទងសួតនៅហុងកុង។
en-mt: In the same year, HCoV-HKU1 was separated from a 71-year-old male who was treated in hospital for pneumonia and tuberculosis in Hong Kong.

sourceString: Besides community-acquired pneumonia and bronchiolitis, HCoV-HKU1 was reported to be associated with acute asthmatic exacerbation.
targetString: ក្រៅពីជំងឺរលាកសួត និងជំងឺរលាកទងសួតដែលទទួលបានដោយសហគមន៍ HCoV-HKU1 ត្រូវបានគេរាយការណ៍ថាមានជាប់ទាក់ទង​នឹងជំងឺហឺតធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ។
en-mt: In addition to pneumonia and tuberculosis suffered by the community, HCoV-HKU1 is reported to have been linked to severe slow disease.

sourceString: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 was found worldwide, causing mild respiratory diseases.
targetString: ស្រដៀងគ្នាទៅនឹង HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E និង HCoV-OC43 ដែរ HCoV-HKU1 ត្រូវបានគេរកឃើញនៅទូទាំងពិភពលោកដែលបង្កឱ្យមានជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើមកម្រិតស្រាល។
en-mt: Similar to HCoV-NL63, HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 has been detected around the globe that leads to minor respiratory diseases.

sourceString: All these four community-acquired HCoVs have been well adapted to humans and are generally less likely to mutate to cause highly pathogenic diseases, though accidents did occur for unknown reasons as in the rare case of a more virulent subtype of HCoV-NL63, which has recently been reported to cause severe lower respiratory tract infection in China.
targetString: រាល់ HCoV ដែលទទួលបាន​តាម​សហគមន៍​ទាំងបួននេះ នេះបានសម្របខ្លួនយ៉ាងល្អក្នុងខ្លួនមនុស្ស ហើយជាទូទៅមិនងាយនឹងបង្កឱ្យមានជំងឺបង្ករោគខ្ពស់ទេ ទោះបីជាមានឧប្បទ្ទវហេតុបានកើតឡើងដោយមិនដឹងមូលហេតុ ដូចក្នុងករណីកម្រនៃប្រភេទរងវីរុស HCoV-NL63 ដែលថ្មីៗនេះ គេបានរាយការណ៍ថាបណ្តាលឱ្យមានការឆ្លងមេរោគរលាកផ្លូវដង្ហើមខាងក្រោមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ ក្នុងប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: Every HCoV obtained by these four communities has adapted well in humans and is generally not easier to cause hypertension, albeit without knowing the accident The cause, as in the rare case of the recent HCoV-NL63 virus, it was reported to have caused a series of lower respiratory infections in China.

sourceString: Generally, when these HCoVs acquire the abilities to transmit efficiently and to maintain themselves continuously within humans, they also become less virulent or pathogenic.
targetString: ជាទូទៅ នៅពេលដែល HCoVs ទាំងនេះទទួលបានសមត្ថភាពក្នុងការបញ្ជូនប្រកប ដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាព និងដើម្បីរក្សាខ្លួនពួកគេជាប្រចាំនៅក្នុងខ្លួនមនុស្ស ពួកវាក៏ក្លាយទៅជាស្លូតឬបង្ករោគតិច។
en-mt: Generally, when these HCoVs are capable of transmitting effectively and to maintain themselves constantly in humans, they also became mild or leprosy.

sourceString: MERS-CoV was first isolated in 2012 from the lung of a 60-year-old patient who developed acute pneumonia and renal failure in Saudi Arabia.
targetString: MERS-CoV ត្រូវបានបំបែកចេញ​ជាលើកដំបូងនៅឆ្នាំ 2012 ពីសួតរបស់អ្នកជំងឺដែលមានអាយុ 60 ឆ្នាំ ដែលបានវិវត្តទៅជាជំងឺរលាកសួតស្រួចស្រាវ និងខ្សោយតម្រងនោមនៅអារ៉ាប៊ីសាអូឌីត។
en-mt: MERS-CoV was separated for the 2012 for the 2012 from the lungs of a 60-year-old patient who evolved into alcohol and kidney failure in Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Whereas most of the laboratory-confirmed cases originate from the Middle East, imported cases with occasional secondary spreads to close contacts have been reported in various European countries and Tunisia.
targetString: ក្នុងករណីភាគច្រើន ដែលបាន​បញ្ជាក់ពីមន្ទីរ​ពិសោធន៍មានប្រភពមកពីមជ្ឈឹមបូព៌ា គេបាន​រាយការណ៍ថា មានករណីដែលបាននាំចូល ដោយ​មានការរាលដាល​លំដាប់ទីពីរម្តងម្កាល​ដោយសារការទាក់ទងជិតស្និទ្ធ នៅក្នុងបណ្តា​ប្រទេសនៅ​អឺរ៉ុប និងទុយនីស៊ី។
en-mt: In the vast majority of cases confirmed by the laboratory, originating from the Middle East, there have been reports that there have been imported cases Occasionally, second-place spread due to close contact in countries in Europe and Tunisia.

sourceString: Another secondary outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015 with 186 confirmed cases.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះជំងឺលំដាប់ទីពីរមួយទៀតបានកើតឡើងនៅប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងកាលពីឆ្នាំ 2015 ដោយ​មាន​ករណីដែល​បាន​បញ្ជាក់​ចំនួន 186 ករណី។
en-mt: Another second-degree outbreak occurred in South Korea in 2015, with 186 confirmed cases.

sourceString: Clinical manifestations of MERS resemble those of SARS, characterized by progressive acute pneumonia.
targetString: ការបង្ហាញរោគសញ្ញាបែបវេជ្ជសាស្រ្តនៃ ជំងឺ MERS មានសណ្ឋាន​ដូចនឹងជំងឺ SARS ដែរ គេ​សម្គាល់​លក្ខណៈ​បាន​តាមរយៈ​ដោយ​ជំងឺរលាកសួត​ស្រួចស្រាវ​ដែល​ចេះតែ​ធ្ងន់ធ្ងរទៅៗ។
en-mt: Displaying medical symptoms of MERS is the same as SARS is identified by severe alcoholic beverages.

sourceString: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS also developed acute renal failure, which is thus far unique for MERS among HCoV-caused diseases.
targetString: មិនដូចជម្ងឺ SARS ទេ អ្នកជម្ងឺជាច្រើនដែលមានជម្ងឺ MERS ក៏បានវិវត្តទៅជាជម្ងឺខ្សោយតំរងនោមស្រួចស្រាវផងដែរ ដែលវាមានលក្ខណៈប្លែកសម្រាប់ជម្ងឺ MERS ក្នុងចំណោមជម្ងឺដែលបង្កដោយ HCoV ។
en-mt: Unlike SARS, many patients with MERS have also evolved into kidney weakened disease Alcohol abuse is also unique for MERS among the diseases caused by HCoV.

sourceString: More than 30% of patients present with gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea and vomiting.
targetString: ច្រើនជាង 30% នៃអ្នកជម្ងឺដែលមានរោគសញ្ញាក្រពះពោះវៀនដូចជារាគ និងក្អួត។
en-mt: More than 30% of patients with gastrointestinal symptoms, like sprains and vomiting.

sourceString: As of February 14, 2020, over 2500 laboratory confirmed cases were reported with a high case fatality of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses known to humans.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 14 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ករណីដែលបានបញ្ជាក់នៅមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍ជាង 2500 ករណីត្រូវបានគេរាយការណ៍ថា មានអត្រាស្លាប់ខ្ពស់ 34.4% ដែលធ្វើឱ្យ MERS-CoV ក្លាយជាវីរុសដ៏សាហាវបំផុតមួយ ដែលមនុស្សធ្លាប់ជួប។
en-mt: As of February 14, 2020, more than 2500 confirmed laboratory cases were confirmed It is reported to have a high death rate of 34.4%, making MERS-CoV one of the most devastating viruses anyone has ever experienced.

sourceString: During middle to late December 2019, clusters of pneumonia patients retrospectively known to be associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection were detected in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.
targetString: ក្នុងអំឡុងពាក់កណ្តាលដល់ចុងខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 គេបាន​រក​ឃើញ​ក្រុមអ្នកជំងឺរលាកសួត​ដែល​ធ្លាប់​មានទំនាក់ទំនងជាមួយការឆ្លង SARS-CoV-2 នៅទីក្រុងវូហាន ខេត្តហ៊ូប៉ី ប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: During the middle to the end of December 2019, a group of pneumonia patients who had been associated with the SARS-CoV-2 infection in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: World Health Organization declared the ongoing outbreak of lower respiratory tract infection caused by SARS-CoV-2 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern and also named the disease COVID-19.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានប្រកាសអំពីការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃការឆ្លងមេរោគរលាកផ្លូវដង្ហើមទាបដែលបណ្តាលមកពីជម្ងឺ SARS-CoV-2 ជាភាពអាសន្នផ្នែកសុខភាពសាធារណៈនៃការព្រួយបារម្ភអន្តរជាតិហើយក៏បានដាក់ឈ្មោះជម្ងឺនេះថា COVID-19 ។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation has announced outbreak of low respiratory infections caused by SAR S-CoV-2 is a public health emergency of international concern and has also named the disease COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 3, 2020, 90,053 cases have been confirmed worldwide, with a crude case fatality of 3.4%.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 3 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ករណីដែល​បាន​បញ្ជាក់​ទូទាំងពិភពលោក​មាន​ចំនួន 90,053 ករណី ដោយ​មានករណី​ស្លាប់សរុប 3.4%។
en-mt: As of March 3, 2020, there were 90,053 confirmed cases, with a total of 3.4%.

sourceString: Notably, the case fatality in Hubei, China is 4.2%, whereas the one outside of it is 1.2%.
targetString: គួរកត់សម្គាល់ថាករណីស្លាប់នៅហ៊ូប៉ីប្រទេសចិនមានចំនួន 4.2% ចំណែកភាគរយនៅក្រៅពីនោះគឺ 1.2%។
en-mt: It is worth noting that deaths in Hubei, China are 4.2%, while there is a percentage outside that is 1.2%.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 causes severe respiratory infection like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, presented as fever, cough and dyspnea.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 បណ្តាលឱ្យមានការឆ្លងមេរោគផ្លូវដង្ហើមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរដូចជា SARS-CoV និង MERS-CoV ដែរ ដែលត្រូវបានបង្ហាញថាជាគ្រុនក្តៅ ក្អក និងហត់អស់កម្លាំង។
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 also leads to severe respiratory infections, like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, which have been shown to be cold, cough and exhausted.

sourceString: Diarrhea is also seen in some patients.
targetString: គេក៏ប្រទះឃើញអ្នកជំងឺមួយចំនួនមានជំងឺរាគរូសផងដែរ។
en-mt: They also found some patients with tuberculosis.

sourceString: Pneumonia is one of the most severe symptoms and can progress rapidly to acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: ជំងឺរលាកសួត គឺជារោគសញ្ញាមួយក្នុងចំណោមរោគសញ្ញាធ្ងន់ធ្ងរផ្សេងទៀត ហើយអាចវិវឌ្ឍយ៉ាងលឿនទៅជាវិបត្តិផ្លូវដង្ហើមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ។
en-mt: Pneumonia is one of the other symptoms and can rapidly evolve into a series of respiratory distress.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are very similar due to high nucleotide sequence homology of 82%, they cluster into different branches in the phylogenetic tree.
targetString: ទោះបីជា SARS-CoV និង SARS-CoV-2 មានលក្ខណៈស្រដៀងគ្នា ដោយសារតែភាពដូចគ្នានៃលំដាប់នូក្លេអូថាយខ្ពស់ចំនួន 82% ក៏ដោយ ពួកវាបានផ្ដុំ​ចេញ​ជាសាខាផ្សេងៗគ្នាក្នុងមែកធាងហ្សែនអម្បូរ។
en-mt: Albeit SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 are similar because of the likes of the nucleo order An 82% high number of highs, they have been branched into different branches in immediate genetic trees.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is apparently less pathogenic but more transmissible compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 មើលទៅមិនសូវជាបង្ករោគប៉ុន្មានទេ ប៉ុន្តែវាអាច​ចម្លង​បានលឿនជាង បើប្រៀបធៀបទៅនឹង SARS-CoV និង MERS-CoV ។
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 looks rather than inflammatory, but it can be replicated faster compared to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV.

sourceString: Asymptomatic subjects infected with SARS-CoV-2 have been reported and might contribute to its rapid spreading around the world.

sourceString: Comparing and contrasting SARS-CoV-2 with the other six HCoVs reveal similarities and differences of great interest.

sourceString: First, the incubation period and the duration of the course of HCoV disease are very similar.

sourceString: In this regard, SARS-CoV-2 follows the general trend of the other six HCoVs.

sourceString: Second, the severity of symptoms of COVID-19 lies between SARS-CoV and the four community-acquired HCoVs (i.e. HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63).

sourceString: On one hand, SARS-CoV-2 infection exhibits features that are more commonly seen during infection with community-acquired HCoVs, including the presentation of non-specific, mild or even no symptoms.

sourceString: On the other hand, a small subset of severe cases of COVID-19 can also be seen as in the case of SARS-CoV infection, although the ratio is a bit lower.

sourceString: Third, the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 also shows interesting patterns characteristic of both community-acquired HCoVs and SARS-CoV.
