sourceString: However, it is more pathogenic than community-acquired HCoVs and less pathogenic than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ វាបង្ករោគខ្លាំងជាង HCoVs ដែលទទួលបានដោយសហគមន៍ ហើយបង្ករោគតិចជាង SARS-CoV ឬ MERS-CoV ។
en-mt: However, it is more inflammatory than HCoVs obtained by the community and cause fewer symptoms than SARS-CoV or MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It remains to be seen whether it will adapt fully to humans and circulate within humans without a reservoir or intermediate animal host.
targetString: វានៅតែត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញថានឹងសម្របខ្លួនបានយ៉ាងពេញលេញនៅក្នុងខ្លួនមនុស្ស ហើយរត់ក្នុងខ្លួន​មនុស្ស​ដោយមិនត្រូវការធ្មុក ឬធ្មួលសត្វកណ្តាលឡើយ។
en-mt: It is still seen to be fully adapted in humans and run away within the humans without needing a bead or a middle creature.

sourceString: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoVs, it will serve us well to discuss the definitions and characteristics of evolutionary, natural, reservoir, intermediate and amplifying hosts of HCoVs.
targetString: មុនពេលពិភាក្សាអំពីដើមកំណើត​សត្វនៃ HCoV វានឹងជួយយើង​បានយ៉ាង​ល្អ​ដើម្បី​ពិភាក្សា​អំពីនិយមន័យ និង​លក្ខណៈនៃការវិវឌ្ឍន៍ ធម្មជាតិ ធ្មុក ធ្មួលកណ្តាល និងធ្មួលដែលវិវត្តន៍ទៅ​របស់ HCoVs ។
en-mt: Before discussing the animal origins of HCoV, it will help us well to discuss definitions and conditions The development of nature, central helmets, and the evolving witches of HCoVs.

sourceString: An animal serves as the evolutionary host of an HCoV if it harbours a closely related ancestor sharing high homology at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: សត្វដើរតួជាធ្មួលវិវត្តន៍របស់ HCoV ប្រសិន​បើ​វា​មាន​ពំនឹង​យ៉ាង​ជិតស្និទ្ធ​ពាក់ព័ន្ធ​នឹង​បុព្វបុរស​ដែល​​ចែករំលែកភាព​ដូច​គ្នា​ខ្ពស់​នៅកម្រិត​នៃលំដាប់នូក្លៀវថៃ។
en-mt: Animals act as the evolutionary habitat of HCoV if they are closely involved in ancestry that shares high parity at the level of the Thai nukliv order.

sourceString: The ancestral virus is usually well adapted and non-pathogenic in this host.
targetString: ជារឿយៗ វីរុសចាស់ៗសម្របខ្លួនបានល្អ និងមិនប៉ះពាល់ដល់ធ្មួលនេះទេ។
en-mt: Old viruses often adapt well and do not affect this hire.

sourceString: Likewise, a reservoir host harbours HCoV continuously and for long term.
targetString: ដូចគ្នានេះផងដែរ កន្លែងផ្ទុកមេរោគ HCoV នឹងនៅបន្តរយៈពេលយូរទៀត។
en-mt: Likewise, the HCoV virus site will continue for a long time.

sourceString: In both cases, the hosts are naturally infected and are the natural hosts of HCoV or its parental virus.
targetString: ក្នុងករណីទាំងពីរនេះ ជាធម្មតាធ្មួលបានឆ្លងមេរោគ ហើយជាធ្មួលធម្មជាតិរបស់ HCoV ឬជាវីរុសអម្បូរដើមរបស់វា។
en-mt: In both cases, these two cases are usually infected and the natural harm of HCoV or its original virus.

sourceString: In contrast, if the HCoV is newly introduced to an intermediate host right before or around its introduction to humans, it is not well adapted to the new host and is often pathogenic.
targetString: ផ្ទុយទៅវិញ ប្រសិនបើ HCoV បាន​បង្ហាញ​ខ្លួន​ថ្មី​ៗក្នុងធ្មួលកណ្តាលភ្លាមមុន ឬអំឡុងពេលការបង្ហាញខ្លួន​របស់វា​ទៅ​មនុស្ស វាមិនអាចសម្រប​ខ្លួនបានយ៉ាងល្អ​ទៅនឹងធ្មួលថ្មីបានទេ ហើយជាញឹកញាប់ក៏មិនបង្កជំងឺដែរ។
en-mt: On the other hand, if HCoV has recently appeared in a central center immediately before or during its appearing to people It is impossible to adapt well to new hires and often does not lead to disease.

sourceString: This intermediate host can serve as the zoonotic source of human infection and play the role of an amplifying host by allowing the virus to replicate transiently and then transmitting it to humans to amplify the scale of human infection.
targetString: ធ្មួលកណ្តាលនេះជាប្រភពនៃការចម្លងមេរោគពីសត្វមកមនុស្ស ហើយដើរតួជាអ្នកពង្រីកធ្មួលដោយអនុញ្ញាតឱ្យមេរោគទាំងនោះបំបែកខ្លួន រួចបន្តចម្លងទៅមនុស្សដើម្បីពង្រីកការចម្លង​មនុស្យកាន់តែច្រើនឡើងៗ។
en-mt: This middle witch is the source of transmission from animals to humans and acts as an authorised expansionist Let the viruses separate and continue to transmit to humans to expand the transmission of society.

sourceString: An HCoV can undergo a dead-end infection if it cannot sustain its transmission within the intermediate host.
targetString: HCoV អាចនឹងបញ្ឈប់ការចម្លង ប្រសិនបើមេរោគនេះមិនអាចចម្លងចេញពីធ្មួលកណ្តាលរបស់វាបាន។
en-mt: HCoV may stop transmission if the virus cannot be transmitted from its center.

sourceString: On the contrary, HCoVs can also adapt to the intermediate host and even establish long-term endemicity.
targetString: ផ្ទុយទៅវិញ HCoVs ក៏អាចសម្របខ្លួនទៅនឹងធ្មួលកណ្តាល ហើយថែមទាំងបង្កើតឱ្យមានការរីករាលដាលយូរអង្វែងទៀតផង។
en-mt: Instead, HCoVs can also adapt to the central hire and even create long-term spreads.

sourceString: In this case, the intermediate host becomes a natural reservoir host.
targetString: ក្នុងករណីនេះ ធ្មួលកណ្តាលក្លាយជាធ្មួល​អាងស្តុក​ធម្មជាតិវិញ។
en-mt: In this case, the center became a natural reservoir.

sourceString: Epidemiological data revealed retrospectively that the index case of SARS had a contact history with game animals.
targetString: ទិន្នន័យពីការសិក្សារោគរាតត្បាតបានលាតត្រដាងជាអតីតកាលថា ករណីសន្ទស្សន៍នៃ SARS មានប្រវត្តិប៉ះពាល់ជាមួយល្បែងទាក់ទងនឹងសត្វ។
en-mt: Data from an epidemiological study revealed in the past that the SARS Index's index has a history of affecting animal-related games.

sourceString: Subsequent seroprevalence investigations indicated that animal traders had a higher prevalence of anti-SARS-CoV IgG compared with that of the general population.
targetString: លទ្ធផលដែលបានពីសំណាកឈាមបាន​បង្ហាញថា អ្នក​ជួញដូរ​សត្វ​មាន​ការ​សាយភាព anti-SARS-CoV IgG ខ្ពស់ជាង បើប្រៀបធៀប​ទៅនឹង​ប្រជាជន​ទូទៅ។
en-mt: The results from blood samples showed that animal traffickers had higher anti-SARS-CoV IgG spreads compared to the general population.

sourceString: Masked palm civets (Paguma larvata) and a racoon dog in live animal markets were first identified to carry SARS-CoV-like viruses that are almost identical to SARS-CoV.
targetString: សត្វសំពោច និងសត្វរ៉ាឃូន​ដែលត្រូវ​បាន​លក់​​ដូរនៅក្នុងផ្សារលក់សត្វរស់ គឺជា​កន្លែង​ដំបូងគេដែលត្រូវបានកំណត់ឃើញថា មានផ្ទុកវីរុសដូច SARS-CoV ដែល​ស្ទើរ​តែដូចទាំងស្រុងទៅនឹងវីរុស SARS-CoV ។
en-mt: Vessels and racones sold in the market to sell live animals were the beginning places It is determined to be carrying the SARS-CoV-like virus, which is almost entirely similar to the SARS-CoV virus.

sourceString: This was indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS was reported after killing all civets in the markets.
targetString: វាត្រូវបានគាំទ្រដោយប្រយោលតាមរយៈការពិត ដែលមិនមានគេ​រាយការណ៍អំពី​ជំងឺ SARS បន្ថែម​ទៀតទេ បន្ទាប់ពីបានសម្លាប់សត្វសំពោចទាំងអស់នៅលើទីផ្សារ។
en-mt: It is indirectly supported by the fact that no further SARS is reported after killing all the vessels on the market.

sourceString: However, it has been reported that masked palm civets from the wild or farms without exposure to the live animal markets were largely negative for SARS-CoV, suggesting that masked palm civets might only serve as the intermediate amplifying host but not the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: ទោះជាយ៉ាងណា គេបានរាយការណ៍​ថា​សត្វសំពោចដែលមកពីព្រៃ ឬកសិដ្ឋាន​ដោយមិនមាន​ប៉ះពាល់​ទៅ​នឹងទីផ្សារ​សត្វរស់គឺមានភាពអវិជ្ជមានយ៉ាងខ្លាំងចំពោះ SARS-CoV ដោយបង្ហាញ​ថា​សត្វសំពោច​អាចដើរតួបានតែជាធ្មួលរីកសាយភាព​កណ្តាលប៉ុណ្ណោះ ប៉ុន្តែមិនមែនធ្មុក​ធម្មជាតិនៃ SARS-CoV នោះទេ ។
en-mt: However, it has been reported that vessels from woods or farms without affecting the live animal market are very negative for SARS -CoV, demonstrating that the vessels can only act as a middle-growing beaver, but not the natural herb of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Notably, since 80% of the different animals in the markets in Guangzhou have anti-SARS-CoV antibodies, the possibilities that multiple species of small mammals might also serve as intermediate amplifying hosts of SARS-CoV cannot be excluded.
targetString: គួរកត់សម្គាល់ថា ដោយសារតែ 80% នៃ​សត្វ​ផ្សេងៗគ្នានៅលើទីផ្សារក្នុងខេត្តក្វាងចូវមាន​អង្គបដិប្រាណ anti-SARS-CoV គេមិន​អាច​រាប់​បញ្ចូល​លទ្ធភាព ដែលថនិកសត្វតូចៗ​ជាច្រើនប្រភេទអាច​បម្រើជាធ្មួលសាយភាយ​កណ្តាលរបស់ SARS-CoV បានទេ។
en-mt: It should be noted that because 80% of the different animals on the market in Guangdong province have anti-SARS-CoV cannot include the possibility that a wide variety of small mammals could serve as SARS-CoV's central spreadsheet.

sourceString: All of these appear to be dead-end hosts of SARS-CoV.
targetString: ទាំងអស់នេះមើលទៅដូចជាមេផ្ទុកចុងក្រោយបង្អស់នៃ SARS-CoV។
en-mt: All of this looks to be the last storage master of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Subsequent search for the natural animal host of SARS-CoV unveiled a closely related bat CoV, termed SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which exists in Chinese horseshoe bats.
targetString: ការស្វែងរកជាបន្តបន្ទាប់សម្រាប់ធ្មួលសត្វធម្មជាតិរបស់ SARS-CoV បានបង្ហាញ​ពីទំនាក់ទំនងយ៉ាងជិតស្និទ្ធិទៅនឹង CoV ក្នុង សត្វប្រចៀវ ដែលគេហៅថា SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3) ដែល​មាននៅក្នុង​សត្វ​ប្រចៀវ​ជើង​សេះរបស់ចិន។
en-mt: A subsequent search for SARS-CoV's natural animals demonstrated a close relation to CoV in the bats Called SARS-related Rhinolophus bat CoV HKU3 (SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3), which is found in a Chinese horseback bat.

sourceString: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV antibodies and genome sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.
targetString: សត្វប្រចៀវទាំងនេះមានលក្ខណៈវិជ្ជមានសម្រាប់អង្គបដិប្រាណប្រឆាំងនឹង SARS-CoV និងលំដាប់ហ្សែននៃ SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3 ។
en-mt: These bats are positive for anti-SARS-CoV and the genetic sequence of SARSr-Rh-BatCoV HKU3.

sourceString: This and other bat CoVs share 88-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV.
targetString: វីរុសនេះនិងប្រភេទ CoVs ប្រចៀវដទៃទៀតមានចំណែក 88-92% ភាគរយនៃភាពដូចគ្នានៃប្រភេទហ្សែនលំដាប់ nucleotide។
en-mt: The virus and other types of CoVs account for 88-92% of the same nucleotide gene species.

sourceString: These studies have laid the foundation for the new concept that bats host emerging human pathogens.
targetString: ការសិក្សាទាំងនេះបង្កើត​បាន​ជា​មូល​ដ្ឋាន​គ្រឹះសម្រាប់គំនិតថ្មីដែលសត្វប្រចៀវធ្វើជាភ្នាក់ងារបង្កជម្ងឺរបស់មនុស្ស។
en-mt: These studies lay the foundation for new ideas that bats act as human disease-enhancing agents.

sourceString: Several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) have also been identified from bats, but none except for one designated WIV1 can be isolated as live virus.
targetString: គេក៏បាន​កំណត់អត្តសញ្ញាណ​ SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) ជាច្រើន​ចេញ​ពីសត្វ​ប្រចៀវដែរ ប៉ុន្តែមានតែ WIV1 ដែលត្រូវបានកំណត់មួយប៉ុណ្ណោះ​ដែលអាចបំបែកចេញជាវីរុសមានជីវិត។
en-mt: They have also identified several SARS-like CoVs (SL-CoVs) from bats, but only one designated WIV1 can be separated into life viruses.

sourceString: Human angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is known to be the receptor of SARS-CoV.
targetString: អង់ស៊ីម angiotensin របស់មនុស្សបំលែងអង់ស៊ីម 2 (ACE2) ត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ថាជាអ្នកទទួលសារធាតុ SARS-CoV ។
en-mt: The angiotensin enzyme of people converting enzymes 2 (ACE2) is known as the receptor of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: WIV1 derived from fecal sample of bats was demonstrated to use bat, civet and human ACE2 as receptor for cell entry.
targetString: WIV1 ដែលបានទាញយក​ពីសំណាកលាមក​របស់សត្វប្រចៀវ ត្រូវ​បានបង្ហាញ​ក្នុងការប្រើប្រាស់​សត្វប្រចៀវ សំពោច និងមនុស្សដែលមាន ACE2 ជាអង្គ​ទទួលសម្រាប់ការបញ្ចូលកោសិកា។
en-mt: WIV1, downloaded from the mosaics of bats, is displayed in the use of bats, vessels and people with ACE2 as a recipient for the integration of cells.

sourceString: Intriguingly, sera of convalescent SARS patients were capable of neutralizing WIV1.
targetString: ពិតជាគួរឱ្យចាប់អារម្មណ៍ណាស់ ដែលសារធាតុរាវក្នុងឈាម (SERA) នៃអ្នកជាពីជំងឺ SARS មានសមត្ថភាពក្នុងការបន្សាប WIV1។
en-mt: Interestingly, the blood lipids (SERA) of you from SARS patients are capable of combining WIV1.

sourceString: Thus far, WIV1 represents the most closely related ancestor of SARS-CoV in bats, sharing 95% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: ដូច្នេះហើយ WIV1 តំណាងឱ្យបុព្វការីដែលជិតស្និទ្ធបំផុតនៃ SARS-CoV ក្នុងសត្វប្រចៀវ ដែលចែករំលែកអកម៉ូនលំដាប់លំដោយអនុយក្លេអូទីត 95%។
en-mt: Therefore, WIV1 represents the closest ancestor of SARS-CoV in a bat that shares 95% electronic sequencing.

sourceString: Albeit the high homology between these two viruses, it is generally believed that WIV1 is not the immediate parental virus of SARS-CoV and bats are not the immediate reservoir host of SARS-CoV.
targetString: ទោះបីជាវីរុសទាំងពីរប្រភេទនេះមាន​លក្ខណៈដូចគ្នាខ្លាំងយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ ក៏គេនៅតែជឿជាក់ថា WIV1 មិនមែន​ជា​អម្បូរដើមរបស់វីរុស SARS-CoV ទេ ហើយ​សត្វប្រចៀវ​ក៏មិនមែន​ជាធ្មួល​អាង​ផ្ទុកកណ្តាលរបស់ SARS-CoV ដែរ។
en-mt: Despite the fact that these two types of viruses are very much in common, they remain convinced that WIV1 is not a vineyard The original lips of the SARS-CoV virus, and bats are not the central storage of SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis clusters MERS-CoV to the same group as bat CoV-HKU4 and bat CoV-HKU5.
targetString: ការវិភាគជីវសាស្ត្រហ្សែនប្រមូល MERS-CoV ទៅជាក្រុមដូចគ្នានឹងក្រុម CoV-HKU4 និង CoV-HKU5 របស់សត្វប្រចៀវ។
en-mt: Genetic analysis collects MERS-CoV into the same group as the CoV-HKU4 and CoV-HKU5 groups of bats.

sourceString: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV utilize the same host receptor, dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), for virus entry.
targetString: Bat CoV-HKU4 និង MERS-CoV ប្រើប្រាស់កោសិកាទទួលតែមួយគឺ peptidase 4 (DPP4) សម្រាប់ការចូលរបស់វីរុស។
en-mt: Bat CoV-HKU4 and MERS-CoV use single receipt cells, peptidase 4 (DPP4) for the entry of the virus.

sourceString: RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequences of MERS-CoV are phylogenetically closer to counterparts in bat beta-CoVs identified from Europe and Africa.
targetString: លំដាប់ RNA-dependent RNA polymerase របស់ MERS-CoV មាន​លក្ខណៈកាន់​តែជិតស្និទ្ធ​ទៅ​នឹងសមភាគីនៃ beta-CoV ក្នុងសត្វប្រចៀវ​ដែលត្រូវ​បាន​កំណត់​អត្តសញ្ញាណចេញពីអឺរ៉ុប និងអាហ្វ្រិក។
en-mt: The RNA-dependent RNA polymerase sequence of MERS-CoV is much closer to the components of beta-CoV in bats identified from Europe and Africa.

sourceString: Up to now, no live MERS-CoV can be found in wild bats.
targetString: រហូតមកដល់ពេលនេះ គេ​មិនបាន​រក​ឃើញ​មេរោគ MERS-CoV រស់នៅក្នុង​សត្វប្រចៀវព្រៃទេ។
en-mt: Until now, the MERS-CoV virus has not been found living in wild bats.

sourceString: MERS-CoV and its closest relative bat CoV-HKU25 share only 87% nucleotide sequence homology.
targetString: MERS-CoV និង CoV-HKU25 ក្នុងសត្វ​ប្រចៀវ​ដែល​ជា​សាច់ញ្ញាតិ​ជិត​ស្និទ្ធបំផុត​របស់វា​មានចំណែកភាពដូចគ្នា​នៃលំដាប់នូក្លៀវថៃតែ 87% ប៉ុណ្ណោះ។
en-mt: MERS-CoV and CoV-HKU25 in their closest relatives have only 87% of the same portion of the Thai nuclear sequence.

sourceString: Thus, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: ដូច្នេះ សត្វប្រចៀវប្រហែល​មិនមែនជាធ្មួលអាងស្តុកកណ្តាលលរបស់ MERS-CoV ទេ។
en-mt: So bats may not be the central reservoirs of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: On the other hand, studies in Middle East have shown that dromedary camels are seropositive for MERS-CoV-specific neutralizing antibodies, same as camels of Middle East origin in multiple African countries.
targetString: ម៉្យាងវិញទៀត ការសិក្សានៅមជ្ឈិមបូព៌ាបានបង្ហាញថា សត្វអូដ្ឋមានអង្គបដិប្រាណប្រឆាំងទៅនឹង MERS-CoV យ៉ាងជាក់លាក់ដូចគ្នាទៅនឹងសត្វអូដ្ឋដែលមានដើមកំណើតនៅមជ្ឈិមបូព៌ាក្នុងប្រទេសជាច្រើននៃទ្វីបអាហ្វ្រិក។
en-mt: On the other hand, Middle East studies have shown that camels have political opposition to MERS-CoV cold Hidden the same as camels native to the Middle East in many African countries.

sourceString: Live MERS-CoV identical to the virus found in humans was isolated from the nasal swabs of dromedary camels, further indicating that camels serve as the bona fide reservoir host of MERS-CoV.
targetString: វីរុស MERS-CoV ដែលមាន​ជីវិត មានភាព​ដូចគ្នាទៅ​នឹងវីរុស​ដែលត្រូវបានរក​ឃើញនៅក្នុងមនុស្ស ត្រូវបាន​បំបែក​ចេញ​សំណាកច្រមុះសត្វអូដ្ឋដ្រូមមេឌែរ ដែលបង្ហាញបន្ថែមទៀតថា សត្វអូដ្ឋដើរតួជា​ធ្មួល​អាងស្តុក​ពិតប្រាកដ​នៃ MERS-CoV ។
en-mt: The living MERS-CoV virus similar to those found in humans is separated with animal nose samples The Drummeder bridge, which adds that the camels act as the actual storehouse of MERS-CoV.

sourceString: It is also noteworthy that generally mild symptoms but massive virus shedding were observed in camels experimentally infected with MERS-CoV.
targetString: វាក៏គួរឱ្យកត់សម្គាល់ផងដែរថា ជាទូទៅ​ជារោគសញ្ញាស្រាលៗ ប៉ុន្តែ​គេបាន​សង្កេតឃើញមាន​ការចម្លង​វីរុស​យ៉ាង​ខ្លាំង​នៅក្នុងសត្វអូដ្ឋដែល​យមក​ពិសោធន៍​ដែលឆ្លងវីរុស MERS-CoV ។
en-mt: It is also worth noting that it is generally mild symptoms, but they have been observed intense transmission of viruses in experimental camels infected with the MERS-CoV virus.

sourceString: Notably, infected camels shed viruses not only through respiratory route but also through fecal-oral route, which is also the main route for virus shedding from bats.
targetString: គួរកត់សម្គាល់ថា សត្វអូដ្ឋ​ដែលឆ្លង​មេរោគ​បាន​ចម្លងវីរុសមិនត្រឹមតែតាមរយៈ​ផ្លូវដង្ហើម​ប៉ុណ្ណោះទេ ថែមទាំង​ចម្លង​តាមរយៈ​ផ្លូវលាមកទៅមាត់ផងដែរ ដែលវាក៏ជាច្រក​សំខាន់សម្រាប់ការចម្លងវីរុសចេញពីសត្វប្រចៀវផងដែរ។
en-mt: It should be noted that infected camels have transmitted the virus not only through respiratory tracts but also Also transmitted through the mouth-to-mouth road, which is also an important portal for transmitting the virus from the bat.

sourceString: However, questions still remain since many confirmed cases of MERS have no contact history with camels prior to symptom onset, plausibly ascribed to human-to-human transmission or unknown transmission routes involving unrecognized animal species that harbour MERS-CoV.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណា សំណួរនៅតែមាន​ដោយ​សារ​តែករណី MERS ដែលបានបញ្ជាក់ជាច្រើន​មិនមានប្រវត្តិទាក់ទងជាមួយសត្វអូដ្ឋមុន​ពេលចាប់ផ្តើមមានរោគសញ្ញា ដែល​ត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ថាអាចចម្លង​ទៅ​កាន់​មនុស្សមួយទៅមួយទៀត ឬផ្លូវចម្លង​ដែល​មិនស្គាល់ដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹងប្រភេទសត្វមិនស្គាល់​ដែលផ្តល់ជម្រកដល់ MERS-CoV ។
en-mt: However, questions remain because many confirmed MERS geometry has no history of communicating with camels before the beginning of the symptoms that have been confirmed It is possible to transmit to one human to another or an unknown duplicate involved in the unknown species of animals that provide MERS-CoV shelter.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 shares 96.2% nucleotide homology with a bat CoV RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis bats.
targetString: SARS-CoV-2 មាន​ចំណែក​ភាពដូចគ្នា​នៃនូក្លៀវថៃ 96.2% ជាមួយនឹង CoV RaTG13 ក្នុងសត្វប្រចៀវ​ ដែល​បានបំបែកចេញ​ពី​ប្រចៀវប្រភេទ Rhinolophus affinis ។
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 contains a similar portion of 96.2% of Thai Nokliv with CoV RaTG13 in bats separated from the Rhinolophus affinis bat.

sourceString: As in the cases of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the sequence divergence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too great to assign parental relationship.
targetString: ដូចករណី SARS-CoV និង MERS-CoV ដែរ ការបង្វែរលំដាប់គ្នារវាង SARS-CoV-2 និង RaTG13 គឺធំធេងពេក​ដល់​ថ្នាក់មិន​អាច​កំណត់​ទំនាក់ទំនង​អម្បូរបាន។
en-mt: As with the case of SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, the diversion of the sequence between SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 is too huge that classes cannot determine immediate relations.

sourceString: That is to say, bats might not be the immediate reservoir host(s) of SARS-CoV-2 unless almost identical bat CoVs are found in future.
targetString: ទាំងនេះអាចនិយាយបានថា សត្វប្រចៀវប្រហែលមិនមែនជាធ្មួលអាងស្តុកកណ្តាលនៃ SARS-CoV-2 ទេ លុះត្រាតែ​គេ​រកឃើញ CoVs ក្នុង​សត្វប្រចៀវ​ដែល​មាន​អត្តសញ្ញាណ​​​ស្ទើរតែ​ដូចគ្នានាពេលអនាគត។
en-mt: These can be said that bats may not be the central reservoirs of SARS-CoV-2 until they are found coVs in almost the same identity bats in the future.

sourceString: Presumably, the intermediate animal hosts of SARS-CoV-2 should be among the wildlife species sold and killed at the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, with which many of the initial cases of COVID-19 were associated, indicative of a probable animal-to-human transmission event.
targetString: តាមការសន្មត ធ្មួលសត្វកណ្តាលនៃ SARS-CoV-2 គួរតែស្ថិត​នៅក្នុងចំណោម​ប្រភេទ​សត្វ​ព្រៃដែលត្រូវបានលក់ និង​សម្លាប់​នៅ​ផ្សារ​បោះដុំលក់គ្រឿងសមុទ្រហួណាន​ដែល​ភាគច្រើននៃករណីដំបូងនៃ COVID-19 ត្រូវបានផ្សារភ្ជាប់ ដែលបង្ហាញពី​ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍​នៃការចម្លងពីសត្វមកមនុស្ស។
en-mt: Assumed, the central species of SARS-CoV-2 should be actually available in the wildlife species sold and killed at the printing market The sale of Huan seafood, most of the first cases of COVID-19 was linked, showing the event of transmission from animals to humans.

sourceString: Several recent studies based on metagenomic sequencing have suggested that a group of endangered small mammals known as pangolins (Manis javanica) could also harbour ancestral beta-CoVs related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: ការសិក្សាថ្មីៗជាច្រើនដោយផ្អែកលើលំដាប់លំដោយមេតាហ្សែនបានបង្ហាញថាក្រុមថនិកសត្វតូចៗដែលជិតផុតពូជដែលគេស្គាល់ថាជាសត្វពង្រូល (ម៉ានីសជ្វាវ៉ានីកា) ក៏អាចជាជម្រកដល់ beta-CoVs បុព្វបុរស ដែលទាក់ទងនឹង SARS-CoV-2 ផងដែរ។
en-mt: Numerous recent studies based on metagonic sequencing have revealed groups of nearly extinct mammals known as Animals (Manisjwanica) can also be a shelter to beta-CoVs associated with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: These novel pangolin CoV genomes share 85-92% nucleotide sequence homology with SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: សេណូម CoV ក្នុងសត្វពង្រូលថ្មី​ទាំងនេះ​មាន​ចំណែកភាព​ដូចគ្នា​នៃ​លំដាប់នូក្លៀថៃ 85-92% ជាមួយនឹង SARS-CoV-2 ។
en-mt: Senum CoV in these new sculptures contributes to the same part of the Thai nuclear order of 85-92% with SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, they are equally closely related to RaTG13 with about 90% identity at the level of nucleotide sequence.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ ពួកវាមានទំនាក់ទំនងជិតស្និទ្ធស្មើគ្នាជាមួយ RaTG13 ដែលមានអត្តសញ្ញាណប្រហែល 90% នៅកម្រិតនៃលំដាប់នូក្លៀថៃ។
en-mt: However, they have an equally close relation to RaTG13, which identifies about 90% at the level of the Thai nuclear order.

sourceString: They cluster into two sub-lineages of SARS-CoV-2-like viruses in the phylogenetic tree, one of which share a more similar receptor binding domain (RBD) with SARS-CoV-2, with 97.4% amino acid sequence identity.
targetString: ពួកវាផ្ដុំចេញជាអំបូរតូចៗពីររបស់ SARS-CoV-2 ដូចវីរុស​នៅ​ក្នុងមែកធាង​ហ្សែនអំបូរ​ ដែល​មេរោគមួយ មានកោសិកាទទួលស្រដៀងទៅនឹង SARS-CoV-2 និងអាស៊ីតអាមីណូដូចគ្នា 97.4%។
en-mt: They gather into two small butterflies of SARS-CoV-2, like viruses in the butterfly tree Where a virus receives cells similar to SARS-CoV-2 and 97.4% of the same amino acids.

sourceString: In stark contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 are more divergent, albeit a higher degree of sequence homology genome-wide.
targetString: ផ្ទុយទៅវិញ RBDs នៃ SARS- CoV-2 និង RaTG13 មានភាពខុសគ្នា ទោះជាលំដាប់សេណូមដូចគ្នាមានកម្រិតខ្ពស់ជាងក៏ដោយ។
en-mt: In contrast, the RBDs of SARS-CoV-2 and RaTG13 vary, although the same senom order is higher.

sourceString: An earlier study on diseased pangolins also reported the detection of viral contigs from lung samples, which turn out to be similarly related to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Besides the highly pathogenic HCoVs, the zoonotic origin of HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-HKU1 have also been studied.

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence indicated that both HCoV-NL63 and HCoV-229E might have originated from bat CoVs, while the parental viruses of HCoV-OC43 and HCoV-HKU1 have been found in rodents.

sourceString: It has been reported that a bat CoV termed ARCoV.2 (Appalachian Ridge CoV) detected in North American tricolored bat displayed close relationship with HCoV-NL63.

sourceString: In fact, bats are the direct source of human pathogenic viruses including rabies virus, Ebola virus, Nipah virus and Hendra virus.

sourceString: In SARS-CoV, the RBD is in the 318th to 510th amino acids on the S1 fragment, which binds to the human ACE2 as well as its coreceptors for viral entry.

sourceString: In fact, only 6 amino acid residues were observed to be different from human and civet viral isolates in the RBD and 4 of them locate in the receptor-binding motif for interaction with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: A 30% difference between SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV in the S1 unit of the S protein implicates that the binding affinity of its S protein with human ACE2 might have altered.

sourceString: Last but not least, the evolution of novel HCoVs is also driven by the selection pressure in their reservoir hosts.

sourceString: Given that SARS-CoV infection originates from the contact between humans and civets in the markets, closing wet markets and killing civets therein could have effectively ended the SARS epidemic.

en-mt: Due to the SARS-CoV infection, there is a source of relations between humans and civet animals (cat-like) markets The market that sells meat and wet places and killing civets should be able to effectively end the SARS epidemic.

sourceString: By the same reasoning, pangolins should be removed from wet markets to prevent zoonotic transmission, in view of the discovery of multiple lineages of pangolin beta-CoVs closely related to SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: ដោយហេតុផលដូចគ្នានេះ សត្វពង្រូលគួរតែត្រូវបានយកចេញពីផ្សារ ដែលមានជាតិសើម ដើម្បីការពារការឆ្លងហ្សូណូតិច (ពីសត្វមកមនុស្ស) ដោយសារតែការមើលឃើញ ពីរបកគំហើញជាច្រើននៃក្រុមសត្វតជំនាន់ ដែល beta-CoVs នៃពង្រូលមានទំនាក់ទំនងយ៉ាងជិតស្និទ្ធជាមួយ SARS-CoV-2 ។
en-mt: For the same reason, sculptures should be removed from a wet market to prevent infections of xonotech (from human animals) because of spectacle See the many discoveries of generational groups of animals where beta-CoVs of graffiti have close ties to SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: However, whether and how SARS-CoV-2 is transmitted to humans through pangolins and other mammals remain to be clarified in future investigations.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណា របៀប និងថាតើ SARS-CoV-2 ត្រូវបានចម្លងទៅមនុស្សតាមរយៈសត្វពង្រូល និងថនិកសត្វដទៃទៀត នៅតែត្រូវបញ្ជាក់ឱ្យច្បាស់នៅក្នុងការស៊ើបអង្កេតនាពេលអនាគត។
en-mt: However, how and whether SARS-CoV-2 is copied to humans via humans and other mammals remains to be made clear in future investigations.

sourceString: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has existed in dromedary camels for a long time.
targetString: ម៉្យាងទៀត MERS-CoV មានសត្វអូដ្ឋ dromedary អស់រយៈពេលជាយូរមកហើយ។
en-mt: On the other hand, MERS-CoV has had dromedary camels for a long time.

sourceString: These camels serve as an important tool for transportation as well as a main source of meat, milk, leather and wool products for the local people.
targetString: សត្វអូដ្ឋទាំងនេះដើរតួនាទីជាឧបករណ៍សំខាន់មួយសម្រាប់ការដឹកជញ្ជូនក៏ដូចជាប្រភពដ៏សំខាន់ ជាសាច់ ទឹកដោះ ផលិតផលស្បែក និងរោមចៀមសម្រាប់ប្រជាជនក្នុងតំបន់។
en-mt: These camels play an important role for transport as well as major sources of meat, milk, leather products and wool for the local population.

sourceString: They are widely distributed across the Middle East and Africa.

sourceString: It is therefore impossible to sacrifice all camels for the control of MERS, as what was done in wild animal markets in China to prevent the spreading of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: ដូច្នេះវាមិនអាចទៅរួចទេក្នុងការសម្លាប់សត្វអូដ្ឋទាំងអស់ ដើម្បីគ្រប់គ្រងជំងឺ MERS ដូចទៅនឹងអ្វីដែលត្រូវបានធ្វើនៅក្នុងទីផ្សារសត្វព្រៃក្នុងប្រទេសចិន ដើម្បីទប់ស្កាត់ការរីករាលដាលនៃ SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2។
en-mt: So it is impossible to kill all camels to control MERS disease, as with what is done in the wildlife market in China, to prevent the spread of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: To stop the recurrent outbreaks of MERS, a comprehensive approach should be taken to develop effective vaccines against MERS-CoV for camels, in combination with other infection control measures.
targetString: ដើម្បីបញ្ឈប់ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃ MERS ដែលកើតឡើងវិញ ​គួរមានវិធីសាស្ត្រមួយដែលធ្វើដើម្បីអភិវឌ្ឍវ៉ាក់សាំងមានប្រសិទ្ធភាពប្រឆាំងនឹង MERS-CoV សម្រាប់សត្វអូដ្ឋ ក្នុងបន្សំជាមួយវិធានការគ្រប់គ្រងជម្ងឺឆ្លងដទៃទៀត។
en-mt: To stop the outbreak of recurring MERS, there should be a method done to develop an effective vaccine against MERS-CoV for camels in combination with other infected disease control measures.

sourceString: As we are not able to eliminate these viruses, new genotypes might emerge to cause outbreaks.

sourceString: A variety of zoonotic CoVs are circulating in the wild.

sourceString: The culture of eating wild animals in some places of China should be abandoned to reduce unnecessary contact between humans and animals.

sourceString: With the ordeals of SARS, MERS and COVID-19, a better preparedness and response plan should be in place.

sourceString: In fact, many viruses have existed in the planet for a very long time.

en-mt: Albeit with many features that help with the spread of the virus, ក៏មនុស្សអាចកាត់បន្ថយឳកាសក្នុងការទាក់ទងជាមួយសត្វប្រចៀវ and other wildlife species are the minimum if they are educated to stay away from them.

sourceString: Continuous surveillance in mammals is necessary for better understanding of the ecology of CoVs and their natural hosts, which will prove useful in preventing animal-to-human transmission and future outbreaks.

sourceString: To conclude, the most effective way to prevent viral zoonosis is for humans to stay away from the ecological niches of the natural reservoirs of the zoonotic viruses.

sourceString: Several pieces in the puzzle of the zoonotic origin of SARS-CoV-2 are still missing.

sourceString: First, if bats transmit an ancestral virus of SARS-CoV-2 to pangolins, it will be of interest to see under what circumstances bats and pangolins could share the same ecological niche.

sourceString: Second, if bats play a more direct role in human transmission, how humans get into contact with bats should be determined.

en-mt: Finally, some mammals, including home pets, are also vulnerable to SARS-CoV-2, both surveillance and experimental disease, should be performed.

sourceString: Should it be a bat, a pangolin or another mammal, it is expected that SARS-CoV-2 or its parental viruses that are almost identical will be identified in its natural hosts in future.
targetString: ប្រសិនបើជាសត្វប្រចៀវ សត្វពង្រូល ឬថនិកសត្វផ្សេងទៀត គេរំពឹងថា SARS-CoV-2 ឬវីរុសអម្បូរដើមរបស់វាដែលស្ទើរតែដូចគ្នានឹងត្រូវបានកំណត់នៅក្នុងធ្មួលធម្មតារបស់វានាពេលអនាគត។
en-mt: If a bat, a bat, a scorpion, or another mammal, it is expected that its original SARS-CoV-2 or its original virus, almost the same will be defined in its normal hills in the future.

sourceString: Continued investigations in this area will elucidate the evolutionary pathway of SARS-CoV-2 in animals, with important implications in the prevention and control of COVID-19 in humans.
targetString: ការបន្តការស៊ើបអង្កេតនៅក្នុងផ្នែកនេះនឹងជួយបង្ហាញឱ្យដឹងពីរបៀបដែល SARS-CoV-2​ វិវត្តនៅក្នុងខ្លួនសត្វ ដែលវាមានទំនាក់ទំនងយ៉ាងសំខាន់ ទៅលើការបង្ការ និងការគ្រប់គ្រង COVID-19 ចំពោះមនុស្ស។
en-mt: The continuation of investigations in this section will help demonstrate how SARS-CoV-2 evolves in animals, which have an important relation to the prevention and control of COVID-19 to humans.

sourceString: Updating the diagnostic criteria of COVID-19 “suspected case” and “confirmed case” is necessary
targetString: ការធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពនូវលក្ខណៈវិនិច្ឆ័យជំងឺ COVID-19 “ករណីសង្ស័យ” និង“ ករណីឆ្លង” គឺចាំបាច់
en-mt: Updating coVID-19 "suspected cases" and "cases of infection" is necessary

sourceString: On 6 February 2020, our team had published a rapid advice guideline for diagnosis and treatment of 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) infection, and this guideline provided our experience and make well reference for fighting against this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 6 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ក្រុមការងាររបស់យើងបានផ្សព្វផ្សាយគោលការណ៍ណែនាំរហ័សសម្រាប់ការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការព្យាបាលនៃការឆ្លងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណាថ្មី 2019 (2019-nCoV) ហើយគោលការណ៍ណែនាំនេះបានផ្តល់នូវបទពិសោធន៍របស់យើង និងជាឯកសារយោងសម្រាប់ការប្រយុទ្ធប្រឆាំងនឹងរោគរាតត្បាតនេះទូទាំងពិភពលោក។
en-mt: On February 6, 2020, our team published quick guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of new cholera infections 2019 (2019-nCoV) and this guideline provides our experience and is a reference document for the fight against this pandemic globally.

sourceString: However, the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge are gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: ប៉ុន្តែជំងឺវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា 2019 (COVID-19) គឺជាជំងឺថ្មី ការយល់ដឹង និងចំណេះដឹងរបស់យើងកំពុងកើនឡើងជាលំដាប់ ដោយផ្អែកលើលទ្ធផលនៃការស្រាវជ្រាវដែលកំពុងបន្ត និងបទពិសោធន៍នៃការអនុវត្តជាក់ស្តែង។ ហេតុដូច្នេះយុទ្ធសាស្ត្រនៃការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការព្យាបាលក៏ត្រូវបានធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពជាបន្តបន្ទាប់ផងដែរ។
en-mt: But the 2019 Corona virus (COVID-19) is a new disease, understanding and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the results of the ongoing research Therefore, strategies for diagnosis and treatment have also been updated in subsequent terms.

sourceString: In this letter, we answered one comment on our guideline and provided the newest diagnostic criteria of “suspected case” and “confirmed case” according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (seventh version) that issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China.
targetString: នៅក្នុងលិខិតនេះ, យើងបានឆ្លើយតបយោបល់មួយលើគោលការណ៍ណែនាំរបស់យើង និងបានផ្តល់នូវលក្ខណៈវិនិច្ឆ័យថ្មីបំផុតនៃ “ករណីសង្ស័យ” និង“ ករណីឆ្លង” យោងតាមគោលការណ៍ណែនាំរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការព្យាបាលចុងក្រោយសម្រាប់ជំងឺ COVID-19 (កំណែទីប្រាំពីរ) ដែលចេញដោយគណៈកម្មាធិការសុខភាពជាតិនៃសាធារណរដ្ឋប្រជាមានិតចិន។
en-mt: In this letter, We have responded to a suggestion on our guidelines and have provided the newest criteria of "suspicion" and "cross-case", according to junior principles The ultimate diagnosis and treatment for COVID-19 (version seven) issued by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China.

sourceString: In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) has caused an outbreak, which is now officially named as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: កាលពីខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 វីរុសកូរ៉ូណាថ្មី ឆ្នាំ 2019 (2019-nCoV) បានបង្កឱ្យមានការផ្ទុះឡើង ដែលឥឡូវត្រូវបានគេដាក់ឈ្មោះជាផ្លូវការថាជាជំងឺវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា ឆ្នាំ 2019 (COVID-19) ហើយវីរុសនេះត្រូវបានគេដាក់ឈ្មោះថាជាជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរដែលមានឈ្មោះថាវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា 2 (SARS-CoV- 2) ។
en-mt: In December 2019, the new 2019 (2019-nCoV) outbreak caused an outbreak that has now been officially branded a virus Corona 2019 (COVID-19) and the virus has been called a severe respiratory disease called SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: On 11 March 2020, WHO characterized COVID-19 as a pandemic.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 11 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានកំណត់លក្ខណៈជំងឺ COVID-19 ជាជំងឺរាតត្បាត។
en-mt: On March 11, 2020, the People's Health Organisation characterised COVID-19 as a pandemic.

sourceString: In order to fight against the SARS-CoV-2 infection, our team has developed a rapid advice guideline and that has been published online in Military Medical Research on 06 February 2020.
targetString: ដើម្បីប្រយុទ្ធប្រឆាំងនឹងការឆ្លងវីរុស SARS-CoV-2, ក្រុមរបស់យើងបានបង្កើតគោលការណ៍ណែនាំយ៉ាងរហ័សហើយត្រូវបានផ្សព្វផ្សាយតាមអ៊ិនធើណែតក្នុងការស្រាវជ្រាវវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រយោធា នៅថ្ងៃទី 06 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ។
en-mt: To fight SARS-CoV-2 infections, Our team quickly developed guidelines and was broadcast online in military medical research on February 6, 2020.

sourceString: It has attracted a great attention since published.
targetString: វាបានទាក់ទាញចំណាប់អារម្មណ៍យ៉ាងខ្លាំងចាប់តាំងពីបានចេញផ្សាយមក។
en-mt: It has attracted great interest since its release.

sourceString: Note however that COVID-19 is a new disease, our awareness and knowledge is gradually increasing based on the ongoing research findings and clinical practice experience; hence, the strategies of diagnosis and treatment are also continually updated.
targetString: ទោះជាយ៉ាងណាក៏ដោយ សូមកត់សម្គាល់ថា COVID-19 គឺជាជំងឺថ្មី ការយល់ដឹង និងចំណេះដឹងរបស់យើងកំពុងកើនឡើងជាលំដាប់ដោយផ្អែកលើលទ្ធផលស្រាវជ្រាវដែលកំពុងបន្ដ និងបទពិសោធន៍អនុវត្តគ្លីនិក ដូច្នេះយុទ្ធសាស្ត្រនៃការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការព្យាបាលក៏ត្រូវបានធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពជាបន្តបន្ទាប់ផងដែរ។
en-mt: However, note that COVID-19 is a new disease, our understanding and knowledge is growing sequentially based on the research results that are ongoing Continue and clinical practice experience, so diagnostic and treatment strategies have also been subsequently updated.

sourceString: For instance the Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People’s Republic of China (http://www.nhc.gov.cn/), among 16 January 2020 to 3 March 2020, has issued a total of seven editions with some contexts being substantively changed.
targetString: ឧទាហរណ៍សេចក្តីណែនាំអំពីការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការព្យាបាលសម្រាប់ជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលចេញដោយគណៈកម្មាធិការសុខភាពជាតិនៃសាធារណរដ្ឋប្រជាមានិតចិន (ថ្ងៃទី 16 ខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ដល់ថ្ងៃទី 3 ខែមីនាឆ្នាំ 2020) បានចេញសេចក្តីប្រកាសមួយ សរុបនៃការបោះពុម្ពផ្សាយចំនួនប្រាំពីរដែលបរិបទខ្លះត្រូវបានផ្លាស់ប្តូរយ៉ាងច្រើន។
en-mt: For example, the diagnosis and treatment instructions for COVID-19 issued by the National Health Committee of the People's Republic of China (16) January 2020 to March 3, 2020) issued a total declaration of seven publications, some of which have changed much.

sourceString: Now our guideline received a comment by Zhou et al., they introduced a simple scoring proposal based on their clinical experience.
targetString: ឥឡូវនេះគោលការណ៍ណែនាំរបស់យើងបានទទួលការអត្ថាធិប្បាយដោយ Zhou et al ពួកគេបានណែនាំសំណើដាក់ពិន្ទុដ៏សាមញ្ញដោយផ្អែកលើបទពិសោធន៍គ្លីនិករបស់ពួកគេ។
en-mt: Now our guidelines have received comment by Zhou et al, they have introduced simple scoring requests based on their clinical experience.

sourceString: Their work added new evidence for our guideline and also make valuable reference for this pandemic worldwide.
targetString: ការងារ​របស់​ពួកគេ​បាន​បន្ថែម​ភស្ដុតាង​ថ្មី​​សម្រាប់​គោលការណ៍ណែនាំ​របស់​យើង ហើយ​ក៏​ជា​ឯកសារ​យោង​ដ៏​មាន​តម្លៃ​សម្រាប់​ជំងឺ​រាតត្បាតនេះ​ទូទាំង​ពិភពលោក​ផងដែរ។
en-mt: Their work has added new evidence for our guidelines and is also a valued reference document for this global pandemic.

sourceString: We endorse their significant work and express our thanks.
targetString: យើងគាំទ្រការងារសំខាន់របស់ពួកគេហើយថ្លែងអំណរគុណ។
en-mt: We support their important work and give thanks.

sourceString: However, their work also needs update according to the latest Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines for COVID-19 (Trial seventh version) and recently studies.
targetString: ប៉ុន្តែការងាររបស់ពួកគេក៏ត្រូវការការធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាពដោយយោងទៅតាមគោលការណ៍ណែនាំចុងក្រោយនៃការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការព្យាបាលសម្រាប់ជំងឺ COVID-19 (កំណែសាកល្បងទីប្រាំពីរ) និងការសិក្សាថ្មីៗនេះ។
en-mt: But their work also needs updating based on the final guidelines of evolution Age and treatment for COVID-19 (seventh test version) and recent studies.

sourceString: According to the seventh edition (3 March 2020), to confirm the suspected case needs to combine any one item of epidemiological history features with two items of clinical manifestations to make a comprehensive analysis, or needs to meet three items of clinical manifestations if without clear epidemiological history:
targetString: យោងតាមការបោះពុម្ពផ្សាយលើកទីប្រាំពីរ (ថ្ងៃទី 3 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020) ដើម្បីបញ្ជាក់ករណីសង្ស័យចាំបាច់ត្រូវបញ្ចូលគ្នានូវធាតុណាមួយនៃលក្ខណៈប្រវត្តិសាស្រ្តនៃរោគរាតត្បាតជាមួយធាតុពីរនៃការបង្ហាញរោគសញ្ញាដើម្បីធ្វើការវិភាគឱ្យបានទូលំទូលាយ ឬតម្រូវការ​ដើម្បីបំពេញនូវរោគសញ្ញាបីយ៉ាង ប្រសិនបើប្រវត្តិសាស្រ្តរាតត្បាតមិន​មាន​ភាព​ច្បាស់​លាស់៖
en-mt: According to the seventh publication (March 3, 2020) to clarify suspicion needs to be combined with any elements of the historical characteristics of the epidemic With two elements of displaying symptoms for comprehensive analysis or the need to meet certificates if pandemic history is not clear:

sourceString: Epidemiological history: (1) a history of travel or residence in Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 cases had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (2) a history of contact with SARS-CoV-2 infectious cases (with positive nucleic acid test); (3) a history of contacting with patients with fever or respiratory symptoms from Wuhan city and surrounding areas, or other communities where COVID-19 had been reported in the last 14 days before symptom onset; (4) a history of contacting with cluster of confirmed cases (≥ 2 cases with fever and/or respiratory symptoms occurred within 2 weeks in small areas, such as home, office, class of school, etc).

sourceString: Diagnosing the confirmed case should base on suspected case with any one item of pathogenic or serological evidence as following: (1) real-time PCR test positive for SARS-CoV-2; (2) viral whole genome sequencing showing high homogeneity to the known novel coronaviruses; (3) positive for the specific IgM antibody and IgG antibody to SARS-CoV-2 in serum test; or a change of the SARS-CoV-2-specific IgG antibody from negative to positive, or titer rising ≥4 times in the recovery phase above that in the acute phase.

sourceString: Besides, there are more and more evidence that remind us to caution with the atypical symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.
targetString: ក្រៅពីនេះ​ មាន​ភស្ដុតាង​ជា​ច្រើន​ទៀត​ដែល​​ដាស់​តឿន​យើង​ឱ្យ​ប្រុង​ប្រយ័ត្ន​ជាមួយ​​អ្នក​ជំងឺ​ដែល​មាន​រោគសញ្ញាខុសធម្មតា និងគ្មាន​រោគ​សញ្ញា។
en-mt: Besides, there is plenty for other evidence to warn us to be careful with patients with unusual and symptom-free symptoms.

sourceString: Hence, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated, as they classified the person without clinical symptoms as “low risk”.
targetString: ដូច្នេះតារាងលំហូររបស់ Zhou et al. គួរតែត្រូវបានធ្វើបច្ចុប្បន្នភាព ព្រោះពួកគេបានចាត់ទុកមនុស្សដែលមិនមានរោគសញ្ញាគ្លីនិកថា “មានហានិភ័យទាប”។
en-mt: Thus, the flow chart of Zhou et al. should be updated because they have considered people who do not have clinical symptoms "low risk."

sourceString: The score system also needs to be verified in further clinical practice and studies.
targetString: ប្រព័ន្ធពិន្ទុក៏ត្រូវការផ្ទៀងផ្ទាត់នៅក្នុងការអនុវត្ត និងការសិក្សាគ្លីនិកបន្ថែមទៀតដែរ។
en-mt: The scoring system needs to be verified in additional practices and clinical studies.

sourceString: To conclude, we hope more direct evidence coming up and call for readers to provide their comments.

sourceString: For the diagnosis of “suspected case” and “confirmed case”, we suggest to trace and obey the newest guidelines of their home countries.
