sourceString: Yesterday, Bangladesh has confirmed five new deaths due to COVID-19 on the day.
targetString: កាលពីម្សិលមិញ ប្រទេសបង់ក្លាដែសបានបញ្ជាក់ថាមានអ្នកស្លាប់ថ្មីចំនួនប្រាំនាក់ដោយសារការតែជំងឺ COVID-19 នៅថ្ងៃនោះ។
en-mt: Bangladesh yesterday confirmed five new deaths from COVID-19 that day.

sourceString: This is the highest number of fatalities in a day due to the virus.
targetString: នេះគឺជាចំនួនតួលេខអ្នកស្លាប់ខ្ពស់បំផុតក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃដោយសារវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: Here are the highest death numbers in a day from the virus.

sourceString: As of yesterday, Bangladesh's Institute of Epidemiology, Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) reported the number of recorded infected cases included 114 active cases and 33 recovered cases who were staying home.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមម្សិលមិញនេះ វិទ្យាស្ថានប្រយុទ្ធ​ប្រឆាំង ត្រួតពិនិត្យ និងស្រាវជ្រាវ​ជំងឺរាតត្បាត (IEDCR) របសប់ប្រទេស​បង់ក្លាដែស បាន​រាយការណ៍ថា​ចំនួនករណីឆ្លង​ដែលបាន​កត់ទុក រួមមានករណីសកម្ម 114 ករណី និង​ករណី​ជា​សះស្បើយ​ចំនួន 33 ករណីដែលកំពុងស្នាក់នៅផ្ទះ។
en-mt: As of yesterday, the Bangladesh Institute for Anti-Disease Control and Research (IEDCR) listed The number of recorded cases includes 114 active cases and 33 recovery cases staying at home.

sourceString: A total of 17 deaths have been recorded.
targetString: គេបានកត់ត្រាចំនួនអ្នកស្លាប់សរុប 17 នាក់។
en-mt: It was recorded a total of 17 deaths.

sourceString: In an online news briefing, the director of IEDCR, Dr Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the fatalities included four males and one female.
targetString: តាមរយៈកម្មវិធីព័ត៌មានខ្លីអនឡាញ លោកនាយកនៃ IEDCR លោកវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Meerjady Sabrina Flora បាននិយាយថា អ្នកស្លាប់រួមមានបុរសបួននាក់ និងស្ត្រីម្នាក់។
en-mt: Through a short online news program, the director of IEDCR, Dr. Meerjady Sabrina Flora, said the dead included four men and a woman.

sourceString: According to Dr Meerjady, two cases were aged above 60, two between 51 and 60, and one 41-50 years old.
targetString: យោងតាមសម្តីរបស់វេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Meerjady បានអោយដឹងថាមានករណីចំនួនពីរ ដែលមានអាយុលើសពី 60ឆ្នាំ ករណីពីរទៀតអាយុចន្លោះពី 51 ទៅ 60 ឆ្នាំ និងមួយករណីទៀតអាយុ 41-50 ឆ្នាំ។
en-mt: According to Dr. Meerjady, there are two cases of more than age In 60 years, two more cases between the ages of 51 and 60 and the other are 41-50 years old.

sourceString: She also said two of the victims were from Dhaka.
targetString: នាងក៏បាននិយាយផងដែរថា ជនរងគ្រោះពីរនាក់គឺមកពីដាកា។
en-mt: She also said that two of the victims were from Daca.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 11 ខែមីនា អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក (WHO) ​ បានប្រកាសថា COVID-19 គឺជាជំងឺរាតត្បាត។
en-mt: On March 11, the People's Health Organisation (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic.

sourceString: A hospital official told Anadolu Agency, a local news outlet, that one of the deceased was Jalal Saifur Rahman, a director of Bengali Anti-Corruption Commission, who was cared for at the Kuwait Maitree Hospital.
targetString: មន្រ្តីមន្ទីរពេទ្យបានប្រាប់ទីភ្នាក់ងារ Anadolu ដែលជាប្រព័ន្ធផ្សព្វផ្សាយក្នុងស្រុកមួយថាអ្នកស្លាប់ម្នាក់គឺ Jalal Saifur Rahman ប្រធានគណៈកម្មាធិការប្រឆាំងអំពើពុករលួយ Bengali ដែលត្រូវបានគេមើលថែនៅមន្ទីរពេទ្យគុយវ៉ែតម៉ៃទ្រី ។
en-mt: Hospital officials told anadolu agency, a local media outlet, that one of the dead was Jalal Saifur  Rahman, chairman of the Bengali Anti-Corruption Committee, who is being cared for at the Kuwait Maitrie Hospital.

sourceString: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, Bangladeshi Road Transport and Bridges Minister Obaidul Quader said public transport would be shut down for longer than initially planned, until this coming Saturday.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃសៅរ៍ ក្នុងសេចក្តីប្រកាស​ជាវីដេអូ​តាម​អ៊ិនធើណែត​ រដ្ឋមន្រ្តីក្រសួងដឹកជញ្ជូនផ្លូវថ្នល់ និងស្ពានបង់ក្លាដែស លោក Obaidul Quader បាននិយាយថា ការដឹកជញ្ជូនសាធារណៈ​នឹង​ត្រូវ​បានបិទក្នុងរយៈពេល​យូរជាង​ការ​គ្រោងទុក​រហូត​ដល់​ថ្ងៃសៅរ៍​ខាងមុខនេះ។
en-mt: On Saturday, in an online video announcement, the Minister of Road Transport and the Bangladeshi Bridge White Obaidul Quader said public transportation will be closed for longer than planned until next Saturday.

sourceString: This public transport shutdown had initially started on March 26 and was planned to end on Saturday, April 4.
targetString: ការបិទការធ្វើដំណើរជាសាធារណៈនេះ បានចាប់ផ្តើមដំបូងនៅថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែមីនាហើយគ្រោងនឹងបញ្ចប់នៅថ្ងៃសៅរ៍ទី 4 ខែមេសា។
en-mt: The closure of the public transit originally began on March 26 and is scheduled to end on Saturday, April 4.

sourceString: Transport of essential goods -- medical, fuel and food -- was still allowed.
targetString: ការដឹកជញ្ជូនទំនិញដែលសំខាន់ដូចជា បរិក្ខារពេទ្យ ប្រេងសាំង និងអាហារ គឺនៅតែអនុញ្ញាត។
en-mt: Transportation of important goods like medical, petrol and food equipment is still permissive.

sourceString: The first recorded incidents of COVID-19 infection in Bangladesh were on March 8, in two people who returned from Italy and also the wife of one of them.
targetString: ការកត់ត្រាដំបូងមួយ នាថ្ងៃទី៨ ខែមីនា បានបង្ហាញថាមានករណីឆ្លងជំងឺ Covid-19 នៅប្រទេសបង់ក្លាដែស កើតលើមនុស្សពីរនាក់ ដែលបានត្រឡប់មកពីប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលី ស្ត្រីម្នាក់ជាប្រពន្ធរបស់បរុសម្នាក់ក្នុងពួកគេក៏បានឆ្លងជម្ងឺនេះដែរ។
en-mt: An initial record on March 8 showed covid-19 infections in Bangladesh Two people who returned from Italy, a woman as the wife of one of them, also contracted the disease.

sourceString: As of March 19, these three had already recovered.
targetString: កណរីទាំងបីនេះបានជាសះស្បើយហើយ គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 19 ខែមីនា។
en-mt: These three recovered and as of March 19.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 surpasses one million infections worldwide
targetString: ជំងឺ SARS-CoV-2 បានឆ្លងលើសមួយលាននាក់នៅទូទាំងពិភពលោក
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 disease infects over one million people around the globe

sourceString: On Thursday, the total number of cases of the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infections surpassed one million worldwide, Johns Hopkins University data indicated.
targetString: យោងទៅតាមទិន្នន័យនៃសាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Johns Hopkins នៅ​ថ្ងៃ​ព្រហស្បតិ៍ ចំនួនអ្នកឆ្លងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា SARS-CoV-2 បាន​កើន​ឡើង​លើស​ពីមួយ​លាននាក់ជុំវិញពិភពលោក។
en-mt: According to Johns Hopkins University data on Thursday, the number of SARS-CoV-2 cholera infections has increased by more than a million around the globe.

sourceString: At least 52 thousand deaths were linked to COVID-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus.
targetString: យ៉ាងហោចណាស់មនុស្សចំនួន 52 ពាន់នាក់បានស្លាប់ដោយមានជាប់ពាក់ព័ន្ធទៅនឹងជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលបង្កឡើងដោយវីរុស​កូរ៉ូណា។
en-mt: At least 52 thousand people have died associated with COVID-19 caused by cholera.

sourceString: The milestone came the same day Malawi confirmed its first coronavirus infections and Zambia had its first coronavirus-related death.
targetString: ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍សំខាន់មួយបានកើតឡើងនៅថ្ងៃតែមួយ ប្រទេសម៉ាឡាវីបានបញ្ជាក់ពីការឆ្លងវីរុស​ដំបូងគេរបស់ខ្លួន ហើយប្រទេសហ្សំប៊ី​មានអ្នកស្លាប់ ដែលជាប់ទាក់ទងនឹងវីរុស​កូរ៉ូណាជាលើកដំបូង។
en-mt: A significant event occurred on the same day, Malawi confirmed its early infections, and Xambia had the death toll linked to the cholera virus for the very very time for the very time.

sourceString: North Korea claimed, as of Thursday, it was one of the few countries remaining free of coronavirus infections.
targetString: ប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងជើងបានអះអាងនៅថ្ងៃព្រហស្បតិ៍នេះថា ខ្លួនជា​ប្រទេស​មួយក្នុងចំណោមប្រទេសមួយចំនួន ដែលនៅ​តែ​មិនមាន​ការឆ្លងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណានៅឡើយ។
en-mt: North Korea claimed on Thursday to be one of the few countries that still has no cholera outbreak.

sourceString: By yesterday, the World Health Organization reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, including 79,332 cases in the twenty four hours preceding 10 a.m. Central European Time (0800 UTC) on April 4.
targetString: ដោយកាលពីម្សិលមិញ អង្គការ​សុខភាព​ពិភពលោក​បាន​រាយការណ៍ថា មានករណីដែលបានបញ្ជាក់ចំនួន 1,051,635 ករណី ក្នុងនោះមាន 79,332 ករណីក្នុងរយៈពេលម្ភៃបួន ម៉ោងមុនម៉ោង 10 ព្រឹក ម៉ោងនៅអឺរ៉ុបកណ្តាល (0800 UTC) កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 4 ខែមេសា។
en-mt: Yesterday, the People's Republican Organisation reported 1,051,635 confirmed cases, of whom there were 79,332 Twenty-four hours before 10 a.m. in Central Europe (0800 UTC) on April 4.

sourceString: In the United States, over 244 thousand coronavirus cases were recorded, linking to at least 5,900 deaths.
targetString: នៅសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក គេបានកត់ត្រាករណីឆ្លងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណាជាង 244ពាន់នាក់ យ៉ាងហោចណាសមានមនុស្សចំនួន 5,900 ​នាក់ បានស្លាប់ ដែលមានពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹងជំងឺនេះ។
en-mt: In the United States, more than 244,000 people have died in the United States.

sourceString: CBS News reported, citing Johns Hopkins University data, there were over 1,000 US deaths on Wednesday caused by coronavirus infections.
targetString: សារព័ត៌មាន CBS បានរាយការណ៍ ដោយ​ដកស្រង់​ទិន្នន័យ​របស់​សាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Johns Hopkins ថាមានមនុស្សជាង 1,000 នាក់បានស្លាប់ កាលពីថ្ងៃពុធ​ដែល​បណ្តាល​មក​ពីការឆ្លងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា។
en-mt: CBS News reported, quoting Johns Hopkins University data as saying that more than 1,000 people died on Wednesday, caused by a cholera epidemic.

sourceString: Around the world, countries announced stricter measures to inhibit the disease from spreading.
targetString: នៅជុំវិញពិភពលោក បណ្តាប្រទេសជាច្រើនបានប្រកាសពីវិធានការណ៍តឹងរ៉ឹង ដើម្បីរារាំងជំងឺនេះកុំឱ្យមានការរីករាលដាល។
en-mt: Around the globe, many countries have announced tough measures to prevent the disease from spreading.

sourceString: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, extended the city lockdown to May 1.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃព្រហស្បតិ៍ លោក Sergei Sobyanin អភិបាល​ក្រុងម៉ូស្គូ បានបន្តបិទទ្វារទីក្រុងរហូត​ដល់ថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែ​ឧសភា។
en-mt: On Thursday, Sergei Sobyanin, the mayor of Moscow, continued to close the city until May 1.

sourceString: Nationally, President Vladimir Putin declared Russians would continue to be paid without going to work until April 30.
targetString: នៅទូទាំងប្រទេស ប្រធានាធិបតីវ្លាឌីមៀពូទីនបានប្រកាសថា ប្រជាជនរុស្ស៊ីនឹងត្រូវទទួលបានប្រាក់ឈ្នួលដោយមិនចាំបាច់ទៅធ្វើការរហូតដល់ថ្ងៃទី 30 ខែមេសា។
en-mt: Across the country, President Vladimir Putin announced that Russians would be paid without having to go to work until April 30.

sourceString: The parliament of Portugal voted to extend the national state of emergency by 15 days; the vote passed with 215 votes in favor, ten abstentions, and one vote against.
targetString: សភាព័រទុយហ្កាល់បានបោះឆ្នោតពន្យារពេលប្រកាស​អាសន្នរបស់រដ្ឋត្រឹម 15 ថ្ងៃ សំឡេង​ឆ្នោត​បាន​អនុម័ត​ដោយ​សំឡេងគាំទ្រ 215 សំឡេង អនុបវាទចំនួនដប់ និងសំឡេងប្រឆាំងមួយ។
en-mt: Sturgal voted to delay the state emergency by 15 days, with 215 supportive votes, ten applications and an opposition vote.

sourceString: Saudi Arabia extended curfews in the holy cities of Mecca and Medina to last the entire day; previously, the curfew was only in effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.
targetString: ប្រទេសអារ៉ាប់ប៊ីសាអូឌីត បានបន្ថែមបម្រាមគោចរ​នៅ​តាម​ទីប្រជុំជនសំខាន់ៗនៃទីក្រុង Mecca និង Medina ដែល​មាន​រយៈពេល​ពេញ​មួយថ្ងៃ។ ពីមុន​បម្រាម​គោចរ​មាន​ប្រសិទ្ធភាព​នៅ​ចន្លោះម៉ោង 3 រសៀល​ និងម៉ោង 6 ព្រឹក។
en-mt: Saudi Arabia adds curfews to key meetings of Mecca and Medina Before the ban, the curfew took effect between 3 p.m. and 6 a.m.

sourceString: Thailand planned to implement a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.
targetString: ប្រទេសថៃគ្រោងនឹងអនុវត្តបម្រាមគោចរចន្លោះពីម៉ោង 10 យប់ ដល់ 4 ព្រឹក។
en-mt: Thais plans to enforce a curfew between 10 p.m. and 4 a.m.

sourceString: The governor of Ohio, Mike DeWine, announced the state had extended its stay-at-home order until May 1.
targetString: អភិបាលរដ្ឋអូហៃអូ លោក Mike DeWine បាន​ប្រកាស​ថា រដ្ឋបានពន្យារ​បទ​បញ្ជាស្នាក់​នៅ​ក្នុង​ផ្ទះ​រហូត​ដល់​ថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែឧសភា។
en-mt: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced that the state had extended residency orders until May 1.

sourceString: Stores in Australia lower toilet paper limits per transaction
targetString: ហាងនៅក្នុងប្រទេសអូស្រ្តាលីមានកំរិតទាបនៃការប្រើប្រាស់ក្រដាសក្នុងមួយប្រតិបត្តិការ
en-mt: Shops in Australia have low levels of paper use per operation

sourceString: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian store chains Woolworths and Coles lowered their purchase restrictions on toilet paper to two and one package per transaction in all stores on national level, respectively.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃអាទិត្យ និងល្ងាចថ្ងៃសៅរ៍ ហាងលក់ទំនិញអូស្រ្តាលី Woolworths និង Coles បានបន្ថយការទិញរបស់ពួកគេលើក្រដាសបង្គន់ទៅពីរ និងមួយកញ្ចប់ក្នុងមួយប្រតិបត្តិការនៅក្នុងហាងទាំងអស់នៅកម្រិតថ្នាក់ជាតិ។
en-mt: On Sunday and Saturday evening, Australian shopping malls Woolworths and Coles reduced Their purchase on toilet paper to two and a package per operation in all stores at a national level.

sourceString: ALDI also introduced a one-pack limit, on Monday.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃចន្ទ ផ្សារទំនើប ALDI ក៏បានណែនាំអំពីការដាក់កម្រិត “កញ្ចប់មួយ” ផងដែរ។
en-mt: On Monday, the ALDI supermarket also introduced "one package" restrictions.

sourceString: These limitations were posted as messages on the checkouts, and on the chains' Facebook pages.
targetString: ដែនកំណត់ទាំងនេះត្រូវបានបង្ហោះជាសារនៅលើប៉ុស្តិ៍ត្រួតពិនិត្យ និងនៅលើសង្វាក់ទំព័រហ្វេសប៊ុក។
en-mt: These limits are posted as messages on checkout channels and on the Facebook page chain.

sourceString: Buyers were reportedly stocking up due to fears of COVID-19 in case people need to self-isolate.
targetString: អតិថិជន​ត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍ថា​កំពុងទិញ​របស់របរស្តុកទុក​ដោយ​សារភាពភ័យខ្លាចជំងឺ COVID-19 ក្នុងករណី​ដែល​ពួកគេ​ត្រូវការស្នាក់នៅ​កន្លែងដាច់ដោយឡែក។
en-mt: Customers are reportedly buying storage items over fear of COVID-19 in case they need to stay in isolation.

sourceString: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited toilet paper purchases for home delivery to one pack per order.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃពុធ ក្រុមហ៊ុន Woolworths ក៏បានកម្រិត​ការទិញក្រដាសបង្គន់ សម្រាប់​ការដឹក​ជញ្ជូន​ដល់ផ្ទះត្រឹមមួយកញ្ចប់ប៉ុណ្ណោះ ក្នុងមួយការ​បញ្ជាទិញ។
en-mt: On Wednesday, Woolworths also limited the purchase of toilet paper for home transport to only a package per purchase.

sourceString: These changes followed the previous four-pack per transaction restriction introduced by Woolworths and Coles on March 4 and 5 respectively.
targetString: ការផ្លាស់ប្ដូរទាំងនេះត្រូវបានធ្វើតាមវិធានដាក់កំហិតការបួនប្រអប់ក្នុងការទិញម្ដងលើកមុនដែលត្រូវបានណែនាំដោយ Woolworths និង Coles នៅថ្ងៃទី4 និងទី5 ដាច់ដោយឡែកពីគ្នា។
en-mt: These changes have been complied with four box restrictions in previous purchases introduced by Woolworths and Coles on the 4th and 5th separate days.

sourceString: Coles, in its March 8 media release, reported that with the four-pack restriction in place, "many stores are still selling out within an hour of delivery", and called the demand "unprecedented", while ALDI, in a Facebook post on Tuesday, called it "unexpected".
targetString: នៅក្នុងការចេញផ្សាយតាមប្រព័ន្ធផ្សព្វផ្សាយនៅថ្ងៃទី 8 ខែមីនារបស់ខ្លួន ផ្សារទំនើប Coles បានរាយការណ៍ថា ជាមួយនឹងការដាក់កម្រិតចំនួនបួនកញ្ចប់ "ហាងជាច្រើននៅតែលក់អស់ពីស្តុកក្នុងរយៈពេលមួយម៉ោងនៃការដឹកជញ្ជូន" ហើយបានហៅតម្រូវការនេះថា “មិនធ្លាប់មានពីមុនមក” ខណៈដែលផ្សារទំនើប ALDI បានហៅវាថា “មិនបានរំពឹងទុក” នៅក្នុងការបង្ហោះតាមហ្វេសប៊ុកនៅថ្ងៃអង្គារ។
en-mt: In its March 8 media release, supermarket Coles reported that with four package restrictions, "many stores are still out of store An hour of transportation" and called the requirement "unprecedented," while the ALDI supermarket called it "unexpected" in a Facebook post on Tuesday.

sourceString: Sales went up in a "sharp increase" last week, according to a Woolworths spokesperson.
targetString: យោងតាមអ្នកនាំពាក្យរបស់ Woolworths បានឲ្យដឹងថា ការលក់បាន “កើនឡើងយ៉ាងខ្លាំង” កាលពីសប្តាហ៍មុន។
en-mt: According to a Woolworths spokesperson, sales "increased dramatically" last week.

sourceString: Costco's store in Canberra also limited the allowed amount to two packs last week.
targetString: ហាងរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន Costco នៅ Canberra ក៏បានកំណត់ចំនួនដែលត្រូវបានអនុញ្ញាតឱ្យមានចំនួនពីរកញ្ចប់កាលពីសប្តាហ៍មុនផងដែរ។
en-mt: Costco's store in Canberra also determined the number allowed to be two packages last week.

sourceString: To further alleviate the shortage, Coles ordered bigger packages from suppliers and increased delivery frequency, Woolworths ordered extra stock, while ALDI made stocks for a planned Wednesday special available early.
targetString: ដើម្បីធ្វើការកាត់បន្ថយការខ្វះខាត Coles បានបញ្ជាទិញ​​កញ្ចប់​ធំ​ពី​អ្នក​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់ និងបង្កើនភាពញឹបញាប់នៃការដឹកជញ្ជូន Woolworths បានបញ្ជាទិញ​ស្តុកបន្ថែម ខណៈដែល ALDI បង្កើតស្តុក​សម្រាប់​គម្រោង​ដែលបានគ្រោងទុកសម្រាប់ថ្អៃពុធពិសេសឲ្យបានមុន។
en-mt: To reduce shortages, Coles ordered large packages from suppliers and increased the frequency of Woolwor transportation Theths have ordered the purchase of additional stock while ALDI creates a stockpile for planned projects for special Wednesdays early.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman, executive director of the Australian Retailers Association, said that retailers try to raise stock, but local council restrictions on the timing of truck-deliveries make it hard.
targetString: លោក Russell Zimmerman ប្រធានសមាគម​​អ្នកលក់​រាយ​របស់​អូស្ត្រាលីបាននិយាយថា អ្នកលក់រាយ​ព្យាយាម​នាំ​ឥវ៉ាន់ចូលស្តុក ប៉ុន្តែការដាក់កំហិត​របស់​ក្រុមប្រឹក្សាក្នុង​តំបន់ចំ​ពេលឡានដឹកឥវ៉ាន់ចូល​បានបណ្ដាល​ឲ្យមាន​ការ​ពិបាក។
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman, president of the Australian Retailers Association, said retailers try to bring shopping Store into the store, but the restraint of councils in the area as the truck enters has caused challenges.

sourceString: He expects rising production costs, as suppliers try to meet demand, and fewer specials.
targetString: លោករំពឹងថាថ្លៃដើមផលិតកម្មនឹងកើនឡើងដោយសារតែអ្នកផ្គត់ផ្គង់ព្យាយាមបំពេញតាមតម្រូវការ ហើយមានជំនាញពិសេសតិចជាងមុន។
en-mt: He expects production tree costs to increase since suppliers try to meet demand and have fewer specialty skills.

sourceString: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the early release of stock, some stores can't run the Wednesday special.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃអង្គារ ALDI បានប្រកាសថា​បន្ទាប់ពីការ​ចេញផ្សាយស្តុកដំបូង ហាងមួយចំនួន​មិនអាចដំណើរការកម្មវិធីថ្ងៃពុធពិសេសបានទេ។
en-mt: On Tuesday, ALDI announced that following the release of the initial stock, some stores were unable to operate a special Wednesday program.

sourceString: In a News.com.au report, Dr Gary Mortimer, retail expert from Queensland University of Technology, said the stores fill the stock every night.
targetString: នៅក្នុងរបាយការណ៍របស់ News.com.au លោកវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Gary Mortimer អ្នកជំនាញផ្នែកលក់រាយមកពីសាកលវិទ្យាល័យបច្ចេកវិទ្យាឃ្វីនលែន បាននិយាយថាហាងទាំងនេះបំពេញស្តុករាល់យប់។
en-mt: In a News.com.au Dr. Gary Mortimer, a retail expert from the Queensivity University of Technology, said these stores fill the stock nightly.

sourceString: He remarked toilet paper is a bulky item, leading to low quantity of stocks in numbers, and, when sold out, leaves vast shelf spaces empty, hardening the feeling of a shortage.
targetString: លោកបានកត់សម្គាល់ថា ក្រដាសបង្គន់ គឺជារបស់​សំពីង​សំពោងដែល​នាំឱ្យបរិមាណ​ស្តុក​មាន​បរិមាណ​តិច ហើយនៅពេលលក់ចេញ បន្សល់​ទុកកន្លែងដាក់​ឥវ៉ាន់ធំៗទុកចោលធ្វើឱ្យអារម្មណ៍ថាខ្វះខាត។
en-mt: He noted that the toilet paper belonged to a vessel that leads to a small quantity of storage and that when sold, leaving large shopping malls, making the feeling of need.

sourceString: "Coles and Woolworths have a view [that] if there was plenty of stuff on the shelf, if product like toilet rolls and sanitiser could be [bought] and are there in quantities, you would probably minimise the panic" said Russell Zimmerman per ABC News.
targetString: លោក Russell Zimmerman បាននិយាយប្រាប់ព័ត៌មាន ABC ថា“ កូឡាសនិងវ៉ូលវូតមានទស្សនៈ [ថា] ប្រសិនបើមានរបស់របរជាច្រើននៅលើធ្នើ ប្រសិនបើផលិតផលដូចជាក្រឡុកបង្គន់និងថ្នាំលាងចានអាចត្រូវបានទិញ ហើយមានបរិមាណអ្នកប្រហែលជាអាចកាត់បន្ថយការភិតភ័យបានច្រើន” ។
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman told ABC News, "Kolas and Wolfwood have the perspective [that] if there is a lot of stuff on the stuff If products like toiletries and dishwashers can be purchased and there is a quantity, you may be able to reduce a lot of terror."

sourceString: Recycled toilet paper producer Who Gives a Crap said on last Wednesday they'd run out of stock.
targetString: ក្រុមហ៊ុន Who Gives a Crap ដែល​ផលិតក្រដាស​​បង្គន់​ដែល​ធ្វើ​ពី​ក្រដាស​កែ​ច្នៃ​ បាននិយាយកាលពីថ្ងៃពុធថា ពួកគេ​អស់ទំនិញ​ពីស្តុកហើយ។
en-mt: Who Gives a Crap, which manufactures toilet paper made of paper, said Wednesday that they had already run out of the store.

sourceString: Kimberly-Clark, which makes Kleenex Toilet Tissue, and Solaris Paper which makes Sorbent, emphasized they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to the News.com.au report.
targetString: ក្រុមហ៊ុន Kimberly-Clark ដែលផលិតក្រដាសម៉ាក Kleenex Toilet Tissue និងក្រដាស Solaris និងផលិតសឹម្ភារស្រូបបឺតយកសម្រាមបានបញ្ជាក់ ថាពួកគេកំពុងធ្វើការ 24/7 ដើម្បីរក្សាការផ្គត់ផ្គង់ នេះបើយោងតាមរបាយការណ៍របស់គេហទំព័រ News.com.au ។
en-mt: Kimberly-Clark company that manufactures Kleenex Toilet Tissue and Solaris paper and manufactures alcohol materials The garbage stated that they were working 24/7 to maintain the supply, according to their website News.com.au.

sourceString: Domain.com, a real estate site, reported some property sellers offering free toilet paper to the first bidder on auctions in Melbourne, when fewer auctions were held because of buyers having time off on the long weekend of Labour Day.
targetString: Domain.com ដែលជាគេហទំព័រ​អចលនទ្រព្យបាន​រាយការណ៍ថា​ ​អ្នកលក់អចលន​ទ្រព្យ​បានផ្ដល់ជូន​ក្រដាស​ប្រើប្រាស់​ក្នុងបន្ទប់ទឹកដោយ​មិនគិតថ្លៃទៅ​កាន់អ្នក​ដែល​បាន​ដេញថ្លៃដំបូងគេ​នៅក្នុងពិធីដេញថ្លៃក្នុង​ទីក្រុង​មែលប៊ន នៅពេលការ​ដេញ​ថ្លៃពីរ​បី​បាន​ធ្វើឡើង​ដោយ​សារ​អ្នកទិញបាន​សម្រាកនៅ​ពេលចុង​សប្ដាហ៍នៃ​ថ្ងៃទិវា​ពលកម្ម។
en-mt: Domain.com real estate website reports that the real estate seller offers free bathroom use paper to those who have bid THE cups were at auction ceremonies in Melbourne when a few auctions took place because shoppers took a break during the Energy Day weekend.

sourceString: The Thursday edition of NT News, a daily printed in Darwin, included an eight-page insert meant to be cut up and used as toilet paper.
targetString: ការបោះផ្សាយរបស់កាសែត NT News កាលពីថ្ងៃព្រហស្បតិ៍ ដែលបានបោះពុម្ពជារៀងរាល់ថ្ងៃនៅ Darwin រួមមានទាំងការបញ្ចូលប្រាំបីទំព័រដែលមានន័យថាត្រូវ​បានកាត់ និងប្រើជាក្រដាសបង្គន់។
en-mt: Thursday's published NT News, published daily in Darwin, includes an inclusion of eight pages meaning cut and used as toilet paper.

sourceString: The stores were originally reluctant to impose restrictions, according to a report from ABC Australia on March 3 in which they said they had no plans to introduce restrictions on the purchases.
targetString: ដំបូងឡើយ ហាងនានាមានការស្ទាក់ស្ទើរក្នុងការដាក់ការរឹតត្បិតនេះ នេះបើយោងតាមរបាយការណ៍ពី ABC អូស្ត្រាលីនៅថ្ងៃទី 3 ខែមីនា ដោយពួកគេបាននិយាយថាពួកគេមិនមានផែនការណែនាំការរឹតបន្តឹងលើការទិញនោះទេ។
en-mt: At first, stores were reluctant to impose this restriction, according to a report from ABC Australia On March 3, they said they did not have a plan to introduce restrictions on purchases.

sourceString: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including masks, sanitiser, dried goods, handwash and flour.
targetString: លោក Russell Zimmerman បានបន្ថែមទៀតថាផលិតផលផ្សេងទៀតក៏មានតម្រូវការខ្ពស់ផងដែររួមមានម៉ាស់មុខ ម៉ាស់អនាម័យ ផលិតផលស្ងួត ស្ងួតដៃ និងម្សៅ។
en-mt: Russell Zimmerman added that other products are also in high demand, including massages, hygiene, hygiene, dry products, hands and powder.

sourceString: Similarly, outside of Australia, on Sunday evening online British supermarket Ocado was observed limiting purchases of Andres toilet paper to two 12-roll packs.
targetString: ស្រដៀងគ្នានេះដែរ ល្ងាចថ្ងៃ​អាទិត្យនេះ នៅខាងក្រៅ​ប្រទេស​អូស្រ្តាលី ផ្សារទំនើប Ocado អនឡាញ​របស់​ចក្រភព​អង់គ្លេស​ត្រូវបាន​គេ​សង្កេតឃើញថា មានការ​ដាក់​កម្រិតលើការ​ទិញក្រដាសសម្រាប់បង្គន់ម៉ាក Andres រហូតដល់ទៅពីរកញ្ចប់​ 12 ដុំ។
en-mt: Similarly this Sunday evening outside Australia, the UK online Ocado supermarket Enemies have been observed to be limited to the purchase of paper for Andres brands to two packages of up to 12 pieces.

sourceString: World Health Organization declares COVID-19 pandemic
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក​បានប្រកាស​អំពីជំងឺរាតត្បាត COVID-19
en-mt: The Organisation of Health declares COVID-19 epidemic

sourceString: On Wednesday, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19 — the disease caused by coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 — to be a pandemic.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃពុធអង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក (WHO) បានប្រកាសពីការផ្ទុះឡើងជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលបណ្តាលមកពីវីរុស ដែលបង្កឡើងដោយវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 ។
en-mt: On Wednesday, the Who (WHO) announced an outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the virus caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: Although the word "pandemic" only refers to how widely a disease has spread, not how dangerous specific cases are, the WHO noted the need to drive governments to action:
targetString: ទោះបីជាពាក្យថា “ជំងឺរាតត្បាត” សំដៅទៅលើរបៀបដែលជំងឺបានរាលដាល ហើយមិនមែនគ្រាន់តែយោងទៅលើករណីជាក់លាក់ ដែលមានគ្រោះថ្នាក់បែបនោះក៏ពិតមែន ប៉ុន្តែអង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានកត់សម្គាល់ពីតម្រូវការក្នុងការជំរុញរដ្ឋាភិបាល ចាត់វិធានការ៖
en-mt: Although the word "pandemic" refers to how the disease spreads and not just references to specific cases There are types of dangers, but the People's Health Organisation has noted the need to urge governments to take action:

sourceString: "All countries can still change the course of this pandemic.
targetString: “ប្រទេសទាំងអស់នៅតែអាចផ្លាស់ប្តូរទិសដៅនៃជំងឺរាតត្បាតនេះបាន។
en-mt: "All countries can still change the direction of this pandemic.

sourceString: If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace and mobilize their people in the response," said Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the WHO.
targetString: លោក Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus អគ្គនាយក​អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានមានប្រសាសន៍ថា ប្រសិនបើប្រទេសនានា រកឃើញ ធ្វើតេស្ត ព្យាបាល ដាក់​ឲ្យ​នៅ​ដាច់​ពី​គេ និងប្រមូលផ្តុំប្រជាជន​របស់ពួក​គេ​តាមការឆ្លើយតបនោះ”។
en-mt: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, world health organization director general, said that if countries are Healing tests are found to be isolated and gather their people in response."

sourceString: "We are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity and by the alarming levels of inaction."
targetString: “យើងមានការព្រួយបារម្ភយ៉ាងខ្លាំងទាំងកម្រិតប្រកាសអាសន្ននៃភាពរាលដាល និងភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ និងកម្រិតនៃភាពអាសន្ននៃភាពអសកម្ម។”
en-mt: "We are deeply concerned by the emergency level of widespread and severity and the level of emergency."

sourceString: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, formerly the director of the United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."
targetString: យោងតាមវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Tom Frieden អតីតនាយក មជ្ឈមណ្ឌលគ្រប់គ្រង និងការពារជំងឺរបស់​សហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក​បានឱ្យដឹងថា ជំងឺរាតត្បាត​រីករាលដាលនេះ​គឺ “មិនធ្លាប់មានពីមុនមក”។
en-mt: According to Dr. Tom Frieden, the former director of the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the pandemic is "unprecedented."

sourceString: He said, in remarks published by CNN in February, "other than influenza, no other respiratory virus has been tracked from emergence to continuous global spread."
targetString: នៅក្នុងសុន្ទរកថារបស់គាត់ដែលបានបោះផ្សាយដោយទូរទស្សន៍ស៊ីអិនអិនកាលពីខែកុម្ភៈថា “ក្រៅពីជំងឺផ្តាសាយ មិនមានវីរុសផ្លូវដង្ហើមផ្សេងទៀតត្រូវបានគេតាមដានពីការលេចចេញមកទេ រហូតដល់មានការបន្តការរីករាលដាលទូទាំងពិភពលោក”។
en-mt: In his speech published by CNN television in February, "Besides influenza, there is no fluorescent virus Other breaths have been monitored from appearances to global epidemics."

sourceString: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar view, saying "we have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a coronavirus."
targetString: Ghebreyesus បានបង្ហាញការយល់ឃើញស្រដៀងគ្នា ដោយនិយាយថា “យើងមិន​ដែលឃើញ​ជំងឺរាតត្បាត​បង្កឡើងដោយវីរុស​កូរ៉ូណាទេពីមុនមក”។
en-mt: Ghebreyesus expressed a similar perception, saying, "We have never seen an epidemic caused by the cholera virus in the past."

sourceString: He continued, "and we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time."
targetString: លោកបានបន្តទៀតថា "ហើយយើង​មិនដែល​ឃើញពី​ជំងឺរាតត្បាតដែលអាចគ្រប់គ្រងបានក្នុងពេលតែមួយនោះទេ"។
en-mt: "And we have never seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time," he continued.

sourceString: The new status as a pandemic follows the WHO's decision in January to declare the outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.
targetString: ស្ថានភាពថ្មីដែលជារោគរាតត្បាតដែលធ្វើតាមការសម្រេចចិត្តរបស់ WHO នៅក្នុងខែមករា ដែលប្រកាសថា ការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺនេះ ជាស្ថានភាពអាសន្នទៅលើសុខភាពសាធារណៈស្ថិតក្នុងការព្រួយបារម្ភកម្រិតអន្តរជាតិ។
en-mt: A new state of pandemics that complied with the WHO decision in January that declared the spread of the disease a state of emergency on public health is of international level concern.

sourceString: The United States' National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease's director, Dr. Anthony Fauci, said of the outbreak, "bottom line, it's going to get worse."
targetString: លោកវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Anthony Fauci នាយក​វិទ្យាស្ថាន​ជាតិ​គ្រប់គ្រង​ផ្នែកអាឡែរហ្ស៊ី និងជំងឺឆ្លង​របស់​សហរដ្ឋ​អាមេរិក​បាន​និយាយអំពីការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺនេះថា “វានឹង​កាន់​តែ​ធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ​ទៅៗ”។
en-mt: Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Allergy Institute of Administration and Infectuations "It's going to be more severe," the United States said of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of Thursday, Associated Press reported there were at least 126,000 cases of COVID-19 worldwide, resulting in over 4,600 deaths.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃព្រហស្បតិ៍ ទីភ្នាក់ងារសារព័ត៌មានបាន​រាយការណ៍ថា យ៉ាងហោចណាស់មានករណីកើតជំងឺ COVID-19 ចំនួន 126,000 នាក់នៅទូទាំងពិភពលោក ដែលបណ្តាលឱ្យមនុស្សស្លាប់ជាង 4,600 នាក់។
en-mt: As of Thursday, news agencies reported that there had been at least a case of COVID 126,000 people around the globe, resulting in more than 4,600 deaths.

sourceString: The 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: ការរាតត្បាតវីរុសកូរ៉ូណាឆ្នាំ 2019–20 គឺជា​ការបន្ត​ការរាតត្បាត​នៃវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា 2019 (ជំងឺ COVID-19) ដែល​បណ្ដាល​មកពីរោគ​សញ្ញា​ជំងឺដង្ហើមដ៏ធ្ងន់ធ្ងរកូរ៉ូណា 2 (SARS-CoV-2)។
en-mt: The 2019–20 cholera epidemic is the epidemic of the 2019 Corona virus (James COVID-19) caused by severe respiratory disease symptoms 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared to be a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020, and recognized as a pandemic on 11 March 2020.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺនេះត្រូវបានគេកំណត់អត្តសញ្ញាណនៅក្នុងទីក្រុងវូហាន ប្រទេសចិន កាលពីខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 ដោយបានប្រកាសថាជាភាពអាសន្នផ្នែកសុខភាពសាធារណៈនៃការព្រួយបារម្ភជាអន្តរជាតិនៅថ្ងៃទី 30 ខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020 និងត្រូវបានទទួលស្គាល់ថាជាជំងឺរាតត្បាតនៅថ្ងៃទី 11 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020។
en-mt: The outbreak was identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, declared a public health emergency International concern on January 30, 2020 and was recognised as a pandemic on March 11, 2020.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 1.61 million cases of COVID-19 have been reported in 210 countries and territories, resulting in approximately 97,000 deaths.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 10 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ករណីនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 មានចំនួនប្រមាណ 1,61 លានករណីត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍​មកពី​ប្រទេស និងតំបន់ចំនួន 210 ករណីស្លាប់មានចំនួន​ប្រមាណ 97,000 នាក់។
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, there were approximately 1,61 million cases of COVID-19 Cases are reported from 210 countries and regions, there are approximately 97,000 deaths.

sourceString: About 364,000 people have recovered.
targetString: មនុស្សប្រមាណ 364,000 នាក់បានជាសះស្បើយ។
en-mt: About 364,000 people have recovered.

sourceString: The case fatality rate has been estimated to be 4% in China, while globally ranging from 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Zealand.
targetString: ករណីអត្រាមរណៈភាពត្រូវបានប៉ានប្រមាណចំនួន 4% នៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិន ខណៈដែលសម្រាប់សកលលោកវិញគឺស្ថិតក្នុងចន្លោះពី 13.04% នៅប្រទេសអាល់ហ្សេរី ទៅដល់ .08% នៅប្រទេសនូវែលសេឡង់។
en-mt: Death rate cases are approximately 4% in China, while for the universe Ranks between 13.04% in Algeria to .08% in New Celand.

sourceString: Common symptoms include fever, cough and shortness of breath.
targetString: រោគសញ្ញាទូទៅ​រួមបញ្ចូល​ទាំងការក្ដៅខ្លួន ក្អក និង​ការ​មាន​ដង្ហើម​ខ្លីៗ។
en-mt: Common symptoms include warming, coughing and having short breath.

sourceString: Complications may include pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: ផលវិបាកអាចរួមបញ្ចូលទាំងជំងឺរលាកសួត និង​រោគ​សញ្ញា​ផ្លូវដង្ហើមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ។
en-mt: The side effects can include both pneumonia and acute respiratory symptoms.

sourceString: The time from exposure to onset of symptoms is typically around five days, but may range from two to fourteen days.
targetString: ចាប់ពីពេលដែលប៉ះពាល់ជាមួយអ្នកជំងឺ រហូត​ដល់​ពេល​ចេញ​រោគសញ្ញា ជាទូទៅ​គេអាចដឹង​បាន​ក្នុង​រយៈពេល​ប្រាំថ្ងៃ ប៉ុន្តែ​អាច​រកឃើញ​ក្នុងចន្លោះ​ពីពីរ​ទៅ​ដប់បួន​ថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: From contact with the patient to the time of symptoms, symptoms can be typically recognised within five days, but can be found in between two and fourteen days.

sourceString: There is no known vaccine or specific antiviral treatment.
targetString: មិនមានថ្នាំវ៉ាក់សាំង ឬការព្យាបាលដោយប្រើថ្នាំប្រឆាំងវីរុសជាក់លាក់ទេ។
en-mt: There is no vaccine or treatment with specific antibiotics.

sourceString: Primary treatment is symptomatic and supportive therapy.Recommended preventive measures include hand washing, covering one's mouth when coughing, maintaining distance from other people, and monitoring and self-isolation for people who suspect they are infected.
targetString: ការព្យាបាលដំណាក់កាលដំបូងគឺការព្យាបាលអាស្រ័យលើរោគសញ្ញា និងការគាំទ្រ។ វិធីបង្ការដែលត្រូវបានណែនាំឲ្យប្រើរួមមានការលាងដៃ ខ្ទប់មាត់នៅពេលក្អក រក្សាចម្ងាយពីអ្នកដទៃ និងតាមដាន និងស្នាក់នៅកន្លែងដាច់ដោយឡែកសម្រាប់អ្នកដែលសង្ស័យថាពួកគេបានឆ្លង។
en-mt: Early stage treatments are treatment depending on symptoms and support. Prevention recommended includes Washing hands, breathing mouths when coughing, keeps distance from others and tracks and stays in separate places for those who suspect they have passed.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: អាជ្ញាធរទូទាំងពិភពលោកបានឆ្លើយតបដោយអនុវត្ត​ការរឹតបន្តឹងការធ្វើដំណើរ ការដាក់ឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយ​ឡែក ​ការហាមឃាត់​ការត្រួតពិនិត្យ​គ្រោះថ្នាក់​នៅ​កន្លែងធ្វើការ និងការបិទកន្លែង។
en-mt: Authorities around the globe responded by enforcing travel restrictions, isolation, banning accidents in the workplace and closing venues.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: ជំងឺរាតត្បាតនេះ​បានបណ្ដាលឲ្យកើតមាន​បញ្ហា​ទៅ​លើ​សេដ្ឋកិច្ច​សង្គមទូទាំងសកលលោក ការលើកពេល ឬការ​លុបចោល​នៃព្រឹត្តិការណ៍កីឡា សាសនា នយោបាយ និងវប្បធម៌ និងការសាយ​ភាយ​ការខ្វះខាតការផ្គត់ផ្គង់​ដែល​បណ្ដាល​មកពីការ​ទិញកើតចេញពីការភ័យខ្លាច។
en-mt: The pandemic has caused a problem on socioeconomically globally, lifting or cancellation of sporting events Religion, politics and culture and spreading the lack of supply caused by buying stems from fear.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: សាលារៀន និងសាកលវិទ្យាល័យបានបិទទូទាំងប្រទេស ឬ​តាម​តំបន់​នៅក្នុងប្រទេសចំនួន 193 ដោយ​ប៉ះពាល់​ដល់​ចំនួន​សិស្ស​ទូទាំង​ពិភពលោកប្រហែល 99.4 ភាគរយ។
en-mt: Schools and universities closed nationwide or regionally in 193 countries, affecting the number of students around the globe at 99.4 percent.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: ព័ត៌មានមិនពិតអំពីវីរុសនេះបានផ្សព្វផ្សាយពេញអនឡាញ ហើយវាថែមទាំងមានឧប្បត្តិហេតុនៃការខ្លាចជនបរទេស និងការរើសអើងជនជាតិចិន ប្រជាជនផ្សេងទៀតមានដើមកំណើតនៅតំបន់អាស៊ីខាងកើត និងអាស៊ីអាគ្នេយ៍ និងអ្នកមើលទៅស្រដៀង និងអ្នកដទៃទៀតមកពីតំបន់ដែលមានករណីឆ្លង។
en-mt: False information about the virus was spread filled online and it even contained incidents of fear of foreigners and discriminating against Chinese people Others originate in East Asia and Ivory Coast and you look similar to and others from areas of infection.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: ដោយសារ​ការកាត់បន្ថយការធ្វើដំណើរ និង​ការបិទឧស្សាហកម្ម​ធន់ធ្ងន់ បណ្ដាល​ឲ្យមាន​ការធ្លាក់ចុះ​ទៅលើការបំពុលខ្យល់ និង​ការ​បញ្ចេញជាតិកាបូន។
en-mt: Thanks to reduced travel and the closure of heavy obesity industries cause a drop in air pollution and carbon emissions.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: អាជ្ញាធរសុខាភិបាលនៅទីក្រុងវូហាន ប្រទេសចិន (រដ្ឋធានីនៃខេត្ត Hubei) បានរាយការណ៍​ពីករណី​ចង្កោម​នៃជំងឺរលាកសួតនៃមូលហេតុដែលមិនស្គាល់នៅថ្ងៃទី 31 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 ហើយការស៊ើបអង្កេត​មួយ​ត្រូវ​បាន​ចាប់ផ្តើម​នៅដើមខែមករាឆ្នាំ 2020។
en-mt: Medical authorities in Wuhan, China (capital of Hubei Province) report cases of pneumonia An unknown cause on December 31, 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: ករណីនេះទាក់ទងភាគច្រើនទៅនឹងផ្សារលក់ដុំអាហារសមុទ្រហួណាន ហើយដូច្នេះវីរុសនេះត្រូវបានគេគិតថាមានដើមកំណើតហ្សូណូ។
en-mt: This case relates mostly to the sale of Huan seafood, and so the virus is thought to be of Xono origin.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: វីរុសដែលបណ្តាលឱ្យមានការផ្ទុះឡើងត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ថា SARS-CoV-2 ជាវីរុសរកឃើញថ្មីៗដែលទាក់ទងយ៉ាងជិតស្និទ្ធទៅនឹងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណានៅក្នុងសត្វប្រចៀវ វីរុសកូរ៉ូណានៅក្នុងសត្វពង្រូល និងវីរុស SARS-CoV។ បុគ្គលដែលមានរោគសញ្ញាដំបូងបំផុតត្រូវបានរកឃើញនៅពេលក្រោយថាបានធ្លាក់ខ្លួនឈឺនៅថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 ហើយបុគ្គលនោះមិនបានប៉ះពាល់ដោយផ្ទាល់ជាមួយក្រុមវីរុសដែលរកឃើញនៅក្នុងផ្សារគ្រឿងសើមនោះទេ។
en-mt: The virus that ignited the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly related virus Close to the cholera virus in bats, cholera in animals and SAR viruses The individual with the earliest symptoms was found later to have fallen ill on December 1 2019 And the person has not personally contacted a group of viruses found in the wet gadget market.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: នៅក្នុងចង្កោមករណីដំបូងៗ​ដែល​ត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍​នៅក្នុង​ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 ចំនួនពីរ​ភាគបី​នៃអ្នកជំងឺ​ត្រូវបាន​រកឃើញ​ប្រភព​ចេញពីផ្សារនោះ។
en-mt: In the initial cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds of patients were found from the market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 13 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 របាយការណ៍​ដែល​មិនបាន​បញ្ជាក់​ពីកាសែត South China Morning Post បាន​លើក​ឡើង​ថា ករណីមួយបានកើតឡើងកាលពីថ្ងៃទី 17 ខែវិច្ឆិកា ឆ្នាំ 2019 ដែលមានអាយុ 55 ឆ្នាំ​មកពី​ខេត្តហ៊ូប៉ី​ប្រហែល​ជាករណីដំបូង។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែកុម្ភៈឆ្នាំ 2020 អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានរាយការណ៍ថា ករណី​ថ្មីៗត្រូវបានគេរាយការណ៍ថាបានធ្លាក់ចុះនៅក្នុងប្រទេស​ចិន ប៉ុន្តែភ្លាមៗ​នោះមានការ​កើនឡើង​នៅក្នុង​ប្រទេស​អ៊ីតាលី អ៊ីរ៉ង់ និងកូរ៉េខាងត្បូង ចំនួនករណីថ្មី​នៅខាង​ក្រៅ​ប្រទេសចិន​បានកើនឡើង​លើស​ចំនួន​ករណីថ្មី​នៅក្នុង​ប្រទេស​ចិនជាលើកដំបូង។
en-mt: On March 13, 2020, an unconfirmed report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case occurred on the day November 17, 2019, aged 55, from Hubei province may have been the forefront of Hubei. 20 The People's Health Organisation reports that new cases are reported to have dropped in China, but there has suddenly been an increase in the country Italy, Iran and South Korea, number of new cases outside China rose by the number of new cases in the country China for the very debut.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: វាប្រហែលជា​មិនមានការរាយការណ៍អំពី​ករណីឆ្លង ជាពិសេស​ក្នុងបណ្ដាអ្នក​ដែល​មាន​រោគ​សញ្ញា​កម្រិត​ស្រាល។
en-mt: There may be no reports of infections, especially in those with minor symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: នៅត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែកុម្ភៈ មានករណីខ្លះត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍ក្នុងចំណោមយុវជនដែលមានអាយុ 19 ឆ្នាំ និងក្រោម 2.4% នៃករណីទូទាំងពិភពលោក។ លោក Patrick Vallance ទីប្រឹក្សាវិទ្យាសាស្រ្តចក្រភពអង់គ្លេសបានប៉ាន់ស្មានថា 60% នៃប្រជាជនអង់គ្លេសនឹងត្រូវឆ្លងជំងឺ មុនពេលសម្រេចបានភាពស៊ាំដែលមានប្រសិទ្ធភាពជាក្រុម។
en-mt: As of February 26, some cases were reported among young people aged 19 and under 2.4% of the worldwide cases. The UK scientific adviser estimates that 60% of the British population will have to contract the disease before achieving group effective immunity.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: ករណី សំដៅលើចំនួនមនុស្សដែលត្រូវបានគេធ្វើតេស្ត​រក​ជំងឺ COVID-19 ហើយការធ្វើតេស្ត​របស់​គេ​ត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ថាមានលទ្ធផល​វិជ្ជមាន យោងទៅ​តាមពិធីសារផ្លូវការ។
en-mt: Cases refer to the number of people being tested for COVID-19, and their tests have been confirmed as positive results according to official protocols.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនា គ្មានប្រទេសណាមួយ​បានធ្វើតេស្ត​ទៅលើ​ប្រជាជនរបស់គេបាន 3 ភាគរយនោះឡើយ ហើយ​ប្រទេស​ជាច្រើនបាន​ចេញគោល​ការណ៍ផ្លូវការ​ដែល​មិន​ធ្វើតេស្ត​ទៅលើអ្នកដែលចេញរោគសញ្ញាកម្រិតស្រាល ប្រទេស​ទាំងនោះមានដូចជា អ៊ីតាលី ហូឡង់ អេស្ប៉ាញ និងស្វីស។
en-mt: As of March 23, no country had tested their population by 3 percent, and many countries were issuing bulls Official reports that do not test those who deliver minor symptoms, those countries include Italy, the Netherlands, Spain and Swits.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: ការសិក្សាមួយដែលត្រូវបានបោះពុម្ពកាលពីថ្ងៃទី16 ខែមីនាបានរកឃើញថានៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិន រហូតមកដល់ថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមករា ការប៉ានប្រមាណចំនួន 86% នៃការឆ្លងជំងឺ COVID-19 មិនត្រូវបានរកឃើញ ហើយការឆ្លង ដែលមិនមានកត់ត្រានេះ គឺជាប្រភពនៃការចម្លងចំនួន 79% នៃករណី ដែលត្រូវបានកត់ត្រាទុក។
en-mt: A study published on March 16 found that in China as of January 23, an estimated estimate Four 86% of COVID-19 infections have not been detected, and unrecorded infections are the source of 79% of the recorded number of cases.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: ការវិភាគស្ថិតិដែលបានចេញផ្សាយនៅថ្ងៃទី 30 ខែមីនា បានប៉ាន់ស្មានថាចំនួននៃការឆ្លងនៅក្នុងប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីគឺមានចំនួនច្រើនជាងករណីដែលបានរាយការណ៍។
en-mt: A statistical analysis released on March 30 estimated that the number of infections in Italy was higher than the cases reported.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: ការប៉ាន់ស្មានដំបូងនៃលេខបន្តពូជមូលដ្ឋាន (R0) សម្រាប់ជំងឺ COVID-19 គឺ 1.4 ទៅដល់ 2.4។
en-mt: The initial estimate of the local reproductive number (R0) for COVID-19 is 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: ការសិក្សាស្រាវជ្រាវដែលចេញផ្សាយដោយមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលគ្រប់គ្រង និងបង្ការជំងឺអាមេរិកបានសន្និដ្ឋានថាវាអាចនឹងមាន 5.7 ។
en-mt: The study, released by the American Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, concluded that it could be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: មនុស្សភាគច្រើនដែលមានជំងឺ COVID-19 បានជាសះស្បើយហើយ។
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 have already recovered.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: សម្រាប់ប្រទេស​ដែល​មិនមាន ពេលវេលានៃការវិវត្ត​រោគ​សញ្ញា​​រហូតដល់ស្លាប់គឺមានចន្លោះពី 6 ទៅ 41 ថ្ងៃ​ ជាមួយ​នឹង​ពេល​វេលា​ទូទៅ​បំផុត​គឺ 14 ថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: For countries where there is no time for evolving symptoms to death, there are between 6 and 41 days, with the most common time of 14 days.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 10 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020 មានអ្នកស្លាប់ដែល​បណ្ដាលមកពីជំងឺ COVID-19 ចំនួនប្រហែល 97,000 នាក់។
en-mt: As of April 10, 2020, there were approximately 97,000 COVID-19 deaths.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: នៅប្រទេសចិនគិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 5 ខែកុម្ភៈ ប្រហែល 80% នៃអ្នកស្លាប់មានអាយុលើសពី 60 ឆ្នាំ ហើយ 75% មានជំងឺសរសៃឈាមបេះដូង និងជំងឺទឹកនោមផ្អែមស្រាប់។ ចំនួនអ្នកស្លាប់ផ្លូវការពីជំងឺរាតត្បាត COVID-19 ជាទូទៅសំដៅទៅលើអ្នកស្លាប់ដែលបានធ្វើតេស្តវិជ្ជមានថាមានជំងឺ COVID យោងទៅតាមពិធីសារផ្លូវការ។
en-mt: In China, as of February 5, approximately 80% of deaths are over 60 years old and 75% have cardiovascular disease and diabetes The official death toll from coVID-19 tuberculosis generally refers to the dead who have tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: ចំនួនអ្នកស្លាប់ពិតប្រាកដដោយសារជំងឺ COVID-19 អាចនឹងមានច្រើនទៀត ព្រោះវាមិនរាប់បញ្ចូលមនុស្ស ដែលស្លាប់ដោយមិនមានការធ្វើតេស្ត - ឧ. នៅផ្ទះ នៅកន្លែងថែទាំជាដើម។
en-mt: The actual death toll from COVID-19 may be greater because it excludes people who die without testing - e.g. at home in care facilities.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: ទិន្នន័យមួយផ្នែកពីប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីបានរកឃើញថាចំនួនអ្នកស្លាប់លើសអំឡុងពេលមានជំងឺរាតត្បាតលើសពីចំនួនសរុបនៃការស្លាប់ដែលគ្របដណ្តប់ដោយសេវាផ្លូវការដោយកត្តា 4-5x។
en-mt: Partial data from Italy found overwhelming number of deaths during epilepsy More than the total number of deaths covered by official services by a factor of 4-5x.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: អ្នកដំណាងឲ្យមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលគ្រប់គ្រង និងបង្ការជំងឺឆ្លងអាមេរិក (CDC) បានទទួលស្គាល់ថា “យើងដឹងថា [ចំនួននៃអ្នកស្លាប់] គឺជាការមើលស្រាលមួយ” សេចក្ដីថ្លែងការណ៍មួយបញ្ជាក់ដោយការរាយការណ៍ អំពីការរាប់មិនគ្រប់ចំនួននៅអាមេរិក។ ការមើលស្រាលបែបនេះជារឿយៗកើតឡើង នៅពេលមានរោគរាតត្បាត ឧទាហរណ៍ដូចជាជំងឺផ្ដាសាយ H1N1 នៅឆ្នាំ2009។ ករណីស្លាប់ដំបូងគេស្ថិតនៅវូហាន នៅថ្ងៃទី9 ខែមករា ឆ្នាំ2020។
en-mt: A representative for the American Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged, "We know that [The number of dead] is a light spectacle," a statement states by reporting on incomplete counts in the camera This kind of mild spectacle often occurs when there is a pandemic, for example, like cholera H1N1 in 2009. The death was located in Wuhan on January 9, 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: ការស្លាប់ដំបូងនៅខាងក្រៅចិនដីគោក បានកើត​ឡើង​កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែកុម្ភៈ នៅប្រទេសហ្វីលីពីន ហើយ​ការ​ស្លាប់ដំបូងនៅខាងក្រៅអាស៊ី គឺនៅ​ប្រទេស​បារាំង​កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 14 ខែកុម្ភៈ។
en-mt: The initial death outside of dry China occurred on February 1 in Phil Pipines, and the early deaths outside Asia were in France on February 14.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: រហូតមកដល់ថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែកុម្ភៈ នៅខាងក្រៅ​ចិនដីគោក មាន​មនុស្ស​ស្លាប់ជាច្រើនត្រូវបានកត់ត្រានៅក្នុងប្រទេសអ៊ីរ៉ង់ កូរ៉េខាងត្បូង និងអ៊ីតាលី។
en-mt: As of February 28, outside of dry China, many deaths were recorded in Iran, South Korea and Italy.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: ត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 13 ខែមីនា ច្រើនជាងសែសិបប្រទេស និង​តំបន់ បានរាយការណ៍​អំពីការស្លាប់នៅ​លើទ្វីប​ទាំងអស់​លើកលែងតែទ្វីបអង់តាក់ទិក។ វិធានការណ៍​ជាច្រើន​ត្រូវ​បានប្រើប្រាស់ដើម្បីកំណត់ចំនួនស្លាប់។
en-mt: By March 13, more than forty countries and regions had reported deaths on the continent All except the Antarctic. Many measures are used to limit the number of deaths.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: ចំនួនទាំងនេះខុសគ្នាតាមតំបន់ និងតាមពេលវេលា ហើយត្រូវបានជះឥទ្ធិពល ដោយបរិមាណតេស្ត គុណភាពប្រព័ន្ធសុខាភិបាល ជម្រើសនៃការព្យាបាល ពេលវេលាចាប់តាំងពីការផ្ទុះជំងឺដំបូង និង​លក្ខណៈ​ប្រជាជន ដូចជាអាយុ ភេទ និងសុខភាពទូទៅ។ ការឆ្លុះ​បញ្ចាំង​ពីចំនួនមរណភាព ដែល​បែងចែក​ដោយ​ចំនួន​ករណី ដែលបានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យក្នុងចន្លោះពេល ដែលបានផ្តល់ឱ្យ។
en-mt: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by quantity, quality of the health system, the choice of time treatment since the disease outbreak Population characteristics such as age, gender and general health. A reflection of the number of deaths divided by the number of cases diagnosed within the given intervals.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: ផ្អែកលើស្ថិតិរបស់សាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Johns Hopkins សមាមាត្រនៃការស្លាប់លើសកលលោកគឺ 6.0% (97,039/1617,204) គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 10 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020។
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death ratio was 6.0% (97,039/1617,204) as of April 10, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: ចំនួនតួលេខខុសគ្នាទៅតាមតំបន់។
en-mt: The number of digits varies by region.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: នៅប្រទេសចិន ការប៉ាន់ស្មានអំពីសមាមាត្រនៃការស្លាប់បានថយចុះពី 17.3% (ចំពោះអ្នកដែលមានរោគសញ្ញាចាប់ផ្តើមពីថ្ងៃទី 1–10 ខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020) ដល់ 0.7% (ចំពោះអ្នកដែលមានរោគសញ្ញាចាប់ផ្តើមបន្ទាប់ពីថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020)។ វិធានការផ្សេងទៀតរួមមានអត្រាស្លាប់តាមករណី (CFR) ដែលឆ្លុះបញ្ចាំងពីភាគរយនៃអ្នកដែលបានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ ដែលស្លាប់ដោយសារជំងឺ និងអត្រាស្លាប់នៃការឆ្លង (IFR) ដែលឆ្លុះបញ្ចាំងពីភាគរយនៃអ្នកឆ្លង (បានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងមិនធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ) ដែលស្លាប់ដោយសារជំងឺ។
en-mt: In China, estimates of death ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptoms starting from 1-10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptoms beginning after February 1, 2020). There are case-by-case death rates (CFR), which reflects the percentage of those diagnosed with diagnosis diagnosed with disease and death rates Infection (IFR), which reflects the percentage of infections (diagnosed and not diagnosed), who die of disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: ស្ថិតិទាំងនេះមិនបានកំណត់ពេលវេលា និងតាមដាន​ប្រជាជនជាក់លាក់ពីការឆ្លងតាមរយៈដំណោះស្រាយករណី។
en-mt: These statistics do not set a time limit and track specific people from transmitting transmission via case solutions.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: ការសិក្សាមួយចំនួនបានព្យាយាមគណនាលេខទាំងនេះសម្រាប់ចំនួនប្រជាជនជាក់លាក់។
en-mt: A number of studies have tried to calculate these numbers for a specific population.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: មជ្ឈមណ្ឌលវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រដែលមានមូលដ្ឋានលើភស្តុតាងនៃសាកលវិទ្យាល័យអ័កស្វឺដ បានប៉ាន់ប្រមាណថាអត្រាមរណភាពនៃការឆ្លងចំពោះជំងឺរាតត្បាតទាំងមូលមានចន្លោះពី 0,1% និង 0,39%។
en-mt: Evidence-based Medical Center of Akwerde University estimated The death rate of transmission for the entire epidemic ranges from 0.1% and 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: ការប៉ាន់ប្រមាណខាងលើនៃជួរនេះគឺស្របទៅនឹង​លទ្ធផលពីការធ្វើតេស្តចៃដន្យដំបូងសម្រាប់ COVID-19 នៅប្រទេសអាឡឺម៉ង់ និងការសិក្សា​ស្ថិតិ​វិភាគ​ផល​ប៉ះពាល់​នៃការធ្វើតេស្តលើការប៉ាន់ស្មានរបស់ CFR។
en-mt: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the initial random test for COVID-19 in Germany and statistical analysis studies of the impact of the CFR estimates.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: WHO បានអះអាងថា ជំងឺរាតត្បាត​នេះ​អាចត្រូវបានគេ​​គ្រប់គ្រង​បាន។
en-mt: The WHO claims that the pandemic can be controlled.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: រយៈពេលកំពូល និងចុងក្រោយនៃការផ្ទុះឡើងគឺមិនច្បាស់លាស់ ហើយអាចខុសគ្នាតាមទីតាំង។
en-mt: The peak and final period of an outbreak is vague and can differ by location.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: លោក Maciej Boni នៅសកលវិទ្យាល័យ Penn State University បានបញ្ជាក់ថា “ដោយនៅសេសសល់​ការមិន​មាន​ការត្រួតពិនិត្យ ជាទូទៅ ការផ្ទុះជំងឺ​កើន​ឡើង​ខ្ពស់ បន្ទាប់​មក​ចាប់ផ្តើម​ថយចុះវិញ នៅពេល​ដែល​ជំងឺ​នេះអស់លែងមាន​អ្នក​ទទួល​ជំងឺ។
en-mt: Maciej Boni at Penn State University stated, "With the remainder of no checks Generally, high-rise outbreaks then begin to decrease when the disease runs out of patients.

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: ប៉ុន្តែវាស្ទើរតែមិនអាចទៅរួចទេក្នុងការធ្វើការប៉ាន់ស្មានដែលសមរម្យនៅពេលឥឡូវនេះអំពីពេលវេលាដែលនឹងត្រូវកើតឡើង” ។
en-mt: But it is already impossible to make an approviate estimate now about when it will happen."

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: ទីប្រឹក្សាវេជ្ជសាស្រ្តជាន់ខ្ពស់របស់រដ្ឋាភិបាលចិនលោក Zhong Nanshan បានអះអាងថា“ វាអាចនឹងបញ្ចប់នៅខែមិថុនា” ប្រសិនបើប្រទេសទាំងអស់អាចត្រូវបានប្រមូលផ្តុំដើម្បីធ្វើតាមដំបូន្មានរបស់អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកស្តីពីវិធានការបញ្ឈប់ការរីករាលដាលនៃវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: Chinese government senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it may end in June" if empty All whites can be mobilized to adhere to the advice of the People's Health Organization on measures to stop the spread of the virus.

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 17 ខែមីនា លោក Adam Kucharski ដែលមកពីសាលាផ្នែកឱសថសាស្ត្រត្រូពិច និងអនាម័យ បានឱ្យដឹងថា SARS-CoV-2 "អាចនឹងបន្តត្រាច់ចរក្នុងរយៈពេលមួយ ឬពីរឆ្នាំទៀត"។
en-mt: On March 17, Adam Kucharski, who is from the School of Medicine, Medicine and Hygiene, said that SARS-CoV-2 "may continue traffic for another year or two."

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: យោងតាមការសិក្សារបស់មហាវិទ្យាល័យ Imperial College ដឹកនាំដោយ Neil Ferguson គម្លាត​ផ្លូវកាយ និង​វិធានការផ្សេងទៀតនឹងត្រូវការ​ជា​ចាំបាច់ "រហូត​ដល់មានវ៉ាក់សាំងមួយអាចប្រើប្រាស់​បាន​ (អាច 18 ខែ ឬយូរ​ជាងនេះ)"។
en-mt: According to an Imperial College study, led by Neil Ferguson, physical gaps and Other measures will be necessary "until a vaccine is available (possibly 18 months or longer)."

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner មកពីសាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Vanderbilt បានថ្លែងថា “ខ្ញុំគិតថាវាប្រហែល​ជាមិនអាចទេ​ដែលថា វីរុសកូរ៉ូណានេះ–ព្រោះវាបានត្រៀមខ្លួនរួចហើយសម្រាប់​ចម្លង–វានឹងមិនបាត់ទៅវិញទាំងស្រុងនោះទេ” ហើយវា “អាចប្រែខ្លួន​ជាជំងឺតាមរដូវកាល ដោយអាចឲ្យវា​ត្រឡប់មក​វិញ​ជារៀងរាល់ឆ្នាំ”។
en-mt: William Schaffner from Vanderbilt University said, "I think it may not be possible that this cholera virus—because it is prepared. Always for copying—it will not disappear completely," and it "can transform itself into a seasonal illness, enabling it to come back every year."

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: សន្ទុះកម្លាំងរាតត្បាតអាចកើតមកវិញនឹងអាស្រ័យលើភាពស៊ាំរបស់ក្រុមមនុស្ស និងទំហំនៃការប្រែប្រួល។
en-mt: Inflammatory strength can recur, depending on group resistance to the human group and the scale of variation.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: រោគសញ្ញាជំងឺ COVID-19 អាចទាក់ទងនឹងភាពមិនច្បាស់លាស់ ហើយបុគ្គលដែលឆ្លងអាចមិនមានរោគសញ្ញាទៀតផង។
en-mt: COVID-19 symptoms may be associated with uncertainties, and individuals infected may no longer have symptoms.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: រោគសញ្ញាពីរដែលដូចគ្នាបំផុតគឺក្ដៅខ្លួន (88%) និងក្អកស្ងួត (68%)។
en-mt: The same two symptoms are hot (88%) and dry (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: រោគសញ្ញាដែលមិនសូវកើតមានរួមមានអស់កម្លាំង ការផលិតជាតិរាវក្នុងប្រព័ន្ធដង្ហើម (phlegm) បាត់បង់ការដឹងក្លិន ការមានដង្ហើមខ្លីៗ ការឈឺចាប់លើសាច់ដុំ និងសន្លាក់ ស្ងួតក ឈឺក្បាល គ្រុនរងារ ក្អួត ក្អកចេញឈាម រាគរូស ឬការប្រែពណ៌ស្បែក។ WHO បានថ្លែងថាមនុស្សប្រមាណម្នាក់ក្នុងចំណោមមនុស្សប្រាំមួយនាក់បានឈឺធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ និងមានការពិបាកដកដង្ហើម។
en-mt: Less occurring symptoms include exhaustion, production of liquids in the respiratory (phlegm) loss of smell, short breath, muscle pain and dry joints The WHO states that an estimated one in six people has serained serial ill and has difficulty breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: មជ្ឈមណ្ឌលគ្រប់គ្រង និងបង្ការជំងឺសហរដ្ធអាមេរិក (CDC) ចុះបញ្ជីរោគសញ្ញាបន្ទាន់ ដូចជាការពិបាកដកដង្ហើម ការឈឺទ្រូងជាប់រហូត ឬសម្ពាធច្របូកច្របល់ភ្លាមៗ ការពិបាកភ្ញាក់ និងមុខឬបបូរមាត់រាងខៀវ។ ការយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ខាងវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រជាបន្ទាន់ត្រូវបានណែនាំ ប្រសិនបើរោគសញ្ញាទាំងនេះមានវត្តមាន។ ការបន្តវិវត្តនៃជំងឺនេះអាចបណ្តាលឱ្យមានជំងឺរលាកសួតធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ រោគសញ្ញាពិបាកដកដង្ហើមស្រួចស្រាវ ជំងឺដំបៅ ដាច់ប្រសាទ និងបាត់បង់ជីវិត។
en-mt: The United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) registers emergency symptoms such as breathing difficulties Persistent chest pain or immediate confusion pressure, difficulty awakening and face or blue lips. Urgent medical attention is recommended if these symptoms are present. The continuation of the evolution of the disease can result in conflict Severe pneumonia, symptoms are difficult to breathe, alcohol, leprosy, nerve disease, and loss of life.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: អ្នកឆ្លងខ្លះអាចនឹងគ្មានរោគសញ្ញា ប៉ុន្តែមានលទ្ធផលតេស្ត ដែលបញ្ជាក់ពីការឆ្លងមេរោគ ដូច្នេះអ្នកស្រាវជ្រាវបានផ្តល់ដំបូន្មានថា អ្នកដែលមានទំនាក់ទំនងជិតស្និទ្ធជាមួយអ្នកដែលបានឆ្លង គួរតែត្រូវបានត្រួតពិនិត្យ និងតាមដានឱ្យបានដិតដល់ ដើម្បីបង្ការការឆ្លង។
en-mt: Some infections may have no symptoms but have test results that indicate infections, so researchers advised That those in close contact with those who are infected should be monitored and monitored closely to prevent transmission.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: រយៈពេលភ្ញាស់ធម្មតា (ពេលវេលារវាងការឆ្លងនិងរោគសញ្ញាចាប់ផ្តើម) មានចាប់ពីមួយថ្ងៃទៅ 14 ថ្ងៃ ឧទាហរណ៍ជាទូទៅនៃរយៈពេលប្រាំថ្ងៃ។ ឧទាហរណ៍នៃភាពមិនប្រាកដប្រជាការប៉ាន់ប្រមាណប្រភាគនៃមនុស្សដែលមានជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលបាត់បង់អារម្មណ៍ក្លិនដំបូងមាន 30% ហើយក្រោយមកធ្លាក់មក 15% ។
en-mt: The normal wake period (time between infection and symptoms begins) ranges from a day to 14 days, for example generally of five days. Examples of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lose sensation, initially accounted for 30% and then fell to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: ព័ត៌មានលម្អិតខ្លះអំពីរបៀបដែលជំងឺនេះឆ្លងរាលដាល នៅតែមិនទាន់កំណត់ច្បាស់នៅឡើយ។
en-mt: Some details of how the disease is contagious remains undetermined.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: ជំងឺនេះត្រូវបានគេជឿថាត្រូវបានរីករាលដាលជាចម្បងក្នុងអំឡុងពេលជិតស្និទ្ធគ្នា និងដោយដំណក់ទឹកតូចៗដែលផលិតក្នុងពេលក្អក កណ្តាស់ ឬនិយាយគ្នា ដោយមានទំនាក់ទំនងជិតស្និទ្ធស្ថិតនៅចន្លោះពី 1 ទៅ 2 ម៉ែត្រ (3 ទៅ 6 ហ្វីត) ។
en-mt: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close times and by small droplets produced during the time Mouse or talk to each other with close relations between 1 and 2 meters (3 and 6 feet).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: ការសិក្សានានាបានរកឃើញថា ការក្អកដែល​មិន​បាន​ខ្ទប់​មាត់​អាច​​នាំឲ្យទឹកមាត់ខ្ទាតចេញចម្ងាយពី 4.5 ម៉ែត្រ (15ហ្វ៊ីត) ទៅ 8.2 ម៉ែត្រ (27 ហ្វ៊ីត)។
en-mt: Studies have found that unbroken coughing can lead to the water ranging from 4.5 feet (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.

targetString: ការឆ្លងជំងឺដោយវីរុសអាចធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យជាបណ្តោះអាសន្នបានដោយផ្អែកលើរោគសញ្ញាដំបូង បើទោះបីជាការបញ្ជាក់​ចុងក្រោយត្រូវធ្វើឡើងដោយប្រតិចារិកអវិជ្ជមាននៃប្រតិកម្មច្រវ៉ាក់ប៉ូលីមែរ (rRT-PCR) របស់វត្ថុធាតុដែលត្រូវបានចម្លង ឬក៏ការថត CT។
en-mt: Infections with viruses can make temporary diagnosis based on early symptoms, albeit final confirmation is right Made by a negative consensus of the polymeric chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of a copied object or a CT recording.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: ការសិក្សាប្រៀបធៀបរវាងប្រតិកម្ម​ខ្សែ​ប៉ូលីមែរ៉ាសទៅនឹងស៊ីធីនៅវូហានបានបង្ហាញថា ស៊ីធីមានលក្ខណៈរសើបខ្លាំងជាងប្រតិកម្ម​ខ្សែប៉ូលីមែរ៉ាស ដោយមានលក្ខណៈពិសេសនៃរូបភាពជាច្រើនរបស់វាត្រួតលើគ្នាជាមួយនឹងជំងឺរលាកសួត និងដំណើរការជំងឺផ្សេងទៀត ទោះបីជាមិនជាក់លាក់ក៏ដោយ។
en-mt: Study compares polymeras reaction to Citi in Wuhan suggests that Citi is more sensitive than the polymeric cable reaction With the features of many of its images controlled on each other with pneumonia and other disease processes, albeit not specific.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: គិតដល់ត្រឹមខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 មហាវិទ្យាល័យ American College of Radiology​ ណែនាំថា “CT មិនគួរ​ត្រូវ​បាន​ប្រើប្រាស់​​ដើម្បីពិនិត្យ ឬមិនត្រូវធ្វើ​ជាជម្រើស​ដំបូង​ក្នុង​ការ​ធ្វើតេស្តរកជំងឺ COVID-19 នោះទេ”។
en-mt: As of March 2020, American College of Radiology advises that "CT should not be right Used to check or not be the first choice to test for COVID-19."

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានចេញផ្សាយពិធីសារសាកល្បង RNA ជាច្រើនសម្រាប់ SARS-CoV-2 ជាមួយនឹងការចេញផ្សាយលើកដំបូងនៅថ្ងៃទី 17 ខែមករា។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the maiden release on January 17.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តប្រើប្រតិកម្មខ្សែប៉ូលីមែរ៉ាសចម្លងបញ្ច្រាស (rRT-PCR)។
en-mt: Testing uses polymeras cord reactions (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តអាចត្រូវបានធ្វើឡើង​លើសំណាក​តាម​ផ្លូវដង្ហើម ឬឈាម។
en-mt: Tests can be carried out on respiratory or blood samples.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: ជាទូទៅ លទ្ធផលមាន​ក្នុងរយៈពេលពីរបី​ម៉ោង​ទៅមួយថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: The results are typically availability in a few hours to a day.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: ជាទូទៅការធ្វើតេស្តនេះត្រូវបានអនុវត្តនៅលើជក់ដបរុកតាមច្រមុះ ទោះបីជាការហើមជក់ដបតាមកក៏អាចត្រូវបានប្រើផងដែរ។ ចំនួនមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍និងក្រុមហ៊ុនកំពុងអភិវឌ្ឍតេស្តសៀរៀលដែលរកឃើញអង្គបដិប្រាណ។
en-mt: This test is typically carried out on a brush along the nose, albeit if bottle brushing can be used The number of laboratories and companies are developing political tests.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 6 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020ឯកសារទាំងនេះមិន​បានបញ្ជាក់ថាត្រឹមត្រូវគ្រប់គ្រាន់ទេ ដើម្បីអាច​ត្រូវបានអនុម័ត​សម្រាប់ការប្រើប្រាស់ជាទូទៅ។
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, these documents do not prove enough to be approved for general use.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: នៅសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិកការសាកល្បងសៀរៀលដែលត្រូវបានបង្កើតឡើងដោយស៊ីលលីនត្រូវបានអនុម័តអោយប្រើប្រាស់ជាបន្ទាន់ដោយមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍ដែលបានបញ្ជាក់តែប៉ុណ្ណោះ។
en-mt: In the United States, a serial test created by Cilline was approved only urgently by a certified laboratory.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: លក្ខណៈពិសេសនៃរូបភាពនៅលើកាំរស្មីអ៊ិច និងការឆ្លុះរូប Tomography (CT) លើ​មនុស្សដែល​មានរោគសញ្ញា រួមមានការស្រអាប់កញ្ចក់នៅលើដី និងអេកូស្យូមដែលមិនមានពន្លឺ។
en-mt: Features of images on radiation on X-rays and tomography (CT) reflection of people with symptoms include opaque, glass on the ground and non-light ecosystem.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: សង្គមវិទ្យុសកម្មអ៊ីតាលី (The Italian Radiological Society) កំពុងប្រមូលផ្ដុំ​ទិន្នន័យ​តាមអ៊ិនធើណែត​អន្តរជាតិអំពីការរកឃើញជារូបភាពសម្រាប់ករណីដែលបានបញ្ជាក់។
en-mt: The Italian Radiological Society is gathering international online data on image discoveries for confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: ដោយសារតែការត្រួតគ្នាជាមួយនឹងការឆ្លងផ្សេងទៀតដូចជា វីរុសអាដេណូ (adenovirus) ការធ្វើត្រាប់តាម​រូបភាព ដោយគ្មានការបញ្ជាក់ពី PCR គឺមាន​លក្ខណៈ​ជាក់លាក់​ក្នុងការកំណត់អត្តសញ្ញាណជំងឺ COVID-19។
en-mt: Because of control with other infections, like adenovirus), imitating images without confirmation of PCR is specific in identifying COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: ការសិក្សាដ៏ធំ​មួយក្នុងប្រទេស​ចិនបានប្រៀបធៀប​លទ្ធផល​តេស្ត​ដើមទ្រូង CT ជាមួយនឹង PCR ហើយ​បាន​ចង្អុលបង្ហាញថា ថ្វីបើ​រូបភាព​មិនសូវជាក់លាក់ក្ដីសម្រាប់ការចម្លង វាគឺលឿនជាង និង​ប្រតិកម្ម​ខ្លាំងជាង​ដោយណែនាំថា ការតេស្ត​របស់​វាជា​ឧបករណ៍​ពិនិត្យ​នៅក្នុងតំបន់រាតត្បាត។
en-mt: A large study in China compared CT chest test results with PCR and pointed out that despite less images Hidden for transmission, it is faster and reactive stronger, suggesting its test is a controlled tool in a pandemic area.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: បណ្តាញសរសៃប្រសាទដែលមានមូលដ្ឋានលើដំណោះស្រាយនៃខួរក្បាលសិប្បនិម្មិតត្រូវបានបង្កើតឡើងដើម្បីចាប់យករូបភាពនៃវីរុសដែលមានទាំងកាំរស្មីអ៊ិច និង CT។
en-mt: The solution-based nerve network of artificial brains is designed to capture images of viruses containing both radiation and CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: យុទ្ធសាស្រ្តក្នុងការការពារការចម្លងជំងឺ រួមមាន​ការ​ថែរក្សា​អនាម័យផ្ទាល់ខ្លួនឱ្យបានល្អ ការលាងដៃ ចៀសវាង​កុំប៉ះភ្នែកច្រមុះ ឬមាត់ដោយមិនបានលាងដៃ និងក្អក ឬកណ្តាស់​ដោយប្រើក្រដាសជូតមាត់ ហើយ​បោះ​ចោល​ក្រដាសជូតមាត់​ទៅក្នុង​ធុង​សំរាមភ្លាម។
en-mt: Strategies for preventing transmission of diseases include maintaining good personal hygiene, washing their hands, avoiding touching eyes The nose or mouth without washing his hands and throats or mouths, using paper, washing mouths and throwing the mouthpiece into the trash.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: អ្នកទាំងឡាយណាដែលប្រហែលជាមានការឆ្លងរួចហើយត្រូវបានគេណែនាំឱ្យពាក់ម៉ាសវះកាត់ជាសាធារណៈ។
en-mt: Those who may have already been transmitted are instructed to wear public surgery.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: វិធានការក្នុងការដាក់មនុស្សឲ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែពីគ្នា ក៏ត្រូវ​បាន​ណែនាំ​ឲ្យអនុវត្ត ដើម្បីបង្ការការឆ្លង។ រដ្ឋាភិបាល​ជាច្រើន​បាន​ដាក់​កំហិត ឬណែនាំហាមប្រាមមិនឲ្យមានការធ្វើដំណើរ បើមិនចាំបាច់ក្នុងការចេញ និងចូលប្រទេស និងតំបន់ដែល​ទទួល​ផលប៉ះពាល់ដោយ​ការ​ផ្ទុះជំងឺ។
en-mt: Measures to put people apart are also recommended to prevent transmission. Brings a ban on travel if it is not necessary to get out and enter countries and areas affected by outbreaks.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: ទោះជាយ៉ាងណា វីរុសនេះបាន​ឈាន​ដល់ដំណាក់កាល​នៃការរីករាលដាលក្នុងសហគមន៍នៅជាផ្នែកធំៗនៃពិភព​លោក។
en-mt: However, the virus has reached the epidemic stage in the community in large parts of the globe.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: នេះមានន័យថាវីរុសកំពុងរាលដាលនៅក្នុងសហគមន៍ហើយសមាជិកសហគមន៍ខ្លះមិនដឹងថាតើពួកគេឆ្លងនៅកន្លែងណា និងតាមវិធីណាទេ។ អ្នកផ្តល់សេវាថែទាំ សុខភាពដែល​កំពុង​ថែទាំនរណាម្នាក់ដែលអាចឆ្លងវីរុស ត្រូវបានណែនាំឲ្យប្រើប្រាស់ការប្រុងប្រយ័ត្ន ការទំនាក់ទំនង និងការការពារភ្នែកតាមស្តង់ដារ។ ការតាមដានទំនាក់ទំនង គឺជាវិធីសាស្ត្រដ៏សំខាន់មួយ សម្រាប់អាជ្ញាធរសុខាភិបាល ដើម្បីកំណត់ប្រភពនៃ​ការឆ្លង និងដើម្បីការពារការឆ្លងបន្ថែមទៀត។
en-mt: This means that the virus is spreading in the community and some community members do not know whether they are infected Health care providers who are caring for someone who can contract the virus are advised To use caution, communication, and standard eye protection. Monitoring communication is a method An important transition for health authorities to determine the source of the transmission and to prevent further infections.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: ការប្រើប្រាស់ទិន្នន័យទីតាំងពីទូរស័ព្ទចល័តដោយរដ្ឋាភិបាល​សម្រាប់គោលបំណងនេះ​បានធ្វើឱ្យ​មាន​ការ​ព្រួយបារម្ភអំពីភាពឯកជន ដោយអង្គការ​លើកលែង​ទោស​អន្តរជាតិ និងអង្គការជាង 100 ផ្សេងទៀត​បានចេញ​សេចក្តីថ្លែងការណ៍​មួយដោយអំពាវនាវឱ្យ​មានដែនកំណត់លើប្រភេទនៃការឃ្លាំមើលនេះ។
en-mt: The use of data since mobile phones by the government for this purpose has raised privacy concerns by organisations on top Amnesty International and more than 100 other organisations issued a statement calling for limits on the type of surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: កម្មវិធីទូរស័ព្ទផ្សេងៗត្រូវបានអនុវត្ត ឬស្នើឡើង​សម្រាប់​ការប្រើប្រាស់ដោយស្ម័គ្រចិត្ត ហើយគិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 7 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020 មាន​ក្រុមជំនាញ​ជាច្រើន​កំពុង​ធ្វើការលើដំណោះស្រាយភាពឯកជនដូចជាការប្រើប្រាស់​ប៊្លូធូសដើម្បីកំណត់ទីតាំងជិតអ្នកប្រើប្រាស់។
en-mt: Various mobile applications have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use and as of April 7, 2020 Many experts are working on privacy solutions, like using Bluetooth to locate close to users.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: អ្នកប្រើប្រាស់នឹងទទួលបានសារប្រសិនបើពួកគេមានទំនាក់ទំនងជិតស្និទ្ធជាមួយនរណាម្នាក់ដែលបានធ្វើតេស្តវិជ្ជមានថាមានជំងឺ COVID-19 ។ ការយល់ខុស​ដែល​កំពុងផ្សព្វផ្សាយអំពីវិធីការពារការឆ្លង។ ឧទាហរណ៍ ការលាងច្រមុះ និងការលាងមាត់ដោយទឹកខ្ពុល​មាត់​មិនមានប្រសិទ្ធភាពទេ។
en-mt: Users will get messages provided they have close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. Whites that are preaching ways to prevent cross-transmission; for example, washing noses and washing mouth with mouthwater are not effective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
