sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: ការលាងដៃត្រូវបានណែនាំឱ្យធ្វើ ដើម្បីការពារ​ការរីករាលដាល​នៃជំងឺនេះ។
en-mt: Hand washing is instructed to prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC ណែនាំឱ្យប្រជាជនលាងដៃឱ្យបានញឹកញាប់ជាមួយសាប៊ូ និងទឹកយ៉ាងហោចណាស់រយៈពេលម្ភៃវិនាទី ជាពិសេសបន្ទាប់ពីចូលបង្គន់ ឬនៅពេលដែលដៃអាចមើលឃើញថាកខ្វក់ មុនពេលបរិភោគ និងបន្ទាប់ពីញើសសំបោរ ក្អក ឬកណ្តាស់។
en-mt: The CDC advises people to wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially the next From entering a toilet or when your hands can be seen as dirty before eating and sweating, nausea, or mouse.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: នេះគឺដោយសារតែនៅខាងក្រៅរាងកាយមនុស្សវីរុសត្រូវបានសម្លាប់ដោយសាប៊ូក្នុងគ្រួសារដែលធ្វើឱ្យផ្ទុះពពុះការពាររបស់វា។
en-mt: This is just because outside the human body is killed by family soap, causing its protective bubbles.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC បានណែនាំបន្ថែមទៀតឱ្យប្រើទឹកលាងដៃដែលមានជាតិអាល់កុលយ៉ាងតិច 60% នៅពេលមិនមានសាប៊ូ និងទឹកដែលអាចប្រើបានស្រាប់។
en-mt: The CDC additionally recommends using at least 60% of alkaline hand washing water when there is no available soap and water.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO បានណែនាំឲ្យប្រជាជនជៀសវាងការប៉ះពាល់ភ្នែក ច្រមុះ ឬមាត់ជាមួយដៃដែលមិនបានលាង។
en-mt: WHO advises people to avoid touching eyes, noses or mouths with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: លើផ្ទៃនានាអាចត្រូវបានលាងសម្លាប់មេរោគដោយល្បាយមួយចំនួន (ក្នុងរយៈពេលមួយនាទី បន្ទាប់ពីត្រូវថ្នាំសម្លាប់មីក្រុបសម្រាប់ផ្ទៃដែកអ៊ីណុក) រួមមានអេតាណុល 62–71% អ៊ីសូប្រូប៉ាណុល 50–100% សូដ្យូមអ៊ីប៉ូក្លរីត 0.1% អ៊ីដ្រូសែនប៉េរ៉ូស៊ីដ 0.5% និងប៉ូវីដូនអ៊ីយ៉ូឌីន 0.2–7.5%។
en-mt: On the surface, the surface can be washed away by some mixtures (within a minute of being killed by microbial drugs for iron surfaces) includes 62-71% ethanol 50-100% sodium hypoclrites 0.1% hydrogen peroxide 0.5% and povidon iodine 0.2–7.5%.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: ដំណោះស្រាយផ្សេងទៀតដូចជា benzalkonium chloride និង chrohexidine gluconate មិនសូវមានប្រសិទ្ធភាពទេ។

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: មជ្ឈមណ្ឌល​​ត្រួត​​ពិនិត្យ​និង​បង្កា​ជំងឺ​ឆ្លង (CDC) ផ្តល់អនុសាសន៍ថា ប្រសិនបើករណីសង្ស័យ ឬបានបញ្ជាក់ថាមានជំងឺ COVID នៅតាមកន្លែង ដូចជាការិយាល័យ ឬកន្លែងមើលថែក្មេងរាល់ថ្ងៃ ដូចជាការិយាល័យ បន្ទប់ទឹក កន្លែងរួម ឧបករណ៍អេឡិចត្រូនិក ដែលបានចែករំលែក ដូចជា ថេប្លេត ឧបករណ៍ដែលប្រើអេក្រង់ប៉ះ ក្តារចុចឧបករណ៍ ឧបករណ៍ចុចបញ្ជា និងម៉ាស៊ីន ATM ដែលប្រើដោយអ្នកជំងឺ នោះគួរតែធ្វើការបាញ់សម្លាប់មេរោគ។
en-mt: The Centers for Infectual Control and Prevention (CDC) recommends that if in doubt Or confirmed that there is COVID in places such as offices or daily looking places, such as employment High school, bathroom, shared electronic devices such as tabs, touchscreen devices The keyboard, keyboard, control device, and ATM machine used by patients should commit a virus-killing shot.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពបានណែនាំឲ្យមនុស្សខ្ទប់មាត់ និងច្រមុះពួកគេដោយឱនទៅក្រោមកែងដៃ ឬប្រើក្រដាសជូតមាត់នៅពេលក្អក ឬកណ្ដាស់ និងបោះក្រដាសនោះចោលភ្លាមៗ។
en-mt: Health organisations advise people to brush their mouths and noses by bowing under their elbows or using paper to wash their mouths or mouthpieces and immediately throw them away.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: ម៉ាស់វេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ​ត្រូវបានណែនាំ​ឲ្យប្រើប្រាស់ សម្រាប់​អ្នក​ដែល​អាច​នឹង​មានឆ្លងជំងឺ ដោយការ​ពាក់ម៉ាស់ អាច​កម្រិតចំនួនឆ្លង និង​ការខ្ទាតចេញ​សារធាតុរាវ​នៅពេលនិយាយ កណ្ដាស់ និង​ក្អក។
en-mt: Medical massages are recommended to be used for those who may be infected by wearing masks, possibly limiting the number of transmissions and corrosion when speaking, lashing and coughing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក​ (WHO) បានដាក់ចេញសេចក្ដី​ណែនាំអំពីពេលវេលា និងរបៀបប្រើប្រាស់ម៉ាស។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation (WHO) has issued guidelines on when and how to use mass.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: យោងតាមលោក Stephen Griffin អ្នក​សិក្សា​អំពី​វីរុស​នៅ​សាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Leeds បាន​ឲ្យដឹងថា “ការពាក់ម៉ាស​អាចកាត់បន្ថយទំនោររបស់​មនុស្ស​ពីការប៉ះមុខរបស់​ពួកគេ ដែល​ជា​ប្រភព​ចម្បងមួយ​នៃការឆ្លង​ដែល​គ្មាន​ការអនាម័យ​ដៃ​ត្រឹមត្រូវ”។ ម៉ាសក៏ត្រូវបាន​ណែនាំ​ឲ្យប្រើប្រាស់​សម្រាប់​អ្នកដែល​មើលថែទាំអ្នកដែលអាចកើតជំងឺនេះដែរ។
en-mt: "Wearing masks can reduce human trends from touches, according to Stephen Griffin, a viral student at Leeds University. Their verses are one of the main sources of infections without proper hygiene." Mass is also recommended for those who care for those who may develop the disease.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានផ្តល់អនុសាសន៍ឱ្យអ្នកដែលមានសុខភាពល្អពាក់ម៉ាស់ក្នុងករណីប្រឈមនឹងហានិភ័យខ្ពស់ ដូចជាអ្នកមើលថែទាំអ្នកជំងឺ COVID-19 ជាដើម។ ទោះជាយ៉ាងណា ពួកគេក៏ទទួលស្គាល់ផងដែរថាការពាក់ម៉ាស់អាចជួយឱ្យមនុស្សជៀសផុតពីការប៉ះពាល់មុខរបស់ខ្លួន។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation recommends that healthy people wear masks in case of high risk, such as caregivers COVID-19 diseases, however, also recognise that wearing masks can help people avoid their own facial exposure.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: បណ្តាប្រទេសមួយចំនួនបានចាប់ផ្តើមលើកទឹកចិត្តឱ្យប្រើប្រាស់ម៉ាស់មុខដោយសមាជិកសាធារណៈ។
en-mt: Several countries have begun to encourage the use of massages by members of the public.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: នៅសហរដ្ឋ​អាមេរិក CDC បានណែឲ្យពាក់ម៉ាស​ធ្វើចេញពី​ក្រណាត់​ដែល​មិនមែនជា​ម៉ាសវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ។ ប្រទេសចិនបាន​ណែនាំយ៉ាង​ជាក់លាក់​ទៅកាន់សាធារណៈជន ជាពិសេស​សម្រាប់អ្នក​ដែល​មាន​ការទាក់ទងជិតគ្នា (ចម្ងាយ 1 ម៉ែត្រ (3 ហ្វីត) ឬជិតជាងនេះ) ជាមួយ​អ្នកដទៃឲ្យប្រើប្រាស់​ម៉ាស​វេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ​​ដែល​អាច​បោះ​ចោលបាន។
en-mt: In the United States, the CDC has recommended that masks are made from non-medical canvases. China has specifically introduced to the public as Special for those who have close contact (1 meter (3 feet) or closer) with others to use discardable medical massages.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: ទីក្រុងហុងកុងផ្ដល់អនុសាសន៍ឱ្យពាក់ម៉ាសនៅពេលដែលប្រជាជនធ្វើដំណើរតាមប្រព័ន្ធដឹកជញ្ជូនសាធារណៈ ឬនៅពេល​ស្ថិតនៅក្នុងទីតាំងដែលមានមនុស្សច្រើន។
en-mt: Hong Kong recommends wearing masks when people travel on public transportation or while in a crowded location.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: មន្ត្រីសុខាភិបាលថៃលើកទឹកចិត្តដល់ប្រជាជនឲ្យធ្វើម៉ាសចេញពីក្រណាត់នៅផ្ទះ ហើយបោកសម្អាតវាជារៀងរាល់ថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: Thai medical officials encourage people to make massages out of the fabric at home and clean it every day.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: សាធារណៈរដ្ឋឆេក និងស្លូវ៉ាគីដាក់បម្រាមហាមចេញទៅទីសាធារណៈដោយមិនមានការពាក់ម៉ាស ឬមានអ្វីខ្ទប់ច្រមុះ និងមាត់។
en-mt: The Croatian public and Slovakia impose a ban on going out to public places without wearing masks or anything broken, nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 16 ខែមីនា ប្រទេសវៀតណាម​បានស្នើឱ្យ​អ្នករាល់គ្នាពាក់ម៉ាសមុខពេលទៅតំបន់សាធារណៈ​ដើម្បីការពារខ្លួន និងអ្នកដទៃ។
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam offered you to wear masks while going to public areas for self-defense and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: រដ្ឋាភិបាលអូទ្រីសបានបញ្ជាថាមនុស្សគ្រប់គ្នាដែលចូលហាងលក់ទំនិញត្រូវតែពាក់ម៉ាស់មុខ។
en-mt: The Austrian government has ordered that everyone who enters a department store must wear a mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: អ៊ីស្រាអែលបានស្នើរឲ្យប្រជាជនទាំងអស់ពាក់ម៉ាសនៅពេលស្ថិតនៅទីសាធារណៈ។
en-mt: Israel has asked all people to wear masks while in public.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: តៃវ៉ាន់ ដែលបានផលិតម៉ាសចំនួនដប់លានម៉ាសក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃចាប់តាំងពីពាក់កណ្ដាលខែមីនា តម្រូវឲ្យអ្នកដំណើរនៅលើរថភ្លើង និងឡានក្រុងឲ្យពាក់ម៉ាសនៅថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែមេសា។
en-mt: Taiwan, which has produced ten million masses a day since mid-March, requires passengers on trains and buses to wear masks on April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: ប្រទេសប៉ាណាម៉ាបានតម្រូវឱ្យពាក់ម៉ាស់រាល់ពេលចេញក្រៅ ហើយក៏បានណែនាំឱ្យផលិតម៉ាស់ធ្វើដោយដៃសម្រាប់អ្នកដែលមិនអាចទិញម៉ាស់បានផងដែរ។
en-mt: Panama has required wearing masks every time out and has also instructed manufacturing handmade massages for those who cannot afford them.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: ម៉ាសត្រូវបានប្រើប្រាស់យ៉ាងទូលំទូលាយ​នៅក្នុង​ប្រទេស​ជប៉ុន កូរ៉េខាងត្បូង ម៉ាឡេស៊ី និងសិង្ហបូរី។
en-mt: Mass is widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: ការដាក់គម្លាតសង្គម (ឬត្រូវបានស្គាល់ថាការនៅឆ្ងាយពីគ្នា) រួមបញ្ចូលទាំងវិធានការគ្រប់គ្រងការចម្លងដែលមានគោលបំណងពន្យឺតការរាលដាលជំងឺដោយបន្ថយការមានទំនាក់ទំនងជិតគ្នារវាងមនុស្សម្នាក់ទៅមនុស្សម្នាក់។
en-mt: Social gaps (or being known as staying apart) include cow-control measures The intention to slow the disease spread by slowing down close-to-person relations.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: វិធីសាស្រ្តរួមមានការ​ដាក់ឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែក ការដាក់​កម្រិត​លើការធ្វើដំណើរ និងការបិទសាលារៀន កន្លែង​ធ្វើការ កីឡាដ្ឋាន រោងកុន ឬ​មជ្ឈមណ្ឌល​លក់​ទំនិញ​ជាដើម។
en-mt: Methods include isolation, travel restrictions and school closures, stadiums, cinemas, or shopping centers.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: បុគ្គលម្នាក់ៗអាចអនុវត្តវិធីសាស្រ្តគម្លាត​សង្គម​ដោយ​ស្នាក់នៅផ្ទះ កម្រិត​ការធ្វើដំណើរ ជៀសវាង​កន្លែង​ដែល​មាន​មនុស្សច្រើន ប្រើការស្វាគមន៍គ្នា​ដោយ​មិនប៉ះពាល់ និងការដាក់គម្លាតខ្លួន​ឯង​ឆ្ងាយ​ពីអ្នកដទៃ។
en-mt: Individuals can apply social gap methods by staying at home, travel limits, avoiding Between crowded places use mutual welcome without touching and self-gaping away from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: ឥឡូវនេះ រដ្ឋាភិបាលជាច្រើនកំពុងកំណត់ ឬ​ណែនាំ​ឱ្យ​មានគម្លាតសង្គមនៅក្នុងតំបន់ដែលរងផលប៉ះពាល់ពី​ការ​ផ្ទុះជំងឺនេះ។
en-mt: Many governments are now determining or introducing social gaps in areas affected by the outbreak.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: ទំហំប្រមូលផ្តុំអតិបរិមា ដែល​បានណែនាំ​ដោយ​ស្ថាប័ន​រដ្ឋាភិបាល និង​អង្គការ​សុខាភិបាល​​សហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក​ត្រូវ​បានកាត់បន្ថយយ៉ាងឆាប់រហ័សពី 250 នាក់ (ប្រសិនបើមិនមានការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 នៅក្នុងតំបន់) មកត្រឹម់ 50 នាក់ ហើយ​ក្រោយមកទៀត​មកត្រឹម 10 នាក់។
en-mt: The maximum collection scale introduced by U.S. government institutions and health organisations has been rapidly reduced More than 250 (if there is no COVID-19 epidemic in the region) to 50 and then by 10.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 22 ខែមីនាឆ្នាំ 2020 ប្រទេសអាល្លឺម៉ង់បានហាមឃាត់ការជួបជុំជាសាធារណៈ ដែលមានមនុស្សចាប់ពីពីរនាក់ឡើងទៅ។ មនុស្សពេញវ័យ និងអ្នកដែលមានជំងឺដូចជា ទឹកនោមផ្អែម ជំងឺបេះដូង ជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើម ជំងឺលើសឈាម ​និងប្រព័ន្ធភាពស៊ាំចុះខ្សោយប្រឈមនឹងហានិភ័យខ្ពស់នៃជំងឺធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ និងមានផលវិបាកជាច្រើន។ នៅចុងខែមីនាឆ្នាំ 2020 អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក និងអង្គការសុខភាពដទៃទៀតបានចាប់ផ្តើមជំនួសការប្រើប្រាស់ពាក្យ“ គម្លាតសង្គម” ជាមួយនឹង“ ការរក្សាគម្លាតរាងកាយ” ដើម្បីបញ្ជាក់ថា គោលបំណង គឺដើម្បីកាត់បន្ថយទំនក់ទំនងរាងកាយ ខណៈពេល ដែលរក្សាបាននូវទំនាក់ទំនងសង្គមទាំងនៅជិត ឬឆ្ងាយ។
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany banned public gatherings ranging from two people. Diseases like diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, blood transfusions and weakened immune systems face The high risk of serious diseases and many consequences. By the end of March 2020, the People's Health Organisation and organisations Other health began to replace the use of the word "social gap" with "maintaining physical gaps" to emphasise the purpose It is to reduce physical light while maintaining social connections either near or far.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: ការប្រើប្រាស់ពាក្យ “ការដាក់គម្លាតសង្គម” បាននាំឲ្យមានផលប៉ះពាល់ដែលមនុស្សគួរទាក់ទងក្នុងសភាពនៅដាច់ដោយឡែកពីសង្គមទាំងស្រុង ជាជាងការលើកទឹកចិត្តឲ្យពួកគេនៅទាក់ទងជាមួយអ្នកដទៃទៀតតាមរយៈវិធីសាស្ត្រដទៃទៀត។ អាជ្ញាធរមួយចំនួនបានប្រកាសការណែនាំសុខភាពផ្លូវភេទសម្រាប់ប្រើប្រាស់ក្នុងអំឡុងពេលរោគរាតត្បាតនេះ។
en-mt: The use of the word "social gap" has taken a toll that people should communicate in complete social isolation status rather than encouraging them to stay in touch with you Some authorities have announced sexual health guidance for use during the pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: ទាំងនេះរួមបញ្ចូលនូវអនុសាសន៍ដើម្បីរួមភេទតែជាមួយអ្នកដែលអ្នករស់នៅជាមួយដែលមិនមានវីរុស ឬរោគសញ្ញានៃវីរុស។
en-mt: These include recommendations to have sex only with those you live with who do not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: ការដាក់​ខ្លួន​ឯង​ឲ្យ​នៅដាច់​ដោយ​ឡែក​នៅផ្ទះ​ត្រូវ​បាន​ណែនាំសម្រាប់អ្នកដែលត្រូវបានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យថាមានជំងឺ COVID-19 និងអ្នកដែលសង្ស័យថាបានឆ្លងជំងឺ។
en-mt: Self-isolation at home is introduced for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those suspected of contracting the disease.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: ភ្នាក់ងារសុខាភិបាល​បាន​ប្រកាស​ការណែនាំ​លម្អិត​សម្រាប់​ការ​ស្នាក់​នៅកន្លែង​ដាច់ដោយឡែក​ដែលត្រឹមត្រូវ។ រដ្ឋាភិបាល​ជា​ច្រើន​បាន​បង្គាប់បញ្ជា ឬណែនាំ​ឲ្យមានការ​ធ្វើចត្តាឡីស័ក​ខ្លួន​ឯង​សម្រាប់គ្រប់ប្រជាជន​ដែលរស់នៅ​ក្នុងតំបន់​ដែល​បាន​ឆ្លង​ជំងឺ​នេះ។
en-mt: Health agencies have announced detailed guidelines for accommodating isolated locations. Growth has ordered or suggested self-determination for all people living in the area who have contracted the disease.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: ការណែនាំឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែកខ្លួនឯង ត្រូវបានប្រកាសចំពោះអ្នកដែលស្ថិតក្នុងក្រុមហានិភ័យខ្ពស់។
en-mt: Self-isolation instructions are announced to those in high risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: អ្នកដែលប្រហែលជាបានប៉ះពាល់ជាមួយអ្នកមានជំងឺ COVID-19 និងអ្នកដែលទើបតែធ្វើដំណើរទៅប្រទេស ឬតំបន់មួយដែលមានការឆ្លងរាលដាលខ្លាំងត្រូវបានណែនាំឱ្យបង្ខាំងខ្លួនឯងឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែករយៈពេល 14 ថ្ងៃ ចាប់ពីពេលដែលមានការប៉ះពាល់ចុងក្រោយ។
en-mt: Those who may have contacted with coVID-19 patients and those who have only recently travelled to a country or a region of infection A strong stretch has been instructed to squeege yourself into isolation for 14 days from the last impact.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: យុទ្ធសាស្ត្រ​ក្នុងការគ្រប់គ្រងការផ្ទុះនៃជំងឺនេះ គឺការ​គ្រប់គ្រងស្ថានការ ការបង្ក្រាប និងការបន្ថយភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ។
en-mt: The strategy to control the outbreak is controlling situations, repression and reducing service.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: ការធ្វើបែបនេះ ត្រូវបានអនុវត្ត​ក្នុងដំណាក់​ដំបូងៗ​នៃ​ការ​រីក​រាល​ដាល ហើយមានបំណងក្នុងការតាមដាន និង​ផ្ដាច់​ខ្លួន​អ្នក​ដែល​បានឆ្លង ក៏ដូចជា​ការណែនាំ​វិធានការ​ឯទៀតៗ​នៃការ​គ្រប់គ្រង​ការចម្លង និង​ការចាក់វ៉ាក់សាំង​ដើម្បីបញ្ឈប់​ជំងឺ​ពីការរាលដាល​ទៅកាន់​ប្រជាជន​ទាំងមូល។
en-mt: Doing so is carried out in the early stages of radicalisation and is intended to monitor and isolate those who are infected as well as instructions Other measures of replication control and vaccination to stop the disease from spreading to the entire population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: នៅពេលដែលមិនអាចទប់ស្កាត់ការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺនេះ ការខិតខំប្រឹងប្រែងបន្ទាប់មក​ឈានដល់​ដំណាក់កាល​បន្ធូរបន្ថយ៖ វិធានការណ៍ត្រូវបានធ្វើឡើងដើម្បីបន្ថយការរាលដាល និងកាត់បន្ថយផលប៉ះពាល់របស់វាទៅលើប្រព័ន្ធថែទាំសុខភាព និងសង្គម។
en-mt: When it is impossible to prevent the spread of the disease, then efforts reach a reduced phase: Measures have been made to reduce radicalisation and reduce its impact on health and social care systems.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: ការរួមបញ្ចូលគ្នា​ទាំងវិធានការគ្រប់គ្រងស្ថានការ និង​ការ​បន្ថយ​ភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ​ប្រហែល​ត្រូវ​បាន​អនុវត្ត​ក្នុងពេល​ជាមួយ​គ្នា។
en-mt: A combination of both situation management measures and severe reductions may have been implemented at the same time.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: ការបង្ក្រាបតម្រូវឱ្យមានវិធានការខ្លាំងជាងមុន ដើម្បី បញ្ចៀសការរាតត្បាតដោយកាត់បន្ថយចំនួនបន្តពូជឱ្យនៅតិចជាង 1 ភាគនៃការគ្រប់គ្រង ការរីករាលដាល នៃជំងឺឆ្លងកំពុងព្យាយាមកាត់បន្ថយកម្រិតខ្ពស់បំផុតនៃការរាលដាលដែលត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ថាជាការបន្ទាបខ្សែកោងនៃការរាលដាល។
en-mt: Suppression requires stronger measures to avoid epidemics by reducing reproductive numbers by less than 1 percent of the management of work The spread of infected diseases is trying to reduce the highest levels of spread, known as lowering the curve of spread.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: ប្រការនេះកាត់បន្ថយហានិភ័យនៃសេវាសុខាភិបាលដែល​មាន​ភាពលំបាក និងផ្តល់ពេលវេលាបន្ថែមសម្រាប់ការបង្កើតវ៉ាក់សាំង និងការព្យាបាល។
en-mt: This argument reduces the risk of challenging health services and provides additional time for vaccine development and treatment.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: អន្តរាគមន៍ដែលមិនមែនជាឱសថដែលអាចគ្រប់គ្រងការផ្ទុះនេះរួមមានវិធានការបង្ការផ្ទាល់ខ្លួនដូចជាអនាម័យដៃពាក់ម៉ាសមុខ និងការផ្តាច់ខ្លួន វិធានការណ៍សហគមន៍មានគោលបំណងធ្វើឱ្យឃ្លាតឆ្ងាយពីរាងកាយដូចជាបិទសាលា និងលុបចោលព្រឹត្តិការណ៍ប្រមូលផ្តុំដ៏ធំ។ ការចូលរួមរបស់សហគមន៍ដើម្បីជម្រុញការទទួលយកនិងការចូលរួមក្នុងការអន្តរាគមន៍បែបនេះ។ សកម្មភាពជាច្រើនដែលមានគោលដៅទប់ទល់នឹងការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺនេះត្រូវបានធ្វើឡើងនៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិននៅពេលភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរនៃការផ្ទុះឡើងបានលេចឡើងដូចជាការដាក់ទីក្រុងទាំងមូល និងការហាមឃាត់ការធ្វើដំណើរយ៉ាងតឹងរ៉ឹង។
en-mt: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that can control the outbreak include personal prevention measures, like hand hygiene, and disconnecting, community measures aimed at distressing Far from physically, like closing schools and canceling large gathering events; community involvement to boost acceptance and involvement in this kind of intervention. Many of the activities targeted to combat the outbreak were performed in China at a time of severity The severity of an outbreak has appeared, as is the imposition of an entire city and a strict travel ban.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: បណ្តាប្រទេសផ្សេងទៀតក៏បានអនុម័តវិធានការផ្សេងៗគ្នាដែលមានគោលបំណងកម្រិតការរីករាលដាលនៃវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: Other countries have also adopted different measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: ប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងបានធ្វើការត្រួតពិនិត្យទ្រង់ទ្រាយធំ និងបង្ខាំងឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែកនៅតាមមូលដ្ឋាន និងបានចេញសេចក្ដីជូនដំណឹងស្តីពីការផ្លាស់ទីរបស់បុគ្គលដែលបានឆ្លង។
en-mt: South Korea conducted large-scale and barricaded inspections locally and issued an alert on the movement of infected individuals.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: សិង្ហបូរីបាន​ផ្ដល់ការគាំទ្រហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ​សម្រាប់អ្នក​ដែល​បានឆ្លង ហើយធ្វើចត្តាឡីស័ក និង​បានចេញ​ការដាក់ពិន័យ​ខ្លាំងទៅលើ​អ្នក​ដែល​មិនបាន​អនុវត្តតាម។
en-mt: Singapore provided financial support for those who passed and made Salis, and issued hefty fines on those who did not comply.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: តៃវ៉ាន់បានបង្កើនការផលិតម៉ាសមុខ និង​ពិន័យ​លើការ​ទិញស្តុកទុក​ទំនិញវេជ្ជសាស្រ្ត។ លំនាំ​សម្រាប់​ចក្រភព​អង់គ្លេស និងសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក​បង្ហាញថា ការ​កាត់បន្ថយ (ថយចុះ ប៉ុន្តែមិនបញ្ឈប់​ការរីករាលដាល​​ការរាតត្បាត​ជំងឺ) និងការបង្ក្រាប (ការថយចុះ​កំណើនរាតត្បាត) មានបញ្ហាប្រឈមធំៗ។
en-mt: Taiwan has increased the production of masks and fines on purchasing medical goods. A pattern for the United States and the United States shows Reduce (decreasing but not stopping the spread of the disease) and suppression (decreasing pandemic growth), there are major challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: គោលនយោបាយកាត់បន្ថយដែលប្រសើរបំផុត អាច​កាត់​បន្ថយតម្រូវការថែទាំសុខភាពខ្ពស់បំផុតនៅត្រឹម 2/3 និងការស្លាប់ត្រឹមពាក់កណ្តាល ប៉ុន្តែនៅតែ​បណ្តាលឱ្យ​មានមនុស្សស្លាប់រាប់រយ​ពាន់​នាក់ ហើយ និងប្រព័ន្ធសុខាភិបាលកំពុង​រង​ការលំបាក់។
en-mt: Optimal reduction policies could reduce highest healthcare needs by 2/3 and deaths By half, but still resulting in hundreds of thousands of deaths and the health system.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: ការដាក់កំហិតសកម្មភាព អាចនឹងត្រូវជ្រើសរើសយកមកអនុវត្ត ហើយចាំបាច់ត្រូវធ្វើឱ្យបានដរាបណាវីរុសកំពុងរាលដាលដល់មនុស្ស (ឬរហូតដល់មានវ៉ាក់សាំង ប្រសិនបើមានមុន) នៅពេលដែលការបញ្ជូនមានការស្ទុះឡើងយ៉ាងឆាប់រហ័សនៅពេលវិធានការត្រូវបានបន្ធូរបន្ថយ។
en-mt: Activity restraint may be chosen to be implemented and need to be made as long as the virus is spreading to humans (or Until a vaccine is available, if prevented) When transmission quickly rises when measures are reduced.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: ការអន្តរាគមន៍រយៈពេលវែងដើម្បីទប់ស្កាត់ជំងឺរាតត្បាតនេះបណ្ដាលឲ្យមានការខាតបង់ដល់សង្គម និងសេដ្ឋកិច្ច។
en-mt: The long-term intervention to prevent this pandemic is causing loss to society and the economy.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: មិនទាន់មានថ្នាំប្រឆាំងវីរុសជាក់លាក់ណាមួយ ត្រូវ​បាន​អនុម័ត​ឱ្យប្រើប្រាស់សម្រាប់ជំងឺ COVID-19 ទេ ប៉ុន្តែកិច្ចខិតខំប្រឹងប្រែងអភិវឌ្ឍន៍កំពុងដំណើរការ រួមទាំងការធ្វើតេស្តលើថ្នាំដែលមានស្រាប់។
en-mt: No specific antiviral drugs have yet been approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are under way, including testing on existing drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: ការប្រើថ្នាំត្រជាក់ហួសកម្រិត ការផឹកទឹក និងការសម្រាកអាចជួយកាត់បន្ថយរោគសញ្ញា។
en-mt: Taking cold medicine, drinking water and resting can help alleviate symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: ដោយអាស្រ័យលើភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ ការព្យាបាល​ដោយ​អុកស៊ីសែន ការចាក់សារធាតុរាវតាមសរសៃ និង​ជំនួយ​ការ​ដកដង្ហើមអាចនឹង​ត្រូវការ​ជា​ចាំបាច់។
en-mt: Depending on severity, oxygen therapy, injecting fluids by fibers and breathing aids may be necessary.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: ការប្រើប្រាស់ថ្នាំស្តេរ៉ូអ៊ីតអាចធ្វើឱ្យលទ្ធផលកាន់តែអាក្រក់។
en-mt: The use of steroids can make the outcome worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: សមាសធាតុជាច្រើន ដែលបានអនុម័តពីមុន សម្រាប់ការព្យាបាលជំងឺបង្កឡើងដោយ​វីរុស​ផ្សេងៗទៀត កំពុងត្រូវបានស៊ើបអង្កេត ដើម្បីប្រើប្រាស់​ក្នុងការព្យាបាលជំងឺ COVID-19 ។
en-mt: Many previously approved components for the treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកក៏បានបញ្ជាក់ផងដែរថា “វិធីព្យាបាលតាមបែបបុរាណ និងតាមផ្ទះ” មួយចំនួនអាចផ្តល់នូវការធូរស្បើយពីរោគសញ្ញា ដែលបណ្តាលមកពីវីរុស SARS-CoV-19។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation also stated that some "traditional and home-based treatments" can provide relief from symptoms due to the SARS-CoV-19 virus.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: ការបង្កើនសមត្ថភាព និងការកែសម្រួល​ការថែទាំ​សុខភាពសម្រាប់​តំរូវការរបស់អ្នកជំងឺ COVID-19 ត្រូវបានពិពណ៌នាដោយអង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកថាជាវិធានការណ៍ឆ្លើយតបនឹងការផ្ទុះជំងឺ​ជាមូលដ្ឋាន។
en-mt: Improving performance and adjusting health care for the needs of COVID-19 patients must Described by the global health organisation as a measure of response to basic disease outbreaks.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC និងអង្គការ WHO នៅអ៊ីរ៉ុបបានប្រកាស​អំពីការណែ​នាំសម្រាប់​មន្ទីរពេទ្យ និងសេវាកម្មថែទាំសុខភាព​ចម្បងៗ​ទៅលើការ​ប្ដូរធនធាន​នៅកម្រិតជាច្រើន ដោយ​រូមបញ្ចូល​ទាំងការផ្ដោត​ទៅលើសេវាពិសោធន៍ចំពោះ​ការធ្វើតេស្តរក​ជំងឺ COVID-19 លុបចោល​ដំណើរ​ការជ្រើសរើស​ទៅ​តាម​ពេលវេលា​ដែលអាចធ្វើបាន បំបែក និងផ្ដាច់ខ្លួនអ្នក​កើត​ជំងឺ COVID-19 ឲ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែក ហើយ​បង្កើន​សមត្ថភាព​ការមើលថែទាំដែល​មាន​ការយកចិត្តទុក​ដាក់​ខ្ពស់ដោយ​បណ្ដុះបណ្ដាលបុគ្គលិក និងបង្កើន​ចំនួន​ឧបករណ៍​បំពង់ខ្យល់ និងគ្រែ។
en-mt: ECDC and WHO organisations in Iraub have announced guidance for hospitals and major healthcare services on resource exchange Guarantees at many levels, including a focus on experimental services for COVID-19 tests, canceled Selecting as time as possible, separate and isolate coVID-19 patients into isolation and enhance the ability High attention-care visits by training staff and increasing the number of air and bed pipeline devices.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: មានទ្រឹស្តីផ្សេងៗអំពីកន្លែងដែលករណីដំបូង (ហៅថាអ្នកជំងឺសូន្យ) អាចមានប្រភពដើម។
en-mt: There are varied theories about where the early cases (so-called patient networks) may originate.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: ករណីដែលគេស្គាល់ថាជាវីរុសដែលថ្មីហើយប្លែកដំបូងគេ​អាចនឹងកើតមានឡើងនៅថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 នៅទីក្រុង Wuhan ខេត្ត Hubei ប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: The case known as the new and unusual virus may occur on December 1, 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: ក្នុងរយៈពេលមួយខែចំនួនករណីឆ្លងវីរុសហ្ស៊ីកានៅហ៊ូប៉ីកើនឡើងជាលំដាប់។
en-mt: Over the course of a month, the number of cases of Zika virus in Hubei grows in gradually.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: អ្នកជំងឺទាំងនេះភាគច្រើនមានការជាប់ទាក់ទងទៅនឹងទីផ្សារលក់ដុំអាហារសមុទ្រ Huanan ដែលបានលក់សត្វរស់ផងដែរ ហើយទ្រឹស្ដីមួយបានលើកឡើងថាវីរុសនេះបានចេញមកពីប្រភេទសត្វមូយក្នុងចំណោមសត្វទាំងនេះ ឬ អាចនិយាយបាន​ម្យ៉ាងទៀតថា វាមានប្រភពមកពីសត្វ។ បណ្ដុំជំងឺរលាកសួត​ដែលមិនដឹងពីបុព្វហេតុត្រូវបានពិនិត្យតាមដាននៅថ្ងៃទី26 ខែធ្នូ ហើយត្រូវបានព្យាបាលដោយលោកវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Zhang Jixian នៅក្នុងមន្ទីរពេទ្យបង្អែកខេត្ត Hubei ដែលគាត់បានជូន​ដំណឹងទៅកាន់មជ្ឈមណ្ឌលគ្រប់គ្រង និងបង្ការជំងឺក្រុង Wuhan នៅថ្ងៃទី27 ខែធ្នូ។
en-mt: Most of these patients are linked to the huanan seafood sales market, which also sold live animals, and one theory suggests The virus derived from a species of animals around these animals or could be said in other words that it originated with animals. An unknown cause was monitored on December 26 and treated by Dr. Zhang Jixian in the museum The Hubei Provincial Winter Hospital, which he notified to the Wuhan City Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, on December 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 30 ខែធ្នូ​ ក្រុមវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត​នៃមន្ទីរពេទ្យ​កណ្តាល វូហាន បានជូនដំណឹង​ដល់អ្នក​រួមការងាររបស់ពួកគេអំពី“ វីរុស SARs ដូចវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា”។
en-mt: On December 30, a team of doctors of the Wuhan Central Hospital notified their colleagues of "SARs like cancer."

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: គ្រូពេទ្យប្រាំបីនាក់ ក្នុងនោះមានលោក Li Wenliang ត្រូវបានប៉ូលីសធ្វើការដាស់តឿនពីបទផ្សព្វផ្សាយពាក្យចចាមអារាមមិនពិត ហើយម្នាក់ទៀតឈ្មោះ Ai Fenត្រូវបានថ្នាក់លើស្តីបន្ទោសចំពោះការបង្កចលាចល។
en-mt: Eight doctors, including Li Wenliang, were warned by police for spreading words False rumors and another named Ai Fen was superior to blame for chaos.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: គណៈកម្មការសុខភាពក្រុងវូហានក្រោយមកបានចេញសេចក្តីជូនដំណឹងជាសាធារណៈមួយនៅថ្ងៃទី 31 ធ្នូ និងជូនដំណឹងដល់អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក។
en-mt: The Wuhan Health Commission later issued a public notification on December 31 and notified the People's Health Organisation.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: ករណីគ្រប់គ្រាន់នៃជំងឺរលាកសួតដែលមិនធ្លាប់ជួបប្រទះត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍ទៅកាន់អាជ្ញាធរសុខាភិបាលនៅវូហានដើម្បីបង្កើតការស៊ើបអង្កេតនៅដើមខែមករា។ ក្នុងអំឡុងពេលដំណាក់ដំបូងៗនៃការផ្ទុះជំងឺនេះ ចំនួនករណីបានកើនឡើងគុណនឹងពីរក្នុងរយៈពេលប្រមាណប្រាំពីរថ្ងៃកន្លះ។
en-mt: Enough cases of never-experiencing pneumonia have been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to set up an investigation Kate in early January; during the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases increased to two in about seven and a half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: កាលពីដើមខែ និងពាក់កណ្ដាលខែមករា ឆ្នាំ2020 វីរុសនេះបានរាលដាលដល់ខេត្តផ្សេងទៀតក្នុងប្រទេសចិន ដែលបណ្ដាលមកពីការចំណាកស្រុកក្នុងពិធីបុណ្យចូលឆ្នាំចិន ហើយវូហានគឺជាមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលដឹកជញ្ជូន និងជាមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលផ្លូវដែកដ៏ចម្បង។
en-mt: Earlier in the months and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other provinces in China caused by coverage The district at new year's festivities and Wuhan is a transportation center and the main railway center.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 20 ខែមករា ប្រទេសចិនបានរាយការណ៍ថាមានករណីថ្មីជិត 140 ករណីក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ ដែលរួមមានមនុស្សពីរនាក់នៅទីក្រុងប៉េកាំង និងម្នាក់ទៀតនៅទីក្រុងសិនជិន។
en-mt: On January 20, China reported nearly 140 new cases a day, including two people in Beijing and another in Xenchen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: ក្រោយមកទិន្នន័យផ្លូវការបង្ហាញថាមនុស្សចំនួន 6,174 នាក់បានចាប់ផ្ដើមចេញរោគសញ្ញាគិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 20​ ខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020។ គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 26​ ខែមីនា សហរដ្ឋអាមេរិកបានឡើងពីលើប្រទេសចិន និងអ៊ីតាលីជាប្រទេសដែលមានករណីឆ្លងច្រើនជាងគេក្នុងពិភពលោក។ គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 9 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ករណីឆ្លងច្រើនជាង 1.61 លានករណីត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍ជុំវិញពិភពលោក មនុស្សច្រើនជាង 97,000នាក់បានស្លាប់ និងមនុស្សច្រើនជាង 364,000 នាក់បានជាសះស្បើយ។
en-mt: Later, official data shows that 6,174 people began developing symptoms as of January 20 As of March 26, the United States rose above China and Italy as a case country As of April 9, 2020, more than 1.61 million cases were transmitted Reported around the globe, more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: នៅជុំវិញប្រទេស និងតំបន់​ចំនួន 200 មាន​យ៉ាងហោច​ណាស់​មួយករណី។
en-mt: Around 200 countries and regions there are at least a case.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: ដោយសារតែជំងឺរាតត្បាតនៅអឺរ៉ុប ប្រទេសជាច្រើននៅតំបន់ Schengen បានរឹតត្បិតការផ្លាស់ទីដោយសេរី និងរៀបចំការត្រួតពិនិត្យតាមព្រំដែន។
en-mt: Because of the European pandemic, many Schengen countries have restricted free movement and organized border controls.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: ប្រតិកម្មជាតិរួមមានវិធានការណ៍ទប់ស្កាត់ ដូចជាការដាក់ឱ្យនៅដាច់ពីគ្នា (ដែលគេដឹងថា ធ្វើការបញ្ជាទិញពីផ្ទះ ការបញ្ជាទិញមណ្ឌលស្នាក់នៅ ឬការចាក់សោរទ្វារផ្ទះ) និងបំរាមគោចរជាដើម។ ថ្ងៃទី 2 ខែមេសាជិត 300 លាននាក់ ឬប្រហែល 90% នៃប្រជាជន ស្ថិតនៅក្រោមលក្ខណៈការចាក់សោរទ្វារផ្ទះ នៅសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិកមនុស្សជាង 50 លាននាក់កំពុងជាប់គាំងនៅក្នុងប្រទេសហ្វីលីពីន ប្រជាជនប្រហែល 59 លាននាក់កំពុងជាប់នៅក្នុងប្រទេសអាហ្វ្រិកខាងត្បូង ហើយប្រជាជន 1,3 ពាន់លាននាក់កំពុងជាប់គាំង នៅក្នុងប្រទេស ឥណ្ឌា។
en-mt: National reactions include prevention measures such as being placed separately (known to make home purchase orders, orders, residency orders or On April 2, approximately 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, were located in poverty Home locking features in the United States of more than 50 million people are trapped in the Philippines, about  59 million are trapped in South Africa and 1.3 billion people are stranded in India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែមីនា មនុស្សប្រមាណ 1.7 ពាន់​លាន​អ្នក​ទូទាំង​ពិភពលោក​បានស្ថិតនៅ​ក្រោមទម្រង់​នៃការដាក់ឲ្យនៅក្នុងផ្ទះ ដែល​កើនដល់ 2.6 លាន់នាក់​ក្នុងរយៈពេលពីរថ្ងៃក្រោយមក – ដែល​ចំនួននេះស្មើឲ្យ​បីភាគ​នៃចំនួន​ប្រជាជន​សរុប​ក្នុង​ពិភព​លោក។
en-mt: On March 26, approximately 1.7 billion people around the globe were under the form of placing in a ripped home Up to 2.6 billion in the two days that subsequently—that equates to three-quarters of the total population in the globe.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: ករណីដែលត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់លើកដំបូងនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 បានកើតឡើងចាប់តាំងពីថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 ​នៅទីក្រុង​Wuhan ហើយរបាយការណ៍ដែលមិនបានបញ្ជាក់មួយបង្ហាញ​ថា​ករណីដំបូងបំផុតបានកើតឡើងនៅថ្ងៃទី 17 ខែ វិច្ឆិកា។
en-mt: The initial confirmed case of COVID-19 has occurred since December 1, 2019 In Wuhan and an unproven report shows that the earliest case occurred on November 17.

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: វេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត Zhang Jixian បានតាមដាន​ក្រុមករណីជំងឺ​រលាកសួតដែលមិនត្រូវបានគេដឹងពីប្រភពនៅថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែធ្នូ ដែល​មន្ទីរពេទ្យ​របស់​នាងបានជូនដំណឹងដល់ Wuhan Jianghan CDC នៅថ្ងៃទី 27 ខែធ្នូ។
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian monitored a group of unknown pneumonia cases from the day December 26, whose hospital notified the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on December 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តហ្សែនដំបូងនៃសំណាកអ្នកជំងឺនៅថ្ងៃទី 27 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 បានចង្អុលបង្ហាញពីវត្តមាននៃវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា ដូចជាវីរុស SARS។
en-mt: The initial genetic test of patient samples on December 27, 2019 pointed to the presence of cholera, such as SARS.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: សេចក្តីជូនដំណឹងជាសាធារណៈមួយត្រូវបានចេញផ្សាយដោយគណៈកម្មការសុខាភិបាលក្រុងវូហាន កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 31 ខែធ្នូ។
en-mt: A public notification was issued by the Wuhan City Health Commission on December 31.

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក ត្រូវបានជូនដំណឹង​នៅថ្ងៃតែ​មួយ​នោះ។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation was notified that same day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: នៅពេលការជូនដំណឹងទាំងនេះបានធ្វើឡើង វេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត​នៅទីក្រុង​វូហាន ត្រូវបាន​ព្រមាន​ដោយប៉ូលីសពីបទ "ផ្សព្វផ្សាយពាក្យចចាមអារ៉ាម" អំពីការផ្ទុះ​ជំងឺ។
en-mt: When these alarms took place, a doctor in Wuhan was warned by police for "spreading rumors" of a disease outbreak.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: គណៈកម្មការសុខភាពជាតិចិនបានអះអាងជាបឋមថា មិនមានភស្តុតាងច្បាស់លាស់នៃការឆ្លងពីមនុស្សទៅមនុស្សទេ។
en-mt: The Chinese National Health Commission has basically argued that there is no clear evidence of human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: កាលពីចុងខែមករា រដ្ឋាភិបាលចិនបាន​ដាក់ចេញ​យុទ្ធនាការ​តឹងតែងមួយ ដែល​ក្រោយមកត្រូវបាន​ពិពណ៌នាដោយលោក Xi Jinoing ប្រធាន​គណបក្សកុម្មុយនីស្តចិន ថាជា “សង្គ្រាម​របស់​មនុស្ស” ដើម្បីទប់ទល់នឹងការរាតត្បាតជំងឺនេះ។
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a tough campaign later described by Xi Jinoing, president of the Communist People's Republicans, is a "human war" to combat the disease epidemic.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: នៅក្នុងអ្វីដែលត្រូវបានពិពណ៌នាថាជា “ការធ្វើ​ចត្តាឡីស័ក្តិ​ធំជាងគេបំផុតក្នុងប្រវត្តិសាស្ត្រមនុស្សជាតិ” ការបិទច្រកចេញចូលត្រូវបានប្រកាសនៅថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមករា បញ្ឈប់ការធ្វើដំណើរក្នុង និងក្រៅទីក្រុងវូហាន ដែលត្រូវបានពង្រីកដល់ទីក្រុងចំនួន 15 នៅ​ហឺប៉ី ដែល​ប៉ះពាល់ដល់ប្រជាជនសរុបប្រមាណ 57 លាននាក់។
en-mt: In what is described as "the largest lay-off in human history," the closure of the gate was announced on January 23 Stopping travel in and outside of Wuhan, which has been expanded to 15 cities in Herphei, affecting a total population of approximately 57 million.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: ការប្រើប្រាស់​យានយន្ត​ឯកជន​ត្រូវបាន​ហាម​ឃាត់​នៅក្នុង​ទីក្រុង។
en-mt: The use of private vehicles is banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: ការប្រារព្ធពិធីចូលឆ្នាំចិន (ថ្ងៃទី 25 ខែមករា) ត្រូវបាន​លុបចោល​នៅកន្លែងជាច្រើន។
en-mt: The Celebration of Chinese New Year (January 25) was canceled in many places.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: អាជ្ញាធរក៏បានធ្វើការប្រកាសអំពីការសាងសង់មន្ទីរពេទ្យ​បណ្ដោះអាសន្ន គឺមន្ទីរពេទ្យ Huoshenshan ដែល​ត្រូវ​បាន​ស្ថាបនា​រូចក្នុងរយៈពេល 10 ថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: Authorities also announced the construction of the temporary hospital, the Huoshenshan Hospital, which was founded within 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: ក្រោយមកទៀតមន្ទីរពេទ្យមួយទៀតគឺ មន្ទីរពេទ្យ Leishenshan Hospital ត្រូវបានកសាងឡើងដើម្បីរ៉ាប់អ្នកជំងឺបន្ថែមទៀត។
en-mt: Later, another hospital, the Leishenshan Hospital, was built to raise additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: បន្ថែមលើមន្ទីរពេទ្យ ដែលទើបសាងសង់ថ្មីៗ ប្រទេសចិនក៏បានប្តូរទីតាំងចំនួន 14 ផ្សេងទៀត នៅទីក្រុងវូហាន ដូចជាមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលសន្និបាត និងពហុកីឡដ្ឋានទៅជាមន្ទីរពេទ្យបណ្តោះអាសន្ន។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែ មករា រដ្ឋាភិបាលបានដាក់ចេញវិធានការបន្ថែម ដើម្បីទប់ទល់នឹងការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 រួមទាំងការចេញសេចក្តីប្រកាសសុខភាពសម្រាប់អ្នកដំណើរ និងពន្យារថ្ងៃឈប់សម្រាកបុណ្យនិទាឃរដូវផងដែរ។
en-mt: Adding the newly built hospital, China has also relocated 14 other locations in Wuhan, such as The convention and stadium center became a temporary hospital. January, the government has put forward additional measures to combat the spread of COVID-19, including Issue health declarations for passengers and also postpone the spring holidays.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: សាកលវិទ្យាល័យ និងសាលារៀន​នៅទូទាំងប្រទេសក៏ត្រូវបានបិទផងដែរ។
en-mt: Universities and schools across the country are also closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: តំបន់ហុងកុង និងម៉ាកាវបានបង្កើតវិធានការជាច្រើនជាពិសេសទាក់ទងនឹងសាលារៀននិងសាកលវិទ្យាល័យ។
en-mt: The Hong Kong and Macau regions have developed a range of measures, especially with regard to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: វិធានការណ៍ធ្វើការពីចម្ងាយត្រូវបានបង្កើតឡើងនៅក្នុងតំបន់ជាច្រើនរបស់ប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: Remote working measures have been developed in many areas of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: ការរឹតបន្តឹងការធ្វើដំណើរត្រូវបានអនុម័តនៅក្នុងនិងខាងក្រៅហ៊ូប៉ី។
en-mt: Travel restrictions are passed inside and outside Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: ការដឹកជញ្ជូនសាធារណៈត្រូវបានកែប្រែហើយសារមន្ទីរពាសពេញប្រទេសចិនត្រូវបានបិទជាបណ្តោះអាសន្ន។
en-mt: Public transport has been reformed and museums across China have been temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: ការគ្រប់គ្រងចលនាសាធារណៈត្រូវបានអនុវត្តនៅក្នុងទីក្រុងជាច្រើន ហើយវាត្រូវបានគេប៉ាន់ស្មានថាប្រជាជនប្រហែល 760 លាននាក់ (ច្រើនជាងពាក់កណ្តាលនៃចំនួនប្រជាជន) បានប្រឈមមុខនឹងទំរង់ខ្លះនៃការដាក់កម្រិតខាងក្រៅ។ បន្ទាប់ពីការផ្ទុះឡើងបានឈានចូលដំណាក់កាលពិភពលោករបស់ខ្លួននៅក្នុងខែមីនាអាជ្ញាធរចិនបានចាត់វិធានការយ៉ាងតឹងរឹងចំពោះការបង្ការវីរុសពី "ការនាំចូល" ពីប្រទេសផ្សេងទៀត។
en-mt: Public movement control has been implemented in many cities, and it is estimated that the population may have  760 million (more than half of the population) faced some form of placement After the outbreak entered its global stage in March, Chinese authorities took drastic action against preventing the virus from "imports" from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: ជាឧទាហរណ៍ ទីក្រុងប៉េកាំង​បាន​ដាក់ចេញ​បញ្ជាឲ្យ​មាន​ការ​ធ្វើ​ចត្តាឡីស័ករយៈពេល 14 ថ្ងៃ​សម្រាប់រាល់​អ្នកធ្វើ​ដំណើរ​អន្តរជាតិ​ដែលបានចូលបានកាន់ទីក្រុង។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនា ចិន​ដី​គោក​កើត​មាន​អ្នកឆ្លង​ជំងឺ​តែមួយករណី​តែប៉ុណ្ណោះ​ក្នុង​ចន្លោះ​រយៈ​ពេល​ប្រាំថ្ងៃមុននេះ អ្នកកើត​នោះ​គឺជាអ្នក​ដំណើរ​ត្រឡប់​មក​ពី​ទីក្រុងអ៊ីស្តង់ប៊ុលទៅកាន់ទីក្រុងក្វាងចូវ។
en-mt: Beijing, for instance, ordered a 14-day laboratory for every international traveler who entered the city. There was only one infected case in the preval five days before, the born was a passenger returning from Istanbul to Guangdong Hong Kong.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 24 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 នាយករដ្ឋមន្រ្តីចិន លោក Li Keqiang បានរាយការណ៍ថា ការរីករាលដាល​នៃករណីឆ្លង​ក្នុង​ស្រុក​ត្រូវបានរាំងខ្ទប់ជាមូលដ្ឋាន ហើយការផ្ទុះឡើងត្រូវបាន​គ្រប់គ្រង​​នៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Prime Minister Li Keqiang reported The spread of local cases has been fundamentally blocked, and an outbreak is controlled in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: នៅក្នុងថ្ងៃតែមួយនៃការដាក់កំណត់ ការធ្វើ​ដំណើរ​បានត្រូវបន្ថយនៅហ៊ូប៉ី លើកលែងតែវូហាន រយៈពេល​ពីរខែក្រោយពីការចាប់ផ្តើមបិទការធ្វើដំណើរ។ ក្រសួងការបរទេសចិន បានប្រកាសនៅថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ថាការចូលសម្រាប់ទិដ្ឋាការ ឬអ្នក​កាន់ប័ណ្ណស្នាក់នៅនឹងត្រូវផ្អាកចាប់ពីថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែ​មីនា​តទៅ ដោយមិនមាន​ព័ត៌មាន​លម្អិតជាក់លាក់​ស្តី​ពី​ពេលវេលាដែលគោលការណ៍នេះត្រូវបញ្ចប់ឡើយ។
en-mt: In the same day of designation, travel is lowered in Hubei except for Vaughan for the length of time Two months after the beginning of the travel closure, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that admissions for visas or residential card holders will be suspended from March 28 onwards, with no specific details on when the policy is completed.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: អ្នកទាំងឡាយ​ដែលចង់ទៅ​ប្រទេសចិន​ត្រូវធ្វើការ​ដាក់​ពាក្យ​សុំទិដ្ឋការ​នៅតាមស្ថានទូត ឬ​កុងសុលរបស់ប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: Anyone who wants to go to China must apply for a visa application either by China's embassy or consulate.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: រដ្ឋាភិបាលចិនបានលើកទឹកចិត្តដល់សហគ្រាស និងរោងចក្រឱ្យបើកជាថ្មីនៅថ្ងៃទី 30 ខែមីនា និងបានផ្តល់កញ្ចប់រំញោចរូបិយវត្ថុសម្រាប់ក្រុមហ៊ុន។ ក្រុមប្រឹក្សារដ្ឋបានប្រកាសពីថ្ងៃកាន់ទុក្ខ ដើម្បីចាប់ផ្តើមជាមួយភាពស្ងប់ស្ងាត់រយៈពេលបី នាទីរបស់ជាតិនៅម៉ោង 10:00 នៅថ្ងៃទី 4 ខែមេសា ស្របគ្នា ជាមួយនឹងបុណ្យឆេងម៉េង ទោះបីជារដ្ឋាភិបាលកណ្តាលបានស្នើសុំឱ្យក្រុមគ្រួសារគោរពតាមអ៊ីនធើណែតក្នុងការប្រតិបត្តិនៃគម្លាតរាងកាយ ដើម្បីចៀសវាងការផ្ទុះជំងឺ COVID-19 ។
en-mt: The Chinese government encouraged enterprises and factories to reopen on March 30 and offered education packages At least money for the company. The council has announced a day of mourning to begin with three periods of calm National site at 10:00 a.m. on April 4 parallel with Cheng Meng Festival despite the central government Ask families to obey the Internet in operating physical gaps to avoid a COVID-19 outbreak.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: COVID-19 ត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ថាបានរាលដាលដល់ប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងនៅថ្ងៃទី 20 ខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ពីប្រទេសចិន។
en-mt: COVID-19 is confirmed to have spread to South Korea on January 20, 2020 from China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: ទីភ្នាក់ងារសុខាភិបាលជាតិបានរាយការណ៍ពីការកើនឡើង​គួរឱ្យកត់សម្គាល់នៃករណីដែលបានបញ្ជាក់នៅថ្ងៃទី 20 ខែ កុម្ភៈ ដែលភាគច្រើនបណ្ដាលមកពីការជួបជុំគ្នានៅទីក្រុង Daegu នៃ​សកម្មភាពសាសនាដែលគេស្គាល់ថាជាវិហារព្រះ​យេស៊ូវឈ្មោះថា Shincheonji ។
en-mt: The National Health Agency reports a significant increase in confirmed cases on February 20, which Most are caused by the Daegu gathering of religion activities known as the Temple of Jesus, Shincheonji.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: អ្នកកាន់សាសនា Shincheonji ដែលធ្វើដំណើរចូល Daegu មកពីទីក្រុង Wuhan ត្រូវបានគេ​សង្ស័យថា​ជាប្រភពដើមនៃការផ្ទុះជំងឺ។
en-mt: A Shincheonji religionist traveling into Daegu from Wuhan is suspected of being the origin of the outbreak.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 22 ខែកុម្ភៈក្នុងចំណោមអ្នកកាន់សាសនាចក្រចំនួន 9.336 នាក់មាន 1.261 នាក់ឬប្រហែលជា 13% បានរាយការណ៍អំពីរោគសញ្ញា។ ប្រទេសកូរ៉េបានប្រកាសអាសន្នខ្ពស់បំផុតនៅថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែកុម្ភៈឆ្នាំ 2020 ។
en-mt: As of February 22, 9,336 were 1,261 or possibly 13% reported symptoms; Korea declared its highest emergency on February 23, 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែកុម្ភៈ ករណីដែលបានបញ្ជាក់ជាង 2,000 ករណីត្រូវបានរាយការណ៍នៅក្នុងប្រទេសកូរ៉េ ដោយកើនឡើងដល់ 3,150 ករណីនាថ្ងៃទី 29 ខែកុម្ភៈ។
en-mt: On February 28, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, increasing to 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: មូលដ្ឋានយោធាកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងទាំងអស់ត្រូវបានដាក់ឲ្យ នៅដាច់ដោយឡែក បន្ទាប់ពីការធ្វើតេស្ត​បញ្ជាក់ថា​ទាហានបីនាក់មានផ្ទុកមេរោគវិជ្ជមានចំពោះវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: All South Korean military bases were placed in isolation after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positively carrying the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: កាលវិភាគរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុនអាកាសចរណ៍ក៏រងផលប៉ះពាល់ផងដែរ ដូច្នេះពួកគេត្រូវបានផ្លាស់ប្តូរ។ ប្រទេសកូរ៉េបាននាំមកនូវអ្វីដែលត្រូវបានចាត់ទុកថាជាកម្មវិធីធំជាងគេ និងមានការរៀបចំល្អបំផុតនៅលើពិភពលោក ដើម្បីត្រួតពិនិត្យប្រជាជនដើម្បីរកវីរុស និងដាក់អ្នកដែលឆ្លងមេរោគឱ្យនៅដាច់ពីគេ ក៏ដូចជាតាមដាន និងបង្ខាំងអ្នកដែលបានប៉ះពាល់ជាមួយអ្នកឆ្លងឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែក។
en-mt: Airline schedules are also affected, so they have been changed; Korea has brought what is considered the largest and best-prepared Around the globe to monitor the population for the virus and put infected people apart, as well as to monitor and block those who have contact with the infected.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: វិធីសាស្ត្រក្នុងការស្គ្រីនពិនិត្យ​ដោយរួមបញ្ចូលទាំង​ការរាយការណ៍​ដោយ​ខ្លួន​ឯងអំពីរោគសញ្ញា សម្រាប់អ្នក​ដែល​ទើប​មក​ពី​ក្រៅ​ប្រទេស​​ថ្មីៗតាមរយៈកម្មវិធីលើទូរសព្ទដៃ ការធ្វើតេស្ត​ស្វែករក​វីរុស​ជាមួយ​​លទ្ធផលអាចទទួលបាននៅថ្ងៃបន្ទាប់ ហើយ​បង្កើន​សមត្ថភាព​​ក្នុងការតេស្ត​ដែលអនុញ្ញាត​ឲ្យមនុស្ស​ធ្វើតេស្ត​បាន​ចំនួន 20,000 នាក់ជា​រៀងរាល់​ថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: Methods of screening check by including self-reporting symptoms for those newly abroad via mobile apps, white testing Double the virus with the results can be obtained the next day and increases the ability to test that allows 20,000 people to be tested each day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: កម្មវិធីរបស់កូរ៉េខាងត្បូងត្រូវបានគេចាត់ទុកថាជាជោគជ័យក្នុងការគ្រប់គ្រងការផ្ទុះឡើងទោះបីមិនមានការធានាដល់ទីក្រុងទាំងមូលក៏ដោយ។ សង្គមកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងត្រូវបានបែកបាក់គ្នាលើការឆ្លើយតបរបស់ប្រធានាធិបតី Moon Jae-in ចំពោះវិបត្តិនេះ។
en-mt: South Korea's program is considered a success in controlling outbreaks, albeit without guaranteeing the city of Mo South Korean society has been torn apart over President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: ប្រជាជនកូរ៉េជាច្រើនបានធ្វើការចុះឈ្មោះបដ្ឋនាលិខិតដែលមានជម្រើសពីរដូចជាការចោទប្រកាន់លោក Moon អំពីអ្វីដែលពួកគេអះអាងថារដ្ឋាភិបាលលោកដោះស្រាយបញ្ហារោគរាលដាលមិនបានត្រឹមត្រូវ ឬសរសើរលោកសម្រាប់ការដោះស្រាយ។
en-mt: Many Koreans have worked to register two optional letter bridges, much as accusing Moon of what they are Claims that his government handles epidemics improperly or praises him for settling.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនា គេបានរាយការណ៍ថា ប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងមានករណីសរុបតិចបំផុតក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ ធៀបទៅនឹងថ្ងៃនីមួយៗនៃរយៈពេលបួនសប្តាហ៍ចុងក្រោយ។
en-mt: On March 23, it was reported that South Korea had the fewest total cases a day, compared to each of the last four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 29 ខែមីនា មានការរាយការណ៍ថាចាប់ពីថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែមេសាទៅ រាល់ការមកដល់ថ្មីពីបរទេសនឹងត្រូវបានបង្ខាំងឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែករយៈពេលពីរសប្តាហ៍។
en-mt: On March 29, it was reported that from April 1, every new arrival from abroad would be banned in isolation for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: យោងតាមរបាយការណ៍របស់ប្រព័ន្ធផ្សព្វផ្សាយនៅថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែមេសាប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងបានទទួលសំណើសម្រាប់ជំនួយតេស្តមេរោគពី 121 ប្រទេសផ្សេងៗគ្នា។
en-mt: According to media reports on April 1, Korea received requests for viral testing aid from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: ប្រទេសអ៊ីរ៉ង់បានរាយការណ៍ពីករណីឆ្លងវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 ដែលត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ជាលើកដំបូងកាលពីថ្ងៃទី 19 ខែកុម្ភៈ នៅទីក្រុង Qom ដែលមាន​មនុស្ស​ពីរ​នាក់​បានស្លាប់ ​បើយោងតាមការក្រសួងសុខាភិបាល និង​អប់រំវេជ្ជសាស្រ្ត។
en-mt: Iran reports the SARS-CoV-2 infection that was originally confirmed on 19 BC February in Qom, where two people died, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: វិធានការមុនៗ ដែលបានប្រកាសដោយរដ្ឋាភិបាល រួមមានការលុបចោលការប្រគុំតន្ត្រី និងព្រឹត្តិការណ៍វប្បធម៌ផ្សេងទៀត ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍កីឡា និងការបន់ស្រន់​ថ្ងៃសុក្រ និងការបិទសាកលវិទ្យាល័យ ស្ថាប័នឧត្តមសិក្សា និងសាលារៀននានា។
en-mt: Earlier measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events Friday's sports and moral events and the closure of universities, universities, academies and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: ប្រទេសអ៊ីរ៉ង់បានត្រៀមថវិកាចំនួនប្រាំទ្រីលានរីអល ដើម្បី​ប្រយុទ្ធ​ប្រឆាំង​នឹងវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: Iran has prepared five trillion rills of aid to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: ប្រធានាធិបតីហាសាន់រូហានីបានមានប្រសាសន៍កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 26 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ថា មិនមានផែនការដើម្បីដាក់តំបន់ដាច់ស្រយាលដែល​រង​ផល​ប៉ះពាល់ពីការផ្ទុះឡើងនេះទេ ហើយមានតែបុគ្គលប៉ុណ្ណោះដែលត្រូវបានគេទុកឱ្យនៅដាច់ពីគេ។
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on February 26, 2020 that there was no plan for bread Isolated chickens affected by the outbreak, and only individuals have been left apart.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: គម្រោងក្នុងការ​ដាក់កំហិតការ​ធ្វើដំណើរពីទីក្រុង​ទៅទីក្រុង​ត្រូវ​បាន​​ប្រកាសឡើងកាលពីខែមីនា ថ្វីបើការ​ធ្វើចរាចរណ៍​ដ៏ណែន​តាន់តាប់​ពីទីក្រុងមួយទៅទីក្រុងមួយ មុនពេលពិធីបុណ្យ​ចូលឆ្នាំថ្មី​របស់ប្រជាជនពែក្សបន្តធ្វើក៏ដោយ។
en-mt: Plan to restrict travel from city to city was announced in March despite traffic restrictions Nanny holds from city to city before the New Year celebrations of the Phnom Penh people continue.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: ទីសក្ការៈ Shia នៅ Qom នៅតែបន្តបើក​សម្រាប់​អ្នកធ្វើ​ធម្មយាត្រា​រហូតដល់ថ្ងៃទី 16 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ។ ប្រទេស​អ៊ីរ៉ង់​ក្លាយជាមជ្ឈមណ្ឌល​នៃការសាយ​ភាយជំងឺ​នេះ​បន្ទាប់ពី​ប្រទេស​ចិនក្នុងអំឡុងខែកុម្ភៈ។
en-mt: The Shia shrine at Qom continues to open for pilgrims until March 16, 2020 Iran became the center of the disease epidemic, subsequent to China during February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: ជុំវិញការអះអាងនៃការបិទបាំងវិសាលភាពនៃការផ្ទុះរីករាលដាលជំងឺនៅអ៊ីរ៉ង់ ច្រើនជាងដប់​ប្រទេសបាន​តាម​ដាន​ករណីរបស់ពួកគេត្រឡប់ទៅអ៊ីរ៉ង់វិញ នៅថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែកុម្ភៈដែលបង្ហាញថាវិសាលភាពនៃការផ្ទុះឡើងអាចធ្ងន់ធ្ងរជាង​ 388 ករណី ដែលបាន​រាយការណ៍​ដោយ​រដ្ឋាភិបាល​អ៊ីរ៉ង់តាមកាលបរិច្ឆេទនោះ។
en-mt: Surrounding claims of disguise the spread of the disease outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries traced their case back to Iran at February 28, which indicates that the scope of an outbreak could be more severe than the 388 reported cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: សភាអ៊ីរ៉ង់ត្រូវបានបិទដោយមានសមាជិក 23 រូបក្នុងចំណោមសមាជិក 290 របស់ខ្លួនត្រូវបានគេរាយការណ៍ថាបានធ្វើតេស្តិ៍រកវីរុសនេះនៅថ្ងៃទី 3 ខែមីនា។
en-mt: The Iranian parliament has been closed, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have tested the virus on March 3.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 12 ខែមីនា អង្គការឃ្លាំមើលសិទ្ធិមនុស្សបានជំរុញឱ្យអាជ្ញាធរគ្រប់គ្រងពន្ធនាគារអ៊ីរ៉ង់ដោះលែងអ្នកការពារសិទ្ធិមនុស្ស ដែលត្រូវបានឃុំខ្លួន ដោយអហិង្សាដែលធ្វើការប្រឆាំងជំទាស់ដោយសន្តិវិធី ហើយក៏ត្រូវដោះលែងអ្នកទោស ដែលមានសិទ្ធិទាំងអស់ ជាបណ្តោះអាសន្នផងដែរ។
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch urged Iranian bank-governing authorities to release rights defenders Violently detained people who peacefully oppose and are also temporarily released by all rightful prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: វាត្រូវបានថ្លែងថាវីរុស​មានហានិភ័យកាន់តែ​ខ្ពស់​ក្នុង​ការឆ្លង​នៅក្នុង​គ្រឹះស្ថានដែលបានបិទដូចជាមជ្ឈមណ្ឌលឃុំឃាំង ដែលទីនោះក៏មានកង្វះខាតការថែទាំសុខភាពផងដែរ។
en-mt: It was stated that the virus was at higher risk of crossing in closed foundations, like detention centers, where there was also a lack of healthcare.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 15 ខែមីនា រដ្ឋាភិបាលប្រទេអ៊ីរ៉ង់​បានរាយការណ៍ថា មាន​​អ្នកស្លាប់ចំនួន 100 នាក់ក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ ដែលជា​កំណត់ត្រា​ខ្ពស់​បំផុត​ក្នុងប្រទេសចាប់តាំង​ពីការផ្ទុះ​ជំងឺនេះ​បានចាប់ផ្ដើម។
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian empty government reported that there were 100 deaths a day, the highest record in the country since the outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: យ៉ាងហោចណាស់អ្នកអង្គុយ ឬអតីតអ្នកនយោបាយអ៊ីរ៉ង់ និងមន្រ្តីរដ្ឋាភិបាល 12 នាក់បាន​ស្លាប់​ដោយ​សារជំងឺ​នេះ​គិត​ត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 17 ខែមីនា។
en-mt: At least 12 sittings or former Iranian politicians and government officials have died of the disease as of March 17.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: មកដល់ថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនា អ៊ីរ៉ង់ជួបបទពិសោធន៍​ក្នុង​ការ​រកឃើញ​ករណី​ឆ្លងថ្មីចំនួន 50 ករណីក្នុងមួយម៉ោង ហើយ​មា​ន​ករណី​ស្លាប់ថ្មី​ចំនួន​មួយរាល់រយៈពេលដប់នាទីដោយសារ​វីរុសកូរ៉ូណា។
en-mt: Arriving on March 23, Iran experiences the discovery of a new number of cases  50 cases per hour and there are a number of new deaths every ten minutes from cholera.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: យោងតាមមន្រ្តីអង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក (WHO) បានអោយដឹងថានៅក្នុងប្រទេសអ៊ីរ៉ង់ប្រហែលជាមានករណីប្រាំដងច្រើនជាងករណីដែលត្រូវបានគេរាយការណ៍។
en-mt: In Iran, there may be five times more cases in Iran than they are reported, according to The Who officials.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: វាក៏​បាន​ណែនាំ​ថា ការ​ដាន់​ទណ្ឌ​កម្ម​របស់​សហរដ្ឋ​អាមេរិក​នៅប្រទេស​អ៊ឺរ៉ង​អាច​ប៉ះពាល់​ដល់​សមត្ថភាព​ហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ​របស់​ប្រទេស​ក្នុង​ឆ្លើយ​តប​ទៅ​នឹង​ការ​ផ្ទុះ​វីរុស​នេះ។
en-mt: It also suggests that U.S. sanctions in Euro could affect the country's financial capabilities in response to the outbreak of the virus.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: ឧត្ដមស្នងការអង្គការសហប្រជាជាតិទទួលបន្ទុកសិទ្ធិមនុស្សបានទាមទារឱ្យមានការដាក់ទណ្ឌកម្មសេដ្ឋកិច្ចដើម្បីប្រទេសដែលរងផលប៉ះពាល់ពីជំងឺរាតត្បាតរួមទាំងអ៊ីរ៉ង់។
en-mt: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions for countries affected by pandemics, including Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺនេះត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ថាបានរាលដាលដល់ប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីនៅថ្ងៃទី 31 ខែមករានៅពេលដែលភ្ញៀវទេសចរចិនពីរនាក់បានធ្វើតេស្តិ៍វិជ្ជមានចំពោះ SARS-CoV-2 នៅទីក្រុងរ៉ូម។
en-mt: The outbreak of the disease was confirmed to have spread to Italy on March 31 When two Chinese visitors tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: ករណីឆ្លងចាប់ផ្ដើមកើនឡើងខ្លាំង ដែល​បណ្ដាលឲ្យ​រដ្ឋាភិបាល​អ៊ីតាលីធ្វើការបិទ​ជើងយន្តហោះទាំងអស់​ដែល​ហោះទៅ និងមកពីប្រទេសចិនភ្លាមៗ ហើយបាន​ប្រកាស​ដាក់​ប្រទេស​ក្នុងគ្រាអាសន្ន។
en-mt: Transmission cases began to intensify, causing the Italian government to immediately shut down all aircraft flying to and from China, and declared the country in an emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: បណ្ដុំមិនពាក់ព័ន្ធគ្នានៃករណីជំងឺ COVID-19 ត្រូវបានរកឃើញនៅពេលក្រោយ ចាប់ផ្តើមដោយមាន 16 ករណីនៅ Lombardy នៅថ្ងៃទី 21 ខែកុម្ភៈ។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 22 ខែកុម្ភៈ ទីស្តីការគណៈរដ្ឋមន្រ្តី​បាន​ប្រកាស​ក្រឹត្យថ្មីមួយដើម្បីទប់ស្កាត់ការផ្ទុះជំងឺ រួមទាំងការឃុំឃាំងមនុស្សច្រើនជាង 50,000 នាក់ពី ​11 ទីក្រុងផ្សេងគ្នានៅភាគខាងជើងប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលី។
en-mt: A set of non-related sets of COVID-19 cases were found later beginning with 16 cases in Lombardy on February 21. The prime minister has announced a new decree to contain the disease outbreak, including the detention of more than 50,000 people from 11 different cities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: នាយករដ្ឋមន្ត្រីលោក Giuseppe Conte បានមានប្រសាសន៍ថា “នៅក្នុងតំបន់ដែលកើតជំងឺនេះ ការចូល និងចេញនឹងមិនត្រូវបានផ្ដល់ជូននោះទេ។
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said: "In the region of this disease, entry and exit will not be provided.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: ការផ្អាកសកម្មភាពការងារ និងព្រឹត្តិការណ៍កីឡាត្រូវបានបញ្ជានៅក្នុងតំបន់ទាំងនោះ។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 4 ខែមីនា រដ្ឋាភិបាលអ៊ីតាលីបញ្ជាឲ្យមានការបិទសាលារៀន និងសាកលវិទ្យាល័យទាំងអស់ទូទាំងប្រទេស ដោយប្រទេសនេះមានអ្នកស្លាប់កើនដល់ 100 នាក់។
en-mt: The suspension of work activities and sporting events is ordered in those areas. On March 4, the Italian government Orders the closure of all schools and universities nationwide, with the country rising to 100 deaths.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: រាល់ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍កីឡាធំៗ រួមមានការប្រកួតបាល់ទាត់ស៊េរី A ត្រូវបានធ្វើឡើងដោយមិនមានទស្សនិកជនរហូតដល់ខែមេសា ប៉ុន្តែនៅថ្ងៃទី9 ខែមីនា គ្រាប់កីឡាទាំងអស់ត្រូវបានផ្អាកទាំងស្រុង យ៉ាងហោចណាស់រយៈពេលមួយខែ។
en-mt: Every major sporting event, including a Series A football match, is held without visitors until b April, but on March 9, all sports balloons were completely suspended for at least a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 11 ខែមីនា លោកនាយករដ្ឋមន្រ្តី Conte បានបញ្ជាឱ្យបញ្ឈប់រាល់សកម្មភាពពាណិជ្ជកម្មទាំងអស់ លើកលែងតែផ្សារទំនើប និងឱសថស្ថាន។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 6 ខែមីនា មហាវិទ្យាល័យអ៊ីតាលីផ្នែកសណ្ដំ រមាស់ សង្គ្រោះ និងយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ខ្ពស់ (SIAARTI) បានចេញសេចក្តីណែនាំស្តីពីក្រមសីលធម៌វេជ្ជសាស្ត្រទាក់ទងនឹងពិធីសារនៃការជ្រើសរើសអ្នកជំងឺដែលអាចព្យាបាលបាន។
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Conte ordered a halt to all trade activities except supermarkets and pharmaceuticals. The SIAARTI Scrolling and Care (SIAARTI) issued a guideline on medical ethics regarding the protocol of choosing a possible treatment patient.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 19 ខែមីនាប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីបានវ៉ាប្រទេសចិនជាប្រទេសដែលមានអ្នកស្លាប់ដោយសារជំងឺឆ្លងច្រើនបំផុតនៅលើពិភពលោកបន្ទាប់ពីមានអ្នកស្លាប់ដោយសារជំងឺរាតត្បាតចំនួន 3.405 នាក់។
en-mt: On March 19, Italy battles China a country with infected deaths The largest in the globe, in the wake of 3,405 measles deaths.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 22 ខែមីនា មានការរាយការណ៍ថា ប្រទេសរុស្ស៊ី​បាន​បញ្ជូនយន្តហោះ​យោធាចំនួនប្រាំបួន​ជាមួយ​នឹង​ឧបករណ៍​វេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ​ទៅកាន់ប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលី។
en-mt: On March 22, there were reports that Russia had sent nine military aircraft with medical equipment to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 5 ខែមេសា​មានករណីដែល​បាន​បញ្ជាក់​ចំនួន 128,948 នាក់ អ្នកស្លាប់ចំនួន 15,887 នាក់ និង​អ្នក​ជាសះស្បើយចំនួន 21,815 នាក់ នៅ​ប្រទេស​អ៊ីតាលី ដែលភាគច្រើន​នៃករណី​ទាំងនោះ​បានកើតឡើងនៅក្នុងតំបន់ Lombardy។
en-mt: As of April 5, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 dead and reconciliators The number of 21,815 recoveries in Italy, the vast majority of those cases occurred in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: សេចក្ដីរាយការណ៍ពី CNN បានបង្ហាញថា ការរាប់​បញ្ចូលគ្នានៃ​ចំនួនប្រជាជន​វ័យចំណាស់ដ៏ច្រើន និងការដែល​មិនអាច​ធ្វើតេស្ត​ទៅកាន់​អ្នកដែលឆ្លងជំងឺ​រហូតមកដល់​ពេលបច្ចុប្បន្ន​ទាំងអស់​បាន អាចជាកត្តាធ្វើឲ្យ​អាត្រាមរណៈភាព​មាន​ស្ថានភាព​ខ្ពស់។
en-mt: A report from CNN suggests a combination of a large number of elderly populations and unable to be tested to you All infectious diseases can be a factor in higher mortality.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: ការឆ្លើយតបរបស់ចក្រភពអង់គ្លេសចំពោះវីរុសនេះបានលេចចេញជាប្រទេសដែលមានភាពធូររលុងបំផុតមួយក្នុងចំណោមប្រទេសដែលរងផលប៉ះពាល់ ហើយរហូតមកដល់ថ្ងៃទី 18 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 រដ្ឋាភិបាលអង់គ្លេសមិនបានដាក់ចេញនូវទម្រង់ណាមួយនៃការរក្សាគម្លាតសង្គម ឬវិធានការបង្ខាំងឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែកទ្រង់ទ្រាយធំលើពលរដ្ឋរបស់ខ្លួនឡើយ។
en-mt: Britain's response to the virus has emerged as one of the most affected countries and as of March 18 2020 The British government has not put forward any form of maintaining social gaps or pressure to isolate large-scale isolation on its citities.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: ជាលទ្ធផល រដ្ឋាភិបាលបានរងការរិះគន់ចំពោះភាពខ្វះចន្លោះ និងប្រភពភាពក្នុងការឆ្លើយតបរបស់ខ្លួនចំពោះកង្វល់ដែលសាធារណជនបានជួបប្រទះ។ នៅថ្ងៃទី 16 ខែមីនា លោកនាយករដ្ឋមន្រ្តី Boris Johnson បានចេញសេចក្តីជូនដំណឹងដោយណែនាំឱ្យជៀសវាងរាល់ការធ្វើដំណើរ និងទំនាក់ទំនងសង្គមដែលមិនចាំបាច់ ព្រមទាំងផ្តល់យោបល់ឱ្យប្រជាជនធ្វើការពីផ្ទះប្រសិនបើអាច និងជៀសវាងកន្លែងផ្សេងៗដូចជាហាងស្រា ភោជនីយដ្ឋាន និងរោងភាពយន្តជាដើម។
en-mt: As a result, the government has come under criticism for the lack of gaps and sources in its response to the concerns the public has grown On March 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson issued an alert By advising avoiding all unnecessary travel and social communications and advice to the people Work from home, provided possible and avoid places like wine stores, restaurants, and movie theaters.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 20 ខែមីនា រដ្ឋាភិបាលបាន​ប្រកាសថា​កន្លែងកំសាន្តទាំងអស់ ដូចជាហាងស្រា និងកន្លែង​ហាត់​ប្រាណ ត្រូវឱ្យបានឆាប់បំផុត ហើយ​សន្យាថា​នឹងបង់​ប្រាក់​ឈ្នួលដល់កម្មកររហូតដល់ 80% ដល់​ចំនួន​កំណត់ 2500 ផោនក្នុងមួយខែ ដើម្បីការពារភាព​អត់​ការងារ​ធ្វើក្នុងពេល​មាន​វិបត្តិ។ កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនា លោកនាយករដ្ឋមន្រ្តីបាន​ប្រកាស​ពីវិធាន​ការណ៍គម្លាត​សង្គម​កាន់តែម៉ឺងម៉ាត់​ដោយហាមឃាត់​ការប្រមូល​ផ្តុំមនុស្សលើសពីពីរនាក់ និងការរឹតត្បិត​សកម្មភាព​ធ្វើដំណើរ និងក្រៅផ្ទះដែល​ចាត់​ទុក​មាន​ភាព​ចាំបាច់ជា​ដាច់​ខាត​​។
