sourceString: The activity has created a shortage of baby formula in some supermarkets and was subsequently banned by the Australian government.Despite the high prevalence of COVID-19 cases in Northern Italy and the Wuhan region, and the ensuing high demand for food products, both areas have been spared from acute food shortages.
targetString: សកម្មភាពនេះបានបង្កើតឲ្យ​មានកង្វះម្សៅ​ទឹកដោះគោ​កូនក្មេង​នៅតាមផ្សារទំនើប និង​ចុងក្រោយ​ត្រូវបាន​ដាក់បម្រាម​ដោយ​រដ្ឋាភិបាលអូស្ត្រាលី។ ថ្វីបើការរាតត្បាតនៃករណីកើតជំងឺ COVID-19 មានកម្រិតខ្ពស់នៅ​ក្នុងតំបន់​ភាគខាងជើង​ប្រទេស​អ៊ីតាលី និងតំបន់ក្រុង វូហាន ហើយ​តម្រូវការ​ផលិតផល​ចំណី​អាហារ​មាន​ការ​កើន​ឡើង​ខ្ពស់​​ជា​បន្ត​បន្ទាប់ក៏ដោយ​ តំបន់​ទាំងពីរនេះ​ត្រូវ​បាន​រួច​ផុត​​ពីកង្វះខាតចំណីអាហារយ៉ាងធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ​។
en-mt: The activity created a lack of milk powder, kids around the supermarket and ultimately banned by the state Although the epidemic of COVID-19 contracts is high in the mouth Northern Italy and Wuhan regions and food production demand increases In subsequent highs, both areas are surviving severe food shortages.

sourceString: Measures by China and Italy against the hoarding and illicit trade of critical products have been successful, avoiding acute food shortages that were anticipated in Europe as well as in North America.
targetString: វិធានការណ៍របស់ប្រទេសចិន និងប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីប្រឆាំងនឹងការធ្វើពាណិជ្ជកម្មផលិតផលខុសច្បាប់ និងខុសច្បាប់បានទទួលជោគជ័យដោយចៀសវាងការខ្វះខាតស្បៀងអាហារស្រួចស្រាវដែលត្រូវបានគេរំពឹងទុកនៅអឺរ៉ុបក៏ដូចជានៅអាមេរិកខាងជើង។
en-mt: China and Italy measures against illegal and illegal product trade succeeded by Jia Avails the lack of liquor foods that are expected in Europe as well as in North America.

sourceString: Northern Italy with its significant agricultural production has not seen a large reduction, but prices may increase according to industry representatives.
targetString: ប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីភាគខាងជើង ផលិតកម្ម​កសិកម្ម​ដ៏​សំខាន់​របស់ខ្លួន មិនមានការថយចុះច្រើនទេ ប៉ុន្តែ​តម្លៃ​អាចនឹងកើនឡើង យោងទៅតាម​អ្នកតំណាង​ឧស្សាហកម្ម។
en-mt: Northern Italy its main agricultural production has not decreased much, but prices may rise according to industry representatives.

sourceString: Empty food shelves were only encountered temporarily, even in Wuhan city, while Chinese government officials released pork reserves to assure sufficient nourishment of the population.
targetString: ចំណីអាហារបានអស់ពីធ្នើហាង​លក់​ទំនិញ​ជា​បណ្តោះ​អាសន្ន សូម្បីតែនៅក្នុងទីក្រុងវូហាន ខណៈដែល​មន្រ្តី​រដ្ឋាភិបាលចិនបានបញ្ចេញ សាច់ជ្រូកបម្រុង ដើម្បី​ធានាដល់​ការបម្រុង​អាហារ​ដល់ប្រជាជន។
en-mt: Food temporarily runs out of shopping, even in Wuhan, Kn., Where Chinese government officials have released spare pork to ensure food reservations to the people.

sourceString: Similar laws exist in Italy requiring food producers to keep reserves for such emergencies.
targetString: ច្បាប់ស្រដៀងគ្នានេះមាននៅក្នុងប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលីដែលតម្រូវឱ្យអ្នកផលិតម្ហូបអាហាររក្សាទុកបម្រុងសម្រាប់ភាពអាសន្នបែបនេះ។
en-mt: Similar laws exist in Italy that require food producers to retain reserves for this kind of emergency.

sourceString: Damage to the global economy has been felt in China: according to a media report on 16 March, the economy in China was very hard hit in the first two months of 2020 due to the measures taken by the government to curtail virus spread, and retail sales plunged 20.5%.
targetString: ការបំផ្លាញដល់សេដ្ឋកិច្ចពិភពលោកត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញនៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិន៖ យោងតាមរបាយការណ៍តាមប្រព័ន្ធផ្សព្វផ្សាយនៅថ្ងៃទី 16 ខែមីនា សេដ្ឋកិច្ចប្រទេសចិនបានទទួលរងផលប៉ះពាល់យ៉ាងខ្លាំងក្នុងរយៈពេលពីរខែដំបូងនៃឆ្នាំ 2020 ដោយសារតែវិធានការរបស់រដ្ឋាភិបាលក្នុងការកាត់បន្ថយការរីករាលដាលនៃមេរោគ និងការលក់រាយ។ ការលក់បានធ្លាក់ចុះ 20.5%។
en-mt: Damaging the global economy is visible in China: According to media reports on March 16, China's economy was affected Dramatically in the opening two months of 2020 because of government measures to reduce the spread of viruses and retail sales; sales fell by 20.5%.

sourceString: As mainland China is a major economy and manufacturing hub, the viral outbreak has been seen to pose a major destabilizing threat to the global economy.
targetString: ដោយចិនដីគោកគឺជាផ្នែកដ៏ចម្បងសម្រាប់សេដ្ឋកិច្ច និងផលិតកម្ម ការផ្ទុះនៃជំងឺនេះត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញថាបានបង្កើតជាការគំរាមកំហែងដ៏ធំក្នុងការបង្កអស្ថិរភាពទៅលើសេដ្ឋកិច្ចសកលលោក។
en-mt: With dry China being the main part for the economy and manufacturing, the outbreak of the disease is seen to have created as a major threat to creating instability to the global economy.

sourceString: Agathe Demarais of the Economist Intelligence Unit has forecast that markets will remain volatile until a clearer image emerges on potential outcomes.
targetString: លោក Agathe Demarais នៃ Economist Intelligence Unit បានព្យាករណ៍ថា ទីផ្សារនឹងនៅតែ​មានស្ថេរភាព​រហូត​ដល់រូបភាពច្បាស់​លេចចេញ​លើ​លទ្ធផល​សក្តានុពល។
en-mt: Agathe Demarais of Economist Intelligence Unit predicts that the market will remain stable until a clear picture appears on potential outcomes.

sourceString: In January 2020, some analysts estimated that the economic fallout of the epidemic on global growth could surpass that of the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak.
targetString: នៅខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020 អ្នកវិភាគខ្លះបានប៉ាន់ស្មានថាការធ្លាក់ចុះនៃសេដ្ឋកិច្ចដោយសារការរាតត្បាតលើសកលលោកអាចកើនលើសការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺ SARS ឆ្នាំ 2002–2004។
en-mt: In January 2020, some analysts speculated that the slowdown in the economy due to the global epidemic could surpass the 2002-2004 outbreak of SARS.

sourceString: One estimate from an expert at Washington University in St. Louis gave a $300+ billion impact on the world's supply chain that could last up to two years.
targetString: ការប៉ាន់ប្រមាណមួយពីអ្នកជំនាញនៅសាកល​វិទ្យាល័យ​វ៉ាស៊ីនតោននៅ St. Louis បាន​ផ្តល់នូវ​ផលប៉ះពាល់​ចំនួនជាង 300 ពាន់លានដុល្លារ​ទៅលើខ្សែ​សង្វាក់​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​ពិភពលោកដែលអាច​មានរយៈពេល​រហូត​ដល់ពីរឆ្នាំ។
en-mt: An estimate from experts at the University of Washington at St. Louis has given more than 300 billion dollars in impact on the global supply chain, potentially lasting for as much as two years.

sourceString: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) reportedly "scrambled" after a steep decline in oil prices due to lower demand from China.
targetString: អង្គការនៃប្រទេសដែល​នាំចេញប្រេងឆៅ (OPEC) បាន​រាយការណ៍​មកថា “មានការជ្រួលច្របល់” បន្ទាប់ពី​មាន​ការធ្លាក់ចុះតម្លៃ​ប្រេងខ្ពស់ដោយ​សារ​មាន​តម្រូវការ​ទាប​ពី​ប្រទេស​ចិន។
en-mt: The Organisation of Crude Oil Exporting Countries (OPEC) has reported "dilapidated" following a high drop in oil prices due to low demand from China.

sourceString: Global stock markets fell on 24 February due to a significant rise in the number of COVID-19 cases outside mainland China.
targetString: ទីផ្សារភាគហ៊ុនសកលបានធ្លាក់ចុះ នៅថ្ងៃទី 24 ខែកុម្ភៈ ដោយសារមានការកើនឡើងគួរអោយកត់សម្គាល់នូវជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលស្ថិតនៅក្រៅប្រទេសចិនដីគោក។
en-mt: The global stock market fell on February 24 due to a significant increase in COVID-19 diseases outside of dry China.

sourceString: On 27 February, due to mounting worries about the coronavirus outbreak, various U.S. stock indexes including the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500 Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their sharpest falls since 2008, with the Dow falling 1,191 points, the largest one-day drop since the financial crisis of 2007–08.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 27 ខែកុម្ភៈ ដោយសារមានការព្រួយបារម្ភកាន់តែខ្លាំងអំពីការផ្ទុះវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា សន្ទស្សន៍ភាគហ៊ុនផ្សេងៗនៅសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិករួមទាំង NASDAQ-100, S&P 500 Index និង Dow Jones Industrial Average បានបង្ហោះអំពីការធ្លាក់ចុះយ៉ាងឆាប់រហ័សបំផុតមិនធ្លាប់មានតាំងពីឆ្នាំ 2008 មក ដោយ Dow ធ្លាក់ចុះ 1,191 ពិន្ទុ ដែលជាការធ្លាក់ចុះច្រើនបំផុតក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ ចាប់តាំងពីវិបត្តិហិរញ្ញវត្ថុកាលពីឆ្នាំ 2007–08 មក។
en-mt: On February 27, due to deepening concerns about the outbreak of cholera, varied stock indexes in the United States, including NASDAQ-100, S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average have posted the most rapid decline ever since 2008 by Dow T Fall 1,191 points, the most drop in a day since the financial crisis from 2007 to 08.

sourceString: All three indexes ended the week down more than 10%.
targetString: សន្ទស្សន៍ទាំងបីបានបញ្ចប់នៅសប្តាហ៍នេះធ្លាក់ចុះជាង 10% ។
en-mt: All three indices ended this week down more than 10%.

sourceString: On 28 February, Scope Ratings GmbH affirmed China's sovereign credit rating, but maintained a Negative Outlook.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែកុម្ភៈ ក្រុមហ៊ុន Scope Ratings GmbH បានបញ្ជាក់ពីចំណាត់ថ្នាក់កេរ្តិ៍ឈ្មោះអធិបតេយ្យរបស់ប្រទេសចិន ប៉ុន្តែបានរក្សានូវទស្សនវិស័យអវិជ្ជមាន។
en-mt: On February 28, Scope Ratings GmbH confirmed China's sovereign reputation rankings but maintained a negative perspective.

sourceString: Stocks plunged again based on coronavirus fears, the largest fall being on 16 March.
targetString: ផ្សារភាគហ៊ុនបានដំក្បាលចុះម្ដងទៀតដោយសារមានការភ័យខ្លាចអំពីជំងឺកូរ៉ូណា ការធ្លាក់ចុះខ្លាំងបំផុតកើតឡើងនៅថ្ងៃទី16 ខែមីនា។
en-mt: Stock markets have raised their heads down again because of fears about cholera, the steepest drop occurs on March 16.

sourceString: Many consider an economic recession to be likely.
targetString: មនុស្សជាច្រើនគិតថា ការធ្លាក់ចុះនៃសេដ្ឋកិច្ចទំនងជាមិនអាចជៀសផុតបាន។
en-mt: Many people think the recession's downturn is unlikely to be inescapable.

sourceString: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised central banks' and states' timely emergency measures.
targetString: សេដ្ឋវិទូ Mohamed El-Erian បានកោត​សរសើរ​ចំពោះ​វិធានការអាសន្ន​ទាន់​ពេល​វេលា​របស់ធនាគារកណ្តាល និងរដ្ឋ។
en-mt: Economist Mohamed El-Erian praised the timely emergency measures of the central and state banks.

sourceString: Central banks are reacting more quickly than they did to the 2008 financial crash.
targetString: ធនាគារកណ្ដាលបានធ្វើការចាត់វិធានការលឿនជាងអ្វីដែលពួកគេបានធ្វើ កាលពីវិបត្តិហិរញ្ញវត្ថុកាលពីឆ្នាំ 2008។
en-mt: The central bank took steps faster than they did in the financial crisis of 2008.

sourceString: Tourism is one of the worst affected sectors due to travel bans, closing of public places including travel attractions, and advice of governments against any travel all over the world.
targetString: វិស័យទេសចរណ៍ទទួលរងផលអាក្រក់បំផុតក្នុង​ចំណោម​វិស័យផ្សេងទៀត ​ដោយសារតែ​ការហាមឃាត់​ការធ្វើដំណើរ ការបិទកន្លែងសាធារណៈ​រួមទាំង​ការទាក់ទាញទេសចរណ៍ និងដំបូន្មានរបស់​រដ្ឋាភិបាលប្រឆាំងនឹងការធ្វើដំណើរទូទាំងពិភពលោក។
en-mt: Tourism suffers worst affects alike, alike, due to travel bans, shutdowns Public, including the attraction of tourism and government advice against global travel.

sourceString: As a consequence, numerous airlines have cancelled flights due to lower demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines, and Qantas, while British regional airline Flybe collapsed.
targetString: ជាផលវិបាក ក្រុមហ៊ុនអាកាសចរណ៍​ជាច្រើនបានលុបចោលជើងហោះហើរ​ដោយសារតែ​តម្រូវ​ការទាប រួមមានអាកាសចរណ៍ British Airways, China Eastern Airlines និង Qantas ខណៈដែលក្រុមហ៊ុនអាកាសចរណ៍ក្នុងតំបន់អង់គ្លេស Flybe បានដួលរលំ។
en-mt: As a consequence, many airlines canceled flights because of low demand, including British Airways, China Eastern Airlines and Qantas as British airline Flybe collapsed.

sourceString: The impact on the cruise line industry was at a level never seen before.
targetString: ផលប៉ះពាល់លើឧស្សាហកម្មជិះទូកកម្សាន្ត គឺស្ថិតក្នុងកម្រិតមួយដែលមិនធ្លាប់មានពីមុនមក។
en-mt: The impact on the recreational sailing industry is at an unprecedented extent.

sourceString: Several train stations and ferry ports have also been closed.
targetString: ស្ថានីយរថភ្លើងនិងកំពង់ផែសាឡាងជាច្រើនក៏ត្រូវបានបិទផងដែរ។
en-mt: Many railway and port stations were also closed.

sourceString: The epidemic coincided with the Chunyun, a major travel season associated with the Chinese New Year holiday.
targetString: ការរាតត្បាតកើតឡើងស្របពេលនឹងពិធីបុណ្យជុនយុន ដែលជារដូវធ្វើដំណើរដ៏សំខាន់មួយដែលទាក់ទងនឹងថ្ងៃឈប់សម្រាកចូលឆ្នាំចិន។
en-mt: The epidemic occurs in parallel to the Jun-jun Festival, a major travel season involving the Chinese holidays.

sourceString: A number of events involving large crowds were cancelled by national and regional governments, including annual New Year festivals, with private companies also independently closing their shops and tourist attractions such as Hong Kong Disneyland and Shanghai Disneyland.
targetString: ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍ជាច្រើនដែលទាក់ទងនឹងហ្វូងមនុស្សដ៏ច្រើនត្រូវបានលុបចោលដោយរដ្ឋាភិបាលជាតិ និងតំបន់​រួមទាំងពិធីបុណ្យចូលឆ្នាំថ្មី ជាមួយនឹងក្រុមហ៊ុនឯកជន​ក៏បិទហាង និងកន្លែងទាក់ទាញភ្ញៀវទេសចរ​របស់​ពួកគេដែរ ដូចជា Disneyland នៅហុងកុង និងនៅសៀងហៃ។
en-mt: Several events involving large crowds have been cancelled by national and regional governments, including New Year's Celebrations With private companies, they also close their shops and visitor attractions, such as Disneyland in Hong Kong and in Shanghai.

sourceString: Many Lunar New Year events and tourist attractions have been closed to prevent mass gatherings, including the Forbidden City in Beijing and traditional temple fairs.
targetString: ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍បុណ្យចូលឆ្នាំថ្មី និងកន្លែងទាក់ទាញភ្ញៀវទេសចរជាច្រើនត្រូវបានបិទ ដើម្បីរារាំងការប្រមូលផ្តុំទ្រង់ទ្រាយធំ រួមមានរាជវាំងបុរាណ (Forbidden City) ក្នុងទីក្រុងប៉េកាំង និងពិធីពិព័រណ៍ប្រាសាទតាមបែបប្រពៃណីផ្សេងៗ។
en-mt: New Year's Eve events and many visitor attractions have been closed to prevent format collection It includes forbidden City palace in Beijing and varied traditional monument exhibitions.

sourceString: In 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities extended the New Year's holiday to 10 February, instructing most workplaces not to re-open until that date.
targetString: ខេត្ត ក្រុង និងតំបន់​ចំនួន 24 ក្នុងចំណោមខេត្តទាំង 31 របស់​ប្រទេសចិន អាជ្ញាធរ​ បានពន្យារ​ពេល​ឈប់​សម្រាកបុណ្យ​ចូលឆ្នាំថ្មីដល់ថ្ងៃទី 10 ខែកុម្ភៈ ដោយ​បាន​ណែនាំកន្លែងធ្វើការភាគច្រើនមិនឱ្យបើកឡើងវិញរហូតដល់កាលបរិច្ឆេទនោះ។
en-mt: 24 of China's 31 provinces, municipalities and regions, authorities have postponed the anniversary holiday Until February 10, having instructed most workplaces not to reopen until that date.

sourceString: These regions represented 80% of the country's GDP and 90% of exports.
targetString: តំបន់ទាំងនេះ តំណាងឱ្យ 80% នៃផលិតផលក្នុងស្រុក​សរុប​របស់ប្រទេស និង 90% នៃការនាំចេញ។
en-mt: These regions represent 80% of the country's gross domestic product and 90% of exports.

sourceString: Hong Kong raised its infectious disease response level to the highest and declared an emergency, closing schools until March and cancelling its New Year celebrations.The retail sector has been impacted globally, with reductions in store hours or temporary closures.
targetString: ហុងកុងបាន​បង្កើនកម្រិត​ឆ្លើយតប​ទៅកាន់​ជំងឺឆ្លង​ទៅ​កាន់កម្រិតខ្ពស់បំផុត និងប្រកាសភាព​អាសន្ន​ដោយ​ធ្វើការ​បិទសាលារៀនរហូតដល់ខែមីនា និង​លុបចោល​រាល់​ការ​ប្រារព្ធ​បុណ្យចូលឆ្នាំទាំងអស់។ វិស័យ​លក់រាយ​បាន​ទទួល​រង​​ការ​ប៉ះពាល់ពេញ​សកលលោក ជាមួយ​ការ​កាត់បន្ថយ​ម៉ោងលក់ ឬបិទ​ជា​បណ្ដោះអាសន្ន។
en-mt: Hong Kong has increased infected response levels to the highest levels and declared a state of emergency by closing schools until March and erasing locks The retail sector has been affected throughout the globe with a reduction in sales or temporary closures.

sourceString: Visits to retailers in Europe and Latin America declined by 40%.
targetString: ការចូលទៅ​កន្លែង​អ្នកលក់រាយនៅអឺរ៉ុប និង​អាមេរិក​ឡាទីន​បានធ្លាក់ចុះ 40%។
en-mt: Access to European and Latin American retailers fell by 40%.

sourceString: North America and Middle East retailers saw a 50–60% drop.
targetString: អ្នកលក់រាយនៅអាមេរិកខាងជើង និងមជ្ឈិមបូព៌ាបានឃើញការធ្លាក់ចុះពី 50–60%។
en-mt: Retailers in North America and the Middle East have seen a drop from 50 to 60%.

sourceString: This also resulted in a 33–43% drop in foot traffic to shopping centres in March compared to February.
targetString: នេះក៏បណ្តាលឱ្យមានការធ្លាក់ចុះចំនួន 33–43% នៃចរាចរណ៍ដោយថ្មើរជើងទៅកាន់ផ្សារលក់ទំនិញនៅខែមីនាផងដែរ បើប្រៀបធៀបទៅនឹងខែកុម្ភៈ។
en-mt: This also caused a 33-43% drop in pedestrian traffic to the sales market in March compared to February.

sourceString: Shopping mall operators around the world imposed additional measures, such increased sanitation, installation of thermal scanners to check the temperature of shoppers, and cancellation of events.According to a United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America estimate, the pandemic-induced recession could leave between 14 and 22 million more people in extreme poverty in Latin America than would have been in that situation without the pandemic.
targetString: ប្រតិបត្តិករផ្សារទំនើបនៅជុំវិញពិភពលោកបានដាក់ចេញនូវវិធានការណ៍បន្ថែមដូចជាអនាម័យកើនឡើងការតំឡើងម៉ាស៊ីនស្កែនកម្ដៅដើម្បីពិនិត្យមើលសីតុណ្ហភាពរបស់អ្នកដើរផ្សារ និងលុបចោលព្រឹត្តិការណ៍នានា។ យោងតាមការប៉ាន់ស្មានរបស់គណៈកម្មការសេដ្ឋកិច្ចរបស់អង្គការសហប្រជាជាតិសម្រាប់អាមេរិកឡាទីនវិបត្តិដែលបណ្តាលមកពីការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺរាតត្បាតអាចស្ថិតនៅចន្លោះ ប្រជាជន 14 និង 22 លាននាក់ស្ថិតក្នុងភាពក្រីក្រខ្លាំងនៅអាមេរិកឡាទីនច្រើនជាងនៅក្នុងស្ថានភាពនោះដោយមិនមានការរាតត្បាត។
en-mt: Supermarket operators around the globe have put forward additional measures, like sanitation, increased scanner installation Heat to check the temperature of market-goers and cancel events. United Nations for Latin America, a crisis caused by the spread of pandemics could be in the design Between 14 and 22 million people are in extreme poverty in Latin America than in that situation without epidemic.

sourceString: In January and February 2020, during the height of the epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.
targetString: កាលពីខែមករា និងកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ក្នុងអំឡុង​ពេល​នៃ​ការ​រាត​ត្បាត​​ខ្ពស់ក្នុងទីក្រុងវូហាន ប្រជាជនប្រហែល 5 លាន​នាក់​នៅ​ក្នុង​​ប្រទេសចិនបានបាត់បង់ការងាររបស់ពួកគេ។
en-mt: In January and February 2020, during the high epidemic in Wuhan, about 5 million people in China lost their jobs.

sourceString: Many of China's nearly 300 million rural migrant workers have been stranded at home in inland provinces or trapped in Hubei province.In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government aid.
targetString: កម្មករចំណាក​ស្រុកតាមជនបទ​របស់ចិនជាច្រើន​ដែលមានចំនួន​ជិត 300 លាននាក់​ត្រូវបាន​ឲ្យស្ថិតនៅផ្ទះ​នៅក្នុង​ខេត្តដីគោក ឬជាប់​នៅក្នុង​ខេត្ត Hubei ។ កាលពីខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ប្រជាជន​អាមេរិក​លើសពី 10 លាននាក់បាន​បាត់បង់ការងារធ្វើ ហើយ​បាន​ដាក់​ពាក្យ​ស្នើសុំ​ជំនួយពីរដ្ឋាភិបាល។
en-mt: Many rural Chinese migrant workers of nearly 300 million have been stayed home in the dry province or trapped in Hube province In March 2020, more than 10 million Americans lost their jobs and applied for government assistance.

sourceString: The coronavirus outbreak could cost 47 million jobs in the United States and unemployment rate may hit 32%, according to estimates by the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.The lockdown in India has left tens of millions of Indian migrant workers (who are paid through daily wages) unemployed.The survey from the Angus Reid Institute found that 44% of Canadian households have experienced some type of unemployment.Nearly 900,000 workers lost their jobs in Spain since it went into lockdown in mid-March 2020.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះជំងឺកូរ៉ូណាអាចធ្វើឲ្យបាត់បង់ការងារចំនួន 47 លានការងារនៅសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក ហើយអត្រានៃអ្នកដែលគ្មានការងារធ្វើអាចកើនឡើងដល់ 32% នេះបើយោងតាមការព្យាការណ៍របស់ Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis។ ការឲ្យស្នាក់នៅផ្ទះនៅឥណ្ឌាបានធ្វើឲ្យកម្មករចំណាកស្រុកឥណ្ឌាចំនួនដប់លាននាក់បាត់បង់ការងារធ្វើ (ដែលពួកគេទទួលបានប្រាក់បៀវត្សប្រចាំថ្ងៃ)។ ការស្ទង់មតិចេញពីវិទ្យាស្ថាន Angus Reid បានរកឃើញថាគ្រួសារនៅកាណាដាចំនួន 44% បានជួបបទពិសោធន៍នៃការគ្មានការងារធ្វើ។ បុគ្គលិកប្រហែល 900,000 នាក់នៅអេស្ប៉ាញបានបាត់បង់ការងាររបស់ពួកគេ ចាប់តាំងពីប្រទេសបានចេញបញ្ជាឲ្យប្រជាជននៅផ្ទះកាលពីពាក់កណ្ដាលខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020។
en-mt: A cholera outbreak could cost the loss of 47 million jobs in the United States, and the rate of unemployed could rise to 32%, according to Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis: Staying at home in India has caused ten million Indian migrant workers to lose their jobs (which they receive daily salaries). Minimally from the Angus Reid Institute, 44% of Canadian households experienced unemployment experience. Spanish people have lost their jobs since the country ordered people at home in mid-March 2020.

sourceString: During the second half of March, 4 million French workers applied for temporary unemployment benefits and 1 million British workers applied for a universal credit scheme.Almost half a million companies in Germany have sent their workers on a government-subsidized short-time working schemes known as Kurzarbeit.
targetString: ក្នុងកំឡុងពេលពាក់កណ្ដាលខែមីនា បុគ្គលិកបារាំងចំនួន 4 លាននាក់បាន​ដាក់ពាក្យស្នើ​សុំអត្ថប្រយោជន៍​សម្រាប់ការ​មិន​មាន​ការងារធ្វើជា​បណ្ដោះអាសន្ន ហើយ​បុគ្គលិក​ចក្រភពអង់គ្លេស​ចំនួន 1 លាននាក់បានដាក់ពាក្យស្នើសុំ​គម្រោងក្រេឌីត​សកល។ ក្រុមហ៊ុនប្រមាណកន្លះ​លាន​នៅ​ប្រទេស​អាឡឺម៉ង់បានបញ្ជូនបុគ្គលិក​របស់​ពួកគេចូលក្នុង​គម្រោង​ធ្វើការរយៈពេល​ខ្លីដោយ​មាន​ការ​ឧបត្ថម្ភ​ពី​រដ្ឋាភិបាល​ដោយ​ត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ថា Kurzarbeit ។
en-mt: During mid-March, 4 million French employees applied for benefits For temporary unemployment, and 1 million UK employees submitted Approximately half a million companies in Germany have sent staff Their frozen into a short-term working project with government sponsors, known as Kurzarbeit.

sourceString: The German short-time work compensation scheme has been adopted by France and Britain.
targetString: គ្រោងការណ៍សំណងការងាររយៈពេលខ្លីរបស់អាឡឺម៉ង់ត្រូវបានអនុម័តដោយបារាំង និងអង់គ្លេស។
en-mt: The short-term German work compensation scheme was approved by France and England.

sourceString: The performing arts and cultural heritage sectors have been profoundly affected by the pandemic, impacting organizations' operations as well as individuals—both employed and independent—globally.
targetString: វិស័យសិល្បៈ និង​បេតិកភណ្ឌ​វប្បធម៌​បានទទួលរង​ផល​ប៉ះពាល់យ៉ាងខ្លាំងពីជំងឺរាតត្បាត ដែលជះឥទ្ធិពល​ដល់​ប្រតិបត្តិការរបស់អង្គភាពក៏ដូចជាបុគ្គល—ទាំងការងារ និងឯករាជ្យ—ទូទាំងពិភពលោក។
en-mt: The arts and cultural heritage sector has been deeply affected by pandemics that affect the operations of the unit as well as individuals—both work and independence—globally.

sourceString: Arts and culture sector organizations attempted to uphold their (often publicly funded) mission to provide access to cultural heritage to the community, maintain the safety of their employees and the public, and support artists where possible.
targetString: អង្គការវិស័យសិល្បៈ និងវប្បធម៌បានព្យាយាម​លើកស្ទួយ​បេសកកម្ម​របស់ពួកគេ (ជាញឹកញាប់​ត្រូវបានផ្តល់​មូលនិធិ​ជាសាធារណៈ) ដើម្បីផ្តល់នូវសិទ្ធិ​ទទួលបាន​បេតិកភណ្ឌ​វប្បធម៌​ដល់សហគមន៍ ថែរក្សាសុវត្ថិភាពដល់បុគ្គលិក និង​សាធារណជនរបស់ពួកគេ និងគាំទ្រដល់សិល្បករ​តាម​ដែល​អាច​ធ្វើទៅបាន។
en-mt: Art and cultural organisations have sought to promote their mission (often publicly funded) to grant access to access Cultural heritage to the community takes care of the safety of their staff and the public, and supports artists as far as possible.

sourceString: By March 2020, across the world and to varying degrees, museums, libraries, performance venues, and other cultural institutions had been indefinitely closed with their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or postponed.
targetString: ត្រឹមខែមីនាឆ្នាំ 2020 ទូទាំងពិភពលោក និងនៅ​គ្រប់​កម្រិត សារមន្ទីរ បណ្ណាល័យ កន្លែងសម្តែង និង​ស្ថាប័ន​វប្បធម៌ផ្សេងទៀត ត្រូវបានបិទទាំងស្រុង​ដោយ​ការតាំងពិព័រណ៍ ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍ និងការសម្តែង​របស់​ពួកគេត្រូវបានលុបចោល ឬពន្យារ។
en-mt: By March 2020 globally and at all levels, museums, libraries, performances and institutions Other cultures are completely sealed off by their exhibitions, events and performances cancelled or delayed.

sourceString: In response there were intensive efforts to provide alternative services through digital platforms.Another recent and rapidly accelerating fallout of the disease is the cancellation of religious services, major events in sports, and other social events, such as music festivals and concerts, technology conferences, and fashion shows.
targetString: ជាការឆ្លើយតបមានកិច្ចខិតខំប្រឹងប្រែងយ៉ាងខ្លាំង​ក្នុងការផ្តល់សេវាជំនួសតាមរយៈវេទិកាឌីជីថល។ ការធ្លាក់ចុះនៃជំងឺនេះកាន់តែលឿន និងឆាប់រហ័សនា​ពេល​ថ្មី​ៗ​នេះ គឺការលុបចោលសេវាសាសនា ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍​សំខាន់ៗក្នុងកីឡា និង​ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍​សង្គម​ផ្សេងៗ ដូចជាពិធីបុណ្យតន្ត្រី និងការប្រគំតន្ត្រី សន្និសីទបច្ចេកវិទ្យា និងការបង្ហាញម៉ូត។
en-mt: In response, there have been great efforts to provide alternative services via the digital platform. The cancellation of religion services, major events in sports and social events, such as music festivals and music concerts, technological conferences and motor shows.

sourceString: The film industry has also experienced disruption.The Vatican announced that Holy Week observances in Rome, which occur during the last week of the Christian penitential season of Lent, have been cancelled.
targetString: ឧស្សាហកម្មខ្សែភាពយន្តក៏បានជួបប្រទះការរអាក់រអួល​ផងដែរ។ បុរីវ៉ាទីកង់បានប្រកាសថា ការសម្ដែង​សប្តាហ៍​បរិសុទ្ធនៅទីក្រុងរ៉ូម ដែល​កើតឡើង​ក្នុងសប្តាហ៍​ចុង​ក្រោយ​​នៃរដូវបុណ្យគ្រឹស្តសាសនា ត្រូវបាន​លុប​ចោល។
en-mt: The film industry also experienced disruption. The Holy Week in Rome, which takes place in the final week of the holiday season, has been cancelled.

sourceString: Many dioceses have recommended older Christians to stay at home rather than attending Mass on Sundays; some churches have made church services available via radio, online live streaming or television while others are offering drive-in worship.
targetString: តំបន់ដែលគ្រប់គ្រងដោយចៅអធិការក្នុងសាសនាគ្រឹស្តជាច្រើនបានណែនាំអោយគ្រឹស្តបរិស័ទដែលមានវ័យចាស់ជរាស្នាក់នៅផ្ទះ ជំនួសឱ្យការជួបជុំគ្នានៅថ្ងៃអាទិត្យ។ ព្រះវិហារខ្លះបានផ្ដល់សេវាតាមរយៈវិទ្យុ ការផ្សាយបន្តផ្ទាល់តាមអ៊ីនធឺណិត ឬទូរទស្សន៍ ខណៈដែលព្រះវិហារខ្លះទៀតអាចឱ្យគោរពបូជាដោយបើកឡានចូល។
en-mt: The landscape, ruled by many evangelical grandchildren, recommended that elderly householders stay at home instead of getting together on Sundays. Some churches have provided radio services, live broadcasts online or television, while others can be worn by driving a car.

sourceString: With the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome closing its churches and chapels and St. Peter's Square emptied of Christian pilgrims, other religious bodies also cancelled services and limited public gatherings in churches, mosques, synagogues, temples and gurdwaras.
targetString: ដោយមានការបិទព្រះវិហាររ៉ូម៉ាំងកាតូលិក (Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome) នៃភូមិភាគរ៉ូមរបស់ខ្លួន និងព្រះវិហារតូច ព្រមទាំងព្រះវិហារ St. Peter's Square ដោយគ្មានអ្នកធម្មយាត្រាសាសនាគ្រឹស្ត ហើយគ្រឹស្តបរិស័ទផ្សេងទៀតក៏បានលុបចោលកម្មវិធីថ្វាយបង្គំព្រះជាម្ចាស់ និងការជួបជុំគ្នាជាសាធារណៈត្រូវបានដាក់កំណត់នៅក្នុងព្រះវិហារគ្រឹស្ត វិហារអ៊ីស្លាម សាលាប្រជុំ ប្រាសាទ និងព្រះវិហារគោរពបូជារបស់ស៊ីកជាដើម។
en-mt: With the closure of the Roman Catholic Church (Roman Catholic Diocese of Rome) of its Roman village and the small church as well as St. Peter's Square, without a pilgrimage of the evangelizer, and other Sacred Sacrifices canceled the worth of the God and the Judges Public gatherings are designated in the Church of The Church, Muslims, Synagogues, and Sikh worst temples.

sourceString: Iran's Health Ministry announced the cancellation of Friday prayers in areas affected by the outbreak and shrines were later closed, while Saudi Arabia banned the entry of foreign pilgrims as well as its residents to holy sites in Mecca and Medina.
targetString: ក្រសួងសុខាភិបាលអ៊ីរ៉ង់បានប្រកាសអំពីការលុបចោលការ​អធិស្ឋានប្រចាំ​ថ្ងៃសុក្រនៅតាម​តំបន់នានា ដែល​រងឥទ្ធិពល ដោយ​ការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺ ហើយ​ក្រោយ​មកទៀត​ទីសក្ការៈ​នានាត្រូវបានបិទ ខណៈដែល​អារ៉ាប់ប៊ីសាអូឌីត​បានដាក់​បម្រាម​ហាម​មិនឲ្យអ្នកធ្វើធម្មយាត្រាបរទេសចូលមកក្នុងប្រទេស ក៏ដូច​ជា​ហាមមិនឲ្យប្រជាជនក្នុងប្រទេសធ្វើដំណើរទៅកាន់​ទីសក្ការៈនៅទីក្រុងមេកា និងម៉ាឌីណា។
en-mt: The Iranian Ministry of Health announced the cancellation of daily prayers in areas affected by the spread of the disease and later shut down Saudi Arabia has banned foreign pilgrims from entering the country, as well as forbidding the people of the country to travel to sanctuaries in Mecca and Madia.

sourceString: The pandemic has caused the most significant disruption to the worldwide sporting calendar since the Second World War.
targetString: រោគរាតត្បាតបានបង្កឱ្យមានការរំខានគួរឱ្យកត់សម្គាល់បំផុតចំពោះតារាងប្រកួតកីឡាទូទាំងពិភពលោកចាប់តាំងពីសង្គ្រាមលោកលើកទីពីរមក។
en-mt: The epidemic has posed the most noticeable disruption to the global sports competition chart since the Second War.

sourceString: Most major sporting events have been either cancelled or postponed, including the 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.
targetString: ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍កីឡាសំខាន់ៗភាគច្រើនត្រូវបានលុបចោល ឬពន្យាពេលរួមទាំងព្រឹត្តិការណ៍ 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season។
en-mt: Most major sporting events have been cancelled or delayed, including 2019–20 UEFA Champions League, 2019–20 Premier League, UEFA Euro 2020, 2019–20 NBA season, and 2019–20 NHL season.

sourceString: The outbreak disrupted plans for the 2020 Summer Olympics, which were originally scheduled to start at the end of July; the International Olympic Committee announced on 24 March that the event will be "rescheduled to a date beyond 2020 but not later than summer 2021".Casinos and other gaming venues worldwide have closed and live poker tournaments have been either postponed or cancelled.
targetString: ការផ្ទុះជំងឺបានបង្អាក់ដល់ផែនការសម្រាប់ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍​អូឡាំពិករដូវក្តៅឆ្នាំ 2020 ដែលដើមឡើយ​គ្រោង​នឹង​ចាប់ផ្តើមនៅចុងខែកក្កដា។ គណៈកម្មាធិការអូឡាំពិក​អន្តរជាតិបានប្រកាសកាលពីថ្ងៃទី 24 ខែមីនាថា ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍​នេះនឹងត្រូវបានកំណត់​ពេលវេលា​ឡើង​វិញ​ក្រោយឆ្នាំ 2020 ប៉ុន្តែមិនយូរជាងរដូវក្តៅឆ្នាំ 2021 ឡើយ។ កាស៊ីណូ និង​កន្លែង​លេងល្បែង​ដទៃទៀត​​នៅទូទាំងពិភពលោកបានបិទ ហើយ​ការប្រកួត​ល្បែងបៀ​ត្រូវបានពន្យារពេល ឬលុបចោល។
en-mt: Disease outbreak discouraged plans for the originally planned 2020 Summer Olympic event The International Olympic Committee announced on March 24 The event will be rescheduled after 2020, but no longer than summer 2021. No and other gaming venues around the globe closed and beer games were postponed or cancelled.

sourceString: This has led many gamblers to move online, with many online gambling sites reporting significant increases in their rates of new sign-ups.The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspending or cancelling concert tours.
targetString: សកម្មភាពនេះបានធ្វើឱ្យអ្នកលេងល្បែងជាច្រើនផ្លាស់ប្តូរមកលេងតាមអ៊ីនធឺណិត ដោយមានគេហទំព័រលេងល្បែងតាមអ៊ីនធឺណិតជាច្រើនបានរាយការណ៍ ពីការកើនឡើងគួរឱ្យកត់សម្គាល់នូវអត្រានៃការចុះឈ្មោះថ្មី។ ឧស្សាហកម្មកម្សាន្តក៏បានរងផលប៉ះពាល់ផងដែរ ដោយក្រុមតន្ត្រីផ្សេងៗបានផ្អាក ឬលុបចោលដំណើរប្រគុំតន្ត្រីនានា។
en-mt: The action has enabled many gamers to change online, with many Online gaming sites reporting significant increases The entertainment industry has also been affected, with various music groups suspended or canceled concert trips.

sourceString: Many large theatres such as those on Broadway also suspended all performances.
targetString: រោងមហោស្រពធំៗជាច្រើន ដូចជានៅ Broadway ក៏បានផ្អាកការសម្តែងទាំងអស់ផងដែរ។
en-mt: Many large theaters, such as at Broadway, have also suspended all performances.

sourceString: Some artists have explored ways to continue to produce and share work over the internet as an alternative to traditional live performance, such as live streaming concerts or creating web-based "festivals" for artists to perform, distribute, and publicize their work.
targetString: សិល្បករមួយចំនួន​បានរកឃើញវិធី​ក្នុងការ​បន្តការផលិត និង​ចែករំលែក​ការងារ​តាម​អ៊ីនធឺណេត ដោយ​ចាត់​ទុក​វា​ជា​ជម្រើស​ជំនួស​ការសម្ដែង​ដោយផ្ទាល់ ដូចជា​ការប្រគំតន្រ្តី​ផ្ទាល់​តាម​អ៊ីនធឺណេត ឬបង្កើតពិធីបុណ្យនៅលើ “គេហទំព័រ” សម្រាប់​សិល្បករ​ដើម្បីសម្ដែង ចែកចាយ និងបង្ហាញការងាររបស់ពួកគេ។
en-mt: Some artists have found ways to produce and share online work, seeing it as an alternative to a live performance, such as Dance live music online or create festivals on "websites" for artists to perform, share and display their work.

sourceString: Online, numerous coronavirus-themed Internet memes have spread as many turn to humour and distraction amid uncertainty.
targetString: តាមអ៊ិនធើណែត​ រូបភាពកំប្លែងលើអ៊ិនធើណែត​ដែលទាក់ទងនឹងវីរុសកូរ៉ូណាបានរីករាលដាលយ៉ាង​ខ្លាំងដោយមនុស្សជាច្រើនចូលចិត្តការលេងសើច និងដើម្បីបង្វែរអារម្មណ៍នៅពេលមានភាពមិនច្បាស់លាស់។
en-mt: Online, online comic images linked to the cholera virus have spread Strong by many people preferring jokes and to distract when there is uncertainty.

sourceString: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, heightened prejudice, xenophobia, and racism have been noted toward people of Chinese and East Asian descent, and against people from hotspots in Europe, the United States and other countries.
targetString: ចាប់តាំងពីការផ្ទុះរាលដាលនៃ​ជំងឺ COVID-19 ការ​កើន​ឡើង​នៃការប្រកាន់ ការខ្លាចជនបរទេស និង​ការរើស​អើង​ពូជសាសន៍ត្រូវ​បានកត់សម្គាល់ទៅលើជនជាតិចិន និង​ប្រជាជន ដែលមានដើម​កំណើតពីអាស៊ីភាគខាងកើត និង​ទៅកាន់ប្រជាជន​មកពីប្រទេស ដែល​កំពុង​មាន​ការ​ឆ្លង​ខ្លាំង​នៅអ៊ឺរ៉ុប សហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក និង​ប្រទេស​ដទៃទៀត។
en-mt: Since the COVID-19 outbreak, the increase in foreign fear and racial discrimination has been marked on Chinese and people Originating from East Asia and to people from highly infected countries in Europe, the United States, and other countries.

sourceString: Incidents of fear, suspicion, and hostility have been observed in many countries, particularly in Europe, East Asia, North America, and the Asia-Pacific region.
targetString: ឧប្បត្តិហេតុនៃការភ័យខ្លាចការសង្ស័យនិងអរិភាពត្រូវបានគេសង្កេតឃើញនៅក្នុងប្រទេសជាច្រើនជាពិសេសនៅអឺរ៉ុប អាស៊ីខាងកើត អាមេរិកខាងជើង និងតំបន់អាស៊ីប៉ាស៊ីហ្វិក។
en-mt: Incidents of fear, suspicion and priority have been observed in many countries, especially in Eastern Europe, Eastern Asia, North America and the Asia-Pacific region.

sourceString: Reports from February (when the majority of the cases had still been confined to China) have documented racist sentiments expressed in various groups worldwide of Chinese people deserving the virus or receiving what has been claimed as justified retribution.
targetString: សេចក្ដីរាយការណ៍កាលពីខែកុម្ភៈ (នៅពេល​ករណី​នៃ​ការ​ឆ្លង​ភាគ​ច្រើនត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ចេញពីប្រទេសចិន) បាន​បង្ហាញថា មាន​ការបញ្ចេញ​អារម្មណ៍រើសអើង​ពូជសាសន៍​ទៅកាន់​ក្រុម​ប្រជាជន​ជនជាតិចិនផ្សេងៗ​ទូទាំងពិភពលោក​ដែលថា ពួកគេ​សម​នឹងកើតជំងឺនេះ ឬទទួលអ្វី​ដែល​ត្រូវបាន​ចាត់ទុកថា​កម្មពៀរ​ពីអ្វីដែលពួកគេបានប្រព្រឹត្ត។
en-mt: The report last February (when most cases of transmission were confirmed from China) indicated that there was a racially discriminatory feeling Holding a group of varied Chinese people around the globe that they deserve to develop the disease or receive what is considered a spear from what they have done.

sourceString: Some countries in Africa have also seen a rise in anti-Chinese sentiment.
targetString: ប្រទេសមួយចំនួននៅទ្វីបអាហ្វ្រិកក៏ត្រូវបានឃើញមានការបញ្ចេញអារម្មណ៍ស្អប់ខ្ពើមជនជាតិចិន។
en-mt: Some African countries are also seen expressing Chinese disgust.

sourceString: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei have reported discrimination based on their regional origin.
targetString: ប្រជាជនជាច្រើននៅវូហាន និងហ៊ូប៉ី​បានរាយការណ៍​អំពីការរើសអើងដោយផ្អែកលើដើមកំណើតតំបន់របស់ពួកគេ។
en-mt: Many residents of Wuhan and Hubei reported discrimination based on their regional origins.

sourceString: There has been support for the Chinese, both on and offline, and towards those in virus-stricken areas.

Cities in several countries, like Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, and South Korea As beginning in registering a lawsuit, banning the Chinese from entering their country to stop the disease spreading.

sourceString: U.S. president Donald Trump has faced criticism for referring to the coronavirus as the "Chinese Virus", a term considered by critics to be racist and anti-Chinese.

sourceString: Students who come from Northeast India, which shares a border with China, and study in major Indian cities have reportedly experienced harassment related to the coronavirus outbreak.

en-mt: និស្សិតដែលមកពីតំបន់ភាគឦសាន្តប្រទេសឥណ្ឌា bordering China and students studying in Main Indian cities have reportedly come under persecution in connection with the outbreak of the virus.

sourceString: The Bharatiya Janata Party's State unit president in West Bengal Dilip Ghosh stated that the Chinese had destroyed nature and "that's why the God took revenge against them."
targetString: ប្រធានអង្គភាពរដ្ឋរបស់គណបក្ស Bharatiya Janata នៅ​តំបន់ West Bengal Dilip Ghosh បាន​ថ្លែង​ថាប្រជាជនចិន​បានបំផ្លាញធម្មជាតិ ហើយ “នេះជាមូលហេតុដែលព្រះជា​ម្ចាស់បានសងសឹកចំពោះពួកគេវិញ”។
en-mt: The president of the Bharatiya Janata Party's state unit in the West Bengal Dilip Ghosh region stated that the Chinese people have destroyed nature and "that's why the God has retaliated against them."

sourceString: The remarks were later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "erroneous".In China, xenophobia and racism agains non-Chinese residents has been inflamed by the pandemic, with foreigners described as "foreign garbage" and targeted for "disposal".
targetString: ការកត់សម្គាល់នេះក្រោយមកត្រូវបានថ្កោលទោសដោយស្ថានកុងស៊ុលចិននៅ Kolkata ដោយហៅវាថាជា “ការភាន់ច្រឡំ”។ នៅក្នុងប្រទេសចិន អ្នកខ្លាចជន​បរទេស និងការរើសអើង​ជាតិសាសន៍​លើអ្នក​មិនមែន​ជាជនជាតិចិន ត្រូវបានប៉ះពាល់​ដោយ​រោគរាតត្បាត ដែលជនបរទេសត្រូវបានគេនិយាយឲ្យ​ចំថាជា “ជនសំរាមបរទេស” និងកំណត់ថាជា “កាកសំណល់”។
en-mt: This remark was later condemned by the Chinese consulate in Kolkata, calling it "misleading." In China, foreigners and ethnic discrimination If you are not Chinese, you are affected by an epidemic, where foreigners are mentioned as "foreign garbage" and defined as "waste."

sourceString: Laboratory testing for the respiratory coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the associated SARS-CoV-2 virus includes methods that detect the presence of virus and those that detect antibodies produced in response to infection.
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍សម្រាប់ជំងឺរលាកផ្លូវដង្ហើមប្រភេទថ្មីឆ្នាំ 2019 (COVID-19) និងវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 ដែលជាប់ទាក់ទងរួមមានវិធីសាស្ត្រដែលរកឃើញវត្តមានរបស់វីរុស និងអ្នកដែលរកឃើញអង្គបដិបក្ខដែលត្រូវបានផលិតឆ្លើយតបនឹងការឆ្លង។
en-mt: Laboratory testing for new 2019 types of respiratory infections (COVID-19) and SARS-virus The relevant CoV-2 includes methods that detect the presence of the virus and those who detect the bodies produced respond to infections.

sourceString: The presence of viruses in samples is confirmed by RT-PCR, which detects the coronavirus'  RNA.
targetString: វត្តមាននៃវីរុសនៅក្នុងសំណាកត្រូវបានបញ្ជាក់ដោយប្រតិកម្មខ្សែប៉ូលីមែរ៉ាសចម្លងបញ្ច្រាស (RT-PCR) ដែលរកឃើញ RNA របស់វីរុស​កូរ៉ូណា។
en-mt: The presence of the virus in the sample is confirmed by the reverse polymeras reaction (RT-PCR) that detects the RNA of the Corona virus.

sourceString: This test is specific and is designed to only detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តនេះគឺជាក់លាក់ហើយត្រូវបានរចនាឡើងដើម្បីរកឃើញតែ RNA នៃវីរុស SARS-CoV-2 ។
en-mt: This test is specific and is designed only to detect the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

sourceString: It is used to confirm very recent or active infections.
targetString: វាត្រូវបានប្រើដើម្បីបញ្ជាក់ពីការឆ្លង ឬសកម្មថ្មីៗ។
en-mt: It is used to confirm new infections or activities.

sourceString: Detection of antibodies (serology) can be used both for diagnosis and population surveillance.
targetString: ការរកមើលអង្គបដិប្រាណ (serology) អាចត្រូវបានប្រើទាំងសម្រាប់ការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងការពិនិត្យមើលចំនួនប្រជាជន។
en-mt: Searching for serology can be used both for diagnosis and examination of the population.

sourceString: Antibody tests show how many people have had the disease, including those whose symptoms were too minor to report or who were asymptomatic.
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តអង់ទីករបង្ហាញអំពីចំនួនមនុស្សដែលមានជំងឺនេះ រួមទាំងអ្នកដែលមិនចេញរោគសញ្ញា និងអ្នកដែលមានរោគសញ្ញាតិចតួចដែលត្រូវរាយការណ៍ផងដែរ។
en-mt: Anti-tests reveal the number of people with the disease, including those who do not suffer symptoms and those with small symptoms to report.

sourceString: An accurate mortality rate of the disease and the level of herd immunity in the population can be determined from the results of this test.
targetString: ភាពត្រឹមត្រូវនៃអត្រាមរណដោយសារជំងឺ និងកម្រិតនៃភាពស៊ាំរបស់ក្រុមមនុស្ស អាចនឹងត្រូវកំណត់តាមរយៈលទ្ធផលនៃការធ្វើតេស្តនេះ។
en-mt: The accuracy of the mortality rate due to the disease and the level of human group of immunity may be determined via the results of the test.

sourceString: Due to limited testing, as of March 2020 no countries had reliable data on the prevalence of the virus in their population.
targetString: ដោយសារតែការធ្វើតេស្តមានកំណត់នៅត្រឹមខែមីនាឆ្នាំ 2020 គ្មានប្រទេសណាដែលមានទិន្នន័យគួរឱ្យទុកចិត្តស្តីពីអត្រានៃមេរោគនៅក្នុងចំនួនប្រជាជនរបស់ពួកគេនោះទេ។
en-mt: Because the tests are limited to March 2020, no country has reliability data on the rate of viruses in their population.

sourceString: By 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and there are massive variations in how much testing has been done across countries.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនាគ្មានប្រទេសណាមួយបានធ្វើតេស្តលើសពី 3% នៃចំនួនប្រជាជនរបស់ពួកគេទេហើយវាមានភាពខុសប្លែកគ្នាយ៉ាងខ្លាំងនៃចំនួននៃការធ្វើតេស្តដែលត្រូវបានធ្វើនៅទូទាំងប្រទេស។
en-mt: As of March 23, no country had tested more than 3% of their population, and it varied widely in the number of tests being conducted nationwide.

sourceString: This variability is also likely to be significantly affecting reported case fatality rates, which are likely to be significantly over-estimated in some countries.
targetString: ភាពប្រែប្រួលនេះក៏ទំនងជាធ្វើឱ្យប៉ះពាល់យ៉ាងខ្លាំងដល់អត្រាមរណភាពក្នុងករណីដែលបានរាយការណ៍ ដែលទំនងជាមានការប៉ាន់ស្មានលើសនៅប្រទេសមួយចំនួន។
en-mt: This variation is also likely to significantly affect death rates in reported cases, which are likely to be estimated in some countries.

sourceString: Using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) the test can be done on respiratory samples obtained by various methods, including nasopharyngeal swab or sputum sample.
targetString: តាមរយៈការប្រើប្រតិកម្មសង្វាក់ប៉ូលីមែរ៉ាសនៃការចម្លងបញ្ច្រាសទៅតាមពេលវេលាជាក់ស្តែង (rRT-PCR) ការធ្វើតេស្តអាចត្រូវបានធ្វើលើសំណាកផ្លូវដង្ហើម ដែលទទួលបានតាមវិធីសាស្រ្តផ្សេងៗគ្នា រួមមានសំណាកសំឡីជូតច្រមុះបំពង់ក ឬកំហាកជាដើម។
en-mt: By using polymeras chain reactions of reverse copies in real time (rRT-PCR), tests can be conducted Respiratory samples obtained in a variety of methods, including samples, brushing their noses, throats, or coughs.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to 2 days.

sourceString: The RT-PCR test performed with throat swabs is only reliable in the first week of the disease.

en-mt: The RT-PCR test carried out with pneumonia is only reliable in the early weeks of the disease.

sourceString: Later on the virus can disappear in the throat while it continues to multiply in the lungs.

sourceString: For infected people tested in the second week, alternatively sample material can then be taken from the deep airways by suction catheter or coughing up material (sputum) can be used.

sourceString: One of the early PCR tests was developed at Charité in Berlin in January 2020 using real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR), and formed the basis of 250,000 kits for distribution by the World Health Organization (WHO).
targetString: ការធ្វើតេស្តមួយក្នុងចំណោមការធ្វើតេស្ត PCR ដំបូងៗត្រូវបានបង្កើតឡើងនៅ Charité ក្នុងទីក្រុងប៊ែកឡាំងនៅខែមករាឆ្នាំ 2020 ដោយប្រើប្រតិកម្មខ្សែសង្វាក់បញ្ជូន polymerase បញ្ច្រាសពេលវេលាជាក់ស្តែង (rRT-PCR),និងបានបង្កើតមូលដ្ឋានគ្រឹះចំនួន 250.000 សម្រាប់ចែកចាយដោយអង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក (WHO) ។

sourceString: One of three genetic tests in older versions of the test kits caused inconclusive results due to faulty reagents, and a bottleneck of testing at the CDC in Atlanta; this resulted in an average of fewer than 100 samples a day being successfully processed throughout the whole of February 2020.

sourceString: Tests using two components were not determined to be reliable until 28 February 2020, and it was not until then that state and local laboratories were permitted to begin testing.

sourceString: In Russia, the COVID-19 test was developed and produced by the State Research Center of Virology and Biotechnology VECTOR.

sourceString: On 11 February 2020 the test was registered by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare.On 12 March 2020, Mayo Clinic was reported to have developed a test to detect COVID-19 infection.On 13 March 2020, Roche Diagnostics received FDA approval for a test which could be performed within 3.5 hours in high volume, thus allowing one machine to do approximately 4,128 tests in a 24-hour period.

On March 13, 2020, Roche diagnosed FDA consent for test that can be carried out within 3.5 hours In high quantities, thus allow one machine to test approximately 4.128 within 24 hours.

sourceString: On 19 March 2020, the FDA issued emergency use authorization (EUA) to Abbott Laboratories for a test on Abbott's m2000 system; the FDA had previously issued similar authorization to Hologic, LabCorp, and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

en-mt: On March 19, 2020, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) granted urgent use (EUA) to the laboratory Abbott for testing on Abbott's m2000 system. In the past, the Food and Drug Administration has granted similar rights to Hologic, LabCorp and Thermo Fisher Scientific.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: ទីក្រុងហុងកុងបានរៀបចំគម្រោងមួយ ដែលអ្នកជំងឺគួរឱ្យសង្ស័យអាចស្នាក់នៅផ្ទះបាន "នាយកដ្ឋានផ្នែកសង្គ្រោះបន្ទាន់នឹងផ្តល់បំពង់សំណាកដល់អ្នកជំងឺ" ពួកគេស្តោះកំហាក រួចបញ្ជូនកំហាកនោះត្រឡប់មកវិញ ហើយមួយរយៈក្រោយមក គេនឹងទទួលបានលទ្ធផលតេស្ត។ សេវាសុខភាពថ្នាក់ជាតិរបស់ចក្រភពអង់គ្លេស (British NHS) បានប្រកាសថា ពួកគេកំពុងសាកល្បងគម្រោងនេះ ដើម្បីធ្វើតេស្តករណីដែលសង្ស័យថាមានជំងឺនៅផ្ទះ ដែលអាចកាត់បន្ថយហានិភ័យនៃអ្នកជំងឺចម្លងទៅអ្នកដទៃ ប្រសិនបើពួកគេមកកាន់មន្ទីរពេទ្យ ឬបើមានរថយន្តសង្គ្រោះបន្ទាន់ដែលមានការសម្លាប់មេរោគ ប្រសិនបើត្រូវប្រើប្រាស់។ ក្នុងការធ្វើតេស្តរកជំងឺ Covid-19 តាមរថយន្ត សម្រាប់ករណីសង្ស័យ ដែលអ្នកជំនាញថែទាំសុខភាពយកសំណាក ដោយមានការប្រុងប្រយ័ត្នបំផុត។

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: មជ្ឈមណ្ឌលបើកបរ បានជួយឱ្យប្រទេសកូរ៉េខាងត្បូងធ្វើការសាកល្បងលឿនបំផុត និងទូលំទូលាយបំផុតនៃប្រទេសណាមួយ។ នៅប្រទេសអាល្លឺម៉ង់ គ្រូពេទ្យជាតិធានារ៉ាប់រងសុខភាពតាមលក្ខន្តិកៈបានឱ្យដឹងនៅថ្ងៃទី 2 មីនា ថាវាមានសមត្ថភាពសម្រាប់ការធ្វើតេស្តប្រហែល 12.000 នាក់ក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃនៅក្នុងកន្លែងរថយន្តសង្គ្រោះបន្ទាន់ និង 10,700 ត្រូវបានសាកល្បងនៅក្នុងសប្តាហ៍មុន។
en-mt: The Driving Center helped South Korea perform the fastest and most comprehensive tests of any country. It was reported on March 2 that it was capable of about 12,000 tests a day in ambulance sites and 10,700 were tested in the past week.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: ការស្ទង់មតិនៅមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍ដំបូងបានបង្ហាញថា គិតត្រឹមមួយសប្តាហ៍ 12/2020 មានសំណាកសរុបយ៉ាងតិចរហូតដល់ 483.295 ត្រូវបានធ្វើតេស្ត ហើយរាប់បញ្ចូលទាំងសប្តាហ៍ 12/2020 និងសំណាក 33.491 (6,9%) ដែលត្រូវបានធ្វើតេស្តវិជ្ជមានចំពោះ SARS-CoV-2។ នៅអ៊ីស្រាអែល ក្រុមអ្នកស្រាវជ្រាវនៅវិទ្យាស្ថានបច្ចេកវិទ្យាអ៊ីស្រាអែល (Technion) និងមន្ទីរពេទ្យរ៉ាមបាម (Rambam) បានបង្កើត និងបានសាកល្បងវិធីសាស្ត្រមួយសម្រាប់ធ្វើតេស្តសំណាកពីអ្នកជំងឺចំនួន 64 នាក់ក្នុងពេលដំណាលគ្នា ដោយធ្វើការប្រមូលសំណាក ហើយធ្វើតេស្តបន្ថែមទៀត តែក្នុងករណីដែលរកឃើញថាសំណាក ដែលបានប្រមូលនោះមានលក្ខណៈវិជ្ជមានប៉ុណ្ណោះ។ នៅក្រុងវូហាន មន្ទីរពិសោធន៍នៃការរកមើលបន្ទាន់ជាបណ្តោះអាសន្នមានទំហំ 2000 ម៉ែត្រការ៉េ ដែលមានឈ្មោះថា “ហ៊ូ-យាន” (ភាសាចិន៖ 火眼 ឬ “Fire Eye” ជាភាសាអង់គ្លេស) ត្រូវបានបើកដំណើរការនៅថ្ងៃទី 5 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ដោយក្រុមហ៊ុន BGI ដែលអាចដំណើរការបានជាង 10,000 សំណាកក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ។

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 4 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ចំនួនធ្វើតេស្តសរុបគឺ 50,000 ដងក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ។ ប្រភពចំហ ការរចនាចម្រុះដោយ Origami Assays ត្រូវបានចេញផ្សាយ ដែលធ្វើតេស្ដសំណាកអ្នកជំងឺ 1,122 នាក់រកជំងឺ COVID-19 ដោយប្រើការធ្វើតេស្តតែ 93 ប៉ុណ្ណោះ។ ការរចនាដែលមានតុល្យភាពទាំងនេះអាចត្រូវបានដំណើរការនៅក្នុងមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍តូច ដោយមិនចាំបាច់ប្រើឧបករណ៍ចាប់កាន់វត្ថុរាវស្វ័យប្រវត្តិទេ។

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: ជាមួយនឹងការតាមដានទំនាក់ទំនងយ៉ាងខ្លាំង ការរឹតបន្តឹងការធ្វើដំណើរក្នុងប្រទេស ការធ្វើតេស្ត និងការដាក់ឱ្យនៅដាច់ដោយឡែកពីគ្នា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ការ​រាតត្បាត​សកល​នៃ​វីរុស​កូ​រ៉ូ​ណាក្នុងប្រទេសសឹង្ហបុរី ដំណើរការយឺតជាងបណ្តាប្រទេសអភិវឌ្ឍន៍ដទៃទៀតប៉ុន្តែគ្មានការរឹតត្បិតខ្លាំងដូចជាការបង្ខំឱ្យបិទភោជនីយដ្ឋាន និងគ្រឹះស្ថានលក់រាយ។
en-mt: With strong monitoring of communications, country travel restrictions, testing and putting on separate 2020, the global epidemic of the cholera epidemic Singapore is running slower than other developed countries, but there are no restrictions, like forcing the closure of restaurants and retail institutions.

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: ព្រឹត្តិការណ៍ជាច្រើនត្រូវបានលុបចោល ហើយប្រទេសសឹង្ហបុរីបានចាប់ផ្តើមណែនាំឱ្យប្រជាជនស្នាក់នៅផ្ទះនៅថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែមីនា ប៉ុន្តែសាលារៀនបានបើកដំណើរការវិញទាន់ពេលបន្ទាប់ពីឈប់សម្រាកនៅថ្ងៃទី 23 ខែមីនា។
en-mt: Many events were cancelled and Singapore began instructing people to stay at home on the day March 28, but the school reopened on time to stop on March 23.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: បណ្តាប្រទេសជាច្រើនទៀតក៏បានគ្រប់គ្រងជំងឺរាតត្បាតនេះតាមរយៈការទាក់ទងយ៉ាងខ្លាំងក្លា ការរឹតបន្តឹងការធ្វើដំណើរក្នុងប្រទេស ធ្វើតេស្ដ និងការនៅដាច់ដោយឡែក ប៉ុន្តែជាមួយនឹងការនៅផ្ទះដែលមិនសូវរអាក់រអួលដូចជាអ៊ីស្លង់ និងកូរ៉េខាងត្បូង។
en-mt: Many other countries also controlled the pandemic via intense communication, travel restrictions Countries conduct tests and isolation, but with homes that are least crumpled, like Iceland and South Korea.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: ការសិក្សាដោយផ្អែកលើតួលេខបានរកឃើញថាប្រទេសដែលបានធ្វើតេស្ដច្រើន ទាក់ទងនឹងចំនួនមរណភាព មានអត្រាករណីស្លាប់ទាបជាងច្រើន ប្រហែលជាព្រោះតែប្រទេសទាំងនេះអាចការពារនឹងរោគសញ្ញាស្រាលកាន់តែប្រសើរ។
en-mt: Study based on figures found that countries where more tested in terms of mortality numbers had rates Lower death cases may be because these countries are better able to prevent mild symptoms.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: ក្នុងចំណោមមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍យោងទាំង 16 មាន 7 នៅអាស៊ី 5 នៅអ៊ឺរ៉ុប 2 នៅទ្វីបអាហ្រ្វិក 1 នៅអាមេរិកខាងជើង និង 1 នៅអូស្ត្រាលី។
en-mt: Of the 16 reference laboratories, there are 7 in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: ការលាងដៃ ដែលត្រូវបានគេស្គាល់ផងដែរថាអនាម័យដៃ គឺជាសកម្មភាពនៃការលាងដៃរបស់មនុស្សម្នាក់ក្នុងគោលបំណងជំរះដី, ខ្លាញ់, អតិសុខុមប្រាណ ឬសារធាតុផ្សេងទៀតដែលយើងមិនត្រូវការ។
en-mt: Hand washing, also known as hand hygiene, is the activity of washing a person's hands for the purpose of clearing soil, tigers, peace, or other substances that do not need.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: ការលាងដៃជាមួយសាប៊ូជាប់លាប់នៅ “គ្រាដ៏សំខាន់” មួយចំនួននៅពេលថ្ងៃការពារការរីករាលដាលនៃជម្ងឺជាច្រើន ឧទាហរណ៍ ជំងឺរាគ និងអាសន្នរោគ ដែលឆ្លងតាមមាត់។
en-mt: Washing your hands with soap at some "key moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example, oral diseases and allergies.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: មនុស្សក៏អាចឆ្លងតាមជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើមផងដែរ ដូចជា​គ្រុនផ្តាសាយ ឬជំងឺផ្តាសាយធម្មតា ឧទាហរណ៍ ប្រសិនបើពួកគេមិនលាងដៃ មុនពេលប៉ះពាល់ភ្នែក ច្រមុះ ឬមាត់របស់​ពួកគេ (ឧទាហរណ៍ ភ្នាសរំអិល)។
en-mt: People can also contract respiratory illnesses such as cholera or normal flu, for example If they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, noses or mouths (e.g. snow).

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: កាលៈទេសៈទាំងប្រាំ​ដែលសំខាន់ជារៀងរាល់ថ្ងៃដែលត្រូវដែលធ្វើការលាងដៃជាមួយនឹងសាប៊ូរួមមាន មុននិងក្រោយបន្ទោបង់ ក្រោយពេលលាងសម្អាតគូទកុមារ ឬក៏ផ្លាស់ប្ដូរកន្ទោបរបស់កុមារ មុនពេលបញ្ចុកចំណីកូន មុនពេលហូបបាយ និងមុនឬក៏ក្រោយពេលរៀបចំអាហារ ឬក៏ចំអិន សាច់ ត្រី និងបក្សី។
en-mt: The five significant circumstances each day to work with soap include before and after child washing or Also change the children's lumber before feeding the children before eating and before or before, or after preparing a meal or cooking meat, fish and birds.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកណែនាំឱ្យលាងដៃ៖ យើងអាចលាងសំអាតដៃជាមួយផេះ ប្រសិនបើមិនមានទឹក និងសាប៊ូ។

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: មុន និងក្រោយពេលថែទាំ​អ្នកមានជំងឺ។
en-mt: Before and after taking care of the patient.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: បន្ទាប់ពីផ្លាស់ប្តូរក្រណាត់កន្ទបទារក ឬសម្អាតកុមារដែលបានប្រើប្រាស់បង្គន់ហើយ។
en-mt: After changing the baby's linen or cleaning the child who has already used the toilet.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: បន្ទាប់ពីជូតច្រមុះរបស់អ្នក ក្អក ឬកណ្តាស់។
en-mt: After brushing your nose, nausea or mouse.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: បន្ទាប់ពីប៉ះពាល់សត្វ ចំណីសត្វ ឬកាកសំណល់សត្វ។
en-mt: After touching animals, animal feed or animal waste.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: ការអនាម័យដៃបែបវិជ្ជាសាស្ត្រ ផ្តោតទៅលើការអនុវត្តអនាម័យដៃ ដែលទាក់ទងទៅនឹងនិតិវិធីណែនាំរបស់គ្រូទេព្យ។
en-mt: Psychological hygiene focuses on implementing hand hygiene that relates to the guidance procedures of a doctor.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: ការលាងដៃមុនពេលប្រើថ្នាំ ឬការ​ថែទាំវេជ្ជសាស្រ្ត​អាច​ការពារ ឬកាត់បន្ថយការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺបាន។
en-mt: Washing your hands before taking medication or medical care can prevent or reduce the spread of disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: គោលបំណងវេជ្ជសាស្រ្តសំខាន់នៃការលាងដៃគឺដើម្បីសំអាតដៃដែលជាភ្នាក់ងារបង្ករោគ (បាក់តេរី វីរុស ឬមីក្រូសរីរាង្គដទៃទៀតដែលអាចបង្កឱ្យមានជំងឺ) និងសារធាតុគីមីដែលអាចបង្កឱ្យមានគ្រោះថ្នាក់ ឬជំងឺ។
en-mt: The key medical purpose of washing hands is to clean hands as a viral agent (bacteria wire Other organisms or microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals that can cause harm or disease.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: វាមានសារៈសំខាន់ជាពិសេសសម្រាប់អ្នកដែលគ្រប់គ្រងចំណីអាហារ ឬធ្វើការក្នុងវិស័យវេជ្ជសាស្រ្ត ប៉ុន្តែ​ក៏ជា​ការ​អនុវត្ត​ដ៏សំខាន់​សម្រាប់​សារធារណជន​ទូទៅ​ផងដែរ។
en-mt: It is especially important for those who manage food or work in the medical field, but also important practices for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: ការលាងដៃមានគុណប្រយោជន៍ជាច្រើនចំពោះសុខភាពរួមទាំងកាត់បន្ថយការរីករាលដាលនៃជំងឺផ្តាសាយ ជំងឺកូរ៉ូណា និងជំងឺឆ្លងផ្សេងៗទៀត។ ការបង្ការបុព្វហេតុឆ្លងជំងឺរាគ ការកាត់បន្ថយការឆ្លងមេរោគផ្លូវដង្ហើម។
en-mt: Hand washing has many health benefits, including reducing the spread of cholera flu Prevention of infected diseases, reducing respiratory infections.

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: និងកាត់បន្ថយអត្រាមរណភាពទារកនៅពេលសម្រាលកូននៅផ្ទះ។
en-mt: and reduce infant mortality rates while giving birth at home.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: ការសិក្សាឆ្នាំ 2013 បានបង្ហាញថាការអនុវត្តការលាងដៃអាចធ្វើឱ្យប្រសើរឡើងបន្តិចបន្តួច ចំពោះការលូតលាស់របស់កុមារដែលមានអាយុក្រោមប្រាំឆ្នាំ។
en-mt: A 2013 study showed that performing hand washing can improve slightly for the growth of children under the age of five.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: នៅក្នុងប្រទេសកំពុងអភិវឌ្ឍ អត្រាមរណភាពកុមារដែលទាក់ទងនឹងជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើម និងជំងឺរាគអាចត្រូវបានកាត់បន្ថយដោយការណែនាំអំពីការផ្លាស់ប្តូរអាកប្បកិរិយា​សាមញ្ញ ដូចជាការលាងដៃជាមួយសាប៊ូជាដើម។
en-mt: In developing countries, child mortality rates linked to respiratory diseases and tuberculosis can be Reduce by instructing simple attitudes such as washing your hands with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: សកម្មភាពដ៏សាមញ្ញនេះអាចកាត់បន្ថយអត្រាមរណភាពដោយសារជំងឺទាំងនេះបានជិត 50%។
en-mt: This simple activity can reduce mortality rates from these diseases by nearly 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: ការធ្វើអន្តរាគមន៍ដែលលើក​កម្ពស់​ការលាងដៃ​អាច​កាត់​បន្ថយជំងឺរាគរូស បានប្រហែលមួយភាគបី ហើយ​នេះ​អាច​ប្រៀបធៀប​ទៅនឹងការផ្គត់ផ្គង់ទឹកស្អាតនៅក្នុងតំបន់ ដែល​មាន​ប្រាក់ចំណូលទាបបាន។
en-mt: Interventions that prop up hand washing can reduce osteoarthritis by about a third, and this is comparable to the supply of clean water in low-income areas.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: 48% នៃការកាត់បន្ថយផ្នែកជំងឺរាគ អាចត្រូវ​បាន​ផ្សារភ្ជាប់​ជាមួយ​នឹងការលាងដៃជាមួយសាប៊ូ។ ការលាងដៃ​ជាមួយ​សាប៊ូ គឺជាមធ្យោបាយមួយដែលមានប្រសិទ្ធភាព និង​មាន​តំលៃថោកបំផុតក្នុងការការពារការរាគរូស និង​ការឆ្លង​មេរោគ​ផ្លូវដង្ហើមស្រួចស្រាវ (ARI) ដែលជា​អាកប្បកិរិយាគួរ​ប្រតិបត្តិ​ជា​ស្វ័យ​​ប្រវត្ដិ​នៅ​ក្នុងគេហដ្ឋាន សាលារៀន និងសហគមន៍ នៅទូទាំងពិភពលោក។
en-mt: 48% of reduction in tuberculosis can be linked to hand washing with soap. Washing your hands with soap is one of the most effective and cheapest means of preventing oceans White and alcoholic respiratory infections (ARI), an automatic behavior in homes, schools and communities around the globe.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: ជំងឺរលាកសួតដែលជា ARI ដ៏ធំចម្បងគឺជាមូលហេតុទីមួយនៃការស្លាប់ក្នុងចំណោមកុមារអាយុក្រោមប្រាំឆ្នាំដែលបានសម្លាប់កុមារប្រមាណ 1.8 លាននាក់ក្នុងមួយឆ្នាំ។
en-mt: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of death among younger five-year-olds who kill an estimated 1.8 million kids a year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: ជំងឺរាគរូស និងជំងឺរលាកសួតរួមគ្នាមានអត្រាមរណភាពកុមារជិត 3.5 ​លាននាក់ជារៀងរាល់ឆ្នាំ។
en-mt: Tuberculosis and tuberculosis combined have nearly 3.5 million child mortality rates each year.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: យោងតាមអង្គការយូនីសេហ្វការបង្វែរការលាងដៃជាមួយសាប៊ូមុនពេលបរិភោគ និងក្រោយពេលប្រើបង្គន់ទៅជាទម្លាប់ដែលអាចជួយសង្គ្រោះជីវិតបានច្រើនជាងការចាក់វ៉ាក់សាំង ឬការអន្តរាគមន៍ផ្នែកវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រណាមួយដោយកាត់បន្ថយការស្លាប់ពីជម្ងឺរាគរូសបានជិតពាក់កណ្តាល និងការស្លាប់ដែលបណ្ណាលពីការឆ្លងមេរោគផ្លូវដង្ហើមស្រួចស្រាវ មួយភាគបួន។
en-mt: According to UNICEF, diverting hand-washing with soap before mealtime and after use into a life-saving habit more than a vaccine or pop intervention Any medical piece by cutting deaths from osteoporosis by nearly half and the death of a tract from a quarter of an alcoholic respiratory infection.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: ការលាងដៃជាធម្មតាត្រូវបានរួមបញ្ចូលគ្នាជាមួយអន្តរាគមន៍អនាម័យដទៃទៀតដែលជាផ្នែកមួយនៃកម្មវិធីទឹក ការធ្វើអនាម័យ និងអនាម័យភាពស្អាត។
en-mt: Hand washing is usually combined with other hygiene interventions as part of water programs, hygiene and cleanliness.

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: ការលាងសំអាតដៃក៏អាចការពារប្រឆាំងនឹងជំងឺរលាកស្បែកដៃ ដែលឆ្លងតាមរយៈការប៉ះពាល់គ្នាដោយផ្ទាល់។
en-mt: Hand washing can also protect against arm skin inflammation, which is transmitted via direct contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: ផលប៉ះពាល់អាក្រក់តូចមួយនៃការលាងដៃគឺថា ការលាងដៃញឹកញាប់អាចបណ្តាលឱ្យខូចស្បែកដោយសារតែការធ្វើឱ្យស្បែកស្ងួត​។
en-mt: One of the small adverse effects of washing your hands is that frequent hand washing can cause skin damage because of drying the skin.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: ការសិក្សារបស់ដាណឺម៉ាកឆ្នាំ 2012 បានរកឃើញថា ការ​លាង​ដៃ​​ច្រើនពេកអាចបណ្តាលឱ្យរមាស់ របក​ស្បែក ដែល​ត្រូវ​បាន​គេស្គាល់ថាជា ជំងឺត្រអកដៃ ឬជំងឺ​រលាក​ស្បែកដៃ ដែល​ជា​ទូទៅ​កើត​មានក្នុងចំណោមបុគ្គលិកថែទាំសុខភាព។
en-mt: A 2012 Danish study found too much hand washing can lead to scratching the skin bars Known as arthritis or skin disease, which is commonly occurring among health care workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: ការលាងដៃញឹកញាប់ពេកក៏ត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញថាជារោគសញ្ញាមួយ​នៃជំងឺគិតច្រើន ដដែលៗ។
en-mt: Washing hands too often is also seen as a symptom of a recurring multi-thinking disorder.

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: ពេលវេលាសំខាន់ៗចំនួនប្រាំក្នុងមួយថ្ងៃ ដែលអ្នកចាំបាច់ត្រូវការលាងដៃជាមួយសាប៊ូ គឺដើម្បីបន្ថយការឆ្លងជំងឺតាមការប៉ះពាល់ជាមួយនឹងលាមក និងមាត់៖ ក្រោយពេលប្រើប្រាស់បន្ទប់ទឹក (បត់ជើងតូច និងបត់ជើងធំ) ក្រោយពេលលាងសម្អាតគូទកូនៗ (ផ្លាស់ប្ដូរខោទឹកនោមកូន) មុនពេលបញ្ចុកចំណីអាហារដល់កូន ក្រោយពេលញ៉ាំអាហារ និងមុន ឬក្រោយពេល​រៀបចំម្ហូបអាហារ ឬចម្អិនម្ហូប​អាហារ ឬកាន់លាងសាច់ ត្រី ឬ​សត្វស្លាប​។
en-mt: Five key times a day you need to wash your hands with soap are to reduce contagious ill health In contact with waste and mouth: After using the bathroom (small and large folding legs) after washing Clean up the children (change the kidneys) before feeding their children after eating Food and before or after preparing items or cooking or washing meat, fish or birds.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:

en-mt: Proper hand washing techniques are introduced by the United States Centers for The Anti-Infectual Protection to prevent phased infections:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: គេបានណែនាំអោយប្រើទឹកហូរ ​ព្រោះអាងស្តុកទឹកអាចមានភាពកខ្វក់ ខណៈសីតុណ្ហភាពក្នុងទឹកហាក់ដូចជាមិនមានភាពខុសគ្នាទេ។

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.

en-mt: Bubble the sauce on his hands by burning these with enough soap, including the back of his hands, between his fingers and under the wool.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: សាប៊ូអាចកំចាត់មេរោគពីស្បែកបាន ហើយ​ការសិក្សា​បាន​បង្ហាញថា មនុស្សជាច្រើនមានទំនោរទៅលាងដៃ​យ៉ាង​បាន​ហ្មត់ចត់ នៅពេលលាងជាមួយនឹងសាប៊ូ ជា​ជាង​ការលាង​នឹងទឹកទទេ។
en-mt: Soap can eliminate germs from the skin, and studies have shown that many people tend to go thoroughly when washing with soap rather than empty water washing.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.

en-mt: Washing creates a freeom that helps get rid of skin viruses, and longer washing will help get rid of the virus more righteously.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.

en-mt: Humidity is often recommended to preserve the hands from drying. Dry skin can lead to skin damage, potentially increasing the risk of infection.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: ជម្រើសដែលមានតំលៃទាបជាច្រើនអាចត្រូវបានធ្វើឡើងដើម្បីជួយសម្រួលដល់ការលាងដៃនៅកន្លែងដែលមិនមានទឹកម៉ាស៊ីន និង/ឬ សាប៊ូ ឧទាហរណ៍ ចាក់ទឹកពីធុងព្យួបង្ហូរទឹក ឬឃ្លោកដែលមានប្រហោងសមស្រប និង/ឬ ប្រើផេះប្រសិនបើចាំបាច់នៅក្នុងប្រទេសកំពុងអភិវឌ្ឍន៍។ ក្នុងស្ថានភាពដែលមានការផ្គត់ផ្គង់ទឹកមានកំណត់ (ដូចជាសាលារៀន ឬតំបន់ជនបទក្នុងប្រទេសកំពុងអភិវឌ្ឍន៍) មានដំណោះស្រាយអភិរក្សទឹកដូចជា "tippy-taps” និងជម្រើសតម្លៃទាបផ្សេងៗទៀត។
en-mt: Many low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing in places where there is no engine and/or soap For example, pour water from a drainage container or space with a suitability hole and/or use ash if necessary In developing countries, in situations where there is a limited supply of water (such as schools or rural areas in the country Development) there are water conservation solutions, like "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: ធុងព្យួរបង្ហូរទឹក គឺជាបច្ចេកវិទ្យាដ៏សាមញ្ញមួយដោយប្រើ​ធុងទឹកមួយដែលព្យួរដោយខ្សែពួរ ហើយអ្នកយកជើងជាន់ ដើម្បីចាក់ទឹកតិចតួចលើដៃ និងសាប៊ូមួយដុំ។
en-mt: The drainage tank is a simple technology using a bucket of water hanging with a rope and you pick a floor leg to pour small amounts of water on hands and a piece of soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: ការសម្ងួតដៃប្រកបដោយប្រសិទ្ធភាព គឺជាផ្នែកដ៏សំខាន់មួយនៃដំណើរកាលាងសម្អាតដៃ ប៉ុន្តែមានការជជែកវែកញែកខ្លះអំពីទម្រង់សម្ងួតដែលមានប្រសិទ្ធិភាពបំផុតនៅក្នុងបន្ទប់ទឹកសាធារណៈ។
en-mt: Effective hand drying is an important part of the hand-washing process, but there is some debate about the most effective form of dryer in public bathrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: បរិមាណនៃការស្រាវជ្រាវដែលចេះតែកើនឡើងបានបង្ហាញថាក្រដាសអនាម័យ មានអនាម័យច្រើនជាងម៉ាស៊ីនសម្ងួតដៃដែលមាននៅក្នុងបន្ទប់ទឹកជាច្រើន។
en-mt: A growing quantity of research has shown that hygiene paper is far more sanitised than the hand dryers availability in many bathrooms.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: នៅក្នុងឆ្នាំ 2008 ការសិក្សាមួយដែលដឹកនាំដោយសាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Westminster, London និងបានការចូលរួមសហការដោយក្រុមហ៊ុនឧស្សាហកម្មក្រដាសអនាម័យ European Tissue Symposium ដើម្បីធ្វើការប្រៀបធៀបកម្រិតអនាម័យ ដែលបានពីក្រដាសអនាម័យ និងម៉ាស៊ីនសម្ងួតដៃ និងម៉ាស៊ីនផ្លុំសម្ងួតដៃទំនើបផ្សេងៗទៀត។
en-mt: In 2008, a study led by Westminster University, London and collaborated by sanitary paper industry company European Tissue Symposium to compare Compare the hygiene levels derived from hygiene paper and hand dryers and other modern hand dryers.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.

en-mt: Hand washing water containing alkali should contain at least 60% alkali.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: ការលាងដៃតាមបែបវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ បានខ្លាយជាកិច្ចការចាំបាច់ បន្ទាប់ពីគ្រូពេទ្យសញ្ជាតិ ហុងគ្រី លោក  Ignaz Semmelweis ដែលបានរកឃើញពីប្រសិទ្ធភាពរបស់វា (នៅឆ្នាំ1846) នៅក្នុងការការពារជំងឺឆ្លង ក្នុងបរិស្ថានជុំវិញមន្ទីរពេទ្យ។
en-mt: Medical hand washing became essential after Hungarian national doctor Ignaz Semmelweis Discovered of its effectiveness (in 1846) in the prevention of infected diseases in the environment around the hospital.

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: មានឧបករណ៍អេឡិចត្រូនិកដែលផ្ដល់ព៌តមាន ដើម្បីរំលឹកដល់បុគ្គលិកមន្ទីរពេទ្យឱ្យលាងដៃនៅពេលពួកគេភ្លេចធ្វើវា។
en-mt: There are electronic tools that provide the Orient to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget to do it.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: ការលាងដៃតាមបែបវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ គឺមានរយៈពេលយ៉ាងតិច 15 វិនាទី ដោយប្រើសាប៊ូ និងទឹក ឬជែលក្នុងបរិមាណសមស្រប ដើម្បីលាប និងដុះផ្នែកនីមួយ​ៗ​នៃ​ដៃ។
en-mt: Medical hand washing lasts for at least 15 seconds, using soap and water or gel in suitability to rub and grow parts of each hand.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.

en-mt: You should use the brush to retrace the scraps under your wrist if they are availability.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: វាគឺមានសារះសំខាន់ណាស់ក្នុងការដែលត្រូវលាងជម្រះដៃឱ្យបានល្អ ហើយជូតឲ្យស្ងួតដោយកន្សែងស្អាត ដោយសារមេរោគអាចមាននៅសេសសល់នៅក្នុងទឹកដែលមានលើដៃ។
en-mt: It is very important to wash your hands well and dry it with a clean towel, as the virus can be left in the water on hand.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.

en-mt: The purpose of washing hands in healthcare facilities is to eradicate infections and avoid transmission of theirs.

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: ទិនានុប្បវត្តិវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រអង់គ្លេសថ្មីរាយការណ៍ថា កង្វះការលាងដៃនៅតែស្ថិតក្នុងកម្រិតដែលមិនអាចទទួលយកបានក្នុងមជ្ឈដ្ឋានវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រភាគច្រើនដោយមានវេជ្ជបណ្ឌិត និងគិលានុបដ្ឋាយិកាភាគច្រើនភ្លេចលាងដៃមុនពេលប៉ះអ្នកជំងឺ ដែល​នាំ​ឲ្យ​មាន​ការ​បញ្ជូនចម្លងនូវអតិសុខុមប្រាណ។

sourceString: One study showed that proper hand-washing and other simple procedures can decrease the rate of catheter-related bloodstream infections by 66 percent.The World Health Organization has published a sheet demonstrating standard hand-washing and hand-rubbing in health-care sectors.

sourceString: To reduce the spread of germs, it is better to wash the hands or use a hand antiseptic before and after tending to a sick person.

sourceString: For control of staphylococcal infections in hospitals, it has been found that the greatest benefit from hand-cleansing came from the first 20% of washing, and that very little additional benefit was gained when hand cleansing frequency was increased beyond 35%.

en-mt: For staphylococcal infection control in the hospital, it was found that the greatest benefit from hand washing came from washing Clean up the initial 20 percent, and very few additional benefits gained from frequent hand washing are often increased by more than 35%.

sourceString: Washing with plain soap results in more than triple the rate of bacterial infectious disease transmitted to food as compared to washing with antibacterial soap.Comparing hand-rubbing with alcohol-based solution with hand washing with antibacterial soap for a median time of 30 seconds each showed that the alcohol hand-rubbing reduced bacterial contamination 26% more than the antibacterial soap.

Hands and hand washing with bacterial soap for 30 seconds, suggests that washing hands with acid can reduce infections by 26% more than virus-killing soap.

Hand hygiene in healthcare facilities may involve educating staff from hand washing Increase hand washing with alcohol water and written and direct reminders to the staff.

sourceString: There is a need for more research into which of these interventions are most effective in different healthcare settings.
