en-mt: Healthy personal hygiene and living styles as well as diet are instructed to improve resistance.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: ការព្យាបាលបែបបន្ទាប់បន្សំ អាចនឹង​មានសារៈ​ប្រយោជន៍​ចំពោះ​អ្នក​ដែល​មាន​រោគសញ្ញា​ស្រាល​នៃ​ដំណាក់​កាល​ដំបូង​បន្ទាប់ពី​មាន​ការ​ឆ្លង។ អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក ក៏ដូចជា​គណៈកម្មការ​សុខភាព​ជាតិ​របស់​ប្រទេសចិន បាន​ចេញសេចក្តី​ផ្សព្វផ្សាយ​ណែនាំ​ពី​របៀប​ថែទាំ​​អ្នកជំងឺឆ្លង COVID-19 ដែលសម្រាកព្យាលបាល​នៅក្នុង​មន្ទីរពេទ្យ។
en-mt: Combination treatment may be beneficial for those with mild symptoms of the early stages after an infection. China's National Health Commission has released a guideline on how to care for COVID-19 patients who are treated in hospitals.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: អ្នកជំនាញឯកទេសផ្នែកសង្រ្គោះបន្ទាន់ និង​អ្នកជំនាញ​ឯកទេស​ព្យាបាល​​​ជំងឺសួត​នៅក្នុង​សហរដ្ឋ​អាមេរិច​​បានជា​ព្យាយាម​ចង​ក្រង​នូវ​សេចក្តីណែនាំ​ក្នុងការព្យាបាល​ពីភ្នាក់ងារផ្សេងៗ​ចូល​ទៅក្នុងប្រភព​ទិន្នន័យ​ដែលអាចយកឯកសារឥតគិតថ្លៃរបស់ IBCC។
en-mt: Emergency rescue specialists and specialists treating lung diseases in the United States tried to compile Instructions to treat from varied agencies into the source of data that can be obtained free IBCC documents.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.

en-mt: As of August 2020, there were no specific treatments for COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: ចំពោះរោគសញ្ញា អ្នក​ជំនាញ​វេជ្ជសាស្ត្រ​មួយ​ចំនួន​ណែនាំ​ឲ្យ​ប្រើថ្នាំ paracetamol (acetaminophen) ជាជាងប្រើថ្នាំ ibuprofen សម្រាប់ការប្រើក្នុងដំណាក់ដំបូង។
en-mt: For symptoms, some medical experts recommend taking paracetamol (acetaminophen) rather than taking ibuprofen for early use.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: ការប្រុងប្រយ័ត្នត្រូវតែធ្វើឡើង ដើម្បីកាត់បន្ថយ​ហានិភ័យ​​នៃការចម្លងវីរុស ​ជាពិសេស​នៅ​ក្នុង​កន្លែង​​ថែទាំ​​សុខភាព នៅពេលអនុវត្តទម្រង់ការ​ដែលអាច​បង្កើត​បាន​ជា​ឧស្ម័ន ដូចជា​ម៉ាស៊ីន​ដាក់​បំពង់​ខ្យល់ ឬម៉ាស៊ីន​សម្ងួត​ដៃ។

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.

en-mt: Users are asked to enter their name and ID.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: កម្មវិធីអាចរកឃើញ "ទំនាក់ទំនងជិតស្និទ្ធ" ដោយប្រើទិន្នន័យឃ្លាំមើល ហើយដូច្នេះគឺអាចដឹងពីហានិភ័យនៃការឆ្លង។
en-mt: Software can detect "close contact" using surveillance data, and thus is possible to sense the risks of transmission.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

On mobile phone data, facial recognition, mobile phone tracking and intelligence Virtuals are used to track infected people and those they relate to in Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: សារព័ត៌មាន BBC បានដកស្រង់​សម្តីលោក Rory O'Connor ដោយនិយាយថា "ការកើន​ឡើងនៃ​ការផ្តាច់​ខ្លួនពីសង្គម ភាពឯកោ ការថប់បារម្ភសុខភាព ភាព​តានតឹង និងការធ្លាក់ចុះសេដ្ឋកិច្ច គឺជាព្យុះភ្លៀងដ៏​ខ្លាំង​ក្នុង​ការ​បង្កគ្រោះថ្នាក់​ដល់សុខភាពផ្លូវចិត្ត និង​សុខុមាល​ភាព​​របស់​ប្រជាជន"។

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.

en-mt: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with extreme or severe ill health can take three to six weeks to recover.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.

en-mt: CoVID-19-related consequences include microorganisms in the blood, unusual blood ice and damage to the heart, kidneys and the liver.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: ភាពមិនធម្មតានៃការកកឈាមជាពិសេសការកើនឡើងនៃពេលវេលា prothrombin ត្រូវបានពិពណ៌នានៅក្នុង 6% នៃអ្នកដែលត្រូវបានបញ្ជូនទៅមន្ទីរពេទ្យដែលមានជំងឺ COVID-19 ខណៈមុខងារតម្រងនោមមិនធម្មតាត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញថាមាន 4%នៃក្រុមនេះ។
en-mt: The unusuality of blood ice, especially the increase in prothrombin time, is described in 6% of those sent Hospitals with COVID-19, while unusual kidney function is seen to make up 4% of the group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: ប្រហែលជា 20-30% នៃ​មនុស្សដែលមានជំងឺ COVID-19 បង្ហាញពីការកើនឡើងនូវអង់ស៊ីមថ្លើម (ចម្លងរោគ) ។
en-mt: Approximately 20-30% of people with COVID-19 indicate an increase in leprosy (contamination).

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: យោងតាមរបាយការណ៍ដដែល រយៈពេលមធ្យម​រវាង​ការ​ចាប់ផ្តើមរោគសញ្ញា និង​ការស្លាប់គឺ​មានរយៈពេល​ដប់​ថ្ងៃ​ដោយប្រាំនាក់ត្រូវចំណាយពេល​សម្រាក​នៅមន្ទីរពេទ្យ។
en-mt: According to the same report, the medium term between the onset of symptoms and death lasts for ten days, with five spending time off in hospital.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: ទោះយ៉ាងណា អ្នកជំងឺដែលផ្ទេរទៅ ICU មានពេលវេលាជាមធ្យមប្រាំពីរថ្ងៃរវាងការសម្រាកនៅមន្ទីរពេទ្យ និងការស្លាប់។
en-mt: However, patients transferring to the ICU have an average of seven days between hospital rest and death.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: នៅក្នុងការសិក្សាលើករណីដំបូង ពេលវេលាមធ្យម​ចាប់​ពី​​ការបង្ហាញ​រោគសញ្ញា​ដំបូង​រហូត​ដល់ស្លាប់​គឺមាន​រយៈពេល 14 ថ្ងៃ ដោយ​មាន​រយៈ​ពេល​ពីប្រាំមួយ​ទៅ 41 ថ្ងៃ។
en-mt: In the study of the initial case, the mean time from the initial show of symptoms to death lasted 14 days, with a period of between six to 41 days.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: នៅក្នុងការសិក្សារបស់គណៈកម្មការសុខភាពជាតិ (NHC) នៃប្រទេសចិន បុរសមានអត្រាមរណភាព 2.8% ចំណែក​ឯស្ត្រីមានអត្រាមរណភាព 1.7%។
en-mt: In a study of the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a 2.8% death rate, while women had a 1.7% rate of mortality.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: ការពិនិត្យជាលិការកមើលកោសិកាជំងឺនៃសំណាកសួតក្រោយមរណភាពបង្ហាញពីការបំផ្លាញ alveolar ជាមួយនឹងកោសិកា fibromyxoid exudates នៅក្នុងសួតទាំងពីរ។
en-mt: An examination of the disease cells of post-mortality samples reveals the destruction of alveolar with fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: ការផ្លាស់ប្ដូរទ្រង់ទ្រាយដោយសារវីរុសត្រូវបានគេសង្កេតឃើញនៅក្នុងកោសិកាសួត។
en-mt: Format changes due to viruses are observed in lung cells.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: រូបភាពសួតមានសណ្ឋានជារោគសញ្ញាជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើមស្រួចស្រាវ (ARDS)។
en-mt: Pictures of lungs are symptoms of alcohol respiratory disease (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: 11.8% នៃអត្រាស្លាប់ដែលបានរាយការណ៍ដោយគណៈកម្មការសុខភាពជាតិប្រចាំប្រទេសចិន ការខូចបេះដូងត្រូវបានកត់សម្គាល់ដោយការកើនឡើងនូវកម្រិតសារធាតុត្រូប៉ូនីន ឬការគាំងបេះដូង។
en-mt: 11.8% of the death rate reported by China's National Health Commission, heart failure is marked by increased levels of troponin or heart attack.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: យោងតាមទិន្នន័យខែមីនាពីសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិក 89% នៃអ្នកដែលចូលសម្រាកក្នុងមន្ទីរពេទ្យមានលក្ខខណ្ឌជំងឺដូចកាលពីពេលមុនមកមន្ទីរពេទ្យ។ ភាពអាចប្រើប្រាស់បាននៃធនធានវេជ្ជសាស្រ្ត និងសេដ្ឋកិច្ចសង្គមនៃតំបន់មួយអាចប៉ះពាល់ដល់អត្រាមរណភាពផងដែរ។
en-mt: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those who enter the hospital had the same ill conditions in the past The accessibility of the medical and socio-economic resources of a region can also affect the death rate.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: ការប៉ាន់ស្មានអត្រា​មរណៈ​ពី​ស្ថានភាព​ជំងឺ​មាន​លក្ខណៈ​ផ្សេងៗគ្នា​ ពីព្រោះ​តំបន់​គឺ​ខុស​គ្នា ប៉ុន្តែក៏ដោយសារតែវិធីសាស្រ្ត​នៅក្នុង​ការ​ប៉ាន់ស្មាន​មាន​​ភាព​​ពិបាក។
en-mt: Estimates of disease conditions vary because the regions are different, but also because of the methods in difficulty estimates.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: ការមិនរាប់បញ្ចូលករណីស្រាល អាចបណ្តាលឱ្យអត្រា​មរណភាព​មានការ​បា៉ន់ស្មាន​ខុស។
en-mt: Excluding light cases can lead to misconduct of death rates.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: ប៉ុន្តែការពិតដែលថាការស្លាប់ គឺជាលទ្ធផលនៃករណី ដែលបានទាក់ទងកន្លងមក អាចមានន័យថា អត្រា​មរណភាពបច្ចុប្បន្នត្រូវ​ប៉ាន់ស្មានស្ទើរពេក។
en-mt: But the fact that death is the result of cases related so far may mean that current death rates must be too estimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: អ្នកជក់បារីអាចមានរោគសញ្ញាធ្ងន់ធ្ងរនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 ទៅ​ដល់ 1.4 ដង ហើយប្រហែលជា 2.4 ដង អាច​ត្រូវ​ការ​ការ​ថែទាំឲ្យ​បាន​ដិតដល់ ឬស្លាប់​ បើប្រៀបធៀបទៅនឹង​អ្នក​មិន​ជក់បារី។ ការព្រួយបារម្ភត្រូវបានលើកឡើងចំពោះ​​​ជំងឺ​​ដែល​មាន​លក្ខណៈ​រយៈពេលយូរ។
en-mt: Smokers can develop severe symptoms of COVID-19 to 1.4 times and maybe 2.4 times may require care To be close or dead compared to non-smokers; concerns have been raised for long-term diseases.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: អាជ្ញាធរមន្ទីរពេទ្យហុងកុង បាន​រកឃើញ​ការធ្លាក់​ចុះ​នៃ​សុខភាព​សួត ចំពោះ​មនុស្ស​មួយ​ចំនួន​ដែល​បានជាសះ​ស្បើយ​ពីជំងឺនេះ ពី 20% ទៅ 30% ​ ហើយការស្កេនសួត បានបង្ហាញថាមាន​ខូចខាតសរីរាង្គ។
en-mt: The Hong Kong hospital authorities found a decline in lung health for some people recovering from the disease from 20% to 30% and lung scans showed organ damage.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: វា​អាច​បណ្ដាលឱ្យ​មាន​បណ្ដុំ​រោគសញ្ញា​ជំងឺ​ក្រោយ​ទទួល​ការ​ព្យាបាល​ធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ​បន្ទាប់ពីជាសះស្បើយ។
en-mt: It can cause a collection of symptoms after receiving severe treatment after recovery.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 គេមិនដឹងថាតើការ​ឆ្លងពី​អតីត​កាល​ផ្តល់នូវភាពស៊ាំ​ប្រកប​ដោយ​ប្រសិទ្ធភាព និង​រយៈពេល​វែង​​​ចំពោះអ្នកដែលបាន​ជាសះស្បើយ​ពីជំងឺ​នេះទេ។
en-mt: As of March 2020, it is unknown whether past infections provide effective and long-term immunity to those recovering from the disease.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: ប្រព័ន្ធភាពស៊ាំ​ត្រូវបានគេមើលឃើញថា វាមាន​សភាព​អាស្រ័យ​ទៅតាម​ចរិតលក្ខណៈនៃវីរុស​កូរ៉ូណាផ្សេងៗទៀត ប៉ុន្តែ​ក្នុង​ករណីខ្លះ​ដែល​បាន​ជាពី​ជំងឺ COVID-19 គឺដោយមាន​ការ​ធ្វើតេស្តវិជ្ជមាន​នៃវីរុសកូរ៉ូណា នៅពេលបន្ទាប់ផ្សេងទៀត។
en-mt: The immune system is seen as having conditions depending on the characteristics of other cancer viruses, but in the throat Some of the cases from COVID-19 are with positive tests of cancer in the next time.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: ករណីទាំងនេះ ត្រូវបានគេជឿថា កាន់តែយ៉ាប់យ៉ឺនទៅៗ នៃការឆ្លងមេរោគដែលមានរយៈពេលយូរ ជាជាង​ការ​ឆ្លង​ឡើងវិញ។
en-mt: These cases are believed to be increasingly deteriorating of long-term infections rather than recurrence.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: វីរុសនេះត្រូវបានគេគិតថា កើត​ចេញ​ពី​ធម្មជាតិ និង​មាន​ដើម​កំណើតចេញ​ពី​សត្វ តាមរយៈការឆ្លងរាលដាល។
en-mt: The virus is thought to be derived from nature and originated from animals through infections.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: ប្រភពដើមពិតប្រាកដមិនត្រូវបានស្គាល់នៅឡើយទេ ប៉ុន្តែនៅខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 មានការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃការឆ្លងរីករាលដាលនៃមេរោគ ដែលជម្រុញឱ្យមានការឆ្លងពីមនុស្សម្នាក់ទៅកាន់មនុស្សម្នាក់។
en-mt: The actual origin is not yet known, but in December 2019 there was an outbreak of the virus that prompted person-to-person transmission.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: ការសិក្សាលើ 41 ករណីដំបូងនៃការឆ្លងជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែលបានបោះពុម្ពផ្សាយកាលពីខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020 នៅ​ក្នុង​ទស្សនាវដ្តី The Lancet បានបង្ហាញពីថ្ងៃដំបូង​នៃ​ការ​ចាប់ផ្តើម​បណ្តុំរោគសញ្ញា គឺថ្ងៃទី 1 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019 ។
en-mt: The first 41 cases of COVID-19 infection published as of January 2020 in visit The Lancet magastified the first day of the beginning of the symptoms collection, December 1, 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: ការបោះផ្សាយជាផ្លូវការរបស់អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានរាយការណ៍ពីការចាប់ផ្តើមនៃរោគសញ្ញាដំបូងបំផុតនៅថ្ងៃទី 8 ខែធ្នូ ឆ្នាំ 2019។
en-mt: The official publishing of the People Health Organisation reported the onset of the earliest symptoms on December 8, 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: វិធានការមួយចំនួនត្រូវបានប្រើជាញឹកញាប់ ដើម្បីបញ្ជាក់ពីចំនួនមរណភាព។
en-mt: Some measures are frequently used to confirm the number of deaths.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: ចំនួនទាំងនេះខុសគ្នាតាមតំបន់ និងតាមពេលវេលា ហើយត្រូវបានជះឥទ្ធិពលដោយបរិមាណនៃការធ្វើតេស្ត គុណភាពប្រព័ន្ធថែទាំសុខភាព ជម្រើសនៃការព្យាបាល ពេលវេលាចាប់តាំងពីការផ្ទុះដំបូង និងលក្ខណៈប្រជាជនដូចជាអាយុ ភេទ និងសុខភាពទូទៅ។
en-mt: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the quantity of quality of health care system tests A choice of treatment, time since the initial outbreak and population characteristics like age, gender and general health.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: កាលពីចុងឆ្នាំ 2019 អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក បាន​ចាត់តាំង​លេខ​កូដជំងឺ ICD-10 បន្ទាន់ ដោយ U07.1 សម្រាប់​ការ​ស្លាប់​ពី​ការ​ឆ្លងមេរោគ SARS-CoV-2 ដែលបញ្ជាក់ដោយមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍ និង U07.2 សម្រាប់ការស្លាប់ពីការធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យគ្លីនិក ឬជំងឺ​រាតត្បាត COVID-19 ដោយគ្មានការឆ្លង SARS-CoV-2 ដែល​បាន​​បញ្ជាក់ពីមន្ទីរពិសោធន៍។ សមាមាត្រនៃ​ករណី​ស្លាប់​ឆ្លុះ​​បញ្ចាំង​​ពីចំនួនមរណភាពដែលបែងចែកដោយចំនួនករណី ដែលបានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យក្នុងចន្លោះពេលដែលបានផ្តល់ឱ្យ។
en-mt: In late 2019, the People's Health Organisation appointed the urgent ICD-10 disease code by U07.1 for death SARS-CoV-2 infection equation specified by laboratory and U07.2 for death from gladiatory diagnosis Nick or COVID-19 epidemic without the SARS-CoV-2 infection confirmed by the laboratory. The death reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of cases diagnosed in given intervals.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: ផ្អែកលើស្ថិតិសាកលវិទ្យាល័យ Johns Hopkins អត្រា មរណភាពនៃករណីលើសកលមាន 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) គិតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី 17 ខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020។
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the mortality rate of global cases was 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of April 17, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: ចំនួននេះខុសគ្នាទៅតាមតំបន់។ វិធានការផ្សេងៗទៀតរួមមាន អត្រាករណីស្លាប់ (CFR) ដែលឆ្លុះបញ្ចាំងពីភាគរយនៃបុគ្គលដែលបានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ ដែលបានស្លាប់ដោយសារជំងឺ និងអត្រាស្លាប់នៃការឆ្លងរោគ (IFR) ដែលឆ្លុះបញ្ចាំងពីភាគរយនៃបុគ្គលដែលបានឆ្លង (ធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ និងមិនបានធ្វើរោគវិនិច្ឆ័យ) ដែលបានស្លាប់ដោយសារជំងឺ។
en-mt: Other measures include the death rate (CFR), which reflects the percentage of individuals who have diagnosed who die from a distance Ter and the death rate of infection (IFR), which reflects the percentage of infected individuals (diagnosed and not diagnosed) who died of ill health.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: ស្ថិតិទាំងនេះមិនមានកំណត់ពេលវេលាទេ និង​ធ្វើតាមចំនួនប្រជាជនជាក់លាក់ពីការឆ្លងតាមរយៈការដោះស្រាយករណី។
en-mt: These statistics have no time limit and track a specific population from transmission by handling cases.

en-mt: In China, the mortality rate is 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.

en-mt: The exact reason for this gender difference is not known, but genetic factors and behavioral factors can be justified.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.

en-mt: Differences in the sexual immune system, the decreasing commonality of smoking to women and evolutionary men Conditions occur in parallel, like blood transfusions at a younger age than all these women can contribute to higher death rates for men.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: គិតត្រឹមខែមេសា ឆ្នាំ 2020 រដ្ឋាភិបាលសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិកមិនបានតាមដានទិន្នន័យទាក់ទងនឹងការរួមភេទនៃការឆ្លងជំងឺ COVID-19 ទេ។
en-mt: As of April 2020, the United States government did not monitor the sex-related data of COVID-19.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: ការសិក្សាស្រាវជ្រាវបានបង្ហាញថាជំងឺឆ្លងដែលបង្កឡើងដោយវីរុសដូចជាអេបូឡា ហ៊ីវ ជំងឺផ្តាសាយធំ និងជំងឺ SARS មានឥទ្ធិពលលើបុរសនិងស្ត្រីដោយខុសៗគ្នា។
en-mt: Studies have shown that infected diseases caused by viruses, ebola, HIV, influencia and SARS, affect men and women differently.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: ភាគរយខ្ពស់នៃបុគ្គលិកសុខាភិបាល ជាពិសេសគិលានុបដ្ឋាយិកាគឺជាស្ត្រី ហើយពួកគេមានឱកាសខ្ពស់ក្នុងការប៉ះពាល់នឹងវីរុសនេះ។
en-mt: A high percentage of health workers, especially nurses, are women, and they have a high chance of contracting the virus.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបានប្រកាសនៅថ្ងៃទី 11 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ថាឈ្មោះផ្លូវការនៃជំងឺនេះគឺ “COVID-19” ។
en-mt: The People's Health Organisation announced on February 11, 2020 that the official name of the disease is "COVID-19."

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: ប្រធានអង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោក Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus បានពន្យល់ថា CO តំណាងឱ្យ corona, VI សម្រាប់វីរុស, D សម្រាប់ជំងឺ ហើយ 19 សម្រាប់ពេលការផ្ទុះឡើងត្រូវបានគេកំណត់អត្តសញ្ញាណដំបូងគឺថ្ងៃទី 31 ខែធ្នូឆ្នាំ 2019 ។
en-mt: The president of the title of the Organization of Health Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO represents corona, VI for the virus, D for the disease, and 19 for the time of the outbreak was originally identified is December 31, 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: ឈ្មោះនេះត្រូវបានជ្រើសរើស ដើម្បីជៀសវាងការយោងទៅទីតាំងភូមិសាស្ត្រជាក់លាក់ណាមួយ (ឧទាហរណ៍ប្រទេសចិន) ប្រភេទសត្វ ឬក្រុមមនុស្សស្របតាមអនុសាសន៍អន្តរជាតិសម្រាប់ការដាក់ឈ្មោះដែល​សំដៅលើការពារកុំឱ្យមានការមាក់ងាយកើតឡើង។ វីរុសដែលបណ្តាលឱ្យមានជំងឺ COVID-19 ត្រូវបានគេដាក់ឈ្មោះថាជាជំងឺកូរ៉ូណារោគសញ្ញាផ្លូវដង្ហើមធ្ងន់ធ្ងរប្រភេទទី 2 (SARS-CoV-2)
en-mt: This name is chosen to avoid referring to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), type of animals or groups in accordance with international recommendations for names referring to protection The virus that causes COVID-19 is called coronary disease of severe respiratory disease (SARS-CoV-2)

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: លើសពីនេះទៀត អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកប្រើប្រាស់ “វីរុស COVID-19” និង “វីរុសដែល​ជា​ដើម​ហេតុ​នៃ​ជំងឺ COVID-19” ក្នុងការទំនាក់ទំនងសាធារណៈ។
en-mt: In addition, the People's Health Organisation uses "COVID-19" and "COVID-19 viruses" in public communication.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: ជាទូទៅ ទាំងជំងឺ និងវីរុសត្រូវបានគេហៅថា “វីរុស​កូរ៉ូណា"។
en-mt: In general, both the disease and the virus are called "cholera."

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: ក្នុងកំឡុងពេលនៃការផ្ទុះជំងឺដំបូងនៅទីក្រុងវូហាន ប្រទេស​ចិន វីរុស និងជំងឺត្រូវបានគេហៅជាទូទៅថា “វីរុសកូរ៉ូណា” និង “វីរុសកូរ៉ូណាវូហាន”។
en-mt: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and the disease were commonly called "cholera" and "Coronavirus."

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: កាលពីខែមករា ឆ្នាំ 2020 អង្គការសុខភាពពិភពលោកបាន​ផ្តល់អនុសាសន៍អំពីវីរុស 2019-nCov និង​ជំងឺផ្លូវដង្ហើម​ស្រួច​ស្រាវ 2019-nCoV ថា​ជា​ឈ្មោះ​បណ្តោះ​អាសន្ន​សម្រាប់​វីរុស និងជំងឺ​ស្របតាមការណែនាំ​ប្រឆាំង​នឹង​ការប្រើប្រាស់​ក្នុង​ទីតាំងឈ្មោះជំងឺ និងឈ្មោះមេរោគ ឆ្នាំ 2015 ។
en-mt: In January 2020, the People's Health Organisation recommended the 2019-nCov virus and alcohol respiratory disease 2019-n CoV is a temporary name for the virus and disease in accordance with anti-disease instructions in the location of the disease and name of the virus 2015.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: ឈ្មោះផ្លូវការ COVID-19 និង SARS-CoV-2 ត្រូវបានចេញនៅថ្ងៃទី 11 ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ 2020 ។
en-mt: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 are released on February 11, 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: ដោយសារសមត្ថភាពមានកម្រិតនៅក្នុង​សង្វាក់​ផ្គត់ផ្គង់​ស្តង់ដារ ក្រុមហ៊ុនឌីជីថល​មួយចំនួន​កំពុង​ផលិត​សម្ភារៈ​ថែទាំសុខភាពដូចជា សំលីត្បាល់ច្រមុះ និងផ្នែក​បំពង់​ខ្យល់។
en-mt: Because capabilities are limited in the standard supply chain, some digital companies are producing health care materials, like nose melting and air pipe parts.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: ក្នុងឧទាហរណ៍មួយ នៅពេលដែល​មន្ទីរពេទ្យអ៊ីតាលី​តម្រូវឱ្យ​មាន​សន្ទះខ្យល់​ចេញ​ចូលជាបន្ទាន់ ហើយ​អ្នកផ្គត់ផ្គង់​មិនអាច​ចែក​ចាយ​​បានទាន់ពេលវេលាបានតម្រូវការនោះ ក្រុមហ៊ុនថ្មី​ក្នុងស្រុក ដែលបង្កើតផលិតផលវិស្វកម្មផ្នែកខាងក្រោយ និង​ផលិត​នូវសន្ទះចំនួន 100 គ្រាប់ ដែល​ត្រូវការ​ក្នុង​ពេល​មួយ​យប់។
en-mt: In one example, when an Italian hospital requires a wind conversation to be emergency and suppliers cannot share on time That needs, a new local company that creates back-to-back engineering products and produces 100 conversations needed overnight.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: ក្រោយពីមានការផ្ទុះឡើងនៃជំងឺ COVID-19 ភ្លាម​ មាន​ការ​ផ្សព្វផ្សាយ​អំពី​ទ្រឹស្ដី ព័ត៌មានដែលមិនពិតដែលទាក់ទងទៅនឹងដើមកំណើត ការ​ការពារ ការព្យាបាល និងស្ថានភាពទូទៅនៃជំងឺ ហើយ​ព័ត៌មាន​ទាំង​អស់​​នោះត្រូវបានចែកចាយពាសពេញបណ្ដាញអ៊ីនធឺណិត។
en-mt: In the wake of the COVID-19 outbreak, there was immediate coverage of false information theories related to Der Come, prevention, treatment and the general condition of the disease, and all of that information is shared across the Internet.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: មនុស្សហាក់ដូចជាមានសមត្ថភាពក្នុងការធ្វើឱ្យ​រីករាល​ដាលវីរុសនេះដល់សត្វមួយចំនួន។
en-mt: Humans seem to have the ability to spread the virus to some animals.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: ការសិក្សាមិនបានរកឃើញភស្តុតាងនៃការចម្លងមេរោគ​នៅ​ក្នុង​សត្វជ្រូក ទា និងមាន់ទេ។
en-mt: Studies have found no evidence of transmission of viruses in pigs, ducks and chickens.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: គ្មានថ្នាំ ឬវ៉ាក់សាំង​ណាដែលត្រូវបានទទួលស្គាល់ក្នុងការព្យាបាលជំងឺនេះទេ។
en-mt: No medication or vaccine is recognised in treating the disease.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: ការស្រាវជ្រាវជាអន្តរជាតិទៅលើវ៉ាក់សាំង​ក្នុងការព្យាបាលជំងឺ COVID- 19 គឺស្ថិត​នៅក្រោម​ការដឹកនាំ​របស់​រាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល អង្គការ ក្រុម​អ្នកសិក្សា និងអ្នកស្រាវជ្រាវ។
en-mt: International research into the vaccine in the treatment of COVID-19 is under governmental direction, organisations, academic groups and researchers.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: កាលពី​ខែមីនា អង្គការសុខភាពពិភព​លោកបានផ្ដើមគំនិតបង្កើតជា “ការសាកល្បងរួមមួយ” ដើម្បីវាយតម្លៃ​អំពី​ប្រសិទ្ធភាព​នៃ​ការ​ព្យាបាល​របស់​ថ្នាំប្រឆាំង​វីរុស​បួនប្រភេទដែល​មាន​ស្រាប់ និង​ស្វែងរក​ធាតុ​​ផ្សំ​ដែល​​មានប្រសិទ្ធភាពជាងគេ។
en-mt: Last March, the People's Health Organisation began the idea to form a "collective test" to evaluate efficiency The possibility of treatment of four existing antibiotics and finding the most effective ingredients.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: មិនមានវ៉ាក់សាំងទេ ប៉ុន្តែភ្នាក់ងារផ្សេងៗកំពុងអភិវឌ្ឍវ៉ាក់សាំងយ៉ាងសកម្ម។
en-mt: There are no vaccines, but agencies are actively developing vaccines.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: ការសិក្សាពីមុន​​ទៅលើ​មេរោគ SARS-CoV គឺត្រូវ​បាន​ប្រើប្រាស់​ឡើងវិញ ពីព្រោះ SARS-CoV និង​មេរោគ SARS-CoV-2 ទាំងពីរ​នេះ​អាច​ចូលទៅក្នុងកោសិការបស់មនុស្សតាមរយៈកោសិកាទទួល ACE2 ។
en-mt: Previous studies on SARS-CoV viruses are reused because SARS-CoV and these two SARS-CoV-2 viruses are able to enter human cells via ACE2 cells.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: មានការសាកល្បងយុទ្ធសាស្ត្រវ៉ាក់សាំងចំនួនបី។
en-mt: There are three vaccine strategies trials.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: ដំបូង អ្នកស្រាវជ្រាវ​មានគោលបំណង​បង្កើត​វ៉ាក់សាំង​ការពារមេរោគបាន​ទាំងស្រុង។
en-mt: Initially, researchers aimed to completely develop a viral prevention vaccine.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: ការប្រើវីរុសបែបនេះ ទោះវាអសកម្ម ឬងាប់មាន​គោល​បំណង​គឺធ្វើឱ្យមានការឆ្លើយតបនៃប្រព័ន្ធភាពស៊ាំរបស់រាងកាយ​មនុស្សទៅនឹងការឆ្លងថ្មីជាមួយជំងឺ COVID-19 ។
en-mt: The use of this kind of virus, whether inactive or dead, is purpose to cause the response of the human body's immune system to new infections with COVID-19.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: យុទ្ធសាស្រ្តទីពីរគឺ វ៉ាក់សាំង subunit មានគោលបំណងបង្កើតវ៉ាក់សាំងដែលរំញោចប្រព័ន្ធភាពស៊ាំទៅនឹងផ្នែកខ្លះនៃវីរុស។
en-mt: The second strategy, the subunit vaccine, aims to develop a vaccine that stimulates the immune system to parts of the virus.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: ក្នុងករណី SARS-CoV-2+ ការស្រាវជ្រាវបែបនេះ​ផ្តោត​លើ​​ប្រូតេអ៊ីន S-spike ដែលជួយ​ឱ្យវីរុស​ជ្រាបចូលក្នុងអង់ស៊ីម ACE2 ។
en-mt: In the case of SARS-CoV-2+ this kind of research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps enter the ACE2 enzyme.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: យុទ្ធសាស្ត្រទីបី គឺវ៉ាក់សាំងការពារអាស៊ីដនុយក្លេអ៊ិច (វ៉ាក់សាំង DNA ឬ RNA ដែល​ជា​បច្ចេកទេស​បង្កើត​ថ្មី​សម្រាប់​ការ​បង្កើតវ៉ាក់សាំង)។
en-mt: The third strategy is a nuclear acidic protection vaccine (a DNA or RNA vaccine, a technical innovation technique for the development of a vaccine).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: វ៉ាក់សាំងពិសោធន៏ដែល​បាន​ពីយុទ្ធសាស្ត្រ​មួយ​ក្នុង​ចំណោម​យុទ្ធសាស្ត្រទាំងនេះ នឹងត្រូវបានធ្វើតេស្ត ដើម្បីសុវត្ថិភាព និងប្រសិទ្ធភាព។ កាលពីថ្ងៃទី 16 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ការ​សាកល្បង​វ៉ាក់សាំង​ដំបូង​គេ​បានចាប់ផ្តើម​ជាមួយ​នឹង​អ្នក​ស្ម័គ្រចិត្ត​ចំនួនបួននាក់នៅទីក្រុង Seattle ។
en-mt: An experimental vaccine from one of these strategies will be tested for safety and efficacy. March 16, 2020 The testing of the vaccine began with four volunteers in Seattle.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: វ៉ាក់សាំងនេះមានកូដហ្សែន ដែលគ្មានគ្រោះថ្នាក់ចម្លងពីវីរុសដែលបណ្តាលឱ្យកើតជំងឺនេះ។ ការពង្រឹងការពឹងផ្អែកអង់ទីករត្រូវបានគេណែនាំថា ជាបញ្ហាប្រឈមដ៏មានសក្តានុពលសម្រាប់ការអភិវឌ្ឍវ៉ាក់សាំងសម្រាប់ SARS-COV-2 ប៉ុន្តែវាគឺជារឿងចម្រូងចម្រាសមួយ។
en-mt: The vaccine contains a harm-free gene code from the virus that causes the disease. Environment is a potential challenge for developing a vaccine for SARS-COV-2, but it is a controversial one.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.

en-mt: Seven trials have been evaluated on ready-made treatments for tuberculosis Give up, including four studies on hydrozyclozin or chloroquines.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: ការពិនិត្យឡើងវិញប្រកបដោយថាមវន្តលើការវិវត្តគ្លីនិក​សម្រាប់វ៉ាក់សាំងការពារពីជំងឺ COVID-19 ហើយ​បេក្ខភាព​ថ្នាំបានដាក់​ឲ្យ​ប្រើប្រាស់ ហើយគិតត្រឹមខែមេសាឆ្នាំ 2020 ។ ថ្នាំ​ប្រឆាំង​វីរុសដែលមានស្រាប់ជាច្រើន​កំពុង​ត្រូវ​បាន​គេ​វាយ​តម្លៃ​សម្រាប់ការព្យាបាលជំងឺ COVID-19 ថ្នាំ Remdesivir, Chloroquine និង Hydroxychloroquine, Lopinavir/Ritonavir និង Lopinavir / Ritonavir លាយជាមួយ Interferon beta ។
en-mt: A dynamic review of clinical evolution for the COVID-19 vaccine prevents coVID-19 and the drug candidacy has been available and as of April 2020 Many existing antibiotics are being evaluated for the treatment of COVID-19, Remdesivir, Chloroquine, and Hydroxychloroquine, Lopinavir/Ritonavir and Lopinavir / Ritonavir mix with Interferon beta.

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.

en-mt: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the United States, China and Italy. To treat malaria was studied in China in February 2020 with basic results.

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.

en-mt: However, the Wuhan Institute of Radiology recommends the use of only one gram of drugs Only if we consume two grams it is at risk and can be very dangerous to death.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: នៅថ្ងៃទី 28 ខែមីនា ឆ្នាំ 2020 ទីភ្នាក់ងារសហព័ន្ធ FDA បាន​ចេញ​សេចក្តី​ប្រកាស​បើក​អនុញ្ញាត​ឱ្យ​ប្រើប្រាស់ថ្នាំ​ប្រភេទ hydroxychloroquine និងថ្នាំ chloroquine ជាបន្ទាន់ ស្របទៅ​តាម​ការ​សម្រេច​ចិត្ត​របស់​គ្រូពេទ្យ​ក្នុងការព្យាបាល​អ្នកជំងឺ​ដែលមានផ្ទុកជំងឺ COVID-19 ។ សេចក្តីណែនាំលើកទី 7 របស់​ប្រទេស​ចិនក៏​បាន​អនុញ្ញាតឱ្យ​ប្រើប្រាស់ប្រភេទថ្នាំ interferon, ribavirin ឬ umifenovir សម្រាប់​ប្រឆាំងទៅនឹងជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែរ។
en-mt: On March 28, 2020, the Federal Agency FDA issued an opening declaration allowing the use of hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine drugs in urgency According to a doctor's decision to treat patients carrying COVID-19. The 7th instructions of China also allowed the use of interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for fighting COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: ទិន្នន័យ​បឋមបង្ហាញថា កម្រិតខ្ពស់នៃថ្នាំ ribavirin គឺចាំបាច់ ដើម្បី​ទប់ស្កាត់ SARS-CoV-2 ក្នុងកែវពិសោធន៍វេជ្ជសាស្រ្ត។
en-mt: Basic data shows that high levels of the ribavirin drug are necessary to block SARS-CoV-2 in medical experiments.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: ថ្នាំ Nitazoxanide ត្រូវបានស្នើឱ្យមាន​ការសិក្សាបន្ថែមទៀត ក្រោយ​ពីរកឃើញ​មានការទប់ស្កាត់ជំងឺ SARS-CoV-2 កម្រិតទាប។ ការ​សិក្សា​​ផ្សេងទៀត​បានបង្ហាញថា មានការបញ្ចេញប្រូតេអ៊ីនតាម​រយៈ​ភ្នាស​កោសិកា protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) ដែល​ចាំបាច់​សម្រាប់ SARS-CoV-2 ជ្រៀតចូល​កោសិកា​តាមរយៈ​កោសិកាទទួល ACE2
en-mt: The Drug Nitazoxanide has been suggested for more studies after finding low-level SARS-CoV-2 prevention. Other studies have shown Protein release via mountain protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) essential for SARS-CoV-2 penetrating cells through ACE2 receiving cells

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: ការសិក្សាទៅលើថ្នាំ chloroquine និងថ្នាំ hydroxychloroquine ដើម្បី​ប្រើ​ជាមួយ ឬមិនប្រើជាមួយថ្នាំប្រភេទ azithromycin គឺជាបញ្ហាចម្បង ដោយសារ​មានការការពារពីក្រុម​សមាគមវេជ្ជសាស្ត្រថា ការព្យាបាល​នេះ​គួរតែត្រូវបាន​ប្រើប្រាស់ ដោយ​មិនបាច់ធ្វើការ​សិក្សាឡើយ។ ថ្នាំ Oseltamivir មិនបញ្ឈប់ជំងឺ SARS-CoV-2 ទេ ហើយក៏​មិន​មាន​តួនាទី​ក្នុង​ការព្យាបាលជំងឺ COVID-19 ដែរ។
en-mt: Studies into chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine to be used with or not used with azithromycin are major problems due to the protection of the medical association group: Oseltamivir does not stop SARS-CoV-2 and does not play a role in treating COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: ការកើនឡើងស៊ីតូគិន (Cytokine) នេះអាចជាផលវិបាក​នៅដំណាក់​កាល​ចុងក្រោយ​នៃភាពធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ​របស់ជំងឺ COVID-19 ។
en-mt: This increase in Cytokine could be a consequence in the late stages of COVID-19.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: មានភស្តុតាងដែលបង្ហាញថា ថ្នាំ hydroxychloroquine អាចនឹង​ទប់​ស្កាត់​​ការកើនឡើងនៃកោសិកា cytokine។ Tocilizumab ក៏​ត្រូវ​បាន​ដាក់​បញ្ចូល​ឱ្យប្រើប្រាស់ ក្នុងការ​ការព្យាបាល​ដែល​យោង​ទៅតាម គណៈកម្មការ​សុខភាពជាតិរបស់ប្រទេសចិន បន្ទាប់ពី​មាន​ការ​សិក្សា​តូច​មួយ​បានបញ្ចប់។
en-mt: There is evidence that the drug hydroxychloroquine may suppress the growth of cytokine cells. Include the use of treatment according to China's National Health Commission after a small study is completed.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: វាកំពុងស្ថិតក្នុងដំណាក់កាលទី 2 នៃ​ការ​ធ្វើតេស្ត​មិន​មែន​ដោយ​ការចៃដន្យនៅកម្រិតថ្នាក់ជាតិ ក្នុងប្រទេសអ៊ីតាលី បន្ទាប់​ពីបង្ហាញ​លទ្ធផល​វិជ្ជមាន​ចំពោះ​អ្នក​ដែល​មានជំងឺ​ធ្ងន់ធ្ងរ។
en-mt: It is in phase 2 of non-random testing at a national level in Italy after showing positive results for those with serositised diseases.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: រួមជាមួយនឹងការធ្វើតេស្តឈាមសេរ៉ូមហ្វីរីធីន ដើម្បីកំណត់​អត្តសញ្ញាណ Cytokine Storms វាមានន័យថា​ដើម្បី​ប្រឆាំងនឹង​ការវិវត្តបែបនេះ ដែលត្រូវគេ​ចាត់ទុកថា ជា​បុព្វហេតុ​​នៃការស្លាប់​ចំពោះមនុស្ស​ដែល​រង​ផលប៉ះពាល់​មួយចំនួន។
